Title: Department of Transportation - Human Trafficking Awareness, Training, and Response (See Someone, Save Someone Act)
Synopsis: Requiring the Maryland Department of Transportation to develop or identify and implement a training program for transportation sector employees on the identification and reporting of suspected human trafficking victims; requiring transportation sector employers to certify by January 1, 2027, and each year thereafter that certain employees have completed the training program; requiring new employees to receive training within 90 days of hiring; removing civil and criminal liability for reporting of suspected trafficking; etc.
bill_summary: The bill requires the Maryland Department of Transportation to develop or identify human trafficking training programs for transportation-sector employees and implement public awareness campaigns, including safety information at transit and highway locations, to combat human trafficking.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Transportation
stakeholders: Transportation-sector employees and contractors, and the general public using transit, airports, ports, or highways in Maryland
innovative_summary: The program employs targeted training for transportation employees combined with public service announcements in multiple languages, utilizing a proactive, multi-channel approach to human trafficking awareness.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has moderate potential to impact child poverty by reducing human trafficking, including exploitation of children, through increased awareness and reporting.

Title: State Board of Physical Therapy Examiners - Revisions
Synopsis: Clarifying the definition of "physical therapist assistant" as used in the Maryland Physical Therapy Act to mean an individual licensed by the State Board of Physical Therapy Examiners; increasing the membership of the State Board of Physical Therapy Examiners from 8 to 9; and requiring the Board to send renewal notices to licensees by electronic means, rather than first-class mail, unless the licensee requests to receive the renewal notice by first-class mail.
bill_summary: The bill revises the Maryland Physical Therapy Act by clarifying the definition of 'physical therapist assistant', modifying the membership of the State Board of Physical Therapy Examiners, and changing the method of sending license renewal notices from first-class mail to electronic means, unless requested otherwise.
responsible_party: State Board of Physical Therapy Examiners
stakeholders: Physical therapists, physical therapist assistants, and licensees in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill primarily updates communication practices and definitions within existing licensing processes, with no new innovative programs introduced.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill does not directly target child poverty but may improve administrative efficiency for licensees.

Title: Restrictions on Use - Solar Collector Systems - Alteration
Synopsis: Prohibiting a restriction on land use that increases the cost of installing a solar collector system by at least 5% over a certain cost or that reduces the efficiency of the system by at least 10% under a certain energy generation level; authorizing a community association to impose certain restrictions on the installation of solar collector systems in common areas or common elements; authorizing a community association to install a solar collector system in common areas or common elements under certain circumstances; etc.
bill_summary: The bill establishes that restrictions on the use of land cannot significantly increase the cost or reduce the efficiency of installing solar collector systems, and sets guidelines for community associations regarding the installation and restrictions of solar systems in common areas.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Housing and Community Development or appropriate land use agency
stakeholders: Property owners, community associations, solar energy installers, residents interested in solar energy
innovative_summary: The bill standardizes criteria for what constitutes unreasonable restrictions on solar installations and allows property owners to negotiate solar easements, modernizing land use regulations related to solar energy.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill's impact on child poverty is indirect and minimal, primarily facilitating the use of solar energy, which can reduce energy costs over time.

Title: Public Safety - Food System Resiliency Council - Definitions and Reports
Synopsis: Altering certain definitions related to the Food Resiliency Council; defining what constitutes "healthy food priority areas" as predominantly lower-income areas that have limited access to retail outlets that sell, affordable, healthy foods; defining "wasted food" as food not used for its intended purpose; requiring the Council to make recommendations to increase the availability of local foods, create market opportunities for Maryland food businesses, and expand access to small scale food production infrastructure; etc.
bill_summary: This bill establishes the Maryland Food System Resiliency Council, defines key terms related to food access and waste, and outlines the Council's goals and reporting requirements to improve food security, equity, local food procurement, and sustainability in Maryland.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Emergency Management and the Office of Resilience
stakeholders: Residents experiencing food insecurity, local food organizations, food businesses, schools, and local governments in Maryland
innovative_summary: The program employs a coordinated statewide approach including data analysis, policy recommendations, and support for local food initiatives, which is a comprehensive and strategic government effort.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has the potential to significantly reduce child poverty by improving access to healthy foods through coordinated efforts and policy development.

Title: Health Insurance - Access to Nonparticipating Providers - Referrals, Additional Assistance, and Coverage
Synopsis: Repealing the June 30, 2025, termination date for certain provisions of law related to referrals to and reimbursement of specialists and nonphysician specialists who are not part of a carrier's provider panel; prohibiting certain carriers from imposing utilization review requirements other than would be required if the covered benefit was provided by a provider on the carrier's provider panel under certain circumstances; etc.
bill_summary: The bill repeals the termination date of provisions that require insurers and health plans to establish procedures for members to obtain referrals to specialists and nonphysician specialists outside of the provider panel, especially for mental health and substance use disorder services. It also requires these carriers to assist members in identifying and arranging coverage, to limit certain prior authorization requirements for these services, and to establish reimbursement rates for nonparticipating providers.
responsible_party: Maryland Health Care Commission
stakeholders: Individuals seeking mental health and substance use disorder services, insurers, healthcare providers, and policymakers in Maryland
innovative_summary: The program employs a newer approach to ensure easier access to specialized mental health and substance use services by establishing assistance procedures and setting reimbursement formulas for nonparticipating providers, which enhances care accessibility and consistency.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program could have a significant direct impact on child poverty by increasing access to mental health and substance use disorder treatment, which can improve health and stability for affected children.

Title: Cannabis - Sale and Distribution - Tetrahydrocannabinol Offenses
Synopsis: Authorizing the officers and employees of the Field Enforcement Division of the Alcohol, Tobacco, and Cannabis Commission to issue a citation for a violation of §10-108 of the Criminal Law Article; prohibiting the sale or distribution of certain products that contain tetrahydrocannabinol or are advertised as containing tetrahydrocannabinol; authorizing the Executive Director of the Commission to seize, destroy, or confiscate a certain unlawful product; etc.
bill_summary: The bill updates Maryland laws regarding the sale, distribution, labeling, and regulation of products containing tetrahydrocannabinol (THC), including setting licensing requirements, establishing enforcement powers, and imposing penalties for violations.
responsible_party: Maryland Alcohol, Tobacco, and Cannabis Commission
stakeholders: Consumers, cannabis businesses, law enforcement, minors
innovative_summary: The bill primarily modernizes regulations and enforcement in the cannabis industry; it does not introduce new technology or innovative approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill does not directly address or impact child poverty levels.

Title: Corporations and Associations - Limited Worker Cooperative Associations - Authorization (Maryland Limited Worker Cooperative Association Act)
Synopsis: Authorizing the formation of limited worker cooperative associations; and establishing rules and procedures for the formation, governance, conversion, and dissolution of limited worker cooperative associations.
bill_summary: The bill authorizes the formation of limited worker cooperative associations in Maryland, establishes rules for their formation, governance, conversion, and dissolution, and creates a new legal framework and regulations for these cooperatives.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Assessments and Taxation (potentially) and other relevant state agencies for implementation.
stakeholders: Worker members of cooperative associations, small business owners, entrepreneurs interested in forming cooperatives, and the general public benefiting from cooperative services.
innovative_summary: The program introduces a new legal structure for worker cooperatives, employing innovative cooperative governance and membership models, and modernizes law to support collaborative economic models.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has a high potential to directly impact child poverty by enabling more stable and equitable employment opportunities through worker cooperatives.

Title: Vehicle Laws - Noise Abatement Monitoring Systems Pilot Program - Inspection and Extension
Synopsis: Establishing that certain provisions of law relating to the inspection of recorded images apply to recorded images produced by a noise abatement monitoring system; and extending by 2 years the reporting and termination dates of the noise abatement monitoring systems pilot programs in Montgomery County and Prince George's County.
bill_summary: The bill extends the pilot programs for noise abatement monitoring systems in Montgomery County and Prince George's County, allowing for the use and reporting of noise violation data, and clarifies that the provisions regarding inspection of recorded images also apply to noise monitoring systems.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Transportation or county agencies implementing noise monitoring systems
stakeholders: Residents, motorists, and local government agencies in Montgomery County and Prince George's County
innovative_summary: The bill employs technology for noise monitoring, expanding the use of automated systems for noise violation enforcement and data collection, which is a modern approach to noise control.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has limited direct impact on child poverty as it mainly focuses on noise monitoring and enforcement methods.

Title: Health Occupations - Nursing - Loan Repayment, Education, and Sunset Extension (Building Opportunities for Nurses Act of 2025)
Synopsis: Expanding the purpose of the Maryland Loan Assistance Repayment Program for Nurses and Nursing Support Staff; requiring the Department to prioritize funding for nurses or nursing support staff who practice in an area with a shortage of nurses or nursing support staff or who practice in a specialty where a shortage has been identified; altering certain education requirements for licensure; repealing a certain requirement that the State Board of Nursing approve certain nursing assistant training program sites within a certain time period; etc.
bill_summary: This bill extends and enhances Maryland's programs for nurse loan repayment, and updates licensing requirements and regulations for nursing assistants, including new certification pathways and training program approvals, with scheduled sunset dates.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Health and Maryland Board of Nursing
stakeholders: Nurses, nursing support staff, nursing education providers, and healthcare facilities in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill introduces new certification pathways for nursing assistants and leverages stipends, loan repayment, and updated regulation compliance to address workforce shortages using existing and new models.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has a high potential to reduce child poverty by improving healthcare access and workforce through targeted nurse and support staff recruitment and retention.

Title: Department of Public Safety and Correctional Services - Study on Location of Individuals Prior to and Following Incarceration
Synopsis: Requiring the Department of Public Safety and Correctional Services to conduct an annual study examining and comparing certain data regarding an individual's residence prior to incarceration and on release from a State correctional facility; and requiring the Department by October 1, 2026, and each October 1 thereafter, to report the results of the study to certain committees of the General Assembly.
bill_summary: This bill requires the Maryland Department of Public Safety and Correctional Services to conduct a study on the residence locations of individuals before and after incarceration in state correctional facilities, including various data comparisons, and to report the findings.
responsible_party: Department of Public Safety and Correctional Services
stakeholders: Individuals incarcerated in Maryland and their communities
innovative_summary: The bill employs data collection and analysis to inform criminal justice policies, which is a standard approach but valuable for policy refinement.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has a limited direct impact on child poverty as it focuses on data collection regarding incarceration and residence.

Title: Environment – Reservoir Augmentation Permit – Establishment
Synopsis: Establishing the Reservoir Augmentation Program in the Department of the Environment; defining "reservoir augmentation" as the planned placement of reclaimed water into a surface water reservoir used as a source for a drinking water treatment facility; requiring a person to obtain a permit from the Department to perform reservoir augmentation; establishing an Indirect Potable Reuse Pilot Program in the Department to make recommendations on whether the program should be extended or made permanent and any statutory or regulatory changes necessary; etc.
bill_summary: The bill establishes the Reservoir Augmentation Program under the Maryland Department of the Environment, requiring permits for reservoir augmentation activities, defining standards, application procedures, fees, and reporting requirements for the program.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of the Environment
stakeholders: Public water systems, communities utilizing reservoirs, environmental agencies
innovative_summary: The program introduces a structured permitting process for reservoir augmentation, including standards for water treatment and innovative reuse of reclaimed water.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has the potential to enhance water quality and reliability, which can indirectly benefit communities including children.

Title: Estates and Trusts - Compensation of Guardians of Property and Trustees
Synopsis: Clarifying the commissions that a guardian of the property may charge; authorizing a trustee of a trust to charge compensation that is reasonable under the circumstances; and authorizing trustees who are financial institutions or members of the Maryland Bar to charge compensation that is reasonable under the circumstances and calculated in accordance with a schedule of rates filed with an appropriate agency.
bill_summary: This bill clarifies and modifies the rules for compensation of guardians of property and trustees of trusts in Maryland. It specifies the rates and conditions under which they can charge for their services, including reasonable compensation and schedules of rates, and updates legal and procedural provisions related to their fees.
responsible_party: Maryland courts and administrative agencies overseeing trusts and guardianships
stakeholders: Guardians of property, trustees of trusts, beneficiaries, and individuals under guardianship in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill mainly updates existing legal standards and schedules for guardians and trustees, focusing on clarifying and standardizing compensation rules, with some provisions for filing schedules and notifying beneficiaries.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill does not directly impact child poverty but ensures proper management and compensation of guardians and trustees, which can indirectly influence estate and trust management outcomes.

Title: Consumer Protection - Right to Repair - Powered Wheelchairs
Synopsis: Requiring, in order to make repairs to powered wheelchairs, that a certain manufacturer make available certain documentation, parts, embedded software, firmware, and tools to a certain independent repair provider or owner of a powered wheelchair; providing that a violation of the Act constitutes an unfair, abusive, or deceptive trade practice subject to certain enforcement and penalty provisions; and applying the Act prospectively.
bill_summary: This bill requires manufacturers of powered wheelchairs to provide independent repair providers and owners with certain documentation, parts, software, firmware, and tools necessary for repairs, promoting right-to-repair access.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Health or relevant state agency for implementation
stakeholders: Owners of powered wheelchairs, independent repair providers, healthcare providers, and individuals with physical disabilities
innovative_summary: The bill promotes a structured right-to-repair process for powered wheelchairs, but does not employ new technologies or innovative approaches beyond legal requirements.
child_poverty_direct_summary: Potential for a moderate impact on child poverty by improving mobility aid repairs and accessibility.

Title: Maryland Department of Health - Forensic Review Board - Established
Synopsis: Requiring the Maryland Department of Health to establish a forensic review board at facilities that have charge of persons who have been committed to the facility as not criminally responsible; authorizing a forensic review board to make recommendations relating to the release or rehabilitation of a committed person; requiring the board to give notice at least 10 days before a meeting concerning the committed person; requiring the board to give consideration to a written statement offered by the committed person to the board; etc.
bill_summary: The bill establishes forensic review boards at facilities holding persons deemed not criminally responsible, reviews their eligibility for release, and creates a community forensic aftercare program to monitor those on conditional release.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Health
stakeholders: Persons committed as not criminally responsible, mental health providers, courts, and law enforcement
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a structured system of forensic review boards and a community monitoring program for this specific population, employing technology and systematic review processes.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has limited direct effect on child poverty but may indirectly support families by ensuring appropriate treatment and monitoring of vulnerable individuals.

Title: Department of Service and Civic Innovation - Maryland Corps Program Service Year Option Pathways - Revisions
Synopsis: Altering the duties of the Department of Service and Civic Innovation; renaming the Governor's Volunteer Council to be the Governor's Commission on Service and Volunteerism; altering certain requirements relating to qualifications for applicants and compensation for participants in the Young Adult Service Year Option Pathway and the Maryland Service Year Option Pathway; altering certain reporting requirements; and repealing the Executive Fellows Program.
bill_summary: The bill revises the Maryland Corps program by establishing two pathways: the Young Adult Service Year Pathway and the Maryland Service Year Pathway. It sets up related funds, expands program eligibility, sets participation and reporting requirements, and increases funding allocations for these pathways and associated programs.
responsible_party: Department of Service and Civic Innovation
stakeholders: Young adults, local governments, community organizations, and public agencies in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill employs a structured approach to expand civic service pathways with dedicated funding, targeted outreach, and reporting systems, integrating service opportunities into educational and employment pipelines.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The pathways have high potential to impact child poverty by providing young adults with skills, employment, and educational opportunities.

Title: Department of Aging – Aging Services – Program Repeal and Consolidation
Synopsis: Repealing provisions of law requiring the Secretary of Aging to develop certain congregate housing and assisted living programs for seniors; repealing the Interagency Committee on Aging Services and transferring certain responsibilities of the Committee to the Department of Aging; requiring the Department, beginning in June 2025, in coordination with area stakeholders, to conduct program transition planning and to co-design the new, consolidated program required by the Act; etc.
bill_summary: The bill consolidates and repeals certain aging programs and responsibilities, establishes a single point of entry program for older adults, and updates existing service coordination and planning for seniors in Maryland.
responsible_party: Department of Aging
stakeholders: Older adults and their caregivers in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill employs a coordinated, community-based approach with a focus on single points of entry and integration of services, fostering community involvement and innovative service delivery.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has high potential to impact child poverty indirectly by improving services for families with older adults, but its direct impact on child poverty is limited.

Title: Public Health - Repeal of Prohibition on Transfer of Human Immunodeficiency Virus (Carlton R. Smith Act)
Synopsis: Repealing the prohibition on an individual from knowingly transferring or attempting to transfer the human immunodeficiency virus to another individual.
bill_summary: This bill repeals the existing law that prohibits individuals from knowingly transferring or attempting to transfer the human immunodeficiency virus (HIV) to another person.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Health
stakeholders: Individuals with HIV and the general public
innovative_summary: The bill removes previously established criminal prohibition laws related to HIV transmission, which is a shift from punitive approaches to health-based policies.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill does not have a direct impact on child poverty.

Title: Natural Resources - Fishing Licenses and Stamps - Alterations
Synopsis: Altering the fees for resident consolidated senior sport fishing licenses, angler's licenses, and trout stamps; and repealing the exemption from the requirement to obtain a trout stamp under certain circumstances for a holder of a resident consolidated senior sport fishing license.
bill_summary: The bill amends Maryland fishing license laws, primarily increasing fees for various license types, including resident senior sport fishing licenses, angler’s licenses, and trout stamps. It also repeals an exemption for trout stamps for certain senior license holders and establishes new fee amounts.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Natural Resources
stakeholders: Fishing enthusiasts, residents age 65 and older, and state wildlife management agencies
innovative_summary: The bill primarily focuses on fee adjustments and legal clarifications, with no new technology or innovative approach being introduced.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill does not directly impact child poverty, as it mainly involves fee changes and legal clarifications related to fishing licenses.

Title: Election Law - Petitions for the Formation of a New Political Party - Process
Synopsis: Altering the time periods during which a petition for the formation of a new political party or additional signatures to a petition may not be filed; and prohibiting signatures submitted with a petition that was officially determined as not meeting certain legal requirements from being resubmitted with a subsequent petition.
bill_summary: The bill modifies the legal process for filing petitions to form a new political party in Maryland, including changing the time periods when petitions and signatures can be submitted, and prohibits resubmission of signatures if a petition is found not to meet legal requirements.
responsible_party: Maryland State Board of Elections
stakeholders: Individuals and groups interested in forming new political parties in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill primarily alters existing legal procedures for petition filing without employing new technologies or innovative approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has minimal direct impact on child poverty as it mainly involves election law procedural changes.

Title: Federally Qualified Health Centers Grant Program - Acquisition of Land
Synopsis: Authorizing the Board of Public Works, on recommendation of the Secretary of Health, to make grants under the Federally Qualified Health Centers Grant Program to counties, municipal corporations, and nonprofit corporations for the acquisition of land for the construction or use of a federally qualified health center.
bill_summary: This bill authorizes the Maryland Board of Public Works, upon recommendation of the Secretary of Health, to provide grants to counties, municipal corporations, and nonprofit organizations for acquiring land to build or operate federally qualified health centers, as part of the existing Federally Qualified Health Centers Grant Program.
responsible_party: Board of Public Works / Maryland Department of Health
stakeholders: Counties, municipal corporations, nonprofit organizations, and residents needing federally qualified health centers
innovative_summary: The bill expands the existing grant program to include land acquisition for federally qualified health centers, which is a strategic approach to facilitate the development of health infrastructure.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has high potential to directly reduce child poverty by increasing access to healthcare services in underserved areas.

Title: Public Health - Cannabis Public Health Advisory Council - Membership
Synopsis: Altering the membership of the Cannabis Public Health Advisory Council to include the Administrator of the Motor Vehicle Administration, or the Administrator's designee, and the Executive Director of the Office of Social Equity in the Maryland Cannabis Administration, or the Executive Director's designee.
bill_summary: The bill amends the membership of the Cannabis Public Health Advisory Council in Maryland, adding new members appointed by the governor, including representatives from historically black colleges, health care providers, pharmacists, and other experts, to enhance representation and expertise.
responsible_party: Maryland Cannabis Administration and associated state agencies
stakeholders: Cannabis public health community, healthcare professionals, policymakers, and residents of Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill enhances the diversity and expertise of the advisory council through targeted appointments, but does not introduce new technologies or groundbreaking approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill does not directly address child poverty or include specific measures aimed at reducing it.

Title: Environment - Building Energy Performance Standards - Alterations and Analysis
Synopsis: Altering the requirements for certain regulations adopted by the Department of the Environment relating to building energy performance standards to include certain exclusions, considerations, and a certain  annual reporting fee to cover certain costs; requiring the Department to certify a certain building energy performance standards program adopted by a county under certain circumstances; requiring the Department to conduct an analysis of the potential costs and benefits of certain building energy performance standards policy options; etc.
bill_summary: This bill establishes new building energy performance standards in Maryland, including targets for energy use and greenhouse gas emissions, and introduces compliance pathways such as fees and waivers. It also creates a program for training energy auditors, sets deposit rules for fees into a energy fund, and incorporates considerations for special building types and exemptions.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of the Environment
stakeholders: Owners and operators of covered buildings, energy auditors, and building occupants in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill employs innovative regulatory approaches, including alternative compliance pathways, waivers, and integrating new measurements like on-site renewable energy and biofuels into standards, as well as establishing training programs for auditors.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has potential to reduce child poverty indirectly by improving building efficiency and reducing utility costs, but its direct impact is limited.

Title: Health Services Cost Review Commission – User Fee Assessment – Repeal of Sunset
Synopsis: Repealing the termination date for a certain provision of law related to the maximum amount of total user fees that may be assessed on hospitals and related institutions by the Health Services Cost Review Commission.
bill_summary: This bill repeals the sunset provisions related to the maximum limits on user fees assessed on hospitals and related institutions by the Maryland Health Services Cost Review Commission, allowing those limits to continue indefinitely.
responsible_party: Health Services Cost Review Commission
stakeholders: Hospitals and related healthcare institutions in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill mainly continues existing fee assessment rules without introducing new or innovative approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has minimal direct impact on child poverty as it mainly deals with hospital fee regulation.

Title: Procurement - State Department of Education - Local Food Purchasing Program
Synopsis: Requiring the State Department of Education, in coordination with the Department of General Services and the Department of Agriculture, to establish a program to procure, when funding is available, local food for local school systems with preference to providers that are certified local farms or certified Chesapeake invasive species providers; altering the percentage price preference adopted by the Board of Public Works for locally grown food from 5% to 10%; etc.
bill_summary: This bill requires the Maryland State Department of Education to establish a program to procure local food from farms and invasive species providers within specific radii around schools, in coordination with other state agencies, and to promote local sourcing in school procurement by creating a local farm and fish office with a goal of 20% procurement from local providers.
responsible_party: Maryland State Department of Education and related coordinating departments
stakeholders: Local farms, Chesapeake invasive species providers, Maryland schools, students, and local communities
innovative_summary: The bill employs targeted local procurement and promotes coordination among multiple state agencies to increase local sourcing, establishing a dedicated office for local farms and invasive species, and setting specific procurement goals.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has potential to reduce child poverty by boosting local farm income and supporting school nutrition, but direct impact is moderate due to broader factors involved.

Title: Property Tax – Tax Sales – Revisions
Synopsis: Authorizing a tax collector to withhold from tax sale certain property occupied by an heir of a deceased owner of the property; requiring that certain owner-occupied property and certain property occupied by an heir of a deceased owner of the property be withheld from tax sale; requiring each county to establish a registry for interested parties or the Tax Sale Ombudsman to designate property to be withheld from tax sale; requiring the State Department of Assessments and Taxation to assist each county in creating and maintaining the registry; etc.
bill_summary: The bill revises Maryland's laws on property tax sales, including provisions for withholding owner-occupied and other residential properties from tax sales, establishing a homeowner protection and relief program, revising notice requirements, and setting rules for redemption and foreclosure processes.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Assessments and Taxation
stakeholders: Homeowners at risk of tax sale, heirs, local governments, and communities involved in redevelopment
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a Homeowner Protection Program designed to divert vulnerable homeowners from tax lien sales into an alternative support system, and enhances property sale and redemption processes with detailed notice and registry requirements, incorporating targeted protections and assistance.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has moderate potential to directly impact child poverty by helping homeowners maintain their residence and stability, especially those who are low-income, elderly, or disabled.

Title: State Board of Public Accountancy - Sunset Extension and Report
Synopsis: Continuing the State Board of Public Accountancy in accordance with the provisions of the Maryland Program Evaluation Act (sunset law) by extending to July 1, 2030, the termination provisions relating to the statutory and regulatory authority of the Board; and requiring the Maryland Department of Labor to submit a certain report to the Joint Audit and Evaluation Committee on or before July 1, 2028.
bill_summary: The bill extends the termination date of the State Board of Public Accountancy to July 1, 2030, and requires the Maryland Department of Labor to submit a report on the board to the Joint Audit and Evaluation Committee by July 1, 2028.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Labor
stakeholders: Public accountants and consumers of accounting services in Maryland
innovative_summary: This bill primarily extends the regulatory authority of an existing board and does not introduce new technologies or innovative approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill is unlikely to have a direct impact on child poverty as it pertains to professional regulation of accountants.

Title: Education - Holocaust Education Assistance Grant Program - Established
Synopsis: Establishing the Holocaust Education Assistance Grant Program in the State Department of Education to assist local school systems with Holocaust education in public schools; authorizing a local school system to apply to the Department for a grant from the Program to be used for teacher training or teaching materials; and requiring the Governor to include in the annual budget bill an appropriation of $50,000 for the Program.
bill_summary: The bill establishes the Holocaust Education Assistance Grant Program in the Maryland State Department of Education to fund Holocaust-related teacher training and teaching materials in public schools.
responsible_party: Maryland State Department of Education
stakeholders: Public schools, teachers, students, and the broader community interested in Holocaust education
innovative_summary: This bill creates a dedicated grant program specifically for Holocaust education, utilizing government funding to enhance teaching resources and teacher training.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program is unlikely to have a direct impact on child poverty as it focuses on Holocaust education initiatives.

Title: State Finance and Procurement - State Leasing of Real Property
Synopsis: Increasing the noncompetitive threshold for State leases of real property from less than 2,500 square feet to up to 5,000 square feet; altering the time frame during which the State is required to advertise the need for rental of building space from at least 30 days to 20 days before proposals for lease are due; requiring the advertisement to be in certain newspapers providing notice to at least the people of the affected locality; and requiring the notice to be posted on the Department's website and eMaryland Marketplace.
bill_summary: The bill increases the noncompetitive threshold for State leases of real property from 2,500 to 5,000 square feet, and changes the advertising requirements, including reducing the notice period to 20 days and mandating advertisement through the Department's website and eMaryland Marketplace.
responsible_party: Department of General Services
stakeholders: State agencies responsible for leasing property and the general public interested in State leasing activities
innovative_summary: The bill updates and standardizes the advertisement process for State leases using online platforms, including eMaryland Marketplace,Modernizing procurement and leasing communication.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill does not directly target programs affecting child poverty.

Title: Election Law – Special Elections
Synopsis: Altering requirements for scheduling special elections to fill vacancies in a county council or in the office of chief executive officer or county executive; requiring the State Administrator to conduct a special election in accordance with State law and regulations if the State Administrator determines a conflict exists between State law and regulations and a county charter or other county law relating to the conduct of a special election; etc.
bill_summary: The bill modifies procedures for scheduling and conducting special elections in Maryland, allowing county councils to establish the date for a special election without a primary, specify methods for the election, and clarifies rules around voting by mail and ballot drop boxes for special elections.
responsible_party: Maryland State Board of Elections
stakeholders: Voters participating in special elections in Maryland, county election officials, political parties, candidates involved in special elections
innovative_summary: The bill introduces streamlined procedures and voting options, such as allowing ballots via drop boxes in special elections, and clarifies election conduct, modernizing election administration.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has limited direct impact on child poverty, focusing primarily on election procedures.

Title: Estates and Trusts - Maryland Trust Decanting Act - Notification and Document Transmittal
Synopsis: Specifying the manner in which notice regarding an exercise of the decanting power or the sending of a document under the Maryland Trust Decanting Act is required to be provided.
bill_summary: This bill amends the Maryland Trust Decanting Act to specify how notices regarding the exercise of decanting powers or sending documents should be provided to interested parties. It establishes acceptable methods of providing notice, including personal service, certified or first-class mail, courier, or agreed-upon alternative methods such as email or facsimile.
responsible_party: Maryland Trust Department or relevant fiduciary oversight agency
stakeholders: Trust beneficiaries and fiduciaries involved in trust decanting processes in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill clarifies and potentially simplifies the notification process for trust decanting by allowing alternative notification methods such as email or facsimile, which could increase efficiency and responsiveness.
child_poverty_direct_summary: Low, as the bill mainly focuses on procedural rules for notifications in trust decanting and does not directly address child poverty.

Title: Criminal Law - Crimes Relating to Animals - Conviction and Sentencing
Synopsis: Establishing that certain crimes relating to animals do not include certain activities; establishing that each animal harmed in a violation of a prohibition against animal cruelty is a separate offense and shall be deemed an individual victim for purposes of the sentencing guidelines stacking rule; establishing that a conviction for a crime relating to animals may not merge with a conviction for any other crime based on the act establishing the violation; etc.
bill_summary: The bill establishes new rules for crimes related to animal cruelty in Maryland. It clarifies that each harmed animal is a separate offense and victim, and that convictions for animal cruelty cannot merge with other crimes. Sentences may be separate, consecutive, or concurrent.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Public Safety and Correctional Services
stakeholders: Animals, animal rights advocates, law enforcement, and communities concerned with animal cruelty laws
innovative_summary: The bill employs a clear legal framework that treats each harmed animal as a separate offense and victim, and prevents merging of animal cruelty convictions with other crimes, providing a more rigorous approach to animal protection.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill does not have a direct impact on child poverty.

Title: Heating, Ventilation, Air–Conditioning, and Refrigeration Contractors – License Restoration
Synopsis: Extending from 90 days to 4 years the time period during which an individual who has held a heating, ventilation, air-conditioning, and refrigeration contractor license may apply for license restoration after expiration.
bill_summary: The bill extends the period during which a person with a HVACR contractor license in Maryland can apply for license restoration after expiration from 90 days to 4 years.
responsible_party: State Board of Heating, Ventilation, Air–Conditioning, and Refrigeration Contractors
stakeholders: Heating, ventilation, air–conditioning, and refrigeration contractors in Maryland
innovative_summary: This bill primarily changes the legal process and time frame for license restoration, not employing new technologies or approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has no direct impact on child poverty, as it pertains solely to licensing processes for HVACR contractors.

Title: Opioid-Associated Disease Prevention and Outreach Programs - Appeals and Membership of Standing Advisory Committee
Synopsis: Authorizing a local health department or community-based organization to appeal to the Secretary of Health or the Secretary's designee rather than to the Deputy Secretary for Public Health Services, an adverse decision of the Maryland Department of Health and a local health officer regarding an application for authorization to operate an Opioid-Associated Disease Prevention and Outreach Program; etc.
bill_summary: The bill authorizes local health departments and community organizations to establish opioid prevention and outreach programs, including procedures for application, approval, appeals, and advisory support, along with establishing a standing advisory committee to guide these programs.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Health
stakeholders: Individuals who use or are at risk of opioid use, local health departments, community organizations, law enforcement, healthcare providers, and families affected by opioid use
innovative_summary: The bill establishes a structured framework for local opioid prevention programs with advisory support, appeal processes, and specified operational protocols, integrating community input and technical assistance.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program potentially impacts child poverty by reducing opioid-related harm in communities, improving public health, and supporting affected families.

Title: Anne Arundel County - Class A (Off-Sale) and Class D (Off-Sale) Licenses - Population Ratio Quota
Synopsis: Establishing a population ratio quota for certain Class A (off-sale) and Class D (off-sale) licenses in Anne Arundel County; specifying a certain official map to be used to identify certain tax assessment districts for purposes of the population ratio quota; and prohibiting the Board of License Commissioners for Anne Arundel County from approving the transfer of certain alcoholic beverages licenses under certain circumstances.
bill_summary: This bill establishes a population ratio quota for Class A and Class D alcoholic beverage licenses in Anne Arundel County, limiting the number of licenses based on the population in specific assessment districts, and prohibits certain transfers of licenses outside these districts.
responsible_party: Anne Arundel County Board of License Commissioners
stakeholders: Alcohol license applicants, local residents, businesses in the assessment districts
innovative_summary: The program employs geographic and population-based licensing quotas, which is a structured approach to regulate alcohol licenses.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill does not directly target child poverty but may impact local economic conditions that influence community well-being.

Title: Insurance Pooling - Public Entity - Definition
Synopsis: Altering the definition of "public entity" to include a Resilience Authority for purposes of insurance pooling.
bill_summary: The bill amends the Maryland insurance laws to include Resilience Authorities as 'public entities' that can participate in insurance pooling for casualty, property, or health insurance, or to self-insure against related risks.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Insurance (implied, as the bill pertains to insurance regulation)
stakeholders: Resilience Authorities, local governments, public entities, residents benefiting from resilience infrastructure projects
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a new category of public entities—Resilience Authorities—into insurance pooling, which is a novel approach to enhancing resilience infrastructure financing and risk management.
child_poverty_direct_summary: Potential for some impact, as improved resilience infrastructure may benefit vulnerable populations, but the bill primarily focuses on definitions for insurance pooling.

Title: Family and Medical Leave Insurance Program - Revisions
Synopsis: Defining "anchor date" to establish certain reference points for the calculation of a certain covered employee's average weekly wage and eligibility for increases in weekly benefits under the Family Medical Leave and Insurance Program; requiring the Maryland Department of Labor to adopt regulations establishing an optional self-employed enrollment program governing the participation of self-employed individuals in the Program; repealing certain requirements related to  contributions made by certain participating individuals; etc.
bill_summary: This bill revises the Family and Medical Leave Insurance Program in Maryland by establishing procedures for self-employed individuals to participate, updating contribution and benefit calculations, defining key terms like 'anchor date', and clarifying implementation details. It also repeals certain contribution payment requirements for self-employed participants and sets administrative reporting deadlines.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Labor
stakeholders: Employees, self-employed individuals, employers, healthcare providers, and public welfare organizations in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a self-employed enrollment program within a state family leave insurance system, which is a relatively new approach to expanding social insurance programs through employment and self-employment integration, applying new regulations and contribution structures.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has a moderate potential to impact child poverty by providing expanded leave benefits to workers caring for children or family members, thereby supporting family stability and income.

Title: Maryland Farms and Families Fund – Purpose and Use – Alterations
Synopsis: Altering the purpose and use of the Maryland Farms and Families Fund to match purchases made with FMNP, SNAP, and WIC benefits at certain farmers markets and farm stands, support nonprofit farmers markets by providing logistical and marketing support to increase the use of federal nutrition programs at these markets, and to support nonprofit  organizations or other responsible persons to implement the Program.
bill_summary: The bill alters the purpose and use of the Maryland Farms and Families Fund to support programs that increase access to fresh fruits and vegetables for food-insecure residents by supporting farmers markets and nonprofit organizations that facilitate the use of federal nutrition benefits like FMNP, SNAP, and WIC.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Agriculture
stakeholders: Food-insecure Maryland residents, local farmers, farmers markets, nonprofit organizations involved in healthy food programs
innovative_summary: The program employs a targeted approach to increase access to healthy foods through existing federal benefits, with some use of funding to support infrastructure for farmers markets and community organizations, but does not involve new technology or entirely new interventions.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has a potential to significantly reduce child poverty by improving access to nutritious foods for low-income families.

Title: Consumer Protection - Automatic Renewals
Synopsis: Requiring a person who makes an automatic renewal offer to consumers to allow a consumer to cancel the automatic renewal in a cost-effective, timely, and easy-to-use manner; requiring automatic renewal offers to be displayed in a certain manner and contain certain information; establishing that compliance with certain regulations or a certain license shall be considered to be compliance with the Act; establishing that a violation of the Act is an unfair, abusive, or deceptive trade practice; etc.
bill_summary: The bill mandates transparent and fair practices for automatic renewal offers, including clear disclosures, consumer cancellation rights, and restrictions on automatic charges without explicit consent.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Consumer Protection
stakeholders: Consumers in Maryland who sign up for auto-renewal services
innovative_summary: The bill employs new regulatory approaches to ensure transparency and fairness in automatic renewal practices, focusing on consumer rights and business compliance.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has limited potential to directly impact child poverty, focusing mainly on consumer protection and business practices.

Title: Pesticide and Pest Control - Revisions to Pesticide Applicator's Law and Repeal of Obsolete Provisions
Synopsis: Establishing requirements for the commercial application of general use pesticides, the commercial application of restricted use pesticides, and the private application of restricted use pesticides; requiring a certified private applicator to ensure that certain individuals working under the certified applicator's supervision meet certain requirements; specifying the responsibility and liability of certified applicators for the application of certain pesticides; etc.
bill_summary: The bill updates Maryland's pesticide laws by establishing requirements for the application of pesticides, defining roles of certified applicators, and repealing obsolete provisions related to certain pesticides and antifouling paints. It also sets rules for the sale and use of specific chemicals and pesticides.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Agriculture
stakeholders: Pesticide applicators, commercial boatyards, agricultural producers, and the general public
innovative_summary: The bill mainly revises existing regulations and enforcement regarding pesticide application and antifouling paints, without employing new technologies or approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill's focus on pesticide regulation has limited direct impact on child poverty.

Title: Electric Companies - Regional Transmission Organizations - Report (Utility Transparency and Accountability Act)
Synopsis: Requiring an electric company, other than a municipal electric utility, by February 1 each year, to submit a report to the Public Service Commission regarding each recorded vote cast by the electric company and any of its State affiliates at a meeting of a regional transmission organization.
bill_summary: This bill requires electric companies in Maryland to submit an annual report to the Public Service Commission detailing all recorded votes they and their affiliates made at regional transmission organization meetings during the previous year.
responsible_party: Public Service Commission of Maryland
stakeholders: Electric companies, affiliates, and consumers in Maryland interested in transparency of transmission organization votes
innovative_summary: The bill introduces transparency requirements by mandating detailed annual voting reports from electric companies and their affiliates, which is a new approach to regulatory oversight.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill's focus on transparency in electric companies' governance does not directly target child poverty but may improve utility accountability.

Title: Maryland Correctional Training Commission – Membership
Synopsis: Altering the membership of the Maryland Correctional Training Commission to include the Director of the Division of Parole and Probation within the Department of Public Safety and Correctional Services and one employee of the Division recommended by the exclusive representative for the employees of the Division of Parole and Probation and appointed by the Governor.
bill_summary: The bill amends the membership of the Maryland Correctional Training Commission to include the Director and an employee of the Division of Parole and Probation within the Department of Public Safety and Correctional Services, as well as an additional parole and probation employee recommended by their exclusive representative.
responsible_party: Maryland Correctional Training Commission
stakeholders: Correctional officers, parole and probation employees, and the Department of Public Safety and Correctional Services
innovative_summary: The bill primarily changes the composition of a training commission's membership; it does not introduce new technologies or innovative approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill does not directly impact child poverty as it focuses on the membership structure of a correctional training commission.

Title: Residential Property - Assignment of Contracts of Sale - Disclosure Requirements and Rescission
Synopsis: Authorizing a seller or assignee of certain residential property to rescind a contract of sale without penalty at any time before closing if a certain seller does not provide a certain notice; establishing that an assignee is entitled to a refund of any deposit paid in connection with the assignment of a contract of sale of the residential property under certain circumstances; requiring that a contract of sale comply with the requirements of the Act; and applying the Act prospectively.
bill_summary: This bill allows residential property sellers, buyers, and assignees to rescind contracts of sale under certain conditions and establishes disclosure requirements for wholesale buyers and sellers involved in residential property transactions.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Housing and Community Development
stakeholders: Residential property buyers and sellers, wholesalers, and real estate agents in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill introduces specific disclosure and rescission provisions for wholesale real estate transactions, increasing transparency through mandated written disclosures.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill's impact on child poverty is indirect but could potentially improve housing stability for families, which may contribute to reducing child poverty.

Title: Department of Housing and Community Development - Maryland Housing Rehabilitation Program - Local Rehabilitation Program Administration
Synopsis: Expanding the entities eligible to administer local rehabilitation programs to include certain nonprofit sponsors.
bill_summary: The bill expands the entities eligible to administer local housing rehabilitation programs in Maryland to include certain nonprofit sponsors, allowing them to originate and manage program loans.
responsible_party: Department of Housing and Community Development
stakeholders: Nonprofit organizations, local governments, residents needing housing rehabilitation
innovative_summary: The bill introduces the inclusion of nonprofit sponsors as eligible administrators for housing rehabilitation loans, promoting community-based participation and capacity building.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has potential to directly impact child poverty by improving housing conditions for low-income families.

Title: Climate Change Adaptation and Mitigation - Total Assessed Cost of Greenhouse Gas Emissions - Study and Reports
Synopsis: Requiring the Comptroller, in coordination with the Department of the Environment and the Department of Commerce, to conduct a study to assess the total cost of greenhouse gas emissions in the State and report certain findings to certain committees by December 1, 2026, on the total assessed cost of greenhouse gas emissions in the State based on the findings of the study; authorizing the Comptroller to hire a consultant to conduct the study; and requiring the report to include certain information and calculations.
bill_summary: This bill establishes a program for Maryland to study and impose payments on fossil fuel companies responsible for significant greenhouse gas emissions during the covered period (1994-2023). It creates the Climate Change Adaptation and Mitigation Fund funded by these payments, to finance infrastructure projects and initiatives to address climate change impacts and health effects on vulnerable populations.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of the Environment and the Department of Commerce
stakeholders: Fossil fuel companies, residents of Maryland, vulnerable communities, local governments, environmental and health agencies
innovative_summary: The bill employs a new approach by assigning liability and collecting payments from fossil fuel companies based on their historical emissions, and directing funds to climate adaptation and mitigation infrastructure and programs.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has high potential to reduce child poverty by funding infrastructure and programs that protect vulnerable communities from climate impacts.

Title: Environment - Bay Restoration Fund - Septic System Upgrade Program
Synopsis: Updating the funding priorities for failing sewage systems and holding tanks; requiring as a second priority those located within the Maryland Chesapeake Bay 8-digit watershed that have a relative effectiveness for total nitrogen reduction of 9.24 or higher based on the Chesapeake Bay watershed model; requiring as a third priority funding for failing systems within the 500-year floodplain, and fourth to certain other failing systems; and expanding certain funding eligibility criteria for on-site and community sewage systems.
bill_summary: The bill establishes a program for funding upgrades to on-site sewage disposal systems using nitrogen removal technologies, evaluates and ranks these technologies, and prioritizes funding for improving water quality and reducing nitrogen pollution.
responsible_party: Department of the Environment
stakeholders: Residents and property owners with on-site sewage disposal systems in Maryland
innovative_summary: The program employs evaluation and ranking of new nitrogen removal technologies and establishes performance-based funding levels, integrating environmental technology assessment into government funding decisions.
child_poverty_direct_summary: Potential for direct impact on child poverty is moderate, as cleaner water and environmental health benefits could improve public health.

Title: State Department of Assessments and Taxation - Notification of Constant Yield Tax Rate - Alteration
Synopsis: Altering the requirement that the State Department of Assessments and Taxation notify each taxing authority of the constant yield tax rate for each taxable year by requiring that the notice be sent by the Department to a taxing authority only on the request of the taxing authority.
bill_summary: The bill alters the process by which the Maryland Department of Assessments and Taxation notifies taxing authorities of the constant yield tax rate. Instead of automatically providing the notice, the Department will only send it upon request from a taxing authority.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Assessments and Taxation
stakeholders: Taxing authorities, county and municipal governments, property taxpayers
innovative_summary: The bill implements a change in notification procedures based on request rather than automatic delivery, which is a procedural update but not an entirely new technological or innovative approach.
child_poverty_direct_summary: Minimal direct impact on child poverty, as the bill mainly concerns tax notification procedures.

Title: Criminal Procedure - Sexual Assault Exam and Treatment Reimbursement
Synopsis: Providing that the Governor's Office of Crime Prevention and Policy, rather than the Criminal Injuries Compensation Board, is responsible for payment to a physician, qualified health care provider, and hospital for providing certain services to a victim of an alleged rape or sexual offense or a victim of alleged child sexual abuse.
bill_summary: The bill shifts responsibility for reimbursing providers who offer sexual assault examinations and treatment to the Governor's Office of Crime Prevention and Policy, replacing the previous system managed by the Criminal Injuries Compensation Board. It ensures victims receive free services and clarifies their rights regarding privacy and insurance information.
responsible_party: Governor’s Office of Crime Prevention and Policy
stakeholders: Victims of sexual assault and child sexual abuse, healthcare providers, hospitals
innovative_summary: This bill updates existing procedures to improve victim privacy rights and streamlines the reimbursement process by centralizing payment responsibility in a state office.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill does not directly address child poverty but improves access to critical healthcare services for victims of abuse.

Title: Estates and Trusts - Resignation of Trustee - Notice
Synopsis: Authorizing the trustee of a trust to resign under the Maryland Trust Act on 30 days' notice to qualified beneficiaries, the settlor, if living, all cotrustees, and any person that has a right to replace or appoint a successor to the resigning trustee.
bill_summary: The bill authorizes trustees of a trust in Maryland to resign by giving at least 30 days' notice to specified parties including beneficiaries, the settlor, co-trustees, and persons with the right to appoint a successor, or with court approval, and details procedures and protections involved.
responsible_party: Maryland courts and trust administration agencies
stakeholders: Trustees, beneficiaries, and trust settlors involved in Maryland trust law
innovative_summary: The bill primarily updates legal procedures for trustee resignation; it does not employ new technologies or innovative approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has minimal direct impact on child poverty as it mainly affects legal procedures for trusts.

Title: Child Care Centers - Certificated Staff Ratio Requirement - Alteration
Synopsis: Altering a requirement that a child care center that has 20 or more children have in attendance a certain ratio, set by the Department, of staff to children who hold a certificate in first aid and cardiopulmonary resuscitation under certain circumstances.
bill_summary: The bill alters requirements for child care centers in Maryland, specifically changing staffing certification and ratio regulations and updating related rules for safety, health, and emergency preparedness.
responsible_party: Maryland State Department of Education
stakeholders: Children attending licensed child care centers, their parents, and child care providers
innovative_summary: The bill primarily updates existing regulations rather than implementing new technology or novel approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program targets child care safety and staffing, which can influence child development and well-being, thereby potentially impacting child poverty.

Title: Department of Aging - Senior Call-Check and Social Connections Program
Synopsis: Renaming the Senior Call-Check Service and Notification Program to be the Senior Call-Check and Social Connections Program; providing that the purpose of the program is to provide regular, direct communication from the Department of Aging or the Department's designee to an eligible participant to promote wellness and purposeful social engagement; authorizing the integration of services between the Program and Telecommunications Access of Maryland to promote awareness of the availability of accessible telecommunications equipment; etc.
bill_summary: The bill renames and modifies the Senior Call–Check Service and Notification Program to the Senior Call–Check and Social Connections Program, establishing it to promote wellness and purposeful social engagement among older adults, integrating with telecommunications access programs, and allowing collaborations with various organizations.
responsible_party: Department of Aging
stakeholders: Older adults and their social support networks in Maryland
innovative_summary: The program employs a comprehensive approach that incorporates various communication methods including phone calls, text messages, virtual, and in-person interactions, and integrates volunteer-led organizations and accessible communications technology.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has a potential high impact on reducing child poverty by supporting older adults and promoting social engagement, which can contribute to overall health and economic stability.

Title: County Boards of Education - Curriculum Guides and Courses of Study - Discrepancies
Synopsis: Requiring each county board of education to adopt curriculum guides and courses of study aligned with content standards established by the State Department of Education; establishing a process for correcting discrepancies identified by the State Superintendent of Schools in a county board's curriculum guides and courses of study, including the imposition of certain penalties; requiring the Department, in consultation with certain teachers, to develop content and curriculum standards and resources for each subject at each grade level; etc.
bill_summary: The bill mandates the development of a comprehensive health education framework and curriculum standards for Maryland public schools, including guidelines for parent opt-out policies and procedures, and establishes a process for correcting curriculum discrepancies.
responsible_party: Maryland State Department of Education
stakeholders: Public school students, parents, teachers, and school administrators in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill employs a comprehensive, standardized health curriculum framework incorporating modern health topics and parental opt-out policies, and introduces a discrepancy correction process with penalties, reflecting a structured and technology-informed approach.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has a high potential to impact child poverty by improving health education, which can contribute to better health and well-being among children in low-income families.

Title: Motor Home and Recreational Vehicle Shows in Worcester County - Permit for Out-of-State Dealers
Synopsis: Establishing the reciprocal out-of-state motor home and recreational trailer vehicle show permit, to be issued by the Motor Vehicle Administration, authorizing the holder to display motor homes and recreational vehicles at vehicle shows in Worcester County; and requiring a permit holder, after the permit is approved, to file a bond with the Administration.
bill_summary: This bill establishes a reciprocal out-of-state motor home and recreational vehicle show permit, to be issued by the Maryland Motor Vehicle Administration, allowing out-of-state dealers licensed in another state to display motor homes and recreational vehicles at shows in Worcester County. It also sets requirements for bonding and permits the display but not the sale or acceptance of deposits.
responsible_party: Maryland Motor Vehicle Administration
stakeholders: Out-of-state motor home and recreational vehicle dealers, residents and visitors of Worcester County, Maryland
innovative_summary: The program introduces a specialized permit system with reciprocity requirements and bonding provisions, but does not employ new technologies or fundamentally new approaches beyond regulatory agreements.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has minimal direct impact on child poverty, as it primarily regulates vehicle show permits for dealers.

Title: Health - Maternal and Child Health Population Health Improvement Fund - Use
Synopsis: Altering from December 31, 2025, to December 31, 2027, the date through which the Maternal and Child Health Population Health Improvement Fund may be used for expenses associated with maternal and child health population health improvements.
bill_summary: This bill extends the use of the Maternal and Child Health Population Health Improvement Fund until December 31, 2027, allowing funds to be used for maternal and child health improvements through 2027.
responsible_party: Medical Care Programs Administration and Prevention and Health Promotion Administration
stakeholders: Maternal and child populations in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill employs a dedicated funding mechanism through a special fund to support maternal and child health improvements, which is a targeted approach but not highly technologically innovative.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has potential to improve health outcomes which may indirectly reduce child poverty, but direct impact is moderate.

Title: Davis Martinez Public Employee Safety and Health Act
Synopsis: Requiring the Correctional Training Commission to adopt regulations for the training, issuance, and use of body-worn cameras by January 1, 2026; establishing the Public Employees' Safety and Health Unit in the Division of Labor and Industry to administer and enforce certain duties regarding the oversight of workplace safety and health of employees of certain public bodies; establishing and applying certain civil and criminal penalties to public bodies and persons in government; etc.
bill_summary: This bill updates Maryland's occupational safety and health laws by establishing a Public Employees’ Safety and Health Unit, setting regulations for correctional officers' body-worn cameras, and expanding workplace violence prevention standards for public bodies. It also revises enforcement procedures, datasets collection, and allocates civil penalties toward apprenticeship and training programs.
responsible_party: Division of Labor and Industry, Maryland Department of Labor
stakeholders: Employees of public bodies, correctional officers, public safety personnel, and the general public served by public agencies
innovative_summary: The bill introduces new regulations for body-worn cameras and workplace violence standards, fostering transparent recording and reporting practices, as well as expanding occupational safety standards with modernized enforcement and data collection methods.
child_poverty_direct_summary: High potential to impact child poverty by creating safer workplaces and improving public employee safety, which can lead to economic stability for families and communities.

Title: Organized Retail Theft Act of 2025
Synopsis: Providing that multiple thefts committed by the same person in multiple counties under one scheme or continuing course of conduct may be joined and prosecuted in any county in which any one of the thefts occurred; prohibiting one or more persons from committing a series of thefts from retail merchants over a 90-day period with an aggregate value exceeding $1,500; requiring a court to make a finding as to whether a certain crime is organized retail theft under certain circumstances for a certain purpose; etc.
bill_summary: The bill enhances laws related to organized retail theft, including setting a monetary threshold for defining such theft, allowing multiple thefts under one scheme to be prosecuted together, and establishing specific penalties based on the value of stolen goods. It also mandates courts to determine if a crime qualifies as organized retail theft for sentencing.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Public Safety and Correctional Services
stakeholders: Retail merchants, law enforcement agencies, and individuals accused of retail theft
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a specific definition of organized retail theft with detailed thresholds and mandatory court findings, representing a targeted approach to combat retail theft, but does not employ new technologies or radically innovative methods.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has limited direct impact on child poverty, primarily focusing on criminal law and prosecution practices.

Title: Military Department – Chief of Staff and Aides – Appointment Authority
Synopsis: Authorizing the Adjutant General instead of the Governor to appoint certain staff in the Military Department; and establishing that certain staff in the Military Department serve at the pleasure of the Adjutant General instead of the Governor.
bill_summary: This bill allows the Adjutant General of Maryland's Military Department to appoint the chief of staff and aides, instead of the Governor, and specifies that these staff members serve at the pleasure of the Adjutant General.
responsible_party: Maryland Military Department
stakeholders: Members of the Maryland Military Department, including staff and military personnel
innovative_summary: The bill shifts appointment authority within the military hierarchy, replacing the Governor with the Adjutant General for staffing decisions.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill does not directly impact child poverty, as it pertains to military staffing procedures.

Title: Motor Vehicles - Speed Monitoring Systems -
Synopsis: Altering the penalties for a civil citation issued as a result of a recorded image produced by a speed monitoring system; requiring the State Highway Administration to convene a workgroup to study best practices regarding speed monitoring systems in school zones; and requiring the workgroup to submit its findings and recommendations to the Governor and the General Assembly by December 1, 2025.
bill_summary: The bill revises penalties for speed violations recorded by speed monitoring systems and establishes a workgroup to study best practices for using these systems in school zones, including their placement and effectiveness.
responsible_party: Maryland State Highway Administration
stakeholders: Motorists, local governments, school communities, law enforcement agencies, and students in school zones
innovative_summary: The bill employs a data-driven approach by forming a workgroup to study and recommend best practices for speed monitoring in school zones, potentially leading to improved traffic safety.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill's primary focus on traffic law and safety measures has limited direct impact on child poverty.

Title: Therapeutic Child Care Grant Program - Funding - Alterations
Synopsis: Altering the fiscal years to include fiscal year 2027 through fiscal year 2029, during which the Governor is required to include in the annual budget bill an appropriation of $3,700,000 to the Therapeutic Child Care Grant Program.
bill_summary: This bill modifies the funding and implementation schedule of the Therapeutic Child Care Grant Program in Maryland, including increasing budget allocations for certain fiscal years and adjusting the distribution of grant funds to providers serving children with developmental delays or disabilities.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Education
stakeholders: Children under age 6 with developmental delays or disabilities, child care providers, families
innovative_summary: The program employs targeted grant distribution to specialized providers for early childhood intervention, but does not incorporate new technologies or approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: High potential for impact on child poverty through improved early childhood care for vulnerable children.

Title: Drunk Driving - Commercial Driver's Licenses - Disqualification From Driving
Synopsis: Requiring the Motor Vehicle Administration to disqualify any individual from driving a commercial motor vehicle for 1 year if the individual, while holding a commercial instructional permit or commercial driver's license, drives or attempts to drive any motor vehicle while the alcohol concentration of the person's blood or breath is 0.08 or greater.
bill_summary: The bill requires the Maryland Motor Vehicle Administration to disqualify individuals from driving commercial motor vehicles for a specified period or for life if they commit various alcohol-related driving offenses, including driving with an alcohol concentration of 0.08 or greater.
responsible_party: Maryland Motor Vehicle Administration
stakeholders: Commercial drivers and individuals who drive or may drive commercial vehicles in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill enhances existing disqualification rules for commercial drivers by including an explicit disqualification for driving with an alcohol concentration of 0.08 or greater and lifetime disqualification for multiple violations.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill is not directly aimed at reducing child poverty; it focuses on driver disqualification rules.

Title: Vehicle Laws - Towed, Removed, or Abandoned Vehicles - Electronic Notice to Owner
Synopsis: Authorizing a person who tows or removes a vehicle from a parking lot to provide electronic notice of the tow or removal to the vehicle owner through the Motor Vehicle Administration under certain circumstances; and authorizing a police department that takes an abandoned vehicle into custody to send an electronic notice to the last known registered owner of the vehicle through the Administration under certain circumstances.
