bill_summary: The bill authorizes towing and removal companies and police departments to send electronic notices to vehicle owners regarding towed, removed, or abandoned vehicles, including establishing procedures, notifying owners via email, and creating a database for electronic communication.
responsible_party: Maryland Motor Vehicle Administration and local police departments
stakeholders: Vehicle owners, towing companies, police departments, insurers, secured parties
innovative_summary: The bill introduces electronic notification procedures for vehicle towing, removal, and abandonment awareness, including the use of a centralized database and email communications.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program could potentially reduce the burden on vehicle owners by streamlining notifications, but its direct impact on child poverty is limited.

Title: Uninsured Employers' Fund - Assessments and Special Monitor
Synopsis: Altering the circumstances under which the Uninsured Employers' Fund must collect or suspend a certain assessment; altering, from 1% to up to 1.5%, the additional percentage the Uninsured Employers' Fund Board may direct the Workers' Compensation Commission to assess on awards and settlements if the Board determines that the reserves of the Fund are inadequate to meet anticipated losses; and requiring the Workers' Compensation Commission to designate a special monitor to assess the financial condition of the Uninsured Employers' Fund.
bill_summary: The bill updates the assessment percentage the Uninsured Employers’ Fund can impose on awards, settlements, and insurers, and establishes a special monitor to assess the financial condition of the Fund for up to one year, including recommended legislative changes.
responsible_party: Workers’ Compensation Commission
stakeholders: Employers, insurers, and employees covered by workers' compensation in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a special monitoring process with a designated monitor to assess the financial health of the Uninsured Employers’ Fund, which is a proactive approach to fund management.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill does not directly target child poverty, but improving the financial stability of workers' compensation could indirectly support economic stability for families.

Title: Public Schools - Restorative Practices Schools - Comprehensive Plan
Synopsis: Requiring the State Department of Education to develop a comprehensive plan by July 1, 2026, for the establishment of Restorative Practices Schools which integrate restorative practices into daily practices and activities of the whole school; requiring a county board of education to use the comprehensive plan if the county board chooses to establish a Restorative Practices School; and requiring the Department to report to the Governor and the General Assembly by December 1, 2026, on the comprehensive plan for Restorative Practices Schools.
bill_summary: The bill requires the Maryland Department of Education to develop a comprehensive plan to implement Restorative Practices Schools, which are schools that integrate restorative practices into daily activities, and to assist local school systems in creating such schools. It also sets guidelines for student discipline and prohibits corporal punishment.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Education
stakeholders: Public school students, teachers, administrators, and families in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill promotes the adoption of restorative practices, a relationship-focused, preventative approach to discipline, with a structured plan and statewide standards, which is an innovative approach to school discipline.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has strong potential to reduce child poverty by improving school climate and student well-being, which can lead to better educational and socio-economic outcomes.

Title: Election Law - Notice to Permanent Absentee Voters
Synopsis: Altering the time before an election when a certain notice is required to be sent to each voter who is on the permanent absentee ballot list; repealing a requirement that the notice be sent to each voter who is on the permanent absentee ballot list as of a certain date; and altering the action the State Board of Elections is required to take if the State Board is unable to contact a voter who is on the permanent absentee ballot list using the method of communication chosen by the voter.
bill_summary: The bill alters the procedures for sending notices to voters on the permanent absentee ballot list, including changing when notices are sent, what contact methods are used, and the actions if contact fails.
responsible_party: Maryland State Board of Elections
stakeholders: Voters enrolled in the permanent absentee ballot list in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill primarily modifies communication procedures for existing absentee voting processes, rather than introducing new technologies or approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill is unlikely to have a direct impact on child poverty.

Title: Consumer Protection – False Advertising – Digital Goods
Synopsis: Prohibiting a person that is a seller from advertising or offering for sale a digital good using certain terminology unless, before executing the sale, a certain affirmative acknowledgment is received from the purchaser or a certain clear and conspicuous statement is provided by the seller; and establishing that a violation of the Act is an unfair, abusive, or deceptive trade practice subject to certain enforcement and penalty provisions.
bill_summary: This bill prohibits deceptive advertising and sale practices related to digital goods, requiring sellers to provide clear license information and acknowledgment from buyers, especially for time-limited rentals, and establishes penalties for violations.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Commerce or relevant consumer protection agency
stakeholders: Consumers purchasing digital goods and digital content providers in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill employs new legal definitions and requirements for digital goods, emphasizing clear licensing and acknowledgment procedures, representing an innovative approach in digital commerce regulation.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill's focus on digital goods advertising likely has limited direct impact on child poverty.

Title: State Finance and Procurement - Local Cybersecurity Preparedness and Response Plan and Assessment - Repeal
Synopsis: Repealing a duplicative provision of law requiring each county government, local school system, and local health department, in consultation with the local emergency manager, to create or update a cybersecurity preparedness and response plan and complete a cybersecurity preparedness assessment in a manner and frequency established by the Department of Information Technology.
bill_summary: The bill repeals a law that required local government entities in Maryland to create or update cybersecurity preparedness and response plans and conduct assessments.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Information Technology
stakeholders: Local government entities in Maryland, such as counties, local school systems, and local health departments
innovative_summary: The bill primarily removes existing cybersecurity requirements and does not establish new programs or initiatives.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill is unlikely to have a direct impact on child poverty.

Title: Human Services - Maryland Assistive Technology Program - Establishment
Synopsis: Establishing the Maryland Assistive Technology Program in the Department of Disabilities; providing the purpose of the Program is to increase access to assistive technology services and devices for individuals with disabilities, support the State's efforts to provide assistive technology services and devices to persons with disabilities of all ages, including underrepresented populations, and ensure statewide access to assistive technology lending libraries; establishing the Assistive Technology Services Fund; etc.
bill_summary: The bill establishes the Maryland Assistive Technology Program within the Department of Disabilities to provide assistive technology devices and services to individuals with disabilities. It also creates the Assistive Technology Services Fund to support these activities and related digital accessibility services.
responsible_party: Department of Disabilities
stakeholders: Individuals with disabilities in Maryland
innovative_summary: Creates a comprehensive statewide assistive technology program and fund, including digital accessibility services, which is an integrated approach leveraging new technology and services.
child_poverty_direct_summary: High potential to impact child poverty among disabled children by improving access to technology and services.

Title: Public Safety - Fuel Gas Piping Systems and Corrugated Stainless Steel Tubing - Prohibitions and Study
Synopsis: Prohibiting the sale, offer for sale, transfer, or distribution of non-arc-resistant jacketed corrugated stainless steel tubing; providing a civil penalty of up to $1,000 for a violation of the Act; and requiring the Maryland Department of Labor and the Office of the State Fire Marshal, by September 1, 2026, to submit a final report to the Governor and certain committees of the General Assembly with recommendations related to preventing the fire hazards associated with commonly used fuel gas piping systems.
bill_summary: The bill prohibits the sale, transfer, or use of non–arc-resistant jacketed corrugated stainless steel tubing that does not meet specific safety standards in residential and commercial buildings. It also requires a study and recommendations by state agencies on the fire hazards associated with fuel gas piping systems, including gas piping and tubing.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Labor and the Office of the State Fire Marshal
stakeholders: Manufacturers, builders, property owners, and residents of Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill involves a comprehensive study and set of standards to improve fire safety related to fuel gas piping systems, employing scientific testing and recommendations for legislative and regulatory updates.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill does not directly address child poverty but may improve safety in residential buildings, which can indirectly benefit children.

Title: Vehicle Laws - Exceptional Hauling Permits for Farm Products
Synopsis: Creating an exception for vehicles carrying fluid milk products to the prohibition against driving a vehicle subject to an exceptional hauling permit on the interstate highway system; altering certain weight limits and tolerances under an exceptional hauling permit; altering the preventive maintenance documents that an individual operating under an exceptional hauling permit must possess; and altering certain record-keeping requirements and the application of certain administrative penalties under an exceptional hauling permit.
bill_summary: The bill creates an exception for vehicles carrying fluid milk products from certain rules related to exceptional hauling permits, including restrictions on interstate highway use, weight limits, and permit requirements.
responsible_party: Maryland State Highway Administration
stakeholders: Farmers, transportation companies, and consumers of dairy products
innovative_summary: The bill employs regulatory adjustments and permit exceptions to facilitate the transportation of farm milk products, which is a common but necessary process for the dairy industry.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill may indirectly benefit child nutrition and welfare by supporting a stable dairy supply chain, but does not directly target child poverty.

Title: Anne Arundel County – Public Schools – School Schedule Options
Synopsis: Authorizing the Anne Arundel County Board of Education to operate all schools within the county using a scheduling model that eliminates early dismissal days to allow for less than 180 school days if the minimal hours of attendance are met; requiring the board, if it elects to use a scheduling model that results in a school in the county being open for less than 180 days to offer certain school employees an opportunity to make up the lost wages; and requiring the Board to make a report on the schools using an alternative scheduling model.
bill_summary: This bill authorizes Anne Arundel County to run some public schools using an alternative scheduling model that can eliminate early dismissals and operate with fewer than 180 days, provided certain reporting and wage restitution requirements are met. It also permits schools to operate year-round under specific conditions.
responsible_party: Anne Arundel County Board of Education
stakeholders: Students, teachers, and staff in Anne Arundel County public schools
innovative_summary: The bill introduces the option for schools to operate on alternative year-round or modified schedules, which is a relatively innovative approach to school scheduling and flexibility.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has the potential to directly impact child poverty by offering more flexible schooling options and ensuring wage opportunities for staff, which could improve educational access and staff retention.

Title: Corporations and Associations - Electric Cooperatives - Nonescheat Capital Credits
Synopsis: Providing that certain unclaimed money held by an electric cooperative and due to a past member is not considered abandoned property; and authorizing an electric cooperative to use this money only to assist members of the cooperative or make donations to nonprofit, charitable organizations.
bill_summary: This bill amends Maryland law concerning the handling of unclaimed money held by electric cooperatives, specifically clarifying that certain nonescheat capital credits are not considered abandoned property and can only be used for specified purposes such as assisting members or making donations to nonprofits.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Commerce or the applicable cooperative oversight agency
stakeholders: Members of electric cooperatives and the cooperatives themselves in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a specific legal recognition that certain retained capital credits are not abandoned property and can be used for cooperative or charitable purposes, which is a new legal clarification in this context.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill’s direct impact on child poverty appears limited, as it primarily governs financial and legal procedures for electric cooperatives.

Title: Maryland Veterans Trust – Assistance to Members of the Maryland National Guard
Synopsis: Expanding the purposes of the Maryland Veterans Trust to include providing monetary and other assistance to members of the Maryland National Guard and their families; and authorizing the Maryland Veterans Trust to expend money from the Maryland Veterans Trust Fund to provide loans and grants to members of the Maryland National Guard and their families.
bill_summary: The bill expands the Maryland Veterans Trust's purposes to include providing assistance, grants, and loans to members of the Maryland National Guard and their families, and allows the trust to use its funds for these purposes.
responsible_party: Maryland Veterans Trust (under the Maryland Department of Veterans Affairs)
stakeholders: Members of the Maryland National Guard and their families, veterans, and programs supporting them
innovative_summary: The bill expands existing veteran support programs to specifically include National Guard members and their families, integrating these groups into existing trust mechanisms.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill potentially helps reduce child poverty among families of National Guard members and veterans by providing financial assistance.

Title: Maryland Public Ethics Law - Training and Financial Disclosure Requirements - Revisions
Synopsis: Altering the format and content of training on the requirements of the Maryland Public Ethics Law provided by the State Ethics Commission to certain State employees and regulated lobbyists to be either through online training or live presentation on the conflict of interest, financial disclosure, relevant administrative, and other applicable requirements of the law; and altering the scope of disclosure for the employment of an individual or a member of the individual's immediate family reported in a financial disclosure statement.
bill_summary: The bill updates Maryland's public ethics laws by changing the format of ethics training courses, expanding the scope of financial disclosure reporting, and making other revisions to transparency and ethics requirements for public officials and lobbyists. It mandates online or live training for certain officials and lobbyists, revises gift acceptance rules, and broadens disclosure of employment and business interests.
responsible_party: Maryland State Ethics Commission
stakeholders: Maryland public officials, lobbyists, and the general public seeking transparency in government
innovative_summary: The bill employs online training methods for ethics education and broadens disclosure requirements, enhancing transparency through use of technology and expanded reporting.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has limited direct impact on child poverty but promotes government transparency and accountability.

Title: State Government - Information Technology - Cybersecurity Revisions
Synopsis: Altering the duties of the Cyber Preparedness Unit in the Maryland Department of Emergency Management; altering the duties of the Office of Security Management in the Department of Information Technology; requiring the Office to submit a yearly report to the Governor and certain committees of the General Assembly on the State's cybersecurity expenditures and recommendations for changes to the budget; and altering the responsibilities of the Secretary of Information Technology with regard to information technology policies.
bill_summary: The bill enhances Maryland's cybersecurity framework by defining roles and responsibilities for the Cyber Preparedness Unit, the Office of Security Management, and the Secretary of Information Technology. It mandates annual reporting on cybersecurity activities and strategies, supports local governments with resources and exercises, and establishes guidelines for managing cybersecurity threats across state agencies.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Emergency Management, Maryland Department of Information Technology, and the Office of Security Management
stakeholders: State government agencies, local governments, and residents of Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill employs a coordinated statewide cybersecurity strategy with regular assessments, resource sharing, regional exercises, and comprehensive reporting, integrating technology and management approaches to enhance cybersecurity resilience.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill primarily focuses on cybersecurity infrastructure and coordination, with minimal direct impact on child poverty.

Title: Peace Orders and Criminal Harassment - Intentional Visual Surveillance
Synopsis: Expanding the relief that may be included in a final peace order; altering the acts that constitute criminal harassment to include certain visual surveillance of an area of another person's residence where the other has a reasonable expectation of privacy; and providing that a person who violates the Act is guilty of a misdemeanor and on conviction for a first offense is subject to imprisonment of up to 90 days or a fine of $500 or both, and for a second or subsequent offense, imprisonment of up to 180 days or a fine of $1,000 or both.
bill_summary: The bill expands the legal protections against visual surveillance by allowing individuals to petition for peace orders if they experience intentional visual surveillance of areas where they have a reasonable expectation of privacy at their residence. It also modifies criminal harassment laws to include certain acts of visual surveillance and provides for remedies in peace orders, such as removing or repositioning surveillance devices.
responsible_party: Maryland Courts and Judiciary
stakeholders: Residents and individuals experiencing unauthorized visual surveillance at their homes
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a legal approach that explicitly addresses intentional visual surveillance and provides specific remedies, employing legal tools to mitigate privacy invasions. It does not employ new technologies but enhances legal protections.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill's provisions are not directly aimed at reducing child poverty, but improved privacy protections can benefit families and children by ensuring safer living environments.

Title: Charitable Organizations - Late Fees and Registration - Suspension and Cancellation Requirements
Synopsis: Authorizing the Secretary of State to suspend payment of certain late fees assessed to certain charitable organizations that fail to file an annual report under certain circumstances; and authorizing the Secretary of State to cancel a charitable organization's registration or reinstate a charitable organization's canceled registration under certain circumstances.
bill_summary: The bill updates regulations for charitable organizations in Maryland, including variations of fees based on contributions, conditions for suspending late fees, and procedures for canceling or reinstating registration.
responsible_party: Secretary of State of Maryland
stakeholders: Charitable organizations operating in Maryland and the public they serve
innovative_summary: The bill introduces some flexibility in the collection of late fees, including options to suspend or waive fees through regulations or settlement agreements, and streamlines registration and cancellation processes.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill's impact on child poverty is indirect, primarily through improved regulatory oversight and potentially increased donations via clarified processes.

Title: Marriage - Confidential Communication
Synopsis: Clarifying that "spouse" includes a former spouse for purposes of disclosure of confidential communications occurring during marriage; and establishing that a spouse, who is the alleged victim, is competent to disclose a confidential communication between spouses occurring during their marriage in a criminal action in which one spouse is charged with a crime against the other spouse.
bill_summary: This bill clarifies that the definition of 'spouse' includes former spouses and establishes that a spouse who is the alleged victim can disclose confidential communications made during marriage in criminal cases where one spouse is charged with a crime against the other. It also states that such spouses cannot be compelled to testify about these communications.
responsible_party: Maryland Courts and Judicial Proceedings
stakeholders: Spouses, victims of crimes, legal system participants
innovative_summary: The bill mainly clarifies legal definitions and rules concerning confidential communications between spouses, with limited technological or new approach elements.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill is unlikely to have a direct impact on child poverty.

Title: Family Law - Adoption of an Adult
Synopsis: Limiting the requirement that a petitioner's spouse join in the petition for adoption to apply only when the prospective adoptee is a minor; authorizing a petitioner's spouse to join in the petition for adoption if the prospective adoptee is an adult; establishing that certain provisions of law requiring the issuance and service of a show-cause order on a prospective adoptee's parents do not apply if the prospective adoptee is an adult; etc.
bill_summary: This bill amends Maryland family law to allow the adoption of adults, modify requirements for spouses joining in adoption petitions based on the age of the adoptee, and adjusts legal procedures regarding parental consent and investigations in adult adoption cases.
responsible_party: Maryland State Judiciary and Family Law Courts
stakeholders: Adults seeking adoption, prospective adoptees, their families, and legal professionals involved in family law cases
innovative_summary: The program introduces a legal framework for the adoption of adults, including procedural changes like suspending certain legal requirements and allowing investigations for adult adoptees, employing legal reforms rather than new technology.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has no direct impact on child poverty as it pertains solely to adult adoption procedures.

Title: Human Services - Adult Protective Services
Synopsis: Specifying that certain provisions of law relating to confidentiality do not prohibit the disclosure of certain information relating to adult protective services or the disclosure of the identity of certain persons making certain reports under certain circumstances; expanding the definition of "health practitioner" to include certain emergency medical providers; and authorizing individuals who are required in specific instances to report information regarding alleged vulnerable adults to make a report by calling the statewide reporting hotline.
bill_summary: The bill updates confidentiality rules related to adult protective services, expanding disclosure allowances, broadening the definition of 'health practitioner' to include certain emergency medical services providers, and clarifying reporting procedures for suspected abuse or neglect of vulnerable adults. It also authorizes reports via a hotline and updates procedures for disclosing the identity of reporters.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Human Services
stakeholders: Vulnerable adults, adult protective services officials, emergency medical providers, the general public
innovative_summary: The bill employs a comprehensive update to confidentiality and reporting laws, including integration of a statewide hotline and expanded definition of health practitioners, representing a modernization of reporting infrastructure.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill primarily focuses on protections for vulnerable adults and reporting procedures; it does not directly address child poverty.

Title: Residential Real Property - Local Limits on Summoning Law Enforcement or Emergency Services
Synopsis: Prohibiting a local jurisdiction from enforcing a law or ordinance that limits the summoning of law enforcement or emergency services to a residential property by establishing a certain threshold or penalty.
bill_summary: This bill prohibits local jurisdictions in Maryland from enacting or enforcing laws that limit the number of times law enforcement or emergency services can be summoned to a residential property, or that penalize individuals for summoning such services, effectively protecting residents' right to seek emergency assistance without penalty.
responsible_party: Maryland State government, likely through the judiciary or local government agencies
stakeholders: Residents of Maryland, particularly those who may need to summon emergency services multiple times or face penalties under local laws
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a legal protection for residents by explicitly prohibiting local laws that restrict or penalize summoning emergency services to residential properties, which is a new approach to safeguarding emergency assistance rights.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill could indirectly help reduce child and family hardship by ensuring access to emergency services without fear of penalty, particularly in vulnerable communities.

Title: Human Services – Local Departments of Social Services – Audits
Synopsis: Altering the frequency, from once every 3 years to an interval of once every 4 years unless it is determined on a case-by-case basis that an audit occur at an interval of 3 years, with which the Office of the Inspector General in the Department of Human Services conducts or contracts for financial and compliance audits of local departments of social services.
bill_summary: The bill alters the frequency with which the Office of the Inspector General in the Maryland Department of Human Services conducts or contracts for financial and compliance audits of local departments of social services, changing it to every 3 to 4 years based on risk assessments.
responsible_party: Department of Human Services
stakeholders: Local departments of social services and their clients in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a risk-based approach to audit frequency, which is a more tailored and efficient method compared to a fixed interval.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill's impact on child poverty is indirect, primarily through improved oversight and accountability of social services.

Title: Health Occupations Boards - Membership Alteration and Sunset Extensions
Synopsis: Continuing certain health occupations boards and the Behavior Analyst Advisory Committee within the State Board of Professional Counselors and Therapists in accordance with the provisions of the Maryland Program Evaluation Act (sunset law) by extending to a certain date the termination provisions relating to the statutory and regulatory authority of the boards and Committee; and altering the membership of the State Board of Massage Therapy Examiners.
bill_summary: The bill extends the sunset dates of several health occupations boards and committees in Maryland, including the State Board of Examiners for Audiologists, Hearing Aid Dispensers, Speech-Language Pathologists, and Music Therapists, the State Board of Massage Therapy Examiners, the State Board of Pharmacy, the State Board of Professional Counselors and Therapists, and the Behavior Analyst Advisory Committee. It also makes specific amendments to the membership and appointment processes for the Massage Therapy Examiners Board.
responsible_party: Maryland state health occupations boards and departments responsible for licensing and oversight
stakeholders: Health professionals in Maryland, including audiologists, massage therapists, pharmacists, counselors, therapists, and behavior analysts, as well as the general public who receive services from these professionals.
innovative_summary: The bill mainly focuses on extending the operational timelines of existing health boards and committees; it does not employ new technologies or innovative approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has no direct or significant impact on child poverty, as it pertains primarily to regulation and oversight of health professional boards.

Title: Economic Development - West North Avenue Development Authority - Alterations
Synopsis: Altering the administration and membership of the West North Avenue Development Authority; specifying the powers and duties of the Authority, subject to certain limitations; requiring the Authority to take certain actions regarding the finances of the Authority; exempting the Authority from certain taxation or assessments under certain circumstances; establishing the West North Avenue Development Authority Fund as a special, nonlapsing fund; altering the termination date of the Authority; etc.
bill_summary: The bill establishes and modifies the West North Avenue Development Authority in Baltimore City to promote economic development, community revitalization, and property redevelopment within the targeted corridor, with specific provisions for governance, powers, funding, and exemptions from certain laws.
responsible_party: West North Avenue Development Authority
stakeholders: Residents, local businesses, community organizations in Baltimore City along the West North Avenue corridor
innovative_summary: The program employs a new economic development authority with comprehensive powers, targeted funding mechanisms, and community stakeholder engagement to revitalize a specific urban corridor.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has the potential for significant impact on child poverty by improving neighborhood conditions, but its primary focus is on economic and community development.

Title: Public Safety - Statewide DNA Database System, DNA Collection, and Penalties - Alterations
Synopsis: Requiring a certain DNA sample to be collected in a certain manner from an individual who is required to register as a sex offender; requiring a DNA sample to be collected by a certain individual or at a certain location under certain circumstances; requiring a custodial agency or correctional facility to ensure a DNA sample is collected in a certain manner; prohibiting a DNA sample from being tested and placed in a certain statewide DNA database system until certain conditions are met; etc.
bill_summary: The bill modifies Maryland's laws on the collection, testing, and expungement of DNA samples related to criminal investigations and offenders, including requirements for collecting DNA from sex offenders and individuals charged with certain crimes, and establishing procedures for destruction and expungement of DNA records.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of State Police, Forensic Sciences Division
stakeholders: Individuals subjected to DNA collection, law enforcement, criminal justice system, and the public
innovative_summary: The bill updates regulations for DNA collection, testing, and expungement, emphasizing timely destruction of unneeded samples and records, and enhances procedures for DNA record management, showing improvements in data handling and privacy.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill primarily affects criminal justice processes and privacy laws; its direct impact on child poverty is minimal.

Title: Criminal Law - Drug Paraphernalia - Prohibitions and Penalties
Synopsis: Altering the penalties for a person using or possessing with intent to use, delivering or selling under certain circumstances, or manufacturing or possessing with intent to deliver or sell under certain circumstances drug paraphernalia to inject, ingest, inhale, or otherwise introduce into the human body a controlled dangerous substance; removing intent to administer a controlled dangerous substance from a certain list of intents; etc.
bill_summary: The bill modifies Maryland's laws on drug paraphernalia by altering penalties, removing certain prohibitions, and clarifying circumstances under which paraphernalia possession and distribution are illegal, especially in relation to controlled dangerous substances.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Public Safety and Correctional Services
stakeholders: Individuals involved in drug use, law enforcement, and the judicial system in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill primarily makes legal and penal modifications regarding drug paraphernalia; it does not introduce new technologies or approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill does not directly impact child poverty.

Title: Estates and Trusts - Priority of Claims on an Estate - Unpaid Child Support
Synopsis: Prioritizing the payment of unpaid child support over certain other claims on an estate of a decedent with insufficient assets to pay all claims in full.
bill_summary: This bill amends the order of claims on an estate in Maryland, specifically prioritizing unpaid child support over certain other claims when the estate's assets are insufficient to pay all claims in full.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Estates and Trusts (or relevant estate department)
stakeholders: Recipients of unpaid child support, estate administrators, debtors
innovative_summary: This bill primarily revises legal estate priority rules; it does not employ new technologies or innovative approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has the potential to directly impact children receiving unpaid child support by prioritizing their claims in estate settlements.

Title: Department of Agriculture - Maryland Agricultural Commission and Young Farmers
Synopsis: Altering the membership of the Maryland Agricultural Commission; establishing the Committee on Young Farmers for purposes of  communicating to the Maryland Agricultural Commission on issues relating to young and beginning farmers in the State; repealing the provisions of law establishing and governing the Young Farmers Advisory Board; and requiring the Maryland Agricultural Land Preservation Foundation to be governed and administered by a board of trustees composed in a certain manner.
bill_summary: The bill reforms the Maryland Agricultural Commission, establishes a new Committee on Young Farmers, and repeals other young farmers advisory structures to improve representation, communication, and support for young and beginning farmers in Maryland.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Agriculture
stakeholders: Young and beginning farmers, agricultural industry participants in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a dedicated committee on young farmers to focus on issues impacting new farmers and improve communication between young farmers and policy makers, employing a more targeted and organized approach.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has potential to reduce child poverty by supporting young farmers, who are often from economically disadvantaged backgrounds, thereby strengthening rural economies and family incomes.

Title: Dental Services - Qualification for Maryland Dent-Care Program
Synopsis: Altering the eligibility criteria for Higher Education Loan Assistance Grants under the Maryland Dent-Care Program to include part-time employment.
bill_summary: The bill alters eligibility criteria for the Maryland Dent–Care Program, increases the financial aid provided to dental professionals through the program, and requires a study on the use of online credentialing systems by dental insurance carriers.
responsible_party: Office of Student Financial Assistance and Maryland Department of Health
stakeholders: Dental professionals, dental students, Medicaid recipients, and dental insurance carriers in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a healthcare workforce program with financial incentives and mandates a study on the use of online credentialing systems to improve efficiency.
child_poverty_direct_summary: Potentially high impact as increased dental care access can improve children's oral health and overall well-being.

Title: Hospitals - Financial Assistance and Collection of Debts - Policies
Synopsis: Altering provisions of law related to a hospital's financial assistance and collection of debts policies; specifying the percentage by which a hospital is required to reduce a patient's out-of-pocket expenses under certain circumstances; adding to the notice requirements relating to a hospital's financial assistance policy; prohibiting a hospital from filing a civil action to collect a debt against a patient whose outstanding debt is at or below $500; etc.
bill_summary: The bill updates Maryland laws to enhance hospital financial assistance policies, limit civil actions and collections practices for medical debts, and improve transparency and protections for patients regarding hospital bills and debt collection.
responsible_party: Maryland Health Care Commission
stakeholders: Hospital patients, especially those with low or no income, and healthcare providers
innovative_summary: The bill employs comprehensive reforms for hospital billing, financial assistance, and debt collection, emphasizing transparency, patient protections, and use of standardized procedures. It introduces modernized rules but does not employ new technologies or innovative approaches beyond policy reforms.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has potential to reduce child poverty by making hospital bills more manageable and improving access to financial assistance for low-income families.

Title: Data Center Impact Analysis and Report
Synopsis: Requiring the Department of the Environment, the Maryland Energy Administration, and the University of Maryland School of Business, in coordination with the Department of Legislative Services, to conduct an analysis of the likely environmental, energy, and economic impacts of data center development in the State; and requiring the Department of Legislative Services to coordinate preparation of the final report to be submitted to the Governor and the General Assembly by September 1, 2026.
bill_summary: This bill requires Maryland state agencies and institutions to analyze the environmental, energy, and economic impacts of data center development in the state, and to submit a report on their findings by September 1, 2026.
responsible_party: Department of the Environment, Maryland Energy Administration, University of Maryland School of Business, Department of Legislative Services
stakeholders: Data center industry, Maryland residents, environmental and energy sectors, state and local governments
innovative_summary: The bill employs a coordinated, research-based approach to assess the multifaceted impacts of data development, involving multiple agencies and academic expertise, which is relatively innovative for impact assessments.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill does not directly address child poverty but may influence economic and environmental factors affecting various populations.

Title: Maryland Department of Planning – Modernization
Synopsis: Requiring the State Administrator of Elections to electronically submit certain precinct boundary information to the Secretary of Planning; altering certain requirements related to the Department of Planning preparing population projections for the Washington and Baltimore metropolitan areas to authorize the use of population figures developed by the Baltimore Metropolitan Council, the Metropolitan Washington Council of Governments and their member jurisdictions; etc.
bill_summary: The bill updates reporting and procedural requirements for the Maryland Department of Planning related to population projections, land and property information, and coordination of planning efforts across state and local agencies. It also streamlines certain legal access to state land and facilities planning information.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Planning
stakeholders: State and local government agencies involved in planning and land management, and the general public of Maryland.
innovative_summary: The bill primarily updates existing procedures and streamlines data sharing and planning processes without introducing new technologies or innovative approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has limited direct impact on child poverty, focusing mainly on planning and land information sharing.

Title: Residential Leases - Late Payment Penalties - Calculation
Synopsis: Altering a prohibition concerning the maximum penalty for the late payment of rent that a landlord may charge in a residential lease to prohibit a penalty in excess of 5% of the amount of the unpaid rent rather than of the amount due.
bill_summary: The bill modifies the rules regarding late payment penalties in residential leases by setting a maximum penalty in terms of a percentage of the unpaid rent, replacing previous rules that related penalties to a percentage of the total rent due.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Housing and Community Development (implied)
stakeholders: Tenants and landlords in Maryland residential leases
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a more precise cap on late payment penalties based on a percentage of unpaid rent, aiming to make penalties clearer and more equitable.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has a limited direct impact on child poverty, mainly affecting housing affordability and landlord-tenant relations.

Title: Family Law - Child Support - Multifamily Adjustment
Synopsis: Altering the definition of "adjusted actual income" under the State child support guidelines by requiring the deduction, from actual income, of an allowance for support for each child in the parent's home for whom the parent owes a legal duty of support but who is not subject to a support order; requiring that the amount of a certain allowance be subtracted from a parent's actual income before the court determines the amount of a child support award; etc.
bill_summary: The bill modifies Maryland's child support guidelines by defining 'adjusted actual income' and including an allowance deduction for support of children who spend more than 92 nights a year in a parent's home. It also revises how courts determine when the guidelines should not be strictly applied, emphasizing consideration of existing agreements, household circumstances, and poverty levels.
responsible_party: Maryland State Judiciary or Department of Human Services
stakeholders: Parents, children, family courts in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a nuanced adjustment to income calculations for child support, incorporating specific allowances for children spending significant time in a parent's home, as well as detailed factors for court discretion. This represents a technological and procedural innovation in case-law transparency and fairness.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has a high potential to impact child poverty by ensuring more accurate and equitable child support awards, considering household circumstances and poverty levels.

Title: State Government - Forms - Reporting Requirement - Repeal
Synopsis: Repealing a requirement that certain departments or units of State government annually submit a report on the management of forms to the Department of General Services.
bill_summary: The bill repeals the requirement for Maryland state departments to submit annual reports on their form management to the Department of General Services, effective July 1, 2025.
responsible_party: Department of General Services or relevant state departments
stakeholders: Maryland state government agencies
innovative_summary: The bill simplifies government reporting requirements by eliminating a recurring reporting mandate.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has no direct impact on child poverty as it mainly involves administrative reporting requirements.

Title: Environment - Water Bottle Filling Stations - Requirement
Synopsis: Requiring a water bottle filling station or a combined water bottle filling station and drinking fountain to be installed in certain new construction or as part of certain renovations beginning October 1, 2025, subject to certain exceptions; requiring the Maryland Department of Labor to adopt regulations to carry out the provisions of the Act; and applying the Act prospectively.
bill_summary: The bill requires that starting October 1, 2025, all new constructions or renovations in Maryland include a water bottle filling station in places where drinking fountains are currently required, with some exceptions. The Maryland Department of Labor is tasked with adopting regulations to implement this requirement.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Labor
stakeholders: Buildings undergoing new construction or renovations, and the general public who will use these water stations.
innovative_summary: The bill promotes environmental sustainability by encouraging the use of reusable water bottles through the installation of modern water bottle filling stations, integrating water filtration and cooling technology.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program's impact on child poverty is indirect but could promote better health and hydration among children through increased access to drinking water.

Title: Municipalities - Annexation Resolutions - Submission to Department of Planning
Synopsis: Adding the Department of Planning to the list of entities to which a municipality must send a copy of an annexation resolution with the new municipal boundaries.
bill_summary: The bill amends Maryland law to require municipalities to send a copy of their annexation resolution with new boundaries to the Department of Planning, in addition to other entities, within 10 days of taking effect.
responsible_party: Department of Planning
stakeholders: Municipal governments and residents affected by annexation
innovative_summary: The bill modernizes the annexation process by adding the Department of Planning as a recipient of annexation resolutions, ensuring better coordination and record-keeping.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill does not directly impact child poverty; it focuses on municipal boundary procedures.

Title: Procurement – Electronic Transactions – Clarification of Fees Due
Synopsis: Specifying that fees collected for electronic transactions for procurements are those due to the State and not any fees due to a third party.
bill_summary: The bill clarifies that fees collected for electronic procurement transactions are to be paid to the State of Maryland, not third parties, and outlines rules for when and how such fees can be charged and deposited.
responsible_party: Chief Procurement Officer and State procurement agencies
stakeholders: Businesses and contractors participating in Maryland State procurement processes
innovative_summary: The bill employs electronic transaction technology to streamline procurement processes and clarifies fee collection practices to ensure transparency and proper allocation of funds.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has limited direct impact on child poverty, as it primarily focuses on procurement procedures and fee clarifications.

Title: Local Comprehensive Planning and State Economic Growth, Resource Protection, and Planning Policy - Planning Principles
Synopsis: Providing certain planning principles that are collectively intended to create sustainable communities and to protect the environment utilizing active public participation; altering the State Economic Growth, Resource Protection, and Planning Policy to consist of planning principles for advancing sustainable growth in the State; and requiring the publisher of the Annotated Code of Maryland, along with the Department of Legislative Services, to correct cross-references and terminology in the Code that are rendered incorrect by the Act.
bill_summary: The bill updates and clarifies planning principles and policies for sustainable community development, resource protection, infrastructure, transportation, housing, and economic growth in Maryland. It emphasizes public participation, environmental protection, and resilient planning in both local and state planning frameworks, with a focus on sustainable growth and development.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Planning and Maryland Department of Transportation
stakeholders: Mary Maryland residents, local governments, community organizations, environmental groups, and businesses involved in land use, infrastructure, and economic development
innovative_summary: The bill promotes integrated, sustainable planning principles that emphasize community engagement, ecological conservation, and resilient development, employing a comprehensive approach to future growth.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill's focus on equitable housing, community participation, and sustainable development has high potential to reduce child poverty by creating healthier and more accessible communities.

Title: Maryland Transportation Authority – Tolls, Fees, and Other Charges – Temporary Adjustments
Synopsis: Increasing from 180 days to 300 days the maximum duration of an emergency status determination authorizing the temporary adjustment of tolls, fees, or other charges by the Maryland Transportation Authority.
bill_summary: The bill extends the maximum duration of emergency determinations that allow the Maryland Transportation Authority to temporarily adjust tolls, fees, and other charges from 180 days to 300 days, with provisions for public review and comment during such periods.
responsible_party: Maryland Transportation Authority
stakeholders: Motorists, transportation users in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill mainly modifies existing procedures for temporary toll adjustments, with no significant introduction of new technologies or approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has no direct impact on child poverty.

Title: Cooperative Housing Corporations, Condominiums, and Homeowners Associations - Funding of Reserve Accounts and Preparation of Funding Plans
Synopsis: Requiring that certain funds for certain reserve accounts be deposited on or before the last day of each fiscal year; requiring the governing body of a cooperative housing corporation, a residential condominium, or a homeowners association to prepare a certain funding plan subject to certain requirements; authorizing a reasonable deviation from certain reserve funding requirements following a certain financial hardship determination; requiring that certain updated reserve studies be prepared by a certain person; etc.
bill_summary: The bill mandates the development, review, and funding of reserve studies for cooperatives, condominiums, and homeowners associations, including specific requirements for reserve account funding, preparation of funding plans, and potential deviations due to financial hardship, with the goal of ensuring adequate reserves for future repairs and replacements.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Housing and Community Development and local authorities overseeing residential communities
stakeholders: Residents of cooperative housing, condominiums, and homeowners associations in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill introduces detailed requirements for regular reserve studies, updated reserve studies, and comprehensive funding plans, utilizing professional standards and potentially employing new methodologies for funding reserve accounts, which reflects a structured and proactive government approach to housing sustainability.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program potentially reduces child poverty indirectly by ensuring housing stability and safety through better reserve funding, but it does not directly target child poverty.

Title: Criminal Procedure - Child Victims - Testimony in Child Abuse Cases
Synopsis: Altering a certain requirement under which a court is authorized to order that the testimony of a child victim be taken outside a courtroom and shown in the courtroom by closed circuit television in certain child abuse cases; requiring the testimony of a child victim taken by closed circuit television within the courthouse be in a setting that reasonably mitigates the likelihood the child victim will suffer emotional distress; etc.
bill_summary: This bill modifies rules regarding the testimony of child victims in criminal cases involving child abuse. It allows courts to order child victims to testify outside the courtroom via closed-circuit television if it is determined that testifying in person would cause the child serious emotional distress.
responsible_party: Maryland Judiciary
stakeholders: Child victims involved in abuse cases, their families, and defendants
innovative_summary: The bill introduces the use of closed-circuit television technology to help child victims testify without emotional distress, leveraging existing courtroom technology for sensitive testimony.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has no direct impact on child poverty; it focuses on courtroom procedures for child testimony.

Title: Maryland Health Benefit Exchange - State-Based Young Adult Health Insurance Subsidies Pilot Program - Sunset Repeal
Synopsis: Renaming the State-Based Young Adult Health Insurance Subsidies Pilot Program to be the State-Based Young Adult Health Insurance Subsidies Program; repealing the termination date of certain provisions of law that establish and govern the funding for the Program; authorizing rather than requiring the Maryland Health Benefit Exchange to establish and implement the Program; and prohibiting the Exchange from implementing the Program if certain funds are not available.
bill_summary: This bill renames the Young Adult Health Insurance Subsidies Pilot Program to the Young Adult Health Insurance Subsidies Program, removes its sunset clause, and authorizes the Maryland Health Benefit Exchange to establish and implement the program if funds are available. It also updates funding and operational provisions for related health programs.
responsible_party: Maryland Health Benefit Exchange
stakeholders: Young adults, ages 18-40, in Maryland seeking health insurance subsidies
innovative_summary: The program includes tracking and data collection on subsidy impacts, and aims to expand effective coverage options through targeted subsidies and coverage of premium costs, employing data-driven approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: High potential to impact child poverty by increasing health coverage and financial support for young adults, which can indirectly benefit children in those households.

Title: State Government - Grants and Contracts - Reimbursement of Indirect Costs
Synopsis: Altering the rate at which nonprofit organizations receiving State-funded grants or contracts may be reimbursed for indirect costs to match the rate established under relevant federal guidelines; requiring the Maryland Efficient Grant Application Council to study and make certain recommendations to the Department of Budget and Management regarding the entire grants life cycle; requiring the Council to submit a report on its full recommendations to the Department and the General Assembly by July 1, 2027; etc.
bill_summary: The bill modifies reimbursement policies for nonprofit organizations receiving state grants, establishing the rates at which they can be reimbursed for indirect costs, and mandates a study and report by the Department of Budget and Management on indirect costs and grants management efficiency.
responsible_party: Department of Budget and Management
stakeholders: Nonprofit organizations receiving state grants and contracts, state government agencies
innovative_summary: The bill employs a comprehensive study and report approach to improve grant management efficiency, incorporating review of indirect costs and modernization of grants processes, which suggests an innovative approach to governmental operations.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The impact on child poverty is indirect and potentially positive through improved management and utilization of grants that could support child-related services.

Title: Criminal Procedure - Forensic Genetic Genealogical DNA Analysis and Search - Affidavit for Judicial Authorization
Synopsis: Altering and clarifying the requirement that a sworn affidavit for judicial authorization to initiate forensic genetic genealogical DNA analysis and search (FGGS) assert that the reasonable investigative leads have been pursued and failed to identify the perpetrator and instead requiring that a sworn affidavit for judicial authorization assert that identity of the perpetrator is unknown.
bill_summary: The bill amends Maryland's criminal procedure laws to clarify and modify the requirements for law enforcement to seek judicial approval for forensic genetic genealogical DNA analysis and search, which involves using DNA profiles from crime scenes to identify suspects through genetic genealogy.
responsible_party: Maryland courts and law enforcement agencies
stakeholders: Crime victims, law enforcement, suspects, and the general public
innovative_summary: The bill clarifies legal procedures for using genetic genealogy in criminal investigations, which is a relatively new technique involving DNA analysis and publicly available genetic databases.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has limited direct impact on child poverty.

Title: Courts and Judicial Proceedings - Statement of Charges - Human Service Workers
Synopsis: Expanding certain provisions of law relating to a certain investigation and recommendation by a State's Attorney concerning the filing of a statement of charges against certain professionals to include certain human service workers.
bill_summary: The bill expands the investigation and recommendation process of the State's Attorney concerning statements of charges against human service workers, including adult protective services workers, child welfare caseworkers, educators, law enforcement, and emergency personnel, before such charges are filed.
responsible_party: Maryland State's Attorney's Office
stakeholders: Human service workers, law enforcement, emergency personnel, children, and adults receiving protective services
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a mandatory investigation and recommendation process for charges against certain professionals, ensuring further review before formal charges are filed, which is a new procedural approach.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program could potentially reduce child poverty by protecting vulnerable children through improved oversight of child welfare workers.

Title: Public Safety - Law Enforcement Agencies - Peer Support Programs
Synopsis: Establishing certain confidentiality requirements for peer support counseling programs for law enforcement agencies; prohibiting a peer support specialist from  disclosing the contents of any written or oral communication regarding a peer support interaction; and providing certain exceptions.
bill_summary: This bill establishes confidentiality requirements for peer support counseling programs for law enforcement officers in Maryland, including protections for communications made during peer support interactions.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Public Safety and Correctional Services or law enforcement agencies implementing the program
stakeholders: Law enforcement officers and law enforcement agencies in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill employs established peer support concepts with specific confidentiality protections, which is a recognized approach rather than a novel technological or procedural innovation.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has no direct impact on child poverty or its reduction.

Title: Motor Vehicles - Specially Designed Vintage Reproduction Registration Plates
Synopsis: Repealing the time limitation within which the Motor Vehicle Administration is required to make available specially designed vintage reproduction registration plates; and requiring the Administration to charge a fee of $100 for the initial issuance and $25 for the renewal of a specially designed vintage reproduction registration plate.
bill_summary: The bill repeals the time limitation on making available vintage reproduction registration plates, requiring the Maryland Motor Vehicle Administration to develop and sell these plates, which resemble the 1910 black lettering on yellow background plates. Owners of eligible vehicles can apply and pay fees for initial issuance and renewal, with fees allocated to recover administrative costs and fund motor vehicle revenue.
responsible_party: Maryland Motor Vehicle Administration
stakeholders: Owners of vintage or historic vehicles seeking reproduction registration plates in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill employs a nostalgic approach by recreating historical vehicle registration plates, but does not involve new technologies or innovative government approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has minimal direct impact on child poverty as it mainly involves vehicle registration policies for vintage plates.

Title: Task Force to Study Fiduciary Adjudication in Maryland
Synopsis: Establishing the Task Force to Study Fiduciary Adjudication in Maryland to examine and analyze the efficiency, uniformity, and quality of fiduciary adjudication in Maryland and make recommendations; requiring the orphans' courts, circuit courts, registers of wills, and Administrative Office of the Courts to comply with certain requests of the Task Force; and requiring the Task Force to report its findings and make recommendations on or before January 1, 2026.
bill_summary: The bill establishes a Task Force to Study Fiduciary Adjudication in Maryland to evaluate and recommend improvements for the efficiency, uniformity, and quality of fiduciary legal processes, including probate and related fiduciary matters.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Legislative Services and Maryland State Bar Association
stakeholders: Residents of Maryland involved in probate or fiduciary legal matters, including families, courts, and legal practitioners
innovative_summary: The program involves forming a dedicated task force to analyze and recommend reforms to fiduciary adjudication, including comparing laws across states and public engagement, employing collaborative and research-driven approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill's focus on improving fiduciary adjudication could indirectly benefit children in families by providing more efficient legal processes, but it does not directly target child poverty.

Title: Election Law - Municipal Elections - Administration
Synopsis: Authorizing the State Administrator of Elections to enter into memoranda of understanding with municipal corporations that allow the State Administrator to work collaboratively with a municipal corporation to support the administration of the municipal corporation's elections; authorizing the State Administrator to lease a voting system or other equipment used to administer an election for use in a municipal election; repealing the authority of a local board to lease a voting system to certain entities within the county; etc.
bill_summary: This bill authorizes the Maryland State Administrator of Elections to enter into agreements with municipal corporations to support their elections, including leasing voting systems. It also modifies procedures for municipalities to request inclusion of their elections on state ballots and repeals some leasing authority of local boards.
responsible_party: Maryland State Administrator of Elections
stakeholders: Municipalities and voters involved in municipal elections in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill introduces collaboration agreements between the state and municipalities for election support, including leasing voting systems, and streamlines ballot inclusion requests, representing a new approach to municipal election administration.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has limited direct impact on child poverty but may improve election access for local communities.

Title: Domestic Partnership and Marriage - Required Information
Synopsis: Clarifying required information for registering a domestic partnership or obtaining a marriage license; and requiring a declaration of domestic partnership filed with the register of wills to include the Social Security number of each domestic partner who has a Social Security number.
bill_summary: The bill clarifies requirements for registering a domestic partnership and obtaining a marriage license in Maryland. It specifies the information that must be included, such as full names, addresses, dates of birth, and Social Security numbers, and details about confidentiality and record-keeping.
responsible_party: Maryland State Department of Health and Local Register of Wills
stakeholders: Individuals seeking domestic partnerships or marriage licenses in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill updates existing legal requirements, including privacy protections for sensitive data such as Social Security numbers, but does not employ new technologies or approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has minimal direct impact on child poverty as it primarily deals with legal documentation and administrative procedures.

Title: County Boards of Education - Antibias Training for Members - Requirement (County Board Member Antibias Training Act)
Synopsis: Requiring each member of a county board of education to complete certain antibias training at least once during the member's term.
bill_summary: The bill requires each member of a county board of education in Maryland to complete antibias training at least once during their term. It also mandates the development of antibias training guidelines for school employees and requires biannual training for public school employees with frequent student interaction.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Education
stakeholders: Members of county boards of education, public school employees, students, and communities,
innovative_summary: The bill incorporates contemporary, research-based lessons on implicit bias, cultural awareness, and inclusion, utilizing real-life incidents and peer-to-peer training approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program could impact child poverty by promoting inclusive and respectful school environments, which may improve student well-being and educational outcomes.

Title: Adult Education - High School Diploma by Examination - Requirements and Study
Synopsis: Requiring the Maryland Department of Labor to allow an individual to choose to take all components of the General Educational Development Test in either English or Spanish; and requiring the Department to study the feasibility and cost of offering the examination in additional languages and to report its findings and recommendations to certain committees of the General Assembly on or before December 1, 2026.
bill_summary: The bill allows individuals in Maryland to take all components of the General Educational Development (GED) test in the same language, either English or Spanish. It establishes a process for offering these examinations in multiple languages and reports on the feasibility of additional languages.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Labor and Maryland Department of Education
stakeholders: Adult learners seeking a high school diploma via examination, English language learners, Spanish speakers, and the general population seeking educational equivalency
innovative_summary: The bill introduces multilingual testing options and a study to expand the languages available for the GED test, employing a translation and accessibility approach for adult education.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has the potential to support educational attainment among adults, which can contribute to economic stability and reduce child poverty indirectly.

Title: State Lottery – Instant Ticket Lottery Machines – Veterans’ and Fraternal Organizations
Synopsis: Authorizing the Director of the State Lottery and Gaming Control Agency to issue certain fraternal organizations a license for not more than three instant ticket lottery machines; altering the distribution of proceeds from instant ticket lottery machine sales by veterans' organizations; providing for the distribution of proceeds from instant ticket lottery machine sales by fraternal organizations; altering certain requirements concerning the conduct of gaming through instant ticket lottery machines; etc.
bill_summary: The bill authorizes the Maryland State Lottery to issue licenses for instant ticket lottery machines in certain fraternal and veterans' organizations, specifies how proceeds are distributed, and sets rules for operation locations and conduct.
responsible_party: Maryland State Lottery and Gaming Control Agency
stakeholders: Veterans’ organizations, fraternal organizations, state government, and potential program participants such as students and veterans
innovative_summary: The program employs a new approach by allowing specific organizations to operate instant ticket lottery machines and allocate proceeds to various causes, integrating gaming with public benefit initiatives.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has some potential to impact child poverty through funding education and community programs, but direct effects are limited.

Title: Public Information Act - Public Access Ombudsman - Delegation of Powers
Synopsis: Authorizing the Public Access Ombudsman to delegate to a staff member of the Office of the Public Access Ombudsman any of the powers and duties granted to the Ombudsman that are appropriate to the staff member's training and expertise.
bill_summary: This bill authorizes the Public Access Ombudsman in Maryland to delegate certain powers and duties to a staff member within its office, aiming to enhance the functionality of the Public Access Ombudsman.
responsible_party: Office of the Public Access Ombudsman, Office of the Attorney General of Maryland
stakeholders: Public access to government information and transparency beneficiaries in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill introduces delegation authority to the Public Access Ombudsman, allowing for a more flexible and potentially efficient organization of government oversight, which is a somewhat innovative approach in government operations.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill does not directly address child poverty, but indirectly may improve public transparency and access to information that could benefit vulnerable populations.

Title: Healthcare Ecosystem Stakeholder Cybersecurity Workgroup
Synopsis: Establishing the Healthcare Ecosystem Stakeholder Cybersecurity Workgroup to develop strategies to prevent cybersecurity disruptions to the healthcare ecosystem, ensure the continuous delivery of essential healthcare ecosystem services, and enhance recovery efforts of the healthcare ecosystem following a cybersecurity incident; and requiring the Workgroup to submit an interim report on or before January 1, 2026, and a final report of its findings and recommendations on or before December 1, 2026.
bill_summary: The bill establishes a Healthcare Ecosystem Stakeholder Cybersecurity Workgroup to develop strategies for preventing cybersecurity disruptions, ensuring continuous healthcare services, and improving recovery efforts following incidents.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Emergency Management, Maryland Health Care Commission, Maryland Insurance Administration, and the Maryland Department of Information Technology
stakeholders: Healthcare entities such as hospitals, medical facilities, health information exchanges, and organizations involved in delivering healthcare services in Maryland.
innovative_summary: The program employs a comprehensive, collaborative approach involving cybersecurity standards, third-party audits, and government coordination to strengthen healthcare cybersecurity resilience.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has the potential to improve health security and continuity, which can indirectly benefit populations affected by healthcare disruptions, including children.

Title: Workgroup on Newborn Nurse Home Visiting Services - Establishment
Synopsis: Establishing the Workgroup on Universal Newborn Nurse Home Visiting Services; requiring the Workgroup to compile updated participant data and expenditure per participant from the home visiting programs currently operating in the State, compare the data for home visiting programs to the data for evidence-based models, identify service gaps, and identify workforce needs; and requiring the Workgroup to report its findings and recommendations to the Governor and the General Assembly by December 31, 2025.
bill_summary: This bill establishes a voluntary statewide universal newborn nurse home visiting program in Maryland to support healthy child development and strengthen families by providing evidence-based home visiting services to families with newborns, with data collection and insurer coverage requirements.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Health
stakeholders: Families with newborns in Maryland, healthcare providers, insurers, early childhood organizations, and community groups.
innovative_summary: The program employs an evidence-based, universally offered nurse home visiting model integrated into existing health and community services, with a focus on data-driven quality improvement and coordination.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has high potential to reduce child poverty by promoting early development, health, and family support, thereby potentially decreasing long-term disparities.

Title: State Lottery Fund - Laurel Race Course - Local Impact Aid
Synopsis: Requiring the Comptroller, beginning in fiscal year 2026, to distribute from the State Lottery Fund $250,000 of supplemental local impact aid to Anne Arundel County, Howard County, and the City of Laurel from the proceeds of the Racetrax lottery game to be used for certain programs and services in the communities surrounding Laurel Race Course; specifying the purposes for and manner in which the supplemental local impact aid may be utilized; etc.
bill_summary: This bill allocates additional funds from the State Lottery Fund to support various programs in communities surrounding Laurel Race Course, including health, social, and transportation services, and sets conditions for these funds' use and continuation.
responsible_party: Maryland State Lottery Agency and local county governments (Anne Arundel County, Howard County, City of Laurel)
stakeholders: Residents and workers in the communities surrounding Laurel Race Course, especially backstretch workers and non-English speakers
innovative_summary: The bill employs targeted funding and community-driven grant programs to address social and health needs, integrating lottery proceeds with community development, which is a relatively innovative approach.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has potential to reduce child poverty by supporting community health, social services, and transportation, which can improve overall family well-being.

Title: Motor Vehicles - Speed Monitoring Systems - Statements and Certificates of Violations
Synopsis: Authorizing certain technicians to swear to and affirm, based on inspection of recorded images, the occurrence of violations recorded by speed monitoring systems; requiring law enforcement officers and technicians to complete a reasonable training specific to the speed monitoring system before certifying any certificates of violation; and defining "reasonable training" as a sufficient level of education, instruction, and practical experience to ensure competency in the inspection of images generated by speed monitoring systems.
bill_summary: This bill updates Maryland laws on speed monitoring systems, allowing trained technicians to swear to violations based on recorded images, and requires law enforcement and technicians to complete specific training before certifying violations.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Transportation or local transportation agencies
stakeholders: Motorists, law enforcement, local governments, speed monitoring system contractors, school communities
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a specialized training requirement for technicians certifying speed violations and permits technicians to swear to violations based on recorded images, which is a new approach to enforcement.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has limited direct impact on child poverty but can improve traffic safety around schools, indirectly benefiting children.

Title: Maryland Environmental Service - Membership of Board of Directors - Alterations
Synopsis: Altering the composition of the Board of Directors of the Maryland Environmental Service to include the Secretary of Planning or a designee and, as nonvoting members, one member from the Senate of Maryland and one from the Maryland House of Delegates; and providing that certain provisions of law relating to terms of members of the Board do not apply to the Secretary of Planning, certain legislative members, and the Executive Director.
bill_summary: The bill modifies the composition of the Maryland Environmental Service Board of Directors by replacing the State Treasurer with the Secretary of Planning or their designee, and updates certain provisions regarding board members and terms.
responsible_party: Maryland Environmental Service
