stakeholders: State residents, environmental sector professionals, private sector involved in environmental management
innovative_summary: This bill primarily updates the governance structure of a government agency and does not introduce new technologies or approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill's direct impact on child poverty is minimal, as it mainly changes governance structure.

Title: Interstate Social Work Licensure Compact
Synopsis: Entering into the Social Work Licensure Compact for the purpose of authorizing regulated social workers who hold multistate licenses to practice social work in member states in order to improve public access to competent social work services; establishing requirements for multistate licensure; establishing the Social Work Licensure Compact Commission; providing for withdrawal from the Compact; and providing that the Act is contingent on the enactment of substantially similar legislation in six other states.
bill_summary: The bill establishes Maryland's participation in the Interstate Social Work Licensure Compact, allowing social workers licensed in member states to practice across state lines via multistate licenses, thereby increasing public access, workforce mobility, and telehealth use.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Health
stakeholders: Licensed social workers and the public seeking social work services in Maryland and other member states
innovative_summary: The program employs a multistate licensing system and a centralized data and rulemaking structure to facilitate cross-state practice of social workers, integrating interstate cooperation and telehealth.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has high potential to reduce child poverty by expanding access to social work services, especially in underserved or high-need areas through mobile and telehealth services.

Title: Baltimore City - Alcoholic Beverages - 43rd Alcoholic Beverages District - Class B-D-7 Licenses
Synopsis: Authorizing the Board of License Commissioners for Baltimore City to issue additional B-D-7 beer, wine, and liquor licenses in certain areas of the 43rd alcoholic beverages district of Baltimore City if the license applicant meets certain criteria; and extending to July 1, 2026, an alcoholic beverages license issued for a certain area for the purpose of renewal.
bill_summary: The bill authorizes the Baltimore City Board of License Commissioners to issue new Class B–D–7 alcohol licenses in specific areas of the 43rd district, with certain criteria, and extends the renewal period of an existing license in that area until July 1, 2026.
responsible_party: Baltimore City Board of License Commissioners
stakeholders: Residents of Baltimore City, especially those in the 43rd Alcoholic Beverages District and local businesses seeking licenses
innovative_summary: The bill introduces new licensing permissions with specific criteria, facilitating localized economic development and community engagement through memorandums of understanding with community associations.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill's focus on licensing and local economic activity has minimal direct impact on child poverty.

Title: Real Property – Recordation and Land Records – Requirements
Synopsis: Altering certain provisions relating to the filing, maintenance, and transmittal of land records; and defining "land record" as any document recorded by a clerk of the circuit court relating to property.
bill_summary: The bill makes various amendments to Maryland land record laws, including rules for recording deeds, releases, plats, and notices, as well as procedures for property ownership changes and foreclosure notice requirements.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Assessments and Taxation and Maryland Circuit Court Clerks
stakeholders: Property owners, land record clerks, real estate professionals, and mortgage holders in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill primarily updates and clarifies existing land record procedures; it does not introduce new technologies or innovative approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has little to no direct impact on child poverty.

Title: Prince George's County - Speed Monitoring Systems - Maryland Route 210 PG 306-25
Synopsis: Increasing the maximum civil penalties for violations recorded by speed monitoring systems on Maryland Route 210 (Piscataway Highway) in Prince George's County that involve exceeding the maximum speed limit by certain amounts.
bill_summary: The bill increases the maximum civil penalties for speeding violations recorded by speed monitoring systems on Maryland Route 210 (Piscataway Highway) in Prince George's County, with penalties varying based on the amount by which the speed limit was exceeded.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Transportation or Prince George's County transportation authorities (not explicitly specified)
stakeholders: Drivers using Maryland Route 210, residents of Prince George's County, law enforcement agencies
innovative_summary: The bill primarily revises existing penalties for speeding violations, and does not introduce new technologies or approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill's impact on child poverty is indirect and likely minimal, as it mainly changes penalties for speeding violations.

Title: Budget Bill (Fiscal Year 2026)
Synopsis: Making the proposed appropriations contained in the State Budget for the fiscal year ending June 30, 2026, in accordance with Article III, Section 52 of the Maryland Constitution; etc.
bill_summary: The bill proposes appropriations for fiscal years 2025 and 2026, including reductions and reallocations of funds across various state departments and programs, along with supplemental budgets to adjust for revenue projections and policy changes.
responsible_party: State of Maryland Department of Budget and Management
stakeholders: State agencies, higher education institutions, local governments, and Maryland residents
innovative_summary: The program employs extensive reallocation, contingent funding, and detailed reporting requirements, utilizing both traditional and non-traditional funds with technology-based and performance-based adjustments, which introduces some innovative fiscal management approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill allocates significant funds towards public services, education, and community development which can potentially impact child poverty levels indirectly.

Title: Creation of a State Debt - Maryland Consolidated Capital Bond Loan of 2025, and the Maryland Consolidated Capital Bond Loans of 2011, 2012, 2013, 2014, 2015, 2016, 2017, 2018, 2019, 2020, 2021, 2022, 2023, and 2024
Synopsis: Authorizing the creation of a State Debt in the amount of $1,763,325,000, the proceeds to be used for certain necessary building, construction, demolition, planning, renovation, conversion, replacement, and capital equipment purchases of the State, for acquiring certain real estate in connection therewith, and for grants to certain subdivisions and other organizations for certain development and improvement purposes; etc.
bill_summary: The bill authorizes the creation of various state debt loans through bonded funding for numerous public projects, including building renovations, infrastructure upgrades, community development, and public safety facilities across Maryland, with a focus on education, health, and community services.
responsible_party: Maryland Board of Public Works and various state agencies
stakeholders: Maryland residents, local governments, public and private institutions, community organizations, educational and healthcare facilities
innovative_summary: The bill employs traditional bond financing to fund a broad range of capital improvement projects, which is common in government infrastructure development, and does not employ particularly new or innovative technologies or approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has a significant potential to impact child poverty positively by funding education, health, and community development projects that benefit children and low-income families directly.

Title: Budget Reconciliation and Financing Act of 2025
Synopsis: Establishing or altering certain administrative penalties; altering or repealing certain required appropriations; authorizing the use of certain funds for certain purposes; establishing certain funds; authorizing, requiring, or altering the distribution of certain revenue; altering the rates and rate brackets under the State income tax on certain income of individuals; requiring certain groups of corporations to file a combined income tax return reflecting the aggregate income tax liability of all members of the group; etc.
bill_summary: This bill makes numerous changes to Maryland's laws, including adjustments to various funds, taxes, fees, and programs. It involves modifications to programs in health, education, transportation, environment, and taxation, among others, including new funding allocations, program extensions, and legal adjustments.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Budget and Management, Maryland Department of Health, Maryland Department of Transportation, Maryland Department of Environment, Maryland Department of Education, Maryland Department of Natural Resources, Maryland Department of Assessments and Taxation, Maryland Department of Labor, Maryland Department of Commerce, Maryland Department of Public Safety, Maryland State Treasurer
stakeholders: Maryland residents, government agencies, local governments, businesses, taxpayers, health and social service providers, educational institutions, environmental organizations, law enforcement, racing industry, gambling industry, transportation users, property owners, and various program participants.
innovative_summary: The bill incorporates innovative approaches like expanded use of technology in tax collection, employment incentives through tax credits, enhanced data sharing and inter-agency coordination, and new program models for health, education, and public safety.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill aims to fund and extend programs that support health, education, and social services, which can potentially benefit children in low-income families and reduce child poverty, but does not explicitly focus on direct child poverty alleviation.

Title: Prince George's County - Community Associations - Registration Fees for Administrative Hearing Process PG 408-25
Synopsis: Altering the registration fee requirement for the Community Association Registry; permitting the County Executive to establish the registration fee; prohibiting a person or entity who fails to register from filing a dispute; and requiring the Prince George's County Office of Community Relations to provide revenue from annual community association registration fees to fund the administrative hearing process for disputes between community associations and owners in Prince George's County.
bill_summary: The bill requires community associations in Prince George's County to register and pay fees to fund an administrative dispute resolution process. It allows the County Executive to set registration fees and mandates that fees collected be used to support a hearings process for disputes between community associations and owners.
responsible_party: Prince George’s County Office of Community Relations
stakeholders: Community associations, property owners in Prince George's County, developers
innovative_summary: The bill employs a new approach by linking registration fees directly to funding a dedicated administrative dispute resolution process for community associations.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program is unlikely to have a direct impact on child poverty as it primarily focuses on dispute resolution within community associations.

Title: Health Occupations Boards - English Proficiency Requirements and Licensure by Endorsement for Nursing
Synopsis: Prohibiting a health occupations board from requiring additional evidence of English proficiency as a condition for licensure, certification, or registration if an applicant holds a valid, unrestricted license, certification, or registration from another state that requires evidence of English proficiency; requiring each health occupations board that requires evidence of English proficiency to post a statement on their website that an applicant may not be required to provide additional evidence of proficiency; etc.
bill_summary: The bill updates the requirements and processes for health occupations licensure in Maryland by easing English proficiency proof requirements for applicants who are already licensed elsewhere. It also mandates state boards to display information about other states' English proficiency standards.
responsible_party: Maryland State Health Occupations Boards
stakeholders: Applicants seeking health occupation licensure, licensing boards, and potential employers
innovative_summary: The bill mainly clarifies and streamlines licensure requirements and promotes transparency through information sharing, with no use of new technology or novel approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has minimal direct impact on child poverty as it mainly concerns licensing processes and requirements.

Title: Prince George's Gateway Development Authority - Sunset Repeal PG 403-25
Synopsis: Repealing the termination of certain provisions of law establishing the Prince George's Gateway Development Authority.
bill_summary: This bill repeals the sunset provision ending the authority of the Prince George's Gateway Development Authority, thereby continuing its operations and responsibilities in regional development, neighborhood revitalization, and related initiatives in specific areas within Prince George's County.
responsible_party: Prince George's Gateway Development Authority and associated local government agencies
stakeholders: Residents, businesses, and local governments in the target areas of Prince George's County including Mount Rainier, Brentwood, Cottage City, Bladensburg, Colmar Manor, and North Brentwood
innovative_summary: The bill primarily maintains existing development and revitalization efforts and does not introduce new technologies or innovative approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has some potential to impact child poverty by supporting neighborhood revitalization and economic development in targeted communities.

Title: Bicycles, Play Vehicles, and Unicycles - Authorizations and Requirements (Jay's Law)
Synopsis: Authorizing a person to ride a bicycle, play vehicle, or unicycle on a sidewalk or sidewalk area unless prohibited by local ordinance; and requiring a person riding a bicycle, play vehicle, or unicycle on a sidewalk or sidewalk area or in or through a crosswalk to yield the right-of-way to a pedestrian or a person using an electric personal assistive mobility device.
bill_summary: The bill permits bicycles, play vehicles, and unicycles to be ridden on sidewalks unless prohibited by local ordinance. It requires riders on sidewalks or in crosswalks to yield right-of-way to pedestrians and electric personal assistive mobility device riders.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Transportation (implied)
stakeholders: Cyclists, pedestrians, individuals using electric personal assistive mobility devices, local governments
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a change in traffic and sidewalk use rules allowing more flexible bicycle and vehicle riding and emphasizing safety and right-of-way, but does not employ new technologies or innovative approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has limited direct impact on child poverty but could improve mobility and safety for children and families who bike or walk.

Title: Maryland Cybersecurity Council - Alterations
Synopsis: Altering the selection of the membership and chair of the Maryland Cybersecurity Council; requiring beginning on October 1, 2025, and every 2 years thereafter, the Council to elect a chair and vice chair from among the members of the Council; requiring the Council, working with certain entities, to assess and address cybersecurity threats and associated risks from artificial intelligence and quantum computing; etc.
bill_summary: This bill modifies the Maryland Cybersecurity Council by altering its membership, chair selection, and expanding its focus to include assessing and addressing cybersecurity threats from artificial intelligence and quantum computing, among other responsibilities.
responsible_party: Maryland Cybersecurity Council (under the Maryland State Government)
stakeholders: Cybersecurity companies, higher education institutions, private sector entities, government agencies, and residents of Maryland.
innovative_summary: The bill incorporates cybersecurity issues concerning emerging technologies like artificial intelligence and quantum computing into the state's cybersecurity planning, and establishes a comprehensive council to coordinate efforts.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill does not directly target child poverty but may indirectly benefit residents by improving cybersecurity protections.

Title: Maryland Disability Service Animal Program - Established
Synopsis: Establishing the Maryland Disability Service Animal Program in the Department of Disabilities to select one or more nonprofit training entities to participate in the Program and provide additional funding mechanisms to assist eligible individuals in the Program; requiring the Department to select at least one nonprofit training entity to develop and implement a training protocol and to select qualified participants; and establishing the Maryland Disability Service Animal Program Fund to pay a participating nonprofit training entity.
bill_summary: This bill establishes the Maryland Disability Service Animal Program within the Department of Disabilities, which provides services to individuals with disabilities by facilitating the training and partnership with service animals through selected nonprofit entities, supported by a dedicated fund.
responsible_party: Department of Disabilities
stakeholders: Individuals with disabilities in Maryland who may benefit from service animals
innovative_summary: The program adopts a structured partnership approach involving nonprofits, a dedicated fund, and targeted outreach to empower individuals with disabilities through trained service animals, incorporating a new funding mechanism.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program could have a moderate potential to directly impact child poverty by supporting children with disabilities and improving their participation and well-being.

Title: Vehicle Laws - Drunk and Drugged Driving - Points Assessments
Synopsis: Imposing assessments of 12 points for certain subsequent drunk and drugged driving violations.
bill_summary: The bill increases the penalties for repeated drunk and drugged driving violations in Maryland by adding specific points assessments to related violations and establishes new legal consequences for multiple violations.
responsible_party: Maryland Motor Vehicle Administration (or relevant Maryland State Department responsible for vehicle law enforcement)
stakeholders: Individuals convicted of drunk and drugged driving violations in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill focuses on legal penalties and points assessments rather than employing new technologies or innovative approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill does not directly address issues related to child poverty.

Title: Property Tax - Day Care Centers, Child Care Homes, and Child Care Centers
Synopsis: Exempting personal property used in connection with certain large family child care homes from valuation and taxation; authorizing the Mayor and City Council of Baltimore City or the governing body of a county or a municipal corporation to grant, by law, a property tax credit against the real property tax owed on the portion of real property used for certain large family child care homes; increasing the maximum amount of a property tax credit that may be granted for certain child care homes and centers and day care centers; etc.
bill_summary: The bill provides property tax exemptions and credits for property used in connection with certain large family child care homes, day care centers, and related improvements. It increases the maximum amounts for these credits and exemptions and clarifies rules for property used for child care purposes.
responsible_party: Maryland local governments (counties, Baltimore City, municipal corporations) through their law-making bodies
stakeholders: Large family child care homes, day care centers, children and families relying on these care providers, property owners within these categories
innovative_summary: The bill primarily focuses on tax exemptions and credits; it does not introduce new technologies or innovative approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: By providing tax relief to child care providers, the bill has potential to improve access to quality child care, which can indirectly reduce child poverty.

Title: Affordable Housing Payment In Lieu of Taxes Expansion Act
Synopsis: Authorizing an owner of real property used for rental housing and the governing body of a county to enter into a payment in lieu of taxes agreement for maintaining at least 25% of the rental housing units located at the real property as affordable dwelling units for at least 15 years; and authorizing the governing body of the county to require the owner of real property to maintain a higher percentage of rental housing units as affordable dwelling units than the minimum percentage specified in the Act.
bill_summary: The bill expands the law regarding payment in lieu of taxes agreements for rental housing in Maryland, allowing property owners and counties to negotiate agreements where a lower tax payment is made in exchange for maintaining a certain percentage of affordable units, with the minimum percentage increasing from 25% to 50%.
responsible_party: Maryland counties and property owners involved in the agreements
stakeholders: Rental property owners, tenants in affordable housing, local governments
innovative_summary: The bill employs a flexible, negotiated approach where counties and property owners can customize affordable housing commitments and tax arrangements, using agreements to foster affordable housing development.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has the potential to impact child poverty by increasing affordable housing availability, which can improve stability and access to resources for families with children.

Title: Maryland Agricultural and Resource-Based Industry Development Corporation - Oyster Shucking House Loan Program
Synopsis: Altering a certain loan program to authorize the Maryland Agricultural and Resource-Based Industry Development Corporation to provide loans in an amount up to $25,000 for certain seasonal full-time jobs; and reducing, from 5 years to 3 years, the number of years that a person must have been a licensed seafood dealer in order to be eligible to receive financing under the loan program.
bill_summary: The bill modifies the Maryland Oyster Shucking House Loan Program by allowing the Maryland Agricultural and Resource–Based Industry Development Corporation to provide larger loans for seasonal full-time jobs, reduce eligibility requirements related to licensing experience, and adjusts the program's funding and reporting structure. It aims to support seafood processing projects, particularly oyster shell retention and reef enhancement.
responsible_party: Maryland Agricultural and Resource–Based Industry Development Corporation
stakeholders: Seafood dealers, oyster shucking facilities, Chesapeake Bay oyster industry, and communities involved in oyster shell repletion and reef restoration.
innovative_summary: The program employs a targeted approach to support oyster reef restoration through loans for seafood processing facilities, combining environmental goals with economic development, which is a relatively innovative approach within the context of seafood and environmental management.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has the potential to contribute to economic development and job creation in the oyster industry, which can indirectly reduce child poverty in related communities.

Title: Anne Arundel County Board of Education - Student Member Scholarship - Increase
Synopsis: Increasing the scholarship award for a student member of the Anne Arundel County Board of Education who completes a full term on the county board from $8,000 to $15,000.
bill_summary: The bill increases the scholarship award for a student member of the Anne Arundel County Board of Education who completes a full term from $8,000 to $15,000, to be used for higher education costs.
responsible_party: Anne Arundel County Board of Education
stakeholders: Student members of the Anne Arundel County Board of Education and their higher education pursuits
innovative_summary: The bill introduces an enhanced scholarship for student board members, but does not employ new technologies or innovative approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill's impact on child poverty is likely minimal since it mainly provides a scholarship to student representatives, not a broad program targeting poverty.

Title: State Board of Examiners for Audiologists, Hearing Aid Dispensers, Speech-Language Pathologists, and Music Therapists - Appointment of Hearing Aid Dispenser Members
Synopsis: Altering the appointment process for licensed hearing aid dispenser members of the State Board of Examiners for Audiologists, Hearing Aid Dispensers, Speech-Language Pathologists, and Music Therapists by requiring the Board to notify all licensed hearing aid dispensers in the State of the vacancy and to solicit nominations to fill the vacancy.
bill_summary: This bill alters the appointment process for licensed audiologists, hearing aid dispensers, and music therapists on the Maryland State Board of Examiners for Audiologists, Hearing Aid Dispensers, Speech–Language Pathologists, and Music Therapists, and makes changes regarding the composition and quorum of the board.
responsible_party: Maryland State Board of Examiners for Audiologists, Hearing Aid Dispensers, Speech–Language Pathologists, and Music Therapists
stakeholders: Licensed audiologists, hearing aid dispensers, music therapists practicing in Maryland, and the public seeking their services.
innovative_summary: The bill mainly modifies appointment procedures and composition rules for the regulatory board, with no emphasis on new technologies or innovative approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill does not directly impact child poverty, focusing instead on professional licensing and regulatory procedures.

Title: Anne Arundel County - Board of License Commissioners - Part-Time Deputy Chief Inspector - Compensation
Synopsis: Increasing the annual salary of a part-time deputy chief inspector employed by the Board of License Commissioners for Anne Arundel County from $9,000 to $18,000.
bill_summary: The bill increases the annual salary of a part–time deputy chief inspector employed by the Board of License Commissioners for Anne Arundel County from $9,000 to $18,000 and makes related adjustments to the employment structure.
responsible_party: Board of License Commissioners for Anne Arundel County
stakeholders: Residents and businesses in Anne Arundel County involved in alcohol licensing and enforcement
innovative_summary: The bill does not employ new technologies or approaches; it mainly adjusts salary structures within existing government frameworks.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has no direct impact on child poverty.

Title: State Designations – State Mineral – Chromite (State Mineral Act)
Synopsis: Designating chromite, which reflects the nature of Maryland's rich mining history and vast mineral resources, as the State mineral.
bill_summary: This bill designates chromite as the State mineral of Maryland in honor of its historical significance and presence in the state's mining history.
responsible_party: Maryland State Government (implied general implementation, no specific agency mentioned)
stakeholders: Marylanders interested in state history and mineral resources, local communities with historical ties to mining
innovative_summary: The bill is primarily a symbolic designation with no new technological or innovative program components.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has no direct impact on child poverty.

Title: Elections - Local Boards of Elections - Open Meeting Requirements (Local Boards of Elections Transparency Act)
Synopsis: Requiring each local board of elections to make available on its website each open meeting agenda, a summary of any finalized documents, certain written testimony, and other materials on which the  board will be voting; requiring each local board to provide live video streaming of each open meeting and to maintain a complete and unedited archived video recording of each open meeting for 5 years; requiring the State Board of Elections to adopt regulations to ensure that the streaming requirements are met in a certain manner; etc.
bill_summary: The bill establishes enhanced open meeting requirements for local boards of elections in Maryland, including publicly posting meeting agendas and materials 48 hours in advance, live video streaming of meetings, and maintaining video recordings for 5 years.
responsible_party: Maryland State Board of Elections
stakeholders: Voters and local election officials in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill employs technology to improve transparency through live streaming and archived recordings of election meetings.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has limited direct impact on child poverty, focusing mainly on transparency and election processes.

Title: Criminal Law - Controlled Dangerous Substances and Firearms
Synopsis: Authorizing a person who is at least 21 years of age to manufacture a personal use amount of cannabis products or concentrated cannabis for personal use or adult sharing at a private residence if the manufacturing process does not involve the use of a volatile solvent; specifying that manufacturing, distributing, dispensing, or possessing certain large quantities of certain controlled dangerous substances is a felony; altering the penalties for being a volume dealer and drug kingpin with regard to cannabis; etc.
bill_summary: This bill legalizes the manufacture of small amounts of cannabis for personal use and adult sharing at private residences, with certain restrictions. It increases penalties for large-scale drug and firearm offenses, and modifies sentencing procedures for certain previous convictions. The bill also addresses regulated firearm and handgun regulations, including serial number requirements, and sets effective date for October 1, 2025.
responsible_party: Maryland State Department of Public Safety or relevant law enforcement agencies
stakeholders: Adults in Maryland, especially those involved in cannabis manufacturing for personal use, affected law enforcement agencies, and individuals convicted of drug or firearm-related crimes
innovative_summary: The bill employs a progressive approach by legalizing small-scale personal cannabis manufacturing and adult sharing, alongside advanced firearm regulation measures such as mandatory serial number imprinting and registration requirements, and introduces new sentencing review processes.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill's focus on drug-related penalties and reform may indirectly impact child poverty by reducing recidivism and criminal justice disparities, but it does not directly target child poverty.

Title: State Library Agency - Family Literacy Pilot Program - Establishment
Synopsis: Establishing the Family Literacy Pilot Program administered by the State Library Agency in consultation with the Department of Public Safety and Correctional Services and the Correctional Education Council to enable certain incarcerated individuals to read aloud to their children by preparing a recording; and requiring the State Library Agency to submit a certain report on or before December 1, 2028.
bill_summary: The bill establishes the Family Literacy Pilot Program in Maryland, which allows incarcerated individuals to read aloud to their children by preparing recordings and providing children's books in correctional facilities.
responsible_party: Maryland State Library Agency
stakeholders: Incarcerated individuals, their children, and their families
innovative_summary: The program uses audio recordings and book provisions in correctional facilities to strengthen family bonds and promote literacy, integrating technology and family engagement strategies.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has moderate potential to impact child poverty by strengthening family bonds and supporting child development for children of incarcerated parents.

Title: Education and Health - Emergency Use Epinephrine - Alterations
Synopsis: Altering the defined term "auto-injectable epinephrine" to be "emergency use epinephrine" and to include certain drug delivery devices and products; and altering the name of the Emergency Use Auto-Injectable Epinephrine Program to be the Emergency Use Epinephrine Program.
bill_summary: This bill updates Maryland laws to change the terminology from 'auto–injectable epinephrine' to 'emergency use epinephrine,' broadens the types of devices included, renames the existing program to the Emergency Use Epinephrine Program, and establishes protocols for schools, nonpublic schools, child care providers, youth camps, and institutions to obtain, store, and use emergency use epinephrine to treat anaphylaxis, including training, reporting, and liability provisions.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Health and Maryland State Department of Education
stakeholders: Students, children, youth camp participants, school personnel, child care providers, and institutions of higher education in Maryland
innovative_summary: The program incorporates new approaches such as establishing a standardized emergency response for anaphylaxis across multiple settings, including schools, child care, and youth camps, with the potential to integrate new training and reporting methods.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has a moderate potential to impact child poverty by improving health emergency responses and reducing related health disparities among children and vulnerable populations.

Title: Public Safety - 9-1-1 Trust Fund - 9-8-8 Suicide Prevention Hotline
Synopsis: Authorizing the use of the 9-1-1 Trust Fund for certain expenditures that support the 9-8-8 suicide prevention hotline; and altering a certain restriction on the use of the 9-1-1 Trust Fund to prohibit funds from being used for expenses solely related to the 9-8-8 suicide prevention hotline, instead of preventing the use of funds for any costs associated with the 9-8-8 suicide prevention hotline.
bill_summary: The bill authorizes the use of the Maryland 9-1-1 Trust Fund to support costs related to the 9-8-8 suicide prevention hotline, while preventing the funds from being used solely for the hotline.
responsible_party: Maryland 9-1-1 Trust Fund, managed by the Maryland communication authorities
stakeholders: Individuals requiring mental health and suicide prevention services, Maryland public safety agencies
innovative_summary: This program employs integrated funding to support a nationwide mental health crisis response infrastructure, combining emergency communication systems with a newly established suicide prevention hotline.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has a high potential to directly reduce child poverty by providing mental health crisis intervention and support services.

Title: Public Safety - Maryland 9-1-1 Board and Maryland Department of Emergency Management - Regulatory Authority
Synopsis: Authorizing the Maryland 9-1-1 Board to adopt regulations to implement and enforce certain responsibilities of the Board; and authorizing the Maryland Department of Emergency Management to adopt regulations to implement and enforce the responsibilities of the Department.
bill_summary: The bill grants regulatory authority to the Maryland 9–1–1 Board and the Maryland Department of Emergency Management to establish guidelines, standards, and regulations for the enhancement, deployment, and management of 9–1–1 and emergency management services across Maryland.
responsible_party: Maryland 9–1–1 Board and Maryland Department of Emergency Management
stakeholders: Public safety answering points, emergency services personnel, Maryland residents, particularly individuals with disabilities and those using assistive technologies
innovative_summary: The bill introduces comprehensive regulations, standards, and oversight for Next Generation 9–1–1 services, including interoperability, cybersecurity, training, and data management, employing new standards and procedures.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill's focus on improving emergency services infrastructure and accessibility could have an indirect positive impact on child safety and well-being, but does not target child poverty directly.

Title: Prescription Drug Affordability Board - Authority and Stakeholder Council Membership (Lowering Prescription Drug Costs for All Marylanders Now Act)
Synopsis: Altering the membership of the Prescription Drug Affordability Stakeholder Council; requiring the Prescription Drug Affordability Board, under certain circumstances, to establish a process for setting upper payment limits for purchases and payor reimbursements of prescription drug products that the Board determines have led or will lead to affordability challenges; authorizing the Board to reconsider an upper payment limit for a drug that becomes a current shortage; and altering requirements related to the setting of upper payment limits.
bill_summary: This bill establishes a process for setting upper payment limits for certain prescription drugs in Maryland to improve affordability. It involves the Prescription Drug Affordability Board and Stakeholder Council in developing strategies, monitoring drug shortages, and reporting on impacts.
responsible_party: Prescription Drug Affordability Board
stakeholders: Maryland residents, healthcare providers, pharmacies, and the pharmaceutical industry
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a structured, state-level process for setting upper payment limits on prescription drugs, including considerations for shortages and impact assessments, representing an innovative approach to drug price regulation.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has high potential to reduce drug costs, which can directly lower financial barriers for vulnerable populations and reduce child poverty.

Title: Natural Resources - State Boat Act - Auctioneers
Synopsis: Exempting certain auctioneers from certain provisions of the State Boat Act.
bill_summary: The bill amends the Maryland Natural Resources laws to exempt certain auctioneers from specific provisions of the State Boat Act, clarifying that licensed auctioneers acting on behalf of sellers, secured parties, or owners are not considered dealers.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Natural Resources
stakeholders: Auctioneers, boat sellers, and boat owners in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill mainly clarifies legal exemptions for auctioneers, without establishing new services or using new technology.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill is unlikely to have a direct impact on child poverty.

Title: Election Law - Postelection Tabulation Audits - Risk-Limiting Audits
Synopsis: Requiring the State Board of Elections, in collaboration with the local boards of elections, to conduct a risk-limiting audit after each statewide election; authorizing the State Board, in collaboration with the local boards, to conduct a risk-limiting audit after a special general election; authorizing the State Board, in collaboration with the local boards, to conduct an automated software audit after a statewide election; authorizing a local board to conduct a risk-limiting audit of a local contest under certain circumstances; etc.
bill_summary: This bill mandates the Maryland State Board of Elections to carry out risk-limiting audits after each statewide election to verify vote tabulations, including automated software audits and manual audits of voter-verifiable paper records, to ensure election accuracy.
responsible_party: Maryland State Board of Elections
stakeholders: Voters, election officials, candidates in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill introduces the use of risk-limiting audits and automated software audits, employing statistical methods and independent software to improve election verification processes, representing a technological advancement in election auditing.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has limited direct impact on child poverty but enhances election integrity, which is essential for democratic accountability.

Title: State Board of Public Accountancy - Emeritus Status
Synopsis: Authorizing the State Board of Public Accountancy to place a licensee on emeritus status under certain circumstances; and requiring the Board to reinstate the license of an individual who is on emeritus status under certain circumstances.
bill_summary: The bill authorizes the Maryland State Board of Public Accountancy to place licensed Certified Public Accountants on 'emeritus' status under certain conditions, allowing them to be retired and not practicing actively, while still retaining their license and title. It also modifies the rules for reinstating such licenses and their permissible use for retired accountants.
responsible_party: Maryland State Board of Public Accountancy
stakeholders: Licensed Certified Public Accountants in Maryland, especially those aged 60 and above or with many years of experience
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a formal 'emeritus' status for retired certified public accountants, allowing them to maintain their license and use specific titles without practicing, which is a new approach to managing professional licenses for retired experts.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill's direct impact on child poverty is limited, as it primarily addresses licensing and professional title use for accountants and does not include targeted programs for child poverty.

Title: Medical Debt - Complaints for Money Judgment and Real Property Liens
Synopsis: Establishing certain requirements for a complaint for a money judgment; defining "medical debt" as a debt owed by a consumer to a provider of medical services, products, or devices, but does not include debt charged to a credit card except under certain circumstances; prohibiting the creation of a lien on owner-occupied residential property by contract or as a result of a breach of contract for the payment of medical debt; and applying the Act prospectively.
bill_summary: The bill establishes rules regarding medical debt judgments and prohibits creating liens on owner-occupied residential properties for medical debt by contract or breach of contract, including removing existing liens in such cases.
responsible_party: Maryland courts and the Maryland Real Property department
stakeholders: Homeowners with owner-occupied residential properties and medical debtors
innovative_summary: The bill introduces legal protections for homeowners by preventing liens on their primary residences due to medical debt, which is a targeted legal reform but not highly technological or innovative in approach.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill could potentially reduce financial strain on families with medical debt, helping prevent or alleviate child poverty.

Title: Consumer Protection - Consumer Contracts - Limitation Periods
Synopsis: Prohibiting a consumer contract from setting a shorter time to bring an action under or on the consumer contract than required by the law of the State; excluding certain entities from the application of this Act; and applying the Act prospectively.
bill_summary: This bill prohibits consumer contracts from including provisions that set shorter time limits to bring legal actions than those mandated by Maryland law, making such provisions void and unenforceable. It also classifies violations as unfair trade practices.
responsible_party: Maryland Courts and the Maryland Legislature (for enforcement)
stakeholders: Consumers entering into consumer contracts in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill introduces legal protections to prevent contractual clauses that shorten legal action periods, reinforcing existing consumer rights.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has limited direct impact on child poverty as it mainly enhances legal protections for consumers.

Title: Vehicle Laws - Medical Exemption for Enhanced Tinted Windows - Time Limitation
Synopsis: Repealing the 2-year time limitation on medical exemptions for enhanced tinted windows for vehicle owners with certain permanent medical conditions.
bill_summary: The bill repeals the two-year time limit on medical exemptions for vehicle owners with certain permanent medical conditions to have tinted windows with less than 35% light transmittance.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of State Police
stakeholders: Vehicle owners with certain medical conditions and law enforcement
innovative_summary: This bill makes a straightforward change to existing vehicle tinting laws by removing the time limit on medical exemptions. It does not introduce new technologies or approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has no direct connection or impact on child poverty.

Title: Criminal Law - Visual Surveillance With Prurient Intent - Modifications
Synopsis: Altering the definition of "private place" as it relates to the prohibition on conducting visual surveillance with prurient intent of an individual without the consent of the individual to include a residence; and altering the prohibition against conducting visual surveillance with prurient intent.
bill_summary: The bill amends Maryland law to modify the definition of 'private place' and clarify restrictions on visual surveillance with prurient intent, including prohibition of visual surveillance using cameras of individuals' private areas without consent.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Public Safety or Maryland law enforcement agencies (implied)
stakeholders: Individuals whose private areas or private places may be surveilled without consent
innovative_summary: The bill mainly updates legal definitions and enforcement provisions; it does not employ new technologies or approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill does not directly impact child poverty or its determinants.

Title: Civil Actions - Tortious Injury to or Death of Pet - Compensatory Damages (Buddy's Law)
Synopsis: Increasing from $10,000 to $25,000 the maximum amount of compensatory damages that may be awarded to an owner of a pet from a person who tortiously causes an injury to or death of the pet while acting individually or through an animal under the person's ownership, direction, or control.
bill_summary: The bill increases the maximum amount of compensatory damages that can be awarded to pet owners for tortious injury or death of their pets from $10,000 to $25,000.
responsible_party: Maryland courts and judicial system
stakeholders: Pet owners and owners of domesticated animals in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill primarily amends existing legal damages limits; it does not introduce new technologies or innovative approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill is unlikely to have a direct impact on child poverty as it pertains to damages for pet injuries or death.

Title: Criminal Procedure - Victims and Witnesses - Out of Court Statement of Child to Forensic Interviewer
Synopsis: Expanding the evidentiary rule on the admissibility of out of court statements made by child victims or witnesses to make admissible an out of court statement made by a child to a forensic interviewer.
bill_summary: This bill expands the rules for admitting out-of-court statements made by child victims or witnesses into evidence in criminal and juvenile court proceedings, provided certain conditions are met, including the use of qualified forensic interviewers.
responsible_party: Maryland Judiciary
stakeholders: Child victims and witnesses under age 13 involved in court cases related to abuse, neglect, sexual offenses, or violence
innovative_summary: The program introduces a new legal framework for admitting forensic interview statements into court, emphasizing trustworthy and developmentally appropriate methods, including the use of forensic interviewers.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill's impact on child poverty is indirect; it improves legal processes for vulnerable children which may facilitate their access to justice and support services.

Title: Baby Food Labeling - Statement Regarding Toxic Heavy Metal Testing - Terminology
Synopsis: Altering the statement that must be included on a baby food product label if the baby food product has been tested for toxic heavy metals for the purpose of changing the term included on the label from "toxic heavy metal" to "toxic element".
bill_summary: This bill requires baby food manufacturers in Maryland to test their products for toxic heavy metals, disclose the test results online and with QR codes on labels, and report to the Department if levels exceed U.S. FDA limits, starting from 2025.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Health
stakeholders: Parents and children under age 2 in Maryland, baby food manufacturers, consumers
innovative_summary: The bill employs technology such as QR codes to provide consumers with detailed and timely information about toxic elements in baby food, and mandates transparent online data disclosure.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has moderate potential to impact child poverty by ensuring safer baby foods, which can improve health outcomes for low-income children.

Title: Criminal Law - Interference With a Public Safety Answering Point - Penalties
Synopsis: Prohibiting a person from taking certain actions with the intent to interrupt or impair the functioning of a public safety answering point; and providing that a person who violates the Act is guilty of a felony and on conviction is subject to imprisonment not to exceed 5 years or a fine of up to $25,000 or both.
bill_summary: This bill amends Maryland law to prohibit actions with the intent to interrupt or impair the functioning of public safety answering points and other critical infrastructure, establishing penalties for violations.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Public Safety and Correctional Services
stakeholders: Public safety agencies, general public, government officials, critical infrastructure operators
innovative_summary: The bill introduces specific legal penalties for cyber-related acts targeting public safety systems, emphasizing cybersecurity protection.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill's focus on cybersecurity and public safety does not directly impact child poverty.

Title: Natural Resources - Invasive Blue Catfish Pilot Program
Synopsis: Establishing the Invasive Blue Catfish Pilot Program in the Department of Natural Resources to curb the spread of the invasive blue catfish in the Chesapeake Bay and its tributaries; requiring the Department to expand the use of practices determined to be effective under the Program; and requiring the Department to report to the Governor and the General Assembly by December 1, 2025, on its findings and recommendations based on the Pilot Program.
bill_summary: The bill establishes the Invasive Blue Catfish Pilot Program in Maryland to control the spread of invasive blue catfish in Chesapeake Bay and its tributaries. It permits certain fishing practices and expands existing licenses to increase harvest efforts, including authorization for specific types of fishing gear and methods.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Natural Resources
stakeholders: Fishermen, environmental agencies, residents of Chesapeake Bay area, conservation groups
innovative_summary: The program employs coordinated, adaptive management strategies including expanded use of fishing practices, regulatory adjustments, and data collection to control invasive species.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill is primarily focused on environmental management and does not directly target child poverty but may have indirect benefits through ecological health and community engagement.

Title: Anne Arundel County – Property Tax Credit – Habitat for Humanity of the Chesapeake, Incorporated
Synopsis: Altering the name of Arundel Habitat for Humanity, Inc., to be Habitat for Humanity of the Chesapeake, Incorporated, for purposes of a certain property tax credit against the county or municipal corporation tax imposed on the entity; and authorizing the tax credit for any real property owned by the entity.
bill_summary: The bill renames Arundel Habitat for Humanity, Inc. to Habitat for Humanity of the Chesapeake, Incorporated, and allows the governing body of Anne Arundel County to grant a property tax credit for real property owned by this organization, as a way to support its housing initiatives.
responsible_party: Anne Arundel County government
stakeholders: Habitat for Humanity of the Chesapeake, Inc., property owners in Anne Arundel County, and potentially low-income residents benefiting from Habitat for Humanity programs
innovative_summary: The program introduces a property tax credit for a specific non-profit organization to incentivize the preservation and expansion of affordable housing.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program could have a moderate potential to reduce child poverty by supporting affordable housing initiatives.

Title: Modernization of Military Laws Act
Synopsis: Establishing rules of interpretation related to the uniformed services; altering the rule of interpretation for "veteran"; requiring the Secretary of Veterans and Military Families to develop certain policies related to life transitions of veterans, service members, and military families; and altering the application of certain provisions of law related to veterans, the uniformed services, and the filing of certificates of candidacy, the powers of the Governor, State veterans' cemeteries, and housing and employment discrimination.
bill_summary: The Modernization of Military Laws Act updates Maryland laws to improve interpretation rules for the uniformed services, establish policies for assisting veterans, service members, and military families, and make various legal adjustments related to veterans' rights, benefits, and cemeteries.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Veterans and Military Families
stakeholders: Veterans, service members, military families, and residents of Maryland with military or veteran status
innovative_summary: This bill primarily updates existing legal definitions, policies, and procedures; it does not employ new technologies or significantly new approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has limited direct impact on child poverty, mainly through supporting veterans and military families; potential is moderate.

Title: Maryland Transit Administration - Disability Reduced Fare Program - Renewal for Permanently Disabled Individuals
Synopsis: Requiring the Maryland Transit Administration to automatically renew the Disability Reduced Fare Program certification of an enrollee who is permanently disabled.
bill_summary: The bill requires the Maryland Transit Administration to automatically renew the certification of individuals who are permanently disabled and are enrolled in the Disability Reduced Fare Program, and to establish regulations for this process.
responsible_party: Maryland Transit Administration
stakeholders: Individuals who are permanently disabled and participate in the Reduced Fare Program
innovative_summary: The bill introduces an automated renewal process for disability certifications, streamlining ongoing access to reduced transit fares.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill is unlikely to have a direct impact on child poverty as it primarily addresses fare renewal procedures for disabled individuals.

Title: Outdoor Lighting - Guidance and Use of State Funds
Synopsis: Requiring the Maryland Green Building Council, on or before October 1, 2026, to update or develop guidance for the purchase of outdoor lighting fixtures in consideration of certain recommendations; prohibiting State funds from being used to install or replace certain permanent outdoor luminaires for lighting unless certain requirements are met; altering the requirements for the use of State funds for the installation or replacement of certain permanent outdoor luminaires for lighting; applying the Act prospectively; etc.
bill_summary: This bill establishes guidelines for outdoor lighting in Maryland, including requirements for using energy-efficient and low light pollution fixtures, and sets rules for the use of state funds for outdoor lighting installation and replacement. It also requires the Maryland Green Building Council to develop related guidance and the Department of Transportation to review highway lighting practices.
responsible_party: Maryland Green Building Council and Department of Transportation
stakeholders: State agencies, outdoor lighting providers, and the general public in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill promotes environmentally conscious outdoor lighting practices, including considerations for light pollution and color temperature, and involves development of new guidance and a review of highway lighting practices, which indicates a progressive approach to outdoor lighting.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill does not directly target child poverty but could have indirect benefits through improved public safety and environmental quality.

Title: Anne Arundel County - Development Impact Fees
Synopsis: Altering the scope of certain limitations on the authority of the Anne Arundel County Council to grant exemptions from or credits against development impact fees.
bill_summary: This bill modifies the rules regarding development impact fees in Anne Arundel County, allowing the county council to grant exemptions or credits for certain development projects, including affordable housing, accessory units, and land conveyances for expanded capacity.
responsible_party: Anne Arundel County Government
stakeholders: Developers, residents, and organizations involved in housing and development in Anne Arundel County
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a more flexible and targeted system of exemptions and credits for impact fees, aimed at promoting affordable and workforce housing development.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has potential to directly impact child poverty by incentivizing affordable housing development that benefits families and children.

Title: Braille Flag Memorial Act of 2025
Synopsis: Requiring the Department of Veterans and Military Families to designate a location for an American braille tactile flag to be placed on the grounds of one or more State veterans' cemeteries to honor members of the uniformed services, veterans, and other individuals in the State who are blind or visually impaired.
bill_summary: The bill requires the Maryland Department of Veterans and Military Families to designate a location for an American braille tactile flag at one or more State veterans' cemeteries to honor blind or visually impaired members of the military community.
responsible_party: Department of Veterans and Military Families
stakeholders: Blind and visually impaired veterans and military members, and visitors to Maryland veterans' cemeteries.
innovative_summary: The program introduces a tactile tactile flag for blind and visually impaired individuals to experience the American flag, employing accessible design for inclusivity.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill is not focused on child poverty reduction.

Title: University of Maryland, College Park Campus - TerpsEXCEED Program - Funding
Synopsis: Authorizing the Governor to include in the annual budget bill, beginning in fiscal year 2027, an appropriation of $350,000 to the University of Maryland, College Park Campus TerpsEXCEED (EXperiencing College through Education and Employment Discovery) Program to provide educational and employment opportunities to students with intellectual disabilities.
bill_summary: This bill authorizes funding for the University of Maryland, College Park's TerpsEXCEED Program, which provides educational and employment opportunities for students with intellectual disabilities. Starting in fiscal year 2027, it allows an annual appropriation of $350,000 to support and expand the program.
responsible_party: University of Maryland, College Park Campus
stakeholders: Students with intellectual disabilities, university students, faculty, and staff involved in the program
innovative_summary: The bill supports a specialized program with a comprehensive approach including education, employment, mentorship, and inter-agency collaboration, employing a holistic and inclusive approach to disability support.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has high potential to reduce child poverty among young adults with intellectual disabilities by improving their education and employment opportunities.

Title: Counties - Cancer Screening for Professional Firefighters - Required Coverage (James "Jimmy" Malone Act)
Synopsis: Requiring counties that offer self-insured employee health benefit plans to provide to firefighters employed by the county coverage for preventive cancer screenings in accordance with certain guidelines; authorizing a county to satisfy the requirement by providing a no-cost annual examination or applying for a grant to pay for certain cancer screening technologies; prohibiting counties from imposing a copayment, coinsurance, or deductible requirement; and requiring the Maryland Health Commission to conduct a certain study.
bill_summary: The bill mandates that insurance plans and county self-insured health plans provide coverage for preventive cancer screenings for professional firefighters, in accordance with guidelines issued by the International Association of Fire Fighters. It also requires counties offering self-insured employee health plans to ensure coverage for such screenings without copayments, coinsurance, or deductibles, and allows counties to fulfill this through free examinations or grants. Additionally, the bill mandates data collection and study on the impact of expanding preventive cancer screening coverage.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Health and Maryland Health Care Commission
stakeholders: Professional firefighters in Maryland, County governments, Insurance providers, and Firefighter advocacy groups
innovative_summary: The program employs a targeted approach to improve cancer screening for firefighters and includes data collection and analysis to evaluate the impact and feasibility of expanding coverage to the commercial insurance market.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill primarily focuses on health coverage and does not directly impact child poverty levels.

Title: Vehicle Laws - Motor Vehicle Administration - 3-Hour Roadway Safety Driving Education Program - Requirements
Synopsis: Altering the requirements of the 3-hour Roadway Safety Driving Education Program established by the Motor Vehicle Administration for certain applicants for driver's licenses; and requiring the Administration to adopt regulations establishing criteria for certifying a private entity to offer the 3-hour Roadway Safety Education Program.
bill_summary: This bill requires the Maryland Motor Vehicle Administration to establish and implement a 3-hour Roadway Safety Driving Education Program for certain new drivers or those who have not previously held a driver's license. It outlines the content of the program, including safety and impairment education, and specifies that the program's purpose is educational and preventative.
responsible_party: Maryland Motor Vehicle Administration
stakeholders: Driver’s license applicants, especially new or first-time drivers
innovative_summary: The program employs a structured, educational approach focusing on roadway safety and impairment awareness, integrating it into driver licensing requirements, but it does not employ new technologies or innovative methods explicitly.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program's focus is on driver education and safety, with no direct impact on child poverty.

Title: Health Equality for Service Members Act
Synopsis: Establishing rules of interpretation related to the uniformed services; altering the rule of interpretation for "veteran"; and altering the application of certain provisions of law governing public health, the regulation of health occupations, and housing vouchers and assistance to apply to all uniformed services, rather than only the armed forces.
bill_summary: This bill aims to expand legal protections, access to services, and support for veterans and individuals in the uniformed services, including establishing policies related to health, housing, licensing, and behavioral health programs tailored to service members, veterans, and their families.
responsible_party: Department of Veterans and Military Families
stakeholders: Service members, veterans, and their families in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill introduces coordinated behavioral health programs, web-based resources, and streamlined licensing processes for military-affiliated individuals, employing technology and government collaboration in new ways.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill indirectly supports military families which could contribute to child poverty reduction, but its primary focus on veterans and service members limits direct impact on general child poverty.

Title: Local Government - Annapolis and Anne Arundel County Conference and Visitors Bureau Designation
Synopsis: Altering references to the Annapolis and Anne Arundel County Conference and Visitors Bureau to be Visit Annapolis and Anne Arundel County, Inc.
bill_summary: The bill changes the name of the Annapolis and Anne Arundel County Conference and Visitors Bureau to Visit Annapolis and Anne Arundel County, Inc., and updates related legal references. It specifies the allocation and reporting of hotel tax revenue to this organization and others within Anne Arundel County.
responsible_party: Anne Arundel County and City of Annapolis governing bodies, specifically the Arts Council of Anne Arundel County, Inc., and Visit Annapolis and Anne Arundel County, Inc.
stakeholders: Visitors, local residents, and businesses in Annapolis and Anne Arundel County who benefit from tourism and arts funding.
innovative_summary: The bill primarily updates organizational names and fund allocations without introducing new technology or innovative approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill is unlikely to have a direct impact on child poverty as it mainly concerns tourism branding and hotel tax allocations.

Title: Vehicle Laws - Obscured, Modified, or Blocked Registration Plates and Registration Plate Covers
Synopsis: Prohibiting a person from obscuring or modifying any vehicle registration plate in a manner that may prevent identification and enforcing the prohibition as a secondary offense; prohibiting a person from advertising for or promoting the sale of an unlawful registration plate cover by falsely claiming that the registration plate cover is lawful in the State; and establishing that a violation of the Act is an unfair, abusive, or deceptive trade practice subject to certain enforcement and penalties.
bill_summary: The bill prohibits obscuring, modifying, or blocking vehicle registration plates and the sale or promotion of unlawful registration plate covers in Maryland. It establishes enforcement rules and penalties.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Transportation or law enforcement agencies
stakeholders: Drivers, vehicle owners, law enforcement, and sellers of registration plate covers in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill employs existing law enforcement tools to regulate vehicle registration visual obstructions and prohibits certain commercial practices related to registration covers.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill likely has minimal or no direct impact on child poverty.

Title: Baltimore City - Alcoholic Beverages - 45th Alcoholic Beverages District - Licenses
Synopsis: Authorizing the Board of License Commissioners for Baltimore City to issue a Class C beer, wine, and liquor license in a certain area of the 45th alcoholic beverages district in Baltimore City under certain circumstances; and altering a geographic boundary in the 45th district within which the holder of a Class A or Class B-D-7 beer, wine, and liquor license must operate in accordance with specified hours.
bill_summary: The bill authorizes the Baltimore City Alcoholic Beverages Board to issue a new Class C license in the 45th district, adjusts historical licensing boundaries and hours for liquor sales, and introduces restrictions on outdoor, outdoor-only sales of alcohol in specific areas of Baltimore City.
responsible_party: Board of License Commissioners for Baltimore City
stakeholders: Residents and businesses in Baltimore City, especially those involved in alcohol sales and distribution
innovative_summary: The bill employs targeted licensing adjustments, including specific outdoor alcohol sale restrictions and boundary modifications, to regulate alcohol sales more precisely in Baltimore City areas.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill's provisions are unlikely to directly impact child poverty as they mainly deal with local licensing and sales hours.

Title: Maryland Community College Promise Scholarship Program - Revisions
Synopsis: Altering the number of years that a recipient of an award under the Maryland Community College Promise Scholarship Program may hold the award under certain circumstances.
bill_summary: The bill revises the Maryland Community College Promise Scholarship Program by changing the maximum duration for which a recipient can hold the award, modifying the rules around qualification and continuation, and establishing conditions for extending the award period.
responsible_party: Maryland State Department of Education
stakeholders: Community college students in Maryland receiving the Promise Scholarship
innovative_summary: The bill updates the scholarship program with new rules for duration and eligibility, but does not employ new technologies or approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has the potential to directly impact child poverty by providing extended financial aid for community college students, enabling better economic prospects.

Title: Transportation Equality for Service Members Act
Synopsis: Establishing rules of interpretation related to the uniformed services; altering the rule of interpretation for "veteran"; and altering the application of certain provisions of law governing transportation to apply to all uniformed services, rather than only certain uniformed services.
bill_summary: The bill, titled 'Transportation Equality for Service Members Act', expands legal recognition of various uniformed service members and veterans across Maryland law, and establishes rules and programs aimed at supporting these groups, including special vehicle registration, licensing, and identification provisions.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Veterans and Military Families
stakeholders: Active service members, veterans, military families, and individuals with military service-related disabilities in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill introduces comprehensive support programs for military and veteran populations, including special vehicle registration and licensing options, enhancing accessibility and recognition for these groups.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill is primarily focused on legal recognition and support for service members and veterans, and does not have a direct impact on child poverty.

Title: St. Mary's County - Alcoholic Beverages - Class A License Quota
Synopsis: Altering the quota for the number of Class A alcoholic beverages licenses that may be issued in the 8th election district in St. Mary's County.
bill_summary: The bill adjusts the quota for the number of Class A alcohol licenses in St. Mary's County, specifically in the 8th election district, by changing the population-based limits for issuing and transferring licenses.
responsible_party: St. Mary's County Board of License Commissioners
stakeholders: Alcohol license applicants, residents of St. Mary's County, local businesses
innovative_summary: This bill employs a population-based approach to regulate alcohol license quotas, which is a common regulatory practice without employing new technologies or approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill does not directly target child poverty but may impact local economic activity.

Title: State Department of Education - Family Child Care Homes and Child Care Centers - Regulatory Analysis
Synopsis: Requiring the State Department of Education to conduct a thorough analysis of the State's regulatory framework for child care facilities with particular emphasis on regulations that limit a person's ability to register a child care facility, receive a license to operate a child care center, or operate a child care facility in a profitable manner while providing quality care; and requiring an interim and final report be submitted to the Governor and the General Assembly by January 1, 2026, and September 1, 2026, respectively.
bill_summary: This bill alters child-to-adult ratios in family child care homes and large family child care homes, and requires the Maryland State Department of Education to analyze laws regulating child care facilities and report findings and recommendations.
responsible_party: Maryland State Department of Education
stakeholders: Child care providers, children in child care, families, regulatory agencies
innovative_summary: The bill employs a comprehensive analysis approach to reforming and improving child care regulations based on comparisons across states and stakeholder input.
child_poverty_direct_summary: By potentially increasing access to quality and affordable child care, the program could reduce barriers for low-income families, impacting child poverty.

Title: Hagerstown Community College Police Force - Jurisdiction
Synopsis: Authorizing a Hagerstown Community College police officer to exercise powers granted to a peace and police officer under certain circumstances.
bill_summary: The bill authorizes police officers of Hagerstown Community College to exercise certain law enforcement powers outside the college property under specific circumstances, such as in cases of imminent threats or pursuant to agreements with other law enforcement agencies, starting July 1, 2025.
responsible_party: Hagerstown Community College Police Force
stakeholders: Hagerstown Community College students, staff, faculty, and neighboring community members
innovative_summary: The bill extends existing college police powers to broader jurisdictional circumstances, which is a typical legal adjustment rather than an innovative use of technology or approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: Low potential for direct impact on child poverty.

Title: St. Mary’s County – County Plans – Public Sewerage Systems and Water Supply Systems
Synopsis: Applying certain provisions relating to the adoption of or revision or amendment to a county plan to county plans in St. Mary's County; and repealing certain provisions relating to public sewerage systems and water supply systems in St. Mary's County.
bill_summary: The bill revises the rules in St. Mary's County regarding the review, adoption, and amendment of county plans related to public sewerage and water supply systems. It repeals certain existing provisions and establishes new procedures for approval of such systems.
responsible_party: St. Mary's County Government, specifically the County Commissioners and Planning Commission
stakeholders: Residents and government entities involved in public sewerage and water supply planning in St. Mary's County
innovative_summary: The bill primarily details procedural changes and does not introduce new technological or innovative approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill does not directly impact child poverty but may influence infrastructure development in St. Mary's County.

Title: Washington County - Board of License Commissioners - Membership
Synopsis: Requiring that certain numbers of members of the Board of License Commissioners for Washington County belong to certain political parties based on the aggregated number of votes in the preceding election of the Board of County Commissioners.
bill_summary: This bill amends the membership rules for the Board of License Commissioners for Washington County, Maryland, by specifying that two members must belong to the political party that received the highest number of votes in the previous election, and one member must belong to the second highest.
responsible_party: Washington County Board of License Commissioners
stakeholders: Residents and voters of Washington County, Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a political party-based appointment requirement for the local licensing board, which is a new approach to member selection emphasizing political representation.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill does not have a direct impact on child poverty, but may influence local licensing decisions.

Title: Occupational Licensing and Certification - Criminal History - Predetermination Review Process
Synopsis: Providing that "department" does not include the Maryland Department of Health or the Department of Public Safety and Correctional Services for purposes of certain provisions prohibiting a department from refusing to issue an occupational license or certificate based on a certain conviction under certain circumstances; establishing a predetermination review process for occupational licenses and certificates in certain departments of State government; authorizing a department to charge a criminal history review fee of up to $100; etc.
bill_summary: The bill establishes a predetermination review process for occupational licenses and certificates issued by certain Maryland state departments, allowing individuals to request a review of their criminal history and its impact on licensing eligibility.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Agriculture, Department of the Environment, Department of Human Services, Maryland Department of Labor
stakeholders: Individuals seeking occupational licenses with criminal histories in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a formal review process to evaluate criminal history impacts on licensing, incorporating a structured request and evaluation system, which is a relatively innovative approach to licensing reform.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has potential to reduce barriers to employment for individuals with criminal histories, which may contribute to alleviating child poverty.

Title: St. Mary's County - Corrections
