Synopsis: Adding programs, a day reporting program, an in-patient treatment program, and a pretrial release supervision program, that the St. Mary's County Sheriff is authorized to establish; repealing a requirement that the Sheriff or the Sheriff's designee collect the earnings of a certain individual participating in a certain program; and authorizing the Sheriff or the Sheriff's designee to direct an individual participating in a certain program to provide proof that the individual has made payments toward certain obligations.
bill_summary: The bill authorizes the Sheriff of St. Mary’s County to establish various correctional programs, including home detention, day reporting, work release, in-patient treatment, pretrial release supervision, and prerelease programs, and makes adjustments to how inmate earnings and payments towards obligations are managed.
responsible_party: St. Mary’s County Sheriff
stakeholders: Individuals participating in correctional programs in St. Mary’s County, including inmates and the wider community
innovative_summary: The bill introduces flexible correctional programs with the ability to manage inmate earnings and obligations, utilizing community-based supervision and rehabilitation approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has moderate potential to directly impact child poverty by supporting rehabilitation and potentially reducing recidivism among offenders, which can have positive effects on families.

Title: St. Mary's County - Alcoholic Beverages - Civil Penalty for Sales Violations
Synopsis: Increasing, from $1,000 to $2,500, the maximum civil penalty that the Board of License Commissioners for St. Mary's County may impose for a violation of a law relating to licensing the sale of alcoholic beverages.
bill_summary: The bill increases the maximum civil penalty for violations related to the sale of alcoholic beverages in St. Mary’s County from $1,000 to $2,500 and modifies penalties related to licensing violations. It also specifies fines for employees selling alcohol to minors.
responsible_party: Board of License Commissioners for St. Mary’s County
stakeholders: Alcohol vendors, employees, and minors in St. Mary’s County
innovative_summary: This bill mainly involves modifying penalties and fines related to alcohol licensing violations; it does not introduce new technologies or innovative approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has minimal or no direct impact on child poverty as it primarily involves enforcement penalties.

Title: Maryland Department of Labor - Study on Building Code Requirements for Single-Staircase Buildings
Synopsis: Requiring the Maryland Department of Labor to study building code requirements for single-staircase buildings in the State and other States and analyze best practices when drafting building code requirements; requiring the Department to make legislative and regulatory recommendations for the purpose of increasing the affordable housing supply by reducing barriers to multifamily housing development; and requiring the Department to report to the Governor and certain committees of the General Assembly by December 1, 2026.
bill_summary: The bill requires the Maryland Department of Labor to study building code requirements for single-staircase buildings and make recommendations to allow their construction up to six stories for increasing affordable housing.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Labor
stakeholders: Housing developers, residents, fire safety authorities, local governments, and advocacy groups for affordable housing
innovative_summary: The bill proposes a new approach to building codes and housing development, specifically examining the safety and feasibility of single-staircase buildings up to six stories to increase affordable housing options.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has the potential to significantly increase affordable housing options, which could reduce child poverty in affected communities.

Title: St. Mary's County - Competitive Bidding - Threshold
Synopsis: Increasing the minimum contract value to $50,000 to require a competitive bidding process in St. Mary's County for contracts for services or supplies.
bill_summary: The bill raises the minimum contract value threshold requiring a competitive bidding process in St. Mary's County from $15,000 to $50,000 for contracts for services or supplies.
responsible_party: St. Mary's County government
stakeholders: Residents and businesses in St. Mary's County involved in county government contracts
innovative_summary: The bill simply adjusts procurement rules to increase thresholds for competitive bidding; it does not employ new technologies or approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill does not have a direct impact on child poverty.

Title: St. Mary's County - Metropolitan Commission - Discontinuance of Service
Synopsis: Authorizing the St. Mary's County Metropolitan Commission to discontinue all or part of water or sewer service provided to an improved private property determined to be unsafe, unfit, or unsuitable for human occupancy due to an accident, artificial disaster, or natural disaster; requiring the suspension of the ready-to-serve charge on certain private properties; and authorizing the St. Mary's County Metropolitan Commission to utilize certain remedies for a violation related to certain public water and sewer use.
bill_summary: The bill authorizes the St. Mary's County Metropolitan Commission to discontinue water and sewer service to private properties under certain circumstances, such as unsafe or unsuitable conditions, and outlines procedures for enforcement and suspension of charges.
responsible_party: St. Mary's County Metropolitan Commission
stakeholders: Residents and property owners served by the St. Mary's County Metropolitan Commission
innovative_summary: The bill introduces procedures for service discontinuance and enforcement remedies, including suspension of charges, for public water and sewer services based on safety and compliance issues.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill does not directly address child poverty but impacts access to essential water and sewer services for residents.

Title: Frederick County - County Employees and Volunteers - Criminal History Records Check
Synopsis: Authorizing the Director of Human Resources of Frederick County to request from the Criminal Justice Information System Central Repository of the Department of Public Safety and Correctional Services a State and national criminal history records check for a prospective or current county employee or county volunteer; requiring the Central Repository to forward certain information to certain persons; requiring that the information remain confidential and that it be used only for personnel-related purposes; etc.
bill_summary: This bill authorizes the Frederick County Human Resources Department to request criminal history records checks from the state and national repositories for current or prospective employees and volunteers, and establishes guidelines and confidentiality rules for handling this information.
responsible_party: Frederick County Department of Human Resources
stakeholders: County employees and volunteers of Frederick County
innovative_summary: The bill employs established criminal background check procedures but does not introduce new technologies or approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill does not directly address child poverty but enhances background screening processes.

Title: Recreational Equality for Service Members Act
Synopsis: Establishing rules of interpretation related to the uniformed services; altering the rule of interpretation for "veteran"; altering the application of certain provisions of law governing public health and the regulation of health occupations to apply to all uniformed services, rather than only the armed forces; altering the circumstances under which licenses for fishing in tidal waters do not lapse; etc.
bill_summary: This bill establishes various programs and regulations to support service members and veterans, including benefits for outdoor recreational activities, licensing exemptions, and fee waivers at state parks.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Natural Resources and Maryland Department of Veterans and Military Families
stakeholders: Active service members, veterans, military families, disabled veterans, and Gold Star recipients in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a comprehensive approach to supporting service members and veterans through recreational benefits, licensing exemptions, and dedicated funds, leveraging existing government programs with new initiatives.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill's focus on recreational and licensing benefits does not directly target child poverty but could support veteran and service member well-being.

Title: Residential Child Care Programs - Transportation Companies - Regulation (Preventing Abduction in Youth Transport Act of 2025)
Synopsis: Prohibiting transportation companies that transport children to residential child care programs from using certain restraints unless there is a substantial likelihood of imminent serious physical harm to a child or others; prohibiting transportation companies that transport children to residential child care programs from picking up children between the hours of 9 p.m. and 6 a.m.; authorizing an individual and the Attorney General to bring a certain civil action against certain transportation companies; and applying the Act prospectively.
bill_summary: The bill regulates transportation companies that transport children to residential child care programs, prohibiting certain restraints, limiting pickup hours, and establishing legal actions for violations.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Human Services, Department of Juvenile Services, Department of Health, and Attorney General
stakeholders: Children transported to residential child care programs and transportation providers in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill introduces strict regulations on restraints and pickup times for youth transportation companies, including legal enforcement mechanisms.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has potential to improve safety and stability for children in care, which may indirectly impact child poverty.

Title: Procurement Reform Act of 2025
Synopsis: Authorizing the Secretary of General Services to delegate certain powers and duties to the Chief Procurement Officer; altering the authority of the Department of General Services to engage in or control procurement of certain equipment and services; requiring the Department of Information Technology to establish a technical procurement team; altering the authority of the Department of Transportation and the Maryland Transportation Authority to engage in procurement for certain supplies and services; etc.
bill_summary: The bill overhauls Maryland's procurement laws to enhance efficiency, transparency, and support for small, minority, and veteran-owned businesses. It establishes new programs, modifies existing procedures, and incorporates innovative practices such as pay-for-success environmental contracts and workforce development initiatives.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of General Services and Office of Small, Minority, and Women Business Affairs
stakeholders: Small businesses, minority-owned businesses, veteran-owned businesses, environmental organizations, state agencies, workforce development entities, general public
innovative_summary: The bill introduces innovative approaches including pay-for-success environmental contracts, a comprehensive workforce internship and apprenticeship program, and new methods of procurement that leverage technology and performance-based outcomes.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has high potential to impact child poverty by promoting workforce development, supporting small and disadvantaged businesses, and fostering economic growth.

Title: Office of Disability Employment Advancement and Policy and Maryland as a Model Employer Initiative - Established
Synopsis: Establishing the Office of Disability Employment Advancement and Policy within the Department of Disabilities; establishing the Maryland as a Model Employer Initiative within the Office of Disability Employment Advancement and Policy to facilitate efforts that improve outcomes in the hiring, recruitment, retention, and advancement of people with disabilities in the State government workforce; authorizing the Governor for fiscal year 2027, to include $250,000 in the annual budget bill for the Office; etc.
bill_summary: The bill establishes the Office of Disability Employment Advancement and Policy within the Maryland Department of Disabilities and creates the Maryland as a Model Employer Initiative to improve employment outcomes for people with disabilities in State government workforce.
responsible_party: Department of Disabilities
stakeholders: People with disabilities seeking employment in State government, State agencies, and employees with disabilities
innovative_summary: The program employs a structured initiative with ongoing outreach, training, data collection, and performance reporting to promote employment of people with disabilities across government.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has potential to positively impact child poverty by improving employment opportunities for people with disabilities, including those who are caregivers.

Title: Excellence in Maryland Public Schools Act
Synopsis: Altering the source of funds for the Blueprint for Maryland's Future Fund to include the interest earnings of the Academic Excellence Fund; authorizing the Department to establish a national teacher recruitment campaign; establishing the Academic Excellence Program in the Department to address critical academic needs in public schools; requiring the Department to consult with a certain entity to evaluate  the Concentration of Poverty School Grant Program and establish requirements for community school implementation plans; etc.
bill_summary: This bill makes extensive changes to Maryland's education system, including increasing funding for schools, establishing new programs for teacher recruitment, retention, and leadership, creating community schools with wraparound services, and implementing innovative approaches like a teacher collaboration grant and a digital tool study. It also enacts the Interstate Teacher Mobility Compact to facilitate teacher licensing across states and delays certain funding increase limitations based on fiscal conditions.
responsible_party: Maryland State Department of Education
stakeholders: Students, teachers, school administrators, families, community partners, and educational organizations in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill introduces several innovative approaches, including a statewide community schools program with wraparound services, a national teacher recruitment campaign employing modern marketing strategies, a teacher collaboration innovation grant, and the implementation of a digital tool study evaluating new technologies like AI in education.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has high potential to directly impact child poverty by increasing funding for high-poverty schools, implementing wraparound services, and supporting community schools which serve students in underserved communities.

Title: Chesapeake Bay Legacy Act
Synopsis: Establishing the Maryland Leaders in Environmentally Engaged Farming (LEEF) Program; establishing the Maryland Leaders in Environmentally Engaged Farming (LEEF) Program Fund to support actions associated with the Program's purpose; altering the definition of "healthy soils" for purposes of the Maryland Healthy Soils Program; exempting certain holders of certain fishing licenses from the requirement to obtain a food establishment license from the Maryland Department of Health; establishing the Water Quality Monitoring Program; etc.
bill_summary: The bill establishes the Maryland Leaders in Environmentally Engaged Farming (LEEF) Program, creates a fund to support environmentally friendly farming practices, and implements various water quality and fisheries management initiatives, including oyster restoration and water quality trading credits, in the Chesapeake Bay watershed.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Agriculture and Department of the Environment
stakeholders: Farmers, conservation organizations, local governments, and residents in the Chesapeake Bay watershed
innovative_summary: The bill employs innovative approaches such as nutrient trading credits for oyster restoration, a comprehensive watershed partnership, and recognition tiers for sustainable farming, integrating new scientific and community engagement strategies.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has a moderate potential to impact child poverty by promoting sustainable farming, improving local environmental health, and creating community engagement opportunities.

Title: State Contracts - Prohibited Provisions
Synopsis: Clarifying a prohibition on including in State contracts provisions pertaining to limitations of liability for damage to real or tangible personal property; and clarifying a prohibition on including in State contracts provisions limiting the recovery of costs related to the use of replacement contractors under certain circumstances.
bill_summary: This bill prohibits the State from including certain provisions in its contracts, such as limitations of liability, mandatory arbitration, and provisions limiting recovery costs for replacement contractors.
responsible_party: Maryland State government agencies responsible for entering into contracts, including the Attorney General's Office for legal oversight
stakeholders: Maryland State government, contractors, and potentially affected third parties
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a legal framework to prevent certain unfair or limiting provisions in State contracts, ensuring better protections for the State.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has limited or no direct impact on child poverty but aims to improve legal fairness and transparency in state contracts.

Title: State Procurement Preferences - Blind Industries and Services of Maryland - Packaging and Repackaging
Synopsis: Requiring a State or State aided or controlled entity to require a prime contractor to procure certain janitorial products packaged or repackaged by Blind Industries and Services of Maryland.
bill_summary: This bill requires state agencies and contractors to procure janitorial products that are packaged or repackaged by Blind Industries and Services of Maryland when those products are available.
responsible_party: Maryland State Government (including state agencies and contractors)
stakeholders: Blind Industries and Services of Maryland, state contractors, and public agencies involved in procurement and janitorial services
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a procurement preference for products packaged by a state-supported disabled workers' program, which is a targeted social procurement approach.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has limited direct impact on child poverty as it mainly relates to procurement policies and supporting disabled workers and their organizations.

Title: Maryland Inventory of Cemeteries and Burial Sites Workgroup - Establishment
Synopsis: Establishing the Maryland Inventory of Cemeteries and Burial Sites Workgroup for the purpose of studying issues related to the establishment and maintenance of a State cemetery inventory system; and requiring the Workgroup to report its findings and recommendations to the Governor and the General Assembly by December 1, 2025.
bill_summary: This bill establishes the Maryland Inventory of Cemeteries and Burial Sites Workgroup to study and develop a statewide cemetery inventory system, including definitions, best practices, data collection, costs, and funding.
responsible_party: Maryland Historical Trust and Maryland Office of Cemetery Oversight
stakeholders: local governments, genealogical and historical organizations, descendant communities, cemeteries, religious communities
innovative_summary: The program aims to create a comprehensive statewide cemetery inventory system with data integration and public search features, employing best practices from other states.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has a potential to indirectly impact child poverty by preserving cultural heritage, but does not directly address child poverty.

Title: Frederick County - Barbershop and Beauty Salon Beer and Wine License - Alterations
Synopsis: Increasing from 5 to 6.5 ounces of wine by the glass that a holder of a barbershop or beauty salon beer and wine license in Frederick County may provide to a certain customer for on-premises consumption.
bill_summary: The bill amends the laws in Frederick County regarding beer and wine licenses for barbershops and beauty salons, increasing the limit of alcohol that can be provided to customers and clarifying the provisions of these licenses.
responsible_party: Frederick County Department of Permits and Inspections
stakeholders: Owners and customers of barbershops and beauty salons in Frederick County
innovative_summary: The bill makes a modest revision to alcohol service regulations in a specific local context, without employing new technologies or approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill is unlikely to have any direct impact on child poverty.

Title: Crimes Relating to Animals - Restrictions on Keeping Roosters
Synopsis: Prohibiting, beginning January 1, 2027, a certain person from keeping a rooster movement-constrained through use of a certain enclosure or tether, subject to certain exceptions; establishing that a violation of the Act is a civil offense; and providing the Act may be enforced by any State or local law enforcement officers or local animal control authority for the jurisdiction where the violation occurs.
bill_summary: The bill prohibits individuals from keeping more than 5 roosters per acre or more than 25 roosters total on a property, unless authorized, starting January 1, 2027. It restricts movement-constrained roosters kept individually, enforces penalties for violations, and involves enforcement cooperation between state and local authorities to combat illegal cockfighting and related issues.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Agriculture and local law enforcement agencies
stakeholders: People who keep roosters, animal control agencies, law enforcement, and residents in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill employs a new legal restriction on the number and movement of roosters kept on properties to prevent illegal cockfighting and associated issues, integrating enforcement cooperation.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The direct impact on child poverty is likely minimal, focusing mainly on animal control and public health.

Title: Health Occupations - State Board of Chiropractic Examiners - Revisions
Synopsis: Altering certain provisions of law governing the State Board of Chiropractic Examiners and the practice of chiropractic in the State related to Board membership, licensure of chiropractors, the discipline of chiropractors, and the denial of licenses to applicants; authorizing the Board to inspect chiropractor offices under certain circumstances; and requiring the Board to require a licensee or applicant to submit to an examination by a health care provider under certain circumstances.
bill_summary: This bill updates Maryland's laws regarding the regulation of the chiropractic profession. It revises provisions related to licensing, certification, practice standards, disciplinary actions, examinations, and the operation of chiropractic schools.
responsible_party: Maryland State Board of Chiropractic Examiners
stakeholders: Chiropractors, chiropractic students, and the public seeking chiropractic care in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill primarily focuses on updating legal and regulatory frameworks for chiropractors; it does not introduce new technologies or innovative approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill does not have a direct impact on child poverty.

Title: Anne Arundel County - Alcoholic Beverages Licenses - Veterans' Organizations
Synopsis: Authorizing a certain holder of a Class C beer, wine, and liquor license in Anne Arundel County to convert the license to a Class C (veterans' organization) license; reducing from $400 to $300 the annual license fee for a Class C (veterans' organization) license; authorizing the Board of License Commissioners for Anne Arundel County to provide application and administrative fee discounts to certain licensees and applicants; and authorizing a Class C (veterans' organization) licensee to operate on Sunday without a Sunday license.
bill_summary: The bill authorizes veterans' organizations in Anne Arundel County to convert their existing alcohol licenses to a special veterans' organization license, reduces the annual fee, allows operating on Sundays without an extra license, and provides fee discounts to qualified organizations.
responsible_party: Anne Arundel County Board of License Commissioners
stakeholders: Veterans' organizations in Anne Arundel County and their members
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a specialized license for veterans' organizations, with fee discounts and Sunday operating privileges, but does not employ new technologies or significantly new approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has minimal direct impact on child poverty, as it mainly concerns alcohol licensing for veterans' organizations.

Title: Motor Vehicles - Automated Enforcement Programs - Privacy Protections
Synopsis: Requiring a custodian of recorded images produced by certain automated enforcement systems to deny inspection of the images, subject to certain exceptions; prohibiting certain State and local agencies from using a recorded image or associated data from an automated enforcement system subject to certain exceptions; and establishing certain requirements and authorizations for the removal and destruction of recorded images and associated data produced by an automated enforcement system.
bill_summary: This bill enhances privacy protections for automated traffic enforcement systems in Maryland by limiting access to recorded images, requiring warrants or court orders for use unless for traffic or law enforcement purposes, and establishing procedures for removal and destruction of image data.
responsible_party: Maryland State Department of Transportation or relevant law enforcement agencies implementing automated enforcement systems
stakeholders: Motor vehicle owners, law enforcement agencies, Maryland residents
innovative_summary: The program employs advanced privacy safeguards, including strict data access controls, prohibition of biometric technologies, and mandated destruction procedures to protect individual privacy.
child_poverty_direct_summary: Limited direct impact on child poverty, as the focus is on privacy protections for enforcement data.

Title: Workgroup on the Reorganization of the Maryland Transit Administration
Synopsis: Establishing the Workgroup on the Reorganization of the Maryland Transit Administration to study reorganizing the Maryland Transit Administration; requiring the Workgroup to report its findings and recommendations to the Governor and the General Assembly on or before December 1, 2025; and requiring the Department of Transportation, in consultation with the Department of Legislative Services, to submit to the President of the Senate and the Speaker of the House draft legislation to effectuate the recommendations of the Workgroup.
bill_summary: This bill establishes a Maryland Rail Commuter (MARC) Rail Authority to oversee certain rail services and infrastructure, and it creates a workgroup to study the reorganization of the Maryland Transit Administration and the Department of Transportation, including the future structure of Baltimore City transit services.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Transportation
stakeholders: Maryland transit riders, Baltimore City residents, state transportation agencies, and local governments
innovative_summary: The bill introduces the creation of a dedicated MARC Rail Authority and a comprehensive study workgroup to consider reorganization strategies, using structural separation and specialized oversight for transit services, which is an innovative approach.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has the potential to improve transit efficiency and coverage, which could help reduce transportation barriers for low-income families, including children.

Title: Maryland Transit Administration - Purple Line - Free Ridership and Promotional Materials and Services
Synopsis: Requiring the Maryland Transit Administration to develop and implement a program providing for the first month after transit service begins on the Purple Line, free ridership on Purple Line transit vehicles to individuals residing within a one-quarter-mile radius of the Purple Line track; and requiring the Administration to include, beginning on October 1, 2025, for 3 months after service on the Purple Lines begins promotional materials and services at no cost to small businesses located within a one-quarter-mile radius of the Purple Line track.
bill_summary: The bill requires the Maryland Transit Administration to offer free ridership for the first three months of Purple Line service to residents living within a quarter-mile of the line and provides free advertising space for small businesses within the same area for three months after service begins.
responsible_party: Maryland Transit Administration
stakeholders: Residents near the Purple Line and small local businesses within a quarter-mile of the line
innovative_summary: This program employs targeted free transit service and free promotional space, leveraging existing internal resources to encourage transit ridership and support local businesses.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program could potentially increase access to transportation for residents, which may help reduce barriers related to mobility and employment, thereby indirectly impacting child poverty.

Title: Baltimore County - Vehicle Laws - Private Roadways in Residential Communities
Synopsis: Prohibiting, from October 1, 2025, to July 1, 2028, a person from driving a motor vehicle in violation of certain provisions of the Maryland Vehicle Law on private roadways in a certain residential community in Baltimore County; authorizing, from October 1, 2025, to July 1, 2028, a police officer to enforce the vehicle law on private roadways in a certain residential community in Baltimore County; and prohibiting a person from driving a motor vehicle in violation of the Act on any roadway located in certain areas of Calvert County.
bill_summary: This bill prohibits and regulates enforcement of traffic laws on private roadways within certain residential communities in Baltimore County, including a specific community called Queen Anne Village, from October 1, 2025, to September 30, 2028.
responsible_party: Baltimore County Police Department
stakeholders: Residents and visitors of the Queen Anne Village community and other covered residential communities in Baltimore County
innovative_summary: The bill employs a temporary enforcement measure specifically targeting private roadways in a residential community, and includes a mandated report to evaluate its impact.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The impact on child poverty is likely indirect and minimal, primarily affecting enforcement on private roads within specific communities.

Title: Peace Orders and Protective Orders – Military Protection Orders
Synopsis: Authorizing a judge to consider whether a military protection order has been issued against a respondent when determining whether to grant a temporary peace order or a temporary protective order; and requiring a law enforcement officer to notify a certain law enforcement agency that an individual may have violated a military protection order under certain circumstances.
bill_summary: The bill authorizes judges to consider whether a military protection order has been issued against a respondent when deciding on peace or protective orders. It also requires law enforcement to notify agencies if a military protection order may have been violated and makes violations of such orders punishable by penalties.
responsible_party: Maryland courts and law enforcement agencies
stakeholders: Individuals involved in domestic violence or abuse cases, military personnel, law enforcement
innovative_summary: The bill introduces the consideration of military protection orders in civil and criminal protective procedures and enhances communication between agencies regarding violations, employing existing legal frameworks in a new combined approach.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has limited direct impact on child poverty but could help protect children from abuse and violence.

Title: Abandoned and Neglected Cemeteries Fund - Establishment
Synopsis: Establishing the Abandoned and Neglected Cemeteries Fund to provide for the care, preservation, maintenance, and restoration of abandoned and neglected cemeteries in the State; authorizing the Governor to include in the annual budget bill an appropriation of $250,000 to the fund; and requiring an annual report by September 30 to the General Assembly on the donations to the Fund and promotional efforts undertaken by money from the Fund.
bill_summary: This bill establishes the Abandoned and Neglected Cemeteries Fund to support the care and preservation of such cemeteries in Maryland. It authorizes voluntary contributions through a checkoff on individual income tax returns and allocates funding, including a potential $250,000 annual appropriation from the state budget.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Labor, State Treasurer, Comptroller
stakeholders: Communities with abandoned or neglected cemeteries, local governments, historic preservation groups
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a dedicated funding source with a voluntary checkoff on income tax returns, and includes oversight and reporting mechanisms. It employs a new approach to funding cemetery preservation through tax checkoffs within the existing tax system.
child_poverty_direct_summary: While primarily focused on cemetery preservation, the bill's funding mechanisms and increased awareness may have indirect benefits that support community stability, which can impact child poverty, but it does not directly target child poverty.

Title: Department of Human Services - Federal Commodity Supplemental Food Program - Administration
Synopsis: Requiring the Family Investment Administration in the Department of Human Services to be the central coordinating and directing agency of the federal Commodity Supplemental Food Program using certain funds and resources; and repealing the requirement that the Secretary of Aging administer the Program.
bill_summary: The bill designates the Family Investment Administration in the Maryland Department of Human Services as the central agency for coordinating the federal Commodity Supplemental Food Program, replacing the previous role of the Secretary of Aging.
responsible_party: Department of Human Services, Family Investment Administration
stakeholders: Low-income families and individuals participating in the federal Commodity Supplemental Food Program in Maryland
innovative_summary: This bill updates administrative oversight for a federal nutrition program within the state, consolidating leadership under a single state agency.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program may help reduce child poverty by improving access to nutritious food for low-income families, though direct impact measures are not specified.

Title: Department of Commerce - Nonprofit Organizations Navigator - Established
Synopsis: Establishing a nonprofit organizations navigator within the Department of Commerce to provide technical assistance and work with nonprofits and units of State government to resolve complexities and delays in State grant-making processes, collect and share certain information, and represent nonprofit organizations' interests and concerns as a member of the Maryland Efficient Grant Application Council; and requiring the Department to report to certain committees of the General Assembly on the implementation of the navigator.
bill_summary: The bill establishes a nonprofit organizations navigator within the Maryland Department of Commerce to provide technical assistance, streamline grant processes, and represent nonprofit interests. It also makes changes to the Maryland Efficient Grant Application Council and related grant management procedures.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Commerce
stakeholders: Nonprofit organizations in Maryland and state government grant agencies
innovative_summary: The program employs new approaches such as establishing a dedicated navigator role for nonprofits and creating a centralized grants management system with uniform processes and a council to advise on improvement strategies.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has a high potential to directly impact child poverty by improving access to grants that support programs benefiting children and families.

Title: Adult Protective Services - Investigations and Disclosure of Information
Synopsis: Authorizing a local department of social services to request assistance from federal law enforcement officers in an investigation relating to an alleged vulnerable adult; and altering certain provisions relating to the disclosure of certain information concerning human services to include adult protective services.
bill_summary: The bill authorizes local departments of social services to request assistance from federal law enforcement officers during investigations of alleged vulnerable adults, clarifies rules regarding disclosure of human services information, and enhances protective services for vulnerable adults.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Human Services and local departments of social services
stakeholders: Vulnerable adults, law enforcement agencies, social services
innovative_summary: The bill introduces cooperation between social services and federal law enforcement in vulnerable adult investigations, improving coordination and response.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program's primary focus is on adult protections; it does not directly target child poverty.

Title: Digital Advertising Gross Revenues Tax - Assessments - Appeals and Corrections
Synopsis: Establishing a certain appeal process for persons who are subject to the digital advertising gross revenues tax and receive a notice of assessment from the Comptroller; authorizing the Comptroller or the Comptroller's designee to issue an order to correct an erroneous assessment of the digital advertising gross revenues tax, subject to certain conditions; and applying the Act to assessments of the digital advertising gross revenues tax made after December 31, 2025.
bill_summary: The bill establishes an appeal process for taxpayers subject to the Maryland digital advertising gross revenues tax, including provisions for correction of assessments and finality of orders, starting from January 1, 2026.
responsible_party: Maryland Comptroller's Office
stakeholders: Entities subject to digital advertising gross revenues tax in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a formalized process for correcting erroneous assessments and final orders related to the new digital advertising tax, which aligns with standard tax procedures but applies specifically to a new type of tax.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has limited direct impact on child poverty as it mainly focuses on procedural aspects of tax assessments.

Title: Maryland Medical Assistance Program - Maternal Health Self-Measured Blood Pressure Monitoring
Synopsis: Requiring, beginning on January 1, 2026, the Maryland Medical Assistance Program to provide coverage for self-measured blood pressure monitoring for certain eligible Program recipients; and requiring reimbursement of health care provider and other staff time used for patient training, transmission of blood pressure data, interpretation of blood pressure readings and reporting, remote patient monitoring, and the delivery of co-interventions, including educational materials or classes.
bill_summary: The bill mandates the Maryland Medical Assistance Program to start covering self-measured blood pressure monitoring for eligible recipients starting January 1, 2026. It also requires the program to develop an educational campaign about blood pressure monitoring and submit annual reports on the program's outcomes and savings.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Health
stakeholders: Pregnant women, postpartum women, and individuals with chronic kidney disease, diabetes, heart disease, or cardiometabolic disease enrolled in the Maryland Medical Assistance Program
innovative_summary: The program employs a modern approach by incorporating home blood pressure monitoring technology into state health coverage, including education and remote monitoring components.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program could potentially improve health outcomes for vulnerable populations, which may contribute to reducing child poverty indirectly.

Title: Food Establishments - Portable Chemical Toilets
Synopsis: Authorizing food establishments that are businesses that conduct agritourism, Class 4 limited wineries, or Class 8 farm breweries to comply with the requirement to provide a convenient lavatory by providing a portable chemical toilet that is supplied with approved hand drying devices, kept in a sanitary condition, is properly ventilated, and is placed at least 25 feet from a well.
bill_summary: The bill allows certain food establishments, such as agritourism sites, limited wineries, and farm breweries, to use portable chemical toilets instead of fixed lavatories if the portable toilet meets specific requirements and is placed at least 25 feet from a well.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Health
stakeholders: Food establishments, operators of agritourism sites, wineries, and farm breweries, and the public visiting these establishments.
innovative_summary: This program employs a new approach by allowing the use of portable chemical toilets rather than fixed lavatories in specific food-related settings, simplifying compliance and potentially reducing costs.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has limited potential to directly impact child poverty as it primarily pertains to regulatory flexibility for certain food establishments.

Title: Baltimore County - Political Party Central Committee - Elections
Synopsis: Altering from four to three the number of members elected from each councilmanic district of Baltimore County to the Baltimore County Republican Party Central Committee; and altering the number of members elected from each legislative district of Baltimore County to the Baltimore County Democratic Party Central Committee.
bill_summary: This bill modifies the number of members elected from each district to the Baltimore County Republican and Democratic Party Central Committees.
responsible_party: Baltimore County Republican and Democratic Party Central Committees
stakeholders: Members of Baltimore County Republican and Democratic Party Central Committees
innovative_summary: The bill mainly changes the composition of elected committee members; it does not employ new technologies or approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill's direct impact on child poverty appears minimal, focusing on party committee composition.

Title: Dorchester County - Alcoholic Beverages - Venue Beer, Wine, and Liquor License
Synopsis: Establishing in Dorchester County a venue beer, wine, and liquor license that authorizes the holder to sell or serve beer, wine, and liquor for on-premises consumption during an event where food is served; authorizing the Board of License Commissioners for Dorchester County to issue the license to certain nonprofit or for-profit retail businesses that meet certain criteria; and authorizing the issuance of a license to an establishment that is within 300 feet of a place of worship or a school with certain written consent.
bill_summary: The bill establishes a new venue beer, wine, and liquor license in Dorchester County allowing businesses to sell alcohol during events where food is served, with specific size and capacity requirements, and outlines related regulations and restrictions.
responsible_party: Dorchester County Board of License Commissioners
stakeholders: Business owners hosting events, attendees of events, community residents
innovative_summary: The program introduces a specialized alcohol license tailored for event venues, with specific criteria and regulations, representing a new approach to alcohol licensing.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has limited direct impact on child poverty, as it primarily affects alcohol licensing for event venues.

Title: State Board of Pharmacy - Renewal Notices - Electronic Means
Synopsis: Requiring the State Board of Pharmacy to send renewal notices to licensees, permit holders, and registrants by electronic means, rather than by first-class mail, unless the licensee, permit holder, or registrant requests to receive the renewal notice by first-class mail.
bill_summary: The bill requires the Maryland State Board of Pharmacy to send renewal notices to licensees, permit holders, and registrants by electronic means (email) instead of first-class mail, unless they request traditional mail.
responsible_party: Maryland State Board of Pharmacy
stakeholders: Pharmacy licensees, permit holders, registrants, pharmacy professionals
innovative_summary: The bill adopts a digital approach for renewal notifications, promoting efficiency and environmental sustainability.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill does not directly impact child poverty levels.

Title: Dorchester County - Alcoholic Beverages Licenses - Fees
Synopsis: Altering licensing fees for certain alcoholic beverages licenses in Dorchester County; and authorizing the Board of License Commissioners for Dorchester County to charge an application or transfer fee under certain circumstances.
bill_summary: The bill modifies the licensing fees and authorizes application and transfer fees for alcoholic beverages licenses in Dorchester County, Maryland.
responsible_party: Dorchester County Board of License Commissioners
stakeholders: Alcohol license applicants and licensees in Dorchester County
innovative_summary: The bill introduces additional application and transfer fees for alcohol licenses, with some fees based on new fee structures, but does not employ new technologies or innovative approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has no direct impact on child poverty as it primarily pertains to licensing fees and procedures.

Title: Dorchester County - Alcoholic Beverages - Arts Beer and Wine License
Synopsis: Establishing in Dorchester County an arts beer and wine license that authorizes the holder to sell or serve beer and wine for on-premises consumption; authorizing the Board of License Commissioners for Dorchester County to issue the license to a nonprofit or for-profit retail business that engages in the display and sale of original artwork in an arts and entertainment district; authorizing the issuance the license within 300 feet of a place of worship or a school with certain written permission; and providing an annual fee of $250.
bill_summary: This bill establishes an arts beer and wine license in Dorchester County allowing certain retail businesses engaged in art display and sale to sell beer and wine for on-premises consumption, with specific conditions relating to licensing, location, and operation.
responsible_party: Board of License Commissioners for Dorchester County
stakeholders: Art businesses, local residents, artists, and community members in Dorchester County
innovative_summary: The program introduces a specialized license connecting alcohol sales with arts and entertainment, promoting local art, cultural activities, and economic development, integrating licensing with artistic expression.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill primarily impacts local businesses and cultural activities; it does not directly target child poverty.

Title: Dorchester County - Alcoholic Beverages - Beer, Wine, and Liquor Tasting License
Synopsis: Authorizing certain Class A license holders in Dorchester County to conduct tastings of liquor under certain circumstances, in addition to tastings of beer and wine; and limiting the quantity of liquor allowed per individual for tastings to 0.5 ounces from each offering and 1.5 ounces from all offerings of liquor in 1 day.
bill_summary: The bill authorizes certain Class A alcohol license holders in Dorchester County to conduct tastings of liquor, in addition to beer and wine, with specific quantity limits. It also establishes the licensing process, fees, and guidelines for such tastings.
responsible_party: Dorchester County Alcoholic Beverages Board
stakeholders: Alcohol license holders, consumers in Dorchester County, local businesses, and event organizers
innovative_summary: The program introduces a specific licensing option for liquor tastings, expanding existing alcohol tasting laws to include liquor with clear quantity limits, but does not employ new advanced technologies or approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill's direct impact on child poverty appears minimal as it mainly pertains to licensing and alcohol tasting regulations for adults.

Title: Anne Arundel County - Alcoholic Beverages - Class C Licenses - Events
Synopsis: Authorizing a holder of certain Class C licenses in Anne Arundel County to sell beer, wine, and liquor to certain individuals for on-premises consumption during events held at the licensed premises; and requiring an outside group to obtain a per diem license from the Board of License Commissioners for Anne Arundel County if the outside group holds an event hosted by the holder of a certain Class C license.
bill_summary: This bill establishes a new event permit in Anne Arundel County, allowing holders of Class C (veterans' organization) licenses to sell alcohol during specific events, with certain licensing and fee provisions.
responsible_party: Anne Arundel County Board of License Commissioners
stakeholders: Veterans' organizations, County residents, event attendees
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a targeted event permit for veterans' organizations, simplifying alcohol sales at events and adding a specific licensing mechanism.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has limited direct impact on child poverty as it primarily concerns alcohol licensing for organizations and events.

Title: State Board of Dental Examiners - Expanded Function Dental Assistants - Education and Reinstatement
Synopsis: Authorizing the State Board of Dental Examiners to approve a certain course of study for expanded function dental assistant certification; requiring that a course of study for initial dental assistant certification include at least 35 hours of in-person and online instruction; requiring the Board to reinstate a certain certification only under certain circumstances; requiring the Board to adopt regulations requiring continuing education, including clinical hands-on training, for expanded function dental assistants; etc.
bill_summary: This bill authorizes the Maryland State Board of Dental Examiners to approve specific courses of study for expanded function dental assistants, including online options, and sets regulations for reinstating expired certifications and continuing education requirements.
responsible_party: Maryland State Board of Dental Examiners
stakeholders: Dental assistants, dental professionals, and patients in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill introduces flexible education and certification reinstatement procedures for dental assistants, including online training options and formalized continuing education regulations.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill indirectly impacts child health and safety by improving dental care quality and accessibility through qualified dental assistants.

Title: St. Mary's County - Alcoholic Beverages Licenses - Multiple Licensing Plans
Synopsis: Authorizing the Board of License Commissioners for St. Mary's County to issue not more than three Class B beer, wine, and liquor restaurant licenses to a person under certain circumstances; and prohibiting a person from having a direct or indirect interest in more than a certain number of Class B beer, wine, and liquor restaurant licenses.
bill_summary: The bill authorizes the St. Mary's County Board of License Commissioners to issue up to three Class B alcohol licenses per individual, with restrictions on having multiple licenses and interests in licenses, to prevent individuals from holding more than one license if they have an off-premises sale authorization.
responsible_party: St. Mary’s County Board of License Commissioners
stakeholders: Alcohol licensees, alcohol consumers, residents of St. Mary's County
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a restriction on the number of alcohol licenses an individual can hold and clarifies rules regarding indirect interests, which is a new regulatory approach.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill does not directly address child poverty or include programs aimed at reducing it.

Title: Maryland Protecting Opportunities and Regional Trade (PORT) Act – Reports of Attorney General – Frequency
Synopsis: Altering the frequency, from every month to every 6 months, of the reports required to be submitted by the Attorney General to the General Assembly regarding the status of the recovery of economic damages arising from the closure of the Helen Delich Bentley Port of Baltimore and the collapse of the Francis Scott Key Bridge.
bill_summary: The bill changes the reporting frequency for the Attorney General's updates to the General Assembly on recovering economic damages from port closure and bridge collapse, from monthly to every six months.
responsible_party: Attorney General of Maryland
stakeholders: Maryland residents and businesses affected by the port closure and bridge collapse
innovative_summary: The bill primarily alters reporting frequency, which is a procedural change rather than an innovative program or service.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill does not have a direct impact on child poverty.

Title: Business Regulation - Enforcement for Miscellaneous State Business Licenses - Study
Synopsis: Requiring the Comptroller to consult with certain stakeholders to study and make recommendations on the enforcement process for miscellaneous State business licenses; and requiring the Comptroller to report the findings and recommendations of the study to the General Assembly by December 1, 2025.
bill_summary: The bill studies and recommends improvements to the enforcement process for miscellaneous State business licenses, including the use of civil citations and contact procedures for enforcement by the Maryland Comptroller's Office.
responsible_party: Maryland Comptroller's Office
stakeholders: Businesses affected by miscellaneous State business licenses and enforcement agencies in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill proposes studying and potentially reforming enforcement processes, including considering civil citations instead of criminal penalties, which is a moderate approach to improving enforcement.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has limited potential to have a direct impact on child poverty as it primarily focuses on enforcement procedures and administrative processes.

Title: Terminology and Obsolete References – Maryland State Firefighters Association and Related Terms
Synopsis: Replacing obsolete references to the Maryland State Firemen's Association with references to the Maryland State Firefighters Association; and replacing related terminology.
bill_summary: This bill updates terminology related to the Maryland State Firefighters Association, making references consistent and current, and clarifies legal and procedural provisions involving fire, rescue, and emergency services in Maryland.
responsible_party: Maryland State Firefighters Association and related governmental agencies
stakeholders: Firefighters, emergency medical personnel, law enforcement, correctional officers, and related emergency services in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill mainly updates terminology and legal references; it does not introduce new programs or initiatives, so it employs standard legislative updates rather than new technologies or approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill does not have a direct or visible impact on child poverty as it mainly updates terminology and references.

Title: State Retirement and Pension System - Transfers Between Systems - Workgroup
Synopsis: Requiring the State Retirement and Pension System to convene a workgroup to study transfers of member service between State and local retirement and pension systems; and requiring the Agency to submit a report of the Workgroup's findings and recommendations, including the need for any legislative initiatives, to the Governor and the General Assembly by December 1, 2025.
bill_summary: This bill requires the Maryland State Retirement Agency to form a workgroup to study and recommend improvements to the transfer process of member service credits between state and local retirement systems.
responsible_party: Maryland State Retirement Agency
stakeholders: Members of Maryland's retirement systems, state and local government employees
innovative_summary: The bill employs a collaborative approach by creating a dedicated workgroup to analyze and recommend procedural improvements, integrating stakeholder input and legislative review.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has minimal direct impact on child poverty as it focuses on pension processes for government employees.

Title: Property Tax - Low-Income Housing Tax Credit - Valuation of Property
Synopsis: Requiring the Department of Housing and Community Development to notify the State Department of Assessments and Taxation, within 30 days of closing and the execution and delivery of a certain regulatory agreement, that a commercial property that is developed under a certain provision of federal law has been awarded a low-income tax credit; and applying the Act to all taxable years beginning after June 30, 2025.
bill_summary: The bill amends property valuation rules for commercial real estate developed with low-income housing tax credits, requiring adjustments for affordability restrictions and a notification process to the Maryland Department of Assessments and Taxation.
responsible_party: Department of Housing and Community Development and Department of Assessments and Taxation
stakeholders: Commercial property developers, low-income housing residents, local governments, and tax authorities
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a new valuation approach that accounts for affordability restrictions when determining property value, and includes an automated notification process, employing data sharing to improve transparency and accuracy.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program potentially reduces barriers to affordable housing development by enabling more accurate valuation and fairer tax treatments, thereby supporting low-income populations.

Title: Election Law - Election Judges - Compensation
Synopsis: Requiring a local board of elections to pay an election judge compensation for completing a certain course of instruction only after the election judge actually serves an election day or early voting day; and authorizing a public school student in the State to earn hours toward the service-learning graduation requirement or receive election judge compensation for service as an election judge.
bill_summary: This bill redefines regulations for paying election judges in Maryland, including requiring that they only receive compensation after serving on election day or early voting day, allowing public school students to earn service-learning hours or receive compensation for serving as election judges, and setting minimum pay standards.
responsible_party: Maryland State Board of Elections
stakeholders: Election judges and Maryland public school students
innovative_summary: The bill employs a dual approach allowing students to combine service-learning requirements with paid election judge service, promoting civic engagement and education.
child_poverty_direct_summary: Moderate potential to impact child poverty by engaging students in civic activities that can create educational and employment opportunities.

Title: Public Libraries - Automated External Defibrillator Program (Raymono A. Russell Act)
Synopsis: Requiring certain libraries, beginning January 1, 2026, to place an automated external defibrillator in a prominent area accessible to employees and library users, to provide maintenance for the automated external defibrillator, and to comply with the Public Access Automated External Defibrillator Program; granting certain immunities to libraries and individuals under certain circumstances; requiring by December 1, 2026, a report to certain committees of the General Assembly on the use of defibrillators in libraries; etc.
bill_summary: This bill requires Maryland libraries to install automated external defibrillators (AEDs), maintain their functionality, and ensure trained personnel are present to use them. The Maryland Department of Health and the Maryland Institute for Emergency Medical Services Systems will adopt regulations and oversee the program. Libraries that comply are granted immunity from certain liabilities, and the program aims to improve emergency response to cardiac events in public libraries.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Health and Maryland Institute for Emergency Medical Services Systems
stakeholders: Library users and staff in Maryland
innovative_summary: The program employs a new approach by mandating AED installations and training in public libraries, integrating emergency medical readiness into community spaces.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has limited direct impact on child poverty, as it focuses on emergency health preparedness in libraries.

Title: Anne Arundel County - Property Tax Credit - Supermarkets
Synopsis: Authorizing the governing body of Anne Arundel County or of a municipal corporation in Anne Arundel County to grant, by law, a property tax credit against the personal property tax imposed on personal property of a supermarket that completes certain construction and is located in a certain food desert retail incentive area; requiring the governing body to designate what constitutes a food desert retail incentive area for purposes of the tax credit; etc.
bill_summary: The bill authorizes the governing body of Anne Arundel County to grant property tax credits to supermarkets that complete certain construction projects in designated food desert areas, encouraging grocery store development in underserved regions.
responsible_party: Anne Arundel County government or municipal corporations within Anne Arundel County
stakeholders: Supermarkets, residents of food desert areas in Anne Arundel County, local government
innovative_summary: The program uses property tax credits as an incentive to encourage grocery store development in food deserts, leveraging tax policy creatively to address food access issues.
child_poverty_direct_summary: High potential to reduce child poverty by improving access to nutritious food in underserved areas.

Title: State Personnel - BWI Airport Fire and Rescue Department - Collective Bargaining and Arbitration Processes
Synopsis: Altering the collective bargaining process between the State and uniformed fire employees of the BWI Airport Fire and Rescue Department by requiring the parties to reach a collective bargaining agreement on or before September 30 of the year in which the collective bargaining agreement will expire; and establishing a process of binding arbitration in the event of an impasse.
bill_summary: The bill modifies the collective bargaining and arbitration process between the State of Maryland and uniformed fire employees of the BWI Airport Fire and Rescue Department. It establishes deadlines for reaching agreements, introduces binding arbitration in case of impasse, and requires inclusion of appropriations necessary to implement employment terms in the budget bill.
responsible_party: Maryland State government, specifically the Department of Budget and Management and the Department of Labor, Licensing, and Regulation.
stakeholders: Uniformed fire employees of the BWI Airport Fire and Rescue Department, the Maryland State government, and the public served by the department.
innovative_summary: The bill employs a structured arbitration process with specific deadlines and requirements for included funding, integrating dispute resolution and budget processes, representing a relatively innovative approach to public sector labor relations.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has limited potential for a direct impact on child poverty, as it mainly alters collective bargaining rules for a specific public safety workforce.

Title: Educational Equality for Service Members Act
Synopsis: Establishing rules of interpretation related to the uniformed services; altering the rule of interpretation for "veteran"; and altering the application of certain provisions of law governing education to apply to all uniformed services, rather than only the armed forces.
bill_summary: This bill, titled the Educational Equality for Service Members Act, establishes rules for interpreting terms related to the uniformed services, expands education laws to include all uniformed services, and creates programs and policies to support military-connected students, veterans, and their families in education and employment. It includes provisions for expedited educator certification, school enrollment, scholarships, and veterans' resources.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Education and relevant state agencies
stakeholders: Military service members, veterans, military families, students of military-connected individuals, educational institutions in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill introduces several new programs and policies, including a Purple Star Schools designation and expanded scholarship and certification programs, employing innovative approaches to support military-connected individuals.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill could have a high potential to impact child poverty by improving educational support and resources for military-connected families, which may contribute to stability and opportunity for children.

Title: Economic Development - Small Business Guaranty Fund - Alterations
Synopsis: Authorizing the Maryland Small Business Development Financing Authority to authorize the provision of a guaranty under the Small Business Guaranty Fund in an irrevocable letter of credit, an official treasurer's check, funds on deposit in an escrow or other depository account, or any other legal instrument promising a financial institution restitution or reimbursement for its loan losses, within the limits of the guaranty.
bill_summary: The bill authorizes the Maryland Small Business Development Financing Authority to provide guarantees under the Small Business Guaranty Fund, supporting loans for small businesses for purposes such as working capital, debt refinancing, equipment, or real estate. It outlines the conditions for guarantees, including loan amounts, terms, and types of guarantees supported, and allows the use of the state's full faith and credit or other financial instruments.
responsible_party: Maryland Small Business Development Financing Authority
stakeholders: Small business owners in Maryland, financial institutions, and the Maryland economy
innovative_summary: The program employs financial guarantees supported by the state's credit to encourage lending to small businesses, including the use of various financial instruments for guarantees.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has potential to reduce child poverty indirectly by supporting small business growth and job creation, which can benefit families.

Title: State Board of Nursing - Advanced Practice Nursing Licensure and Specialty Certification - Reciprocity Discussions (Maryland Border States Advanced Practice Nursing Act)
Synopsis: Requiring the State Board of Nursing to hold discussions with Delaware, Pennsylvania, Virginia, West Virginia, and the District of Columbia to pursue reciprocity agreements for advanced practice nursing licensure and specialty certification; and requiring the Board, by November 1, 2025, and each November 1 for the following 4 years, to submit a report to certain committees of the General Assembly on the status of the discussions, agreements reached, challenges in the negotiations, and any legislative recommendations.
bill_summary: The bill requires the Maryland Board of Nursing to discuss reciprocity agreements with neighboring jurisdictions to facilitate mutual recognition of advanced practice nurse licenses and certifications, aiming to improve access, portability, and telehealth services.
responsible_party: State Board of Nursing
stakeholders: Advanced practice registered nurses, patients, healthcare providers in Maryland and neighboring jurisdictions
innovative_summary: The bill promotes interstate collaboration for license reciprocity, which is a policy approach to improve healthcare access and mobility.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program may have an indirect impact by improving healthcare access, but it does not directly target child poverty.

Title: Earned Income Tax Credit - Notice of Eligibility - Alteration
Synopsis: Altering the method by which the Comptroller must provide notice of the maximum income eligibility for the earned income tax credit for the calendar year to all employers in the State to include an electronic means of notification.
bill_summary: The bill changes how the Maryland Comptroller provides notices to employers about the earned income tax credit, requiring the Comptroller to provide notices via mail or electronic means, and impacts employer notice requirements.
responsible_party: Maryland Comptroller's Office
stakeholders: Employers and employees in Maryland potentially eligible for the earned income tax credit
innovative_summary: The bill introduces electronic means of providing notices about tax credits, which reflects a move towards digital communication but is not highly innovative.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill's direct impact on child poverty is indirect, mainly through improving awareness of tax credits, which could enable more families to receive benefits.

Title: Local Earned Income Tax Credit - Calculation - County Income Tax Rate
Synopsis: Clarifying that a county's applicable income tax rate is the tax rate used to calculate the local earned income tax credit that certain individuals may claim against the county income tax; and applying the Act to all taxable years beginning after December 31, 2024.
bill_summary: The bill clarifies how to calculate the local earned income tax credit for certain Maryland residents by specifying the county income tax rate used, including rules for counties with marginal or flat income tax rates, and includes provisions for counties to offer refundable credits.
responsible_party: Maryland Comptroller's Office
stakeholders: Mary Maryland residents subject to county income tax, local governments, and the Maryland tax system
innovative_summary: The bill primarily clarifies and adjusts existing tax credit calculation rules with no new technology or innovative approaches involved.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has limited direct impact on child poverty as it mainly modifies tax credit calculation rules.

Title: Criminal Law - Destroying Funerary Objects and Cemetery Elements - Statute of Limitations and Prohibition
Synopsis: Extending from 1 year to 3 years the statute of limitations for prosecutions relating to destroying funerary objects and other elements of a cemetery to begin at the time local authorities knew or reasonably should have known of the violation; and prohibiting a person from willfully destroying, damaging, defacing, or removing any part of the grounds of a cemetery.
bill_summary: The bill increases the statute of limitations for prosecuting crimes related to destroying funerary objects or cemetery elements from 1 year to 3 years after the authorities knew or reasonably should have known of the violation. It also prohibits willful destruction of cemetery grounds, including landscaping, and specifies penalties for violations.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Public Safety and Correctional Services or local law enforcement agencies (implied)
stakeholders: Cemetery owners, local authorities, descendants and relatives of those interred, and the general public concerned with cemetery preservation.
innovative_summary: The bill employs an extended statute of limitations and clarifies the scope of prohibited acts, including landscaping and grounds of cemeteries, but does not introduce new technologies or innovative approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill's direct impact on child poverty is minimal as it primarily addresses legal procedures and protections concerning cemeteries.

Title: Comptroller - Recording and Monitoring Telephone Calls - Clarification
Synopsis: Clarifying which telephone calls the Comptroller of the State may record and monitor for training, quality control, and employee safety purposes; and providing that the Comptroller may monitor and record calls to the Comptroller's call centers only.
bill_summary: The bill clarifies the circumstances under which the Maryland Comptroller's Office may record and monitor incoming telephone calls to employees at their call centers, specifying purposes, notice requirements, and retention limits.
responsible_party: Maryland Comptroller's Office
stakeholders: Maryland taxpayers and Comptroller's Office employees
innovative_summary: The bill introduces clearer rules on the monitoring and recording of calls, ensuring transparency and limited retention, but does not employ new technologies or approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has limited potential to directly impact child poverty.

Title: State Lottery - Internet Sales of Subscription Plans - Authorization
Synopsis: Authorizing the State Lottery and Gaming Control Agency to allow the establishment of a system or program that allows an individual to purchase a State lottery subscription plan through an electronic device that connects to the Internet, such as a personal computer or mobile device; and requiring the Agency to report by December 1, 2026, to certain committees of the General Assembly on State lottery subscription sales.
bill_summary: The bill authorizes the Maryland State Lottery and Gaming Control Agency to establish a system that allows individuals to purchase lottery subscriptions online through the internet. It also requires the agency to report on subscription sales and renewals by December 1, 2026.
responsible_party: State Lottery and Gaming Control Agency
stakeholders: Individuals interested in purchasing lottery subscriptions, licensed lottery agents, and the Maryland state government.
innovative_summary: The program introduces online purchasing of lottery subscriptions and vouchers, leveraging internet technology to modernize lottery sales and subscriptions.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill's direct impact on child poverty is minimal as it mainly pertains to lottery sales procedures and online access.

Title: Sales and Use Tax - Sales Between Cannabis Businesses and Cannabis Nurseries - Exemption
Synopsis: Expanding the exemption from the sales and use tax for certain cannabis sales to include sales between certain licensed cannabis businesses and registered cannabis nurseries.
bill_summary: The bill expands the exemption from the sales and use tax for cannabis to include sales between licensed cannabis businesses and registered cannabis nurseries.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Revenue (implied as the agency implementing tax law)
stakeholders: Cannabis businesses, registered cannabis nurseries, consumers of cannabis product
innovative_summary: The bill employs a straightforward expansion of existing tax exemption rules without introducing new technologies or approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill does not have a direct impact on child poverty.

Title: Highways - Sidewalks and Bicycle Pathways - Construction and Reconstruction
Synopsis: Requiring the State Highway Administration to prioritize funding for the construction and reconstruction of sidewalks and bicycle pathways to sidewalks and bicycle pathways that are, or are adjacent to highways that are, subject to a complete streets policy or another similar Vision Zero program; requiring a local government to request certain funding from the Department of Transportation; and authorizing certain State funding for the construction or reconstruction of sidewalks or bicycle pathways.
bill_summary: The bill requires the Maryland State Highway Administration to prioritize funding for the construction and reconstruction of sidewalks and bicycle pathways that are, or are adjacent to, highways with complete streets policies or similar Vision Zero programs. It sets rules for funding, local government requests, and maintenance of these facilities, aiming to enhance pedestrian and bicycle infrastructure.
responsible_party: Maryland State Highway Administration
stakeholders: Local governments, pedestrians, bicyclists, residents of urban areas
innovative_summary: The program employs a strategic prioritization of sidewalk and bicycle pathway construction based on Vision Zero and complete streets policies, with some projects potentially entirely funded by the state to improve pedestrian and bicycle safety.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill potentially improves safety and accessibility for pedestrians and bicyclists, which may have a positive impact on low-income and vulnerable populations, but its direct impact on child poverty is limited.

Title: Gaming - Slot Machines - Skills-Based Amusement Devices
Synopsis: Altering the definition of "slot machine" to provide that certain skills-based amusement devices excluded from the definition may award merchandise, tickets, tokens, or other objects that do not exceed a certain minimal value per play and may be accumulated and exchanged for noncash merchandise or prizes of value that is similar to the cumulated value of the objects exchanged, and does not exceed a minimal wholesale value of $599.
bill_summary: The bill modifies the definition of 'slot machine' in Maryland to include certain skills-based amusement devices that can award objects of minimal value, which can be accumulated and exchanged for merchandise or prizes of a certain value.
responsible_party: Maryland State Lottery and Gaming Control Commission
stakeholders: People who play skills-based amusement devices and the gaming industry in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a new category of skills-based amusement devices that include mechanisms for accumulating prizes and exchanging them, which brings innovation in gaming regulation.
