child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has a limited direct impact on child poverty, primarily through regulation of gaming devices.

Title: Income Tax - Income Tax Reconciliation Program - Established (Maryland Fair Taxation for Justice-Involved Individuals Act)
Synopsis: Establishing the Income Tax Reconciliation Program in the State to allow certain justice-involved individuals to establish installment payment plans and receive a waiver of any interest and penalties that accrue for unpaid income tax due for a taxable year beginning after December 31, 2024, but before January 1, 2030; requiring the Comptroller to administer the Program; requiring the Comptroller, in collaboration with the Department of Public Safety and Correctional Services, to develop an awareness campaign about the Program; etc.
bill_summary: The bill establishes the Income Tax Reconciliation Program in Maryland, which allows justice-involved individuals to set up payment plans and receive waivers of interest and penalties on unpaid income taxes while incarcerated.
responsible_party: Maryland Comptroller's Office in collaboration with the Department of Public Safety and Correctional Services
stakeholders: Justice-involved individuals, taxpayers, prison populations in Maryland
innovative_summary: The program introduces a targeted approach to address tax debt among incarcerated individuals by offering payment plans and waivers, utilizing collaboration between tax and correction agencies, and improving tax equity.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program may have an indirect impact on child poverty by reducing financial burdens on families of justice-involved individuals, potentially improving economic stability.

Title: Higher Education - Janet L. Hoffman Loan Assistance Repayment Program - Eligibility
Synopsis: Expanding the eligibility for the Janet L. Hoffman Loan Assistance Repayment Program to include individuals who received a certain degree from an accredited veterinary school and provided veterinary services in the State for not less than 5 years or provided volunteer veterinary services at certain animal shelters for 3 years and to include individuals who provided veterinary technician services for not less than 5 years or provided volunteer veterinary technician services at certain animal shelters over a 3-year period.
bill_summary: The bill expands the eligibility criteria for the Janet L. Hoffman Loan Assistance Repayment Program to include veterinary practitioners and veterinary technicians who have provided services for specified periods or volunteer work at animal shelters, in addition to existing professions.
responsible_party: Office of Student Financial Assistance
stakeholders: Veterinary practitioners, veterinary technicians, animal shelters, and students with education loans in Maryland
innovative_summary: The program incorporates volunteer service hours at animal shelters as qualifying factors for loan repayment assistance, which is a novel approach to incentivizing volunteer work in veterinary services.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill may have an indirect impact on child poverty by enabling professionals serving children and families to access loan forgiveness, but the impact is not direct.

Title: Task Force on the Creation of a Division of Returning Citizens and Expanded Reentry Services - Extension of Report Deadline and Task Force
Synopsis: Extending the deadline for the reporting requirement for the Task Force on the Creation of a Division of Returning Citizens and Expanded Reentry Services to be October 31, 2026; and extending the termination date for the Task Force to be June 30, 2027.
bill_summary: The bill extends the deadline for the Task Force on the Creation of a Division of Returning Citizens and Expanded Reentry Services to submit its report to October 31, 2026, and extends the task force's duration until June 30, 2027.
responsible_party: Maryland General Assembly / Relevant State Agencies (unspecified)
stakeholders: Returning citizens, criminal justice agencies, community organizations, and the general public interested in reentry services
innovative_summary: The bill primarily focuses on extending existing deadlines and durations for a task force, without establishing new programs or innovative approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill does not directly address child poverty; it focuses on reentry services for returning citizens.

Title: Wicomico County - Alcoholic Beverages - Temporary To-Go Event Permit and Class C Per Diem Municipal To-Go Beer, Wine, and Liquor License
Synopsis: Establishing a temporary to-go event permit in Wicomico County; authorizing the Board of License Commissioners for Wicomico County to issue a temporary to-go event permit to a holder of a Class B beer, wine, and liquor license; establishing a Class C per diem municipal to-go beer, wine, and liquor license in the county; authorizing the Board to issue a Class C per diem municipal to-go beer, wine, and liquor license to a municipality in the county; requiring the Board to adopt certain regulations; etc.
bill_summary: The bill establishes a temporary to-go event permit in Wicomico County, allowing license holders to sell alcoholic beverages for takeout at designated special event areas, and creates a Class C per diem municipal to-go beer, wine, and liquor license for municipalities to issue such permits.
responsible_party: Wicomico County Board of License Commissioners
stakeholders: Alcohol license holders, local municipalities, event attendees, general public in Wicomico County
innovative_summary: The program employs a new approach to alcohol sales by enabling on-site licensed establishments and municipalities to offer regulated takeout and temporary sale of alcoholic beverages in designated areas during events.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill's potential to have a direct impact on child poverty is limited as it primarily involves licensing and sale regulations.

Title: Juvenile Services Education Board - Alterations
Synopsis: Authorizing the Secretary of Higher Education and the State Superintendent of Schools to select a designee to serve on the Juvenile Services Education Board; altering the terms of membership for the Board; and altering certain requirements for meetings of the Board.
bill_summary: This bill alters the composition and meeting requirements of the Maryland Juvenile Services Education Board, including changes to membership, terms, and meeting frequency, and authorizes the selection of a designee by the Secretary of Higher Education and the State Superintendent of Schools.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Human Services or relevant overseeing agency
stakeholders: juvenile education providers, juvenile justice system, educational staff, and youth in juvenile facilities
innovative_summary: The bill primarily updates governance rules; it does not introduce new technologies or innovative approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has limited potential to directly impact child poverty, as it mainly revises board membership and meeting protocols.

Title: Health Occupations - Licensed Direct-Entry Midwives - Disciplinary Actions
Synopsis: Clarifying that the State Board of Nursing may deny a license or grant a license, including a license subject to a reprimand, probation, or suspension, if an applicant for a license to practice direct-entry midwifery or a licensed direct-entry midwife violates a ground for discipline.
bill_summary: The bill clarifies the disciplinary actions that the Maryland State Board of Nursing can take against applicants and licensed direct-entry midwives if they violate specific grounds for discipline, including misconduct or incompetence.
responsible_party: Maryland State Board of Nursing
stakeholders: Direct-entry midwives and their clients in Maryland
innovative_summary: This bill mainly clarifies existing disciplinary procedures and does not introduce new technologies or approaches, focusing on regulatory rules.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill does not directly impact child poverty; it focuses on licensing and discipline of midwives.

Title: Maryland Medical Assistance Program and Health Insurance - Required Coverage for Calcium Score Testing
Synopsis: Requiring the Maryland Medical Assistance Program and insurers, nonprofit health service plans, health maintenance organizations, and managed care organizations to provide coverage in accordance with the most recent guidelines issued by the American College of Cardiology that expand the scope of preventive care services for the benefit of consumers; and applying the Act to all policies, contracts, and health benefit plans issued, delivered, or renewed in the State on or after January 1, 2026.
bill_summary: The bill requires the Maryland Medical Assistance Program and certain health insurance providers to cover calcium score testing for individuals with specific risk factors, starting from January 1, 2026. It also mandates coverage for biomarker testing starting July 1, 2025, and prostheses starting January 1, 2025.
responsible_party: Maryland Medical Assistance Program and licensed health insurance providers such as insurers, nonprofit health service plans, health maintenance organizations, and managed care organizations
stakeholders: Individuals at risk for heart disease and the general Maryland population accessing health coverage
innovative_summary: The bill incorporates guidelines from the American College of Cardiology for preventive care, including calcium score testing for at-risk individuals, representing a targeted approach to preventive health.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program could indirectly impact child poverty by improving access to preventive cardiovascular care for at-risk populations, potentially reducing health disparities.

Title: School Health and Wellness Personnel Assessment and Maryland Council on Advancement of School-Based Health Centers
Synopsis: Requiring the State Department of Education and the Maryland Department of Health jointly to conduct an assessment of school health and wellness personnel each year; altering the membership of the Maryland Council on Advancement of School-Based Health Centers; and requiring the Department and the State Department of Education to annually report to the General Assembly on the findings of the assessment beginning December 1, 2027, and publish the report on the website of each agency.
bill_summary: The bill requires the Maryland Department of Education and the Maryland Department of Health to annually assess the school health and wellness personnel workforce, including staffing ratios, vacancy rates, and stakeholder feedback. It also modifies the membership of the Maryland Council on Advancement of School–Based Health Centers, adding a school nurse representative.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Education and Maryland Department of Health
stakeholders: School students, school health and wellness personnel, local school systems, local health departments, and related stakeholders
innovative_summary: The bill introduces an annual assessment of school health and wellness personnel workforce to inform improvements, which is a systematic approach to workforce planning and policy development.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has the potential to improve access to health services for students, potentially reducing child poverty effects related to health disparities.

Title: Criminal Law - Dismembering or Burying Human Remains With Intent to Conceal a Crime
Synopsis: Prohibiting a person, with the intent to conceal a crime, from knowingly and willfully dismembering, destroying, removing, burying, disposing of, or obliterating by any means any portion of human remains; prohibiting a person from aiding or abetting another in committing a violation of the Act; and establishing that a violation of the Act is a felony with a penalty of imprisonment not exceeding 5 years.
bill_summary: This bill criminalizes the concealment of a person's death through acts such as dismembering, destroying, removing, or burying human remains with intent to conceal a crime, and also prohibits failure to notify emergency services or law enforcement about a death.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Public Safety and Correctional Services (implied)
stakeholders: Law enforcement, healthcare providers, legal system, general public
innovative_summary: The bill adopts a traditional legal approach to addressing concealment crimes related to human remains, without employing new technologies or novel methods.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has no direct mechanisms or programs targeted at child poverty.

Title: Public Safety - Rape Kit Testing - Tracking Program and Grant Fund
Synopsis: Altering from December 31, 2025, to March 31,2026, the date by which a certain report under a certain sexual assault evidence collection kit tracking program is required to be submitted; altering the purpose and use of the Rape Kit Testing Grant Fund; expanding the duties of the Executive Director of the Governor's Office of Crime Prevention and Policy relating to the Fund; and prohibiting the use of the Fund for a certain sexual assault evidence collection kit tracking program.
bill_summary: The bill establishes a Rape Kit Testing Grant Fund to provide funding for testing untested sexual assault evidence collection kits and support services for victims, and it authorizes a tracking system for sexual assault kits.
responsible_party: Governor’s Office of Crime Prevention and Policy
stakeholders: Victims of sexual assault, law enforcement agencies, forensic laboratories
innovative_summary: Creates a dedicated grant fund and a statewide tracking system, employing technology and dedicated funding to improve sexual assault evidence testing and victim support.
child_poverty_direct_summary: Moderate potential for impact through victim support and services related to sexual assault cases.

Title: Maryland Deaf Culture Digital Library - Funding and Budget Submission
Synopsis: Requiring the Governor to include in the annual budget bill an appropriation of $450,000 to the Maryland Deaf Culture Digital Library; and requiring the Deaf Culture Digital Library to submit its annual operating budget to the State Library Agency on or before June 1 each year.
bill_summary: The bill establishes the Maryland Deaf Culture Digital Library as the primary resource center for deaf materials, mandates funding of $450,000 annually from fiscal year 2026 onward, requires the library to submit an annual budget, and details its activities and partnerships to support deaf and hard of hearing communities.
responsible_party: State Library Agency of Maryland
stakeholders: Deaf and hard of hearing individuals, library staff, community organizations, and related stakeholders in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill promotes a dedicated digital library for the Deaf community with strategic partnerships, community involvement, and tailored training, employing digital and collaborative approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has a moderate potential to directly impact child poverty by improving resources and accessibility for deaf children and families.

Title: Child Support - Driver's License Suspension for Arrearages and Court Orders
Synopsis: Altering the circumstances under which the Child Support Administration may notify the Motor Vehicle Administration of an individual's child support arrearages for the purpose of suspending the individual's driver's license or privilege to drive; and requiring the court, after establishing a child support order, to send a copy of the guideline calculation and the order to the Child Support Administration.
bill_summary: This bill alters the criteria for suspending driver's licenses for child support arrearages in Maryland, requiring notification after 120 days of non-compliance, and mandates sharing the court's support calculations with the Child Support Administration.
responsible_party: Child Support Administration of the Maryland Department of Human Services
stakeholders: Parents with child support obligations, and children relying on support enforcement programs in Maryland.
innovative_summary: The program primarily updates existing procedures for license suspension related to child support arrearages without employing new technologies or approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has the potential to reduce child poverty by improving enforcement of child support payments, but it mainly focuses on administrative procedures.

Title: Garrett County Alcoholic Beverages Act of 2025
Synopsis: Establishing certain deluxe complex restaurant and resort complex beer and wine and beer, wine, and liquor licenses in Garrett County; requiring the Board of License Commissioners for Garrett County to hold a hearing for the issuance of certain festival licenses and altering certain notice requirements for the hearing; requiring certain festival license applicants to apply to the Board in a certain manner; clarifying the entities to which the Board may issue certain multiple day and multiple event licenses; etc.
bill_summary: The bill authorizes the issuance of various new licenses related to alcoholic beverages, including complex resort licenses, deluxe restaurant licenses, and festival licenses for beer, wine, and liquor in Garrett County, Maryland. It also establishes regulations, fees, and procedures for these licenses.
responsible_party: Maryland Alcoholic Beverages Board
stakeholders: Businesses, event organizers, and consumers in Garrett County, Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill introduces specialized licenses for resorts, restaurants, and festivals, incorporating regulations for large-scale events and complex properties, which is a moderately innovative approach to alcohol licensing.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The direct impact on child poverty is likely minimal as the bill mainly addresses licensing procedures and fees.

Title: Tax Relief and State Personnel Equality for Service Members Act
Synopsis: Establishing rules of interpretation related to the uniformed services; altering the rule of interpretation for "veteran"; and altering the application of certain provisions of law governing personnel and taxation to apply to all uniformed services, rather than only the armed forces.
bill_summary: This bill broadens Maryland's laws related to veterans and uniformed service members by including all uniformed services in legal definitions, providing tax relief, property tax exemptions, and reinstatement rights for service members and veterans, and establishing rules for interpretation of these benefits.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Veterans and Military Families
stakeholders: Maryland veterans and uniformed service members, their families, and eligible residents with disabilities or service-connected benefits
innovative_summary: The bill integrates comprehensive legal definitions, tax exemptions, and reinstatement rights for a broad group of service members and veterans, employing an inclusive approach to military and veteran benefits in Maryland.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has a high potential to impact child poverty by supporting military families and veterans through tax relief and property exemptions, reducing economic burdens.

Title: Local Government - Development Impact Fees, Surcharges, and Excise Taxes - Reporting
Synopsis: Requiring county governments to make a certain report by July 1 each year to the Department of Planning on the amount, use, and location of the use of county development impact fees, surcharges, and excise taxes; and requiring county governments to make certain reports to the Department of Planning identifying certain local laws.
bill_summary: This bill requires Maryland county governments to report annually to the Department of Planning and the Governor on the collection and use of development impact fees, surcharges, and excise taxes, including details on amounts collected, locations, and uses.
responsible_party: Department of Planning and county governments
stakeholders: County governments, developers, local residents
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a standardized annual reporting process for counties regarding development impact fees, promoting transparency and accountability.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program's focus on reporting and transparency may indirectly benefit efforts to reduce child poverty by ensuring better use of funds for community development.

Title: General Provisions - Veterans Benefits - Honorable Discharge
Synopsis: Defining "honorable discharge" with respect to any State program of benefits, rights, or privileges applicable to a veteran to include certain discharges.
bill_summary: This bill expands the definition of 'honorable discharge' for veterans applying to Maryland state benefits to include discharges that are less than honorable under specific circumstances, such as those related to sexual orientation, gender identity, PTSD, or sexual trauma, provided a Department of Veterans and Military Families determines the discharge should be upgraded.
responsible_party: Department of Veterans and Military Families
stakeholders: Veterans who have received discharges that are less than honorable under certain conditions
innovative_summary: The bill employs a nuanced approach to 'honorable discharge' by recognizing specific circumstances related to mental health issues and trauma, which is a more inclusive and empathetic method for evaluating veteran discharges.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill does not directly impact child poverty levels.

Title: County Boards of Education - Special Education Service Delivery Models - Publication Requirement
Synopsis: Requiring each county board of education to publish on its website a certain list of special education service delivery models provided for parentally-placed private school students; and defining "parentally-placed private school student" as a child with a disability enrolled by the parent or guardian of the child in a private elementary or secondary school or facility, including a religious school or facility.
bill_summary: The bill requires county boards of education in Maryland to publish on their websites a list of all special education service delivery models and services provided to parentally-placed private school students, and to state that placement decisions are made by an individualized education program team in consultation with parents, following federal law.
responsible_party: County Boards of Education in Maryland
stakeholders: Students with disabilities enrolled in private schools, parents or guardians of these students, and local education agencies
innovative_summary: The bill enhances transparency by mandating online publication of special education services and models and emphasizes collaborative decision-making, which is a standard practice but formalized here with public access.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has limited direct impact on child poverty, focusing mainly on transparency and procedural aspects of special education services.

Title: Higher Education - Maryland Graduate and Professional Scholarship Program - Eligible Institutions
Synopsis: Expanding eligibility under the Maryland Graduate and Professional Scholarship Program to include certain students attending the Meritus School of Osteopathic Medicine.
bill_summary: The bill expands eligibility for the Maryland Graduate and Professional Scholarship Program to include students attending certain Maryland institutions offering a master's degree in nursing, social work, or a first professional degree in pharmacy.
responsible_party: Maryland State Government, Department of Higher Education or the Commission under the Education Department
stakeholders: Students pursuing graduate or professional degrees in medicine, dentistry, law, pharmacy, nursing, social work, and veterinary medicine attending eligible Maryland institutions
innovative_summary: The bill primarily clarifies and expands eligibility rules for existing scholarship programs; it does not introduce new technologies or novel approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: By expanding access to financial aid for graduate and professional students, the program has a potential impact on reducing barriers to advanced education, which can contribute to alleviating child poverty indirectly.

Title: Vehicle Laws - Licenses, Identification Cards, and Moped Operator's Permits - Notation of Nonapparent Disability (Eric's ID Law)
Synopsis: Requiring that an original and renewal application for a license, an identification card, or a moped operator's permit allow an applicant to choose to indicate on the document the applicant's nonapparent disability; requiring the Motor Vehicle Administration to ensure that a certain license, identification card, or moped operator's permit include a notation of a nonapparent disability; requiring the immediate implementation of training for law enforcement concerning interactions with persons with nonapparent disabilities; etc.
bill_summary: The bill requires certain Maryland vehicle licenses, ID cards, and moped permits to allow applicants to indicate if they have a nonapparent disability, such as developmental or intellectual disabilities. It establishes procedures for noting and removing this information, requires public outreach, and prohibits the disclosure of this information inappropriately.
responsible_party: Maryland Motor Vehicle Administration
stakeholders: Individuals with nonapparent disabilities applying for driver’s licenses, ID cards, or moped permits
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a novel way for individuals with nonapparent disabilities to voluntarily disclose their condition on official documents, with safeguards for privacy and public awareness campaigns.
child_poverty_direct_summary: Moderate potential for impact on child poverty, as improved acknowledgment and support for persons with disabilities can contribute to better social inclusion and opportunities.

Title: Harford County - Alcoholic Beverages - Multiple Licenses - Golf Simulator Facilities
Synopsis: Authorizing the Board of License Commissioners for Harford County to issue a Class GSF (golf simulator facility) license to a holder of a Class B license; and clarifying that the Class GSF (golf simulator facility) license counts toward the maximum number of nine Class B alcoholic beverages licenses a holder may be issued.
bill_summary: The bill authorizes the Harford County Board of License Commissioners to issue a new type of alcohol license, a Class GSF (golf simulator facility) license, to holders of existing Class B licenses. It clarifies that this new license counts toward the maximum number of licenses a person can hold and permits the issuance of one such license per person, starting from July 1, 2025.
responsible_party: Harford County Board of License Commissioners
stakeholders: Golf simulator facility operators, alcohol license holders, residents and visitors in Harford County
innovative_summary: The program employs a new approach by creating a specialized alcohol license for golf simulator facilities, integrating entertainment and alcohol sales, possibly employing new licensing frameworks.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill is unlikely to have a direct impact on child poverty as it mainly pertains to licensing rules for alcohol and entertainment venues.

Title: Harford County - Alcoholic Beverages - Performing Arts Nonprofit Organization License - Record-Keeping Requirements
Synopsis: Repealing certain incorrect references to the Comptroller of Maryland in certain provisions of law requiring the holder of a performing arts nonprofit organization license in Harford County to comply with certain record-keeping and reporting requirements; repealing the authority of the Comptroller to suspend the license of a license holder without a hearing under certain circumstances; and authorizing, rather than requiring, the Board to summon a license holder for a hearing and impose a fine under certain circumstances.
bill_summary: This bill modifies record-keeping, reporting, and enforcement procedures for alcohol licenses in Harford County, Maryland, specifically for performing arts nonprofit organizations, by removing certain references to the Comptroller and giving the licensing authority more discretion in hearings and penalties.
responsible_party: Harford County Board of License Commissioners
stakeholders: Performing arts nonprofit organizations holding alcohol licenses in Harford County, Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a more discretionary approach to license enforcement, reducing automatic suspensions without a hearing and removing references to the state Comptroller, reflecting a localized and flexible enforcement approach.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has limited direct impact on child poverty as it primarily concerns local licensing procedures and enforcement for alcohol sales related to nonprofit organizations.

Title: Harford County - Alcoholic Beverages - Alteration of License Quota
Synopsis: Altering the quota used to determine the maximum number of certain alcoholic beverages licenses that the Board of License Commissioners for Harford County may issue from every 4,000 to every 4,750 individuals in the county.
bill_summary: The bill alters the quota used to determine the maximum number of certain alcoholic beverage licenses that the Board of License Commissioners for Harford County can issue, changing the individual license cap from 4,000 to 4,750 residents in the county, effective July 1, 2025.
responsible_party: Board of License Commissioners for Harford County
stakeholders: Alcoholic beverage license applicants and residents of Harford County
innovative_summary: This program primarily adjusts licensing quotas based on population, which is a straightforward regulatory change without the adoption of new technology or innovative approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: This bill does not directly impact child poverty levels.

Title: Housing and Community Development - Statewide Rental Assistance Voucher Program Eligibility - Alterations
Synopsis: Including the Department of Housing and Community Development in the definition of "public housing agency" for the purposes of the Statewide Rental Assistance Voucher Program; authorizing a public housing agency to administer the Program in accordance with a local administrative plan; authorizing the Department to project-base up to 100% of its authorized voucher units; altering the manner in which the Department and each public housing agency shall prioritize vouchers and housing assistance payments for certain families; etc.
bill_summary: The bill modifies the Maryland Statewide Rental Assistance Voucher Program by including the Department of Housing and Community Development as a public housing agency, allowing it to administer vouchers directly or through local agencies, and adjusting program priorities and funding provisions.
responsible_party: Department of Housing and Community Development
stakeholders: Low-income families, homeless individuals, elderly, disabled, veterans, and families with children in Maryland
innovative_summary: The program expands existing rental assistance by allowing project-basing of vouchers and broadening the eligibility and prioritization criteria, incorporating federal and state coordination.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has a moderate potential to directly reduce child poverty by providing stable housing for low-income families and vulnerable populations.

Title: Natural Resources - Public Lands - Acquisition, Staffing, Operations, and Funding
Synopsis: Altering provisions of law regarding the acquisition of real property by the Department of Natural Resources; establishing a Land and Property Management Program in the Department to process certain  transactions; authorizing the Department and the Natural Resources Police to establish affiliated foundations; authorizing the Governor to transfer certain Program Open Space funds to the Department under certain circumstances; altering and repealing certain provisions of law regarding the use of Program Open Space local funding; etc.
bill_summary: This bill establishes a Land and Property Management Program in the Maryland Department of Natural Resources, authorizes the creation of affiliated foundations to support land conservation and recreational activities, and modifies provisions related to public land acquisitions, funding, and use of Program Open Space funds.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Natural Resources
stakeholders: Public land users, conservation interests, local governments, and Maryland residents interested in recreation and conservation
innovative_summary: The bill employs innovative approaches by establishing affiliated foundations to support land management and public engagement, and by creating a new Land and Property Management Program to efficiently handle property transactions.
child_poverty_direct_summary: Potentially moderate, as increased conservation and recreational access can improve community well-being and outdoor opportunities, indirectly impacting child poverty.

Title: Maryland Health Insurance Coverage Protection Commission - Established
Synopsis: Establishing the Maryland Health Insurance Coverage Protection Commission to monitor and assess the impact of potential and actual federal changes to specified health care programs and to provide recommendations for State and local action to protect the access of residents of the State to affordable health coverage; and requiring the Commission to submit a report of its findings and recommendations, including any legislative proposals, to the Governor and the General Assembly by December 31 each year.
bill_summary: This bill establishes the Maryland Health Insurance Coverage Protection Commission to monitor and assess the impact of federal healthcare policy changes and recommend actions to protect residents' access to affordable health coverage.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Health, Maryland Insurance Administration, and the Department of Legislative Services
stakeholders: Residents of Maryland, especially those at risk of losing health coverage due to federal policy changes
innovative_summary: The bill creates a dedicated state commission to actively monitor federal healthcare policy changes and recommend state-level actions, representing a proactive and coordinated approach to healthcare policy.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has high potential to directly impact child poverty by safeguarding access to affordable health coverage for vulnerable populations.

Title: Natural Resources - State Boat Act - Alterations
Synopsis: Repealing certain advertising and public hearing requirements for proposed regulations implementing the State Boat Act; increasing certain funding thresholds for certain projects financed by the Waterway Improvement Fund; and altering the fees for manufacturer and dealer licenses, certificates of number, Maryland use stickers, and the issuance of certificates of title, transfer of title, or duplicate or corrected certificates of title.
bill_summary: The bill makes numerous updates to Maryland's State Boat Act, including redefining 'personal watercraft' and 'personal flotation device', reducing fees for vessel registration and titles, authorizing nonmotorized vessel decals, and increasing funding thresholds for waterway projects. It also establishes safety requirements for children under 13, such as wearing a life jacket, and allows the Department of Natural Resources to regulate speed zones and restricted areas for safety.
responsible_party: Department of Natural Resources
stakeholders: Vessel owners, boat operators, and the general public in Maryland who use watercraft
innovative_summary: The bill primarily updates rules and definitions related to watercraft, fees, and safety regulations. It employs some new approaches such as nonmotorized vessel decals and enhanced safety requirements for children, but does not introduce entirely new technologies or innovative programs.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill's focus on water safety, vessel regulation, and funding does not directly target child poverty, though better safety regulations may have indirect benefits for children in boating communities.

Title: Natural Resources - Repeal of Somers Cove Marina Commission and Improvement Fund and Alteration of Operations
Synopsis: Repealing provisions of law relating to the Somers Cove Marina Commission, the Somers Cove Marina Improvement Fund, and the operation of Somers Cove Marina; requiring the Secretary to develop a master plan for the operation and improvement of services at Somers Cove Marina by October 1, 2027; requiring all revenue received by the Department from activities associated with Somers Cove Marina be deposited in the Natural Resources Property Maintenance Fund; establishing the Somers Cove Marina Advisory Commission; etc.
bill_summary: This bill repeals the Somers Cove Marina Commission and Improvement Fund, and transfers responsibility and funding for the operation, maintenance, and development of Somers Cove Marina to the Department of Natural Resources. It establishes new advisory commissions and updates legal and financial procedures related to the marina.
responsible_party: Department of Natural Resources
stakeholders: Marina users, local residents, Somerset County, boaters, fishermen, tourists
innovative_summary: The bill employs a new governance structure by replacing a commission with a department-managed program, including the creation of advisory committees and updated funding mechanisms.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill does not specifically address child poverty, but by enhancing local economic development and tourism through improved marina operations, it may indirectly benefit community well-being.

Title: Maryland Department of Health - Report on Oversight of Substance Use Disorder Treatment Programs and Recovery Residences
Synopsis: Requiring the Maryland Department of Health to submit reports on or before December 1, 2025, and December 1, 2026, to the Senate Finance Committee, the Senate Budget and Taxation Committee, the House Health and Government Operations Committee, and the House Appropriations Committee on the oversight of substance use disorder treatment programs and recovery residences.
bill_summary: The bill requires the Maryland Department of Health to submit reports in 2025 and 2026 on the oversight and regulation of substance use disorder treatment programs and recovery residences, including improvements in oversight procedures.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Health
stakeholders: Individuals undergoing substance use disorder treatment and residing in recovery residences in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill mainly involves oversight and reporting, with a focus on improving regulatory procedures, rather than implementing new or innovative programs.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has limited direct impact on child poverty, as it focuses on oversight of substance use disorder treatment programs and recovery residences.

Title: Health Occupations - Authorization to Practice for Former Federal Employees and Dental Applicants Licensed or Certified in Another State
Synopsis: Requiring the State Board of Dental Examiners to issue a license or certification to certain applicants licensed or certified by another state within 15 business days after receiving the completed application; requiring the Maryland Department of Health to develop a plan for a temporary or permanent authorization to practice a health occupation in the State for certain individuals who left employment with a federal agency after January 20, 2025; requiring the Department to submit the plan by October 1, 2025 to certain committees; etc.
bill_summary: This bill expedites the licensing process for out-of-state licensed dental professionals, introduces standards for certification of dental radiation technologists, and directs the Maryland Department of Health to develop a plan for a temporary or permanent authorization to practice for certain federal employees leaving employment after January 20, 2025.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Health
stakeholders: Out-of-state licensed dental professionals, dental radiation technologists, federal employees leaving federal employment, Maryland residents seeking dental care
innovative_summary: The bill employs a streamlined licensure process and a cross-state certification recognition for dental professionals, and creates a new pathway for federal employees to practice in Maryland, incorporating new regulatory and coordination approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has moderate potential to impact child poverty by increasing access to dental professionals, which can improve oral health outcomes in children.

Title: Opioid Restitution Fund - Authorized Uses
Synopsis: Altering the allowable uses of the Opioid Restitution Fund to provide funds for the operating expenses and personnel costs for investigations, enforcement actions, and other activities conducted by the Opioids Enforcement Unit within the Office of the Attorney General that are related to the recovery of funds from opioid-related judgments or settlements; and requiring, beginning October 1, 2025, the Office of the Attorney General to report annually to the General Assembly on the status of activity of the Opioids Enforcement Unit.
bill_summary: The bill authorizes the use of the Maryland Opioid Restitution Fund to include funding for operating expenses and personnel costs for investigations and enforcement activities by the Opioids Enforcement Unit within the Office of the Attorney General related to recovering funds from opioid-related judgments and settlements.
responsible_party: Office of the Attorney General of Maryland
stakeholders: Individuals affected by opioid addiction, community organizations, health providers, and law enforcement agencies involved in opioid recovery and enforcement
innovative_summary: The bill expands the use of opioid restitution funds to include operational and enforcement costs, emphasizing dedicated efforts in investigations and legal actions, which is a strategic approach to enhance opioid-related legal enforcement.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has the potential to reduce child poverty indirectly by supporting programs that prevent opioid overdoses and improve treatment access, thereby stabilizing family environments.

Title: Public Health - Use of Opioid Restitution Fund and Training Under the Overdose Response Program
Synopsis: Altering the training that the Maryland Department of Health is authorized to provide under the Overdose Response Program to include emphasis on the restoration of breathing, avoiding withdrawal, and compassionate postoverdose support and care; clarifying that the use of the Opioid Restitution Fund is subject to certain restrictions; and altering the authorized uses of the Opioid Restitution Fund so as to include the addressing of racial disparities in access to prevention, harm reduction, treatment, and recovery support services.
bill_summary: The bill modifies the use of the Opioid Restitution Fund and the scope of training provided under the Overdose Response Program, aiming to enhance overdose response and substance use disorder support programs in Maryland.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Health
stakeholders: Individuals affected by opioid use disorder, healthcare providers, community organizations, and the general public
innovative_summary: The bill emphasizes addressing racial and socio-economic disparities and supports evidence-based and innovative pilot programs to improve overdose prevention and treatment.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The programs aim to improve access to treatment and support services, which can have a positive impact on child poverty by reducing family hardships related to substance use disorders.

Title: Wildlife - Protections and Highway Crossings
Synopsis: Establishing the Maryland Connectivity Coalition to foster collaboration among State and federal agencies, nongovernmental organizations, and other stakeholders for the purpose of protecting endangered wildlife from habitat fragmentation; requiring the State Highway Administration to have final decision-making authority regarding decisions related to placement, funding, or design of wildlife crossings; etc.
bill_summary: This bill establishes the Maryland Connectivity Coalition and a Wildlife Connectivity Fund to promote wildlife habitat connectivity and reduce vehicle-wildlife collisions, including developing wildlife crossings and related projects, and requires agencies to coordinate, report, and educate the public about these initiatives.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Natural Resources and Maryland Department of Transportation (State Highway Administration)
stakeholders: Wildlife, motorists, local governments, environmental organizations, and residents of Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill employs a collaborative approach involving multiple agencies and stakeholders, uses a dedicated fund, and develops public education and data-sharing platforms to advance wildlife connectivity and safety.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill's primary focus is on wildlife conservation and infrastructure, with limited direct impact on child poverty.

Title: Department of Information Technology - Major Information Technology Development Projects - Oversight
Synopsis: Providing that a unit of State government may not purchase, lease, contract for, or rent an information technology service or product unless consistent with the master plan, as determined by the Secretary of Information Technology; providing that the Secretary is responsible for overseeing the implementation of major information technology projects in the State; establishing the Maryland Office of Digital Experience in the Department to provide oversight, leadership, and strategic modernization for major technology projects; etc.
bill_summary: This bill establishes the Maryland Office of Digital Experience to oversee, modernize, and support major information technology projects within the Maryland government. It creates new standards, reporting requirements, and oversight divisions for IT projects, promotes digital service improvements, and sets up a public dashboard for transparency.
responsible_party: Maryland Office of Digital Experience
stakeholders: State government agencies and residents of Maryland who use government digital services
innovative_summary: The bill employs modern digital management practices, including a new Office of Digital Experience, a dedicated oversight division, a public project dashboard, and emphasis on user-centered digital services, representing a comprehensive modernization approach.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has the potential to directly improve digital access and services for residents, including vulnerable populations, which could reduce barriers that contribute to child poverty.

Title: Motor Vehicles - Reckless, Negligent, and Aggressive Driving (Sergeant Patrick Kepp Act)
Synopsis: Altering the penalties and points assessments related to the offenses of reckless, negligent, and aggressive driving; and adding certain motor vehicle offenses as elements that may contribute to charges for reckless or aggressive driving.
bill_summary: The bill updates and alters penalties and points assessments for reckless, negligent, and aggressive driving offenses in Maryland, and adds certain motor vehicle offenses as elements that can contribute to charges of reckless or aggressive driving.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Transportation or related transportation authority
stakeholders: Motor vehicle drivers and other road users in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill primarily modifies existing legal penalties and classifications for driving offenses, without introducing new technologies or novel approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill does not have a direct impact on child poverty.

Title: State Board of Professional Counselors and Therapists - Behavior Analysts - Licensure Applications
Synopsis: Requiring the State Board of Professional Counselors and Therapists to issue a license to practice behavior analysis to qualified applicants within 30 days of receiving the completed application; requiring the State Board to issue a license within 50 days to an applicant who submitted an incomplete application but has presented additional information; and requiring the State Board to provide a certain e-mail notification regarding the status of an application for a license to practice behavior analysis.
bill_summary: This bill requires the Maryland State Board of Professional Counselors and Therapists to issue a license to qualified applicants to practice behavior analysis within specific time frames, and to notify applicants via email about the status of their license applications.
responsible_party: Maryland State Board of Professional Counselors and Therapists
stakeholders: Applicants seeking licensure as behavior analysts in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill introduces an electronic notification system to keep applicants informed about their application status, streamlining communication between the licensing board and applicants.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has limited direct impact on child poverty, primarily improving access to behavior analyst services.

Title: Baltimore County - Alcoholic Beverages Licenses - Transfers
Synopsis: Authorizing the Board of License Commissioners for Baltimore County to approve the transfer of a Class B or Class D license existing on a certain date that is located in an eligible transferor district to another election district under certain circumstances; and limiting the number of license transfers that the Board may approve from an eligible transferor district.
bill_summary: The bill authorizes the Baltimore County Board of License Commissioners to approve the transfer of certain types of liquor licenses (Class B or D) between election districts under specific conditions, limits the total number of such transfers, and sets rules regarding the consideration and impact of these transfers.
responsible_party: Baltimore County Board of License Commissioners
stakeholders: Liquor license holders, local community, Baltimore County economy
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a specific licensing transfer process with economic impact assessments, linking licensing decisions to community and economic development considerations.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program's impact on child poverty is indirect and minimal, mainly affecting local economic conditions.

Title: Washington County - Public Safety - Buildings Used for Agritourism
Synopsis: Adding Washington County to the list of counties that exempt agricultural buildings used for agritourism from certain building performance standards and where an existing agricultural building used for agritourism is not considered a change of occupancy that requires a building permit under certain circumstances.
bill_summary: The bill adds Washington County to the list of Maryland counties where agricultural buildings used for agritourism are exempt from certain building standards and permits. It modifies the rules on occupancy limits and safety requirements for such buildings.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Public Safety (or Department responsible for building regulations)
stakeholders: Farmers, agritourism operators, rural communities in Washington County
innovative_summary: The bill employs a targeted regulatory exemption approach to facilitate agritourism development, with some streamlined safety standards.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has limited direct impact on child poverty.

Title: Washington County - Property Tax Credit - Economic Development Projects
Synopsis: Altering eligibility requirements for a certain property tax credit for certain business entities that invest a certain amount in certain real property in Washington County and create a certain number of new and permanent full-time jobs in the county; and altering the amount and duration of the property tax credit.
bill_summary: This bill alters the eligibility requirements, amount, and duration of a property tax credit for business entities that invest in real property and create jobs in Washington County, Maryland.
responsible_party: Washington County governing body
stakeholders: Business entities investing and creating jobs in Washington County, Maryland
innovative_summary: The program offers a tiered property tax credit based on investments and job creation, encouraging business development and economic growth.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill may indirectly impact child poverty through economic development and job creation but does not explicitly target child poverty programs.

Title: Harford County - Alcoholic Beverages - Hearing Notice
Synopsis: Altering certain notice requirements before the Board of License Commissioners for Harford County may hold public hearings on proposed regulatory changes or license applications; and providing that the Board may publish a decision on certain license applications either in certain newspapers or on its website.
bill_summary: The bill alters notice requirements and publication procedures for hearings and applications related to alcoholic beverage licenses in Harford County, including allowing the board to publish decisions online.
responsible_party: Harford County Board of License Commissioners
stakeholders: Businesses and residents involved in alcohol licensing in Harford County
innovative_summary: The bill introduces the use of online publication and posting for hearings, applications, and decisions, reducing reliance on newspapers.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has little to no direct impact on child poverty.

Title: Common Ownership Communities - Recreational Common Areas - Sensitive Information as Condition for Access
Synopsis: Prohibiting a cooperative housing corporation, condominium association, or homeowners association from requiring certain sensitive information of certain individuals as a condition for access to a recreational common area; and defining "sensitive information" as an individual's Social Security card or Social Security number, Individual Taxpayer Identification Number, birth certificate, racial or ethnic origin, national origin, citizenship or immigration status,  religious or philosophical beliefs, or medical records.
bill_summary: The bill prohibits cooperative housing corporations, condominiums, and homeowners associations from requiring residents, guests, or children to provide sensitive personal information as a condition for accessing recreational common areas such as pools, playgrounds, or lounges.
responsible_party: Maryland State agencies overseeing housing regulations
stakeholders: Residents of cooperative housing, condominiums, and homeowners associations, including children and guests.
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a legal restriction on the collection of sensitive personal information for recreational access, promoting privacy protection.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The direct impact on child poverty is likely minimal as the bill mainly addresses privacy rules in recreational areas.

Title: Professional and Volunteer Firefighter Innovative Cancer Screening Technologies Program - Funding
Synopsis: Altering the amount the Governor is authorized to include in the annual budget for the Program from $500,000 to at least $1,000,000; and authorizing the Secretary to use up to 20% of Program funds to support research centers, including the University of Maryland Institute for Health Computing, in the collection, analysis, and processing of Program outcome data for the purposes of assessing, maximizing, and improving the effectiveness and clinical utility of the cancer screening funded by the Program.
bill_summary: This bill funds the Professional and Volunteer Firefighter Innovative Cancer Screening Technologies Program by transferring oil license fees to the program, allocates funds for research and evaluation, and sets program duration from 2025 to 2030.
responsible_party: Secretary of Health
stakeholders: Firefighters, cancer patients, medical research centers
innovative_summary: The program focuses on innovative cancer screening technologies, utilizing new approaches to firefighter health and medical research.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has limited direct impact on child poverty, as it mainly funds medical research and screening technologies.

Title: Maryland Uniform Disposition of Abandoned Property Act - Revisions
Synopsis: Making certain virtual currency subject to the abandoned property laws in the State; establishing certain provisions to determine certain information about certain apparent owners of abandoned property; altering and establishing certain provisions pertaining to the presumption of abandonment for certain types of property; establishing certain procedures to establish the death of a certain insured or certain annuitant; altering from $100 to $50 the value at which the Comptroller is required to publish a certain notice; etc.
bill_summary: This bill revises Maryland's unclaimed property laws to include virtual currency, establish procedures for determining apparent ownership, and modify reporting, claiming, and reporting deadlines to improve the management and disposition of abandoned property.
responsible_party: Maryland Office of the Comptroller
stakeholders: Residents and businesses with unclaimed property, including virtual currency holders
innovative_summary: The bill employs new legal and procedural approaches to include virtual currencies in unclaimed property laws and enhances ways to locate apparent owners through modern communication and data matching technologies.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has limited direct impact on child poverty but may improve financial resources recovery for affected populations.

Title: Hospitals - Medical Debt Collection - Sale of Patient Debt
Synopsis: Authorizing a hospital, under certain circumstances, to sell the medical debt of patients if the debt is sold to a governmental unit or an entity that is under contract with the unit or a nonprofit organization for the purpose of canceling the debt; requiring that a hospital's financial policy require the hospital to dismiss actions pending against a patient for the collection of debt that was sold and prohibit the hospital from engaging in specified collection activities; etc.
bill_summary: The bill authorizes hospitals to sell certain old medical debt to governmental units, contractors, or nonprofit organizations for the purpose of canceling the debt, and establishes rules for debt collection, reporting, and patient rights.
responsible_party: Maryland Health and Government Operations Commission or the Maryland Department of Health
stakeholders: Patients with medical debt, hospitals, government units, nonprofit organizations, and consumers in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a new process for hospitals to sell certain old medical debts to reduce patient burden and improve transparency and oversight.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has a moderate potential to directly impact child poverty by reducing medical debt in low-income families.

Title: Real Property - Landlord and Tenant - Procedures for Failure to Pay Rent, Breach of Lease, and Tenant Holding Over
Synopsis: Requiring a landlord to provide certain notice to a tenant when a court has issued a warrant of restitution for a failure of a tenant to pay rent, a breach of lease, or a tenant holding over under certain circumstances; establishing certain procedures and requirements for the execution of a warrant for repossession; establishing that the Act does not restrict the authority of the State or a local jurisdiction to enact or enforce certain legislation; applying the Act prospectively; etc.
bill_summary: This bill establishes new procedures and requirements for landlords during eviction processes, including mandatory notices to tenants about scheduled repossession and provisions for tenants to reclaim personal property within a specified period after eviction.
responsible_party: Maryland District Courts and Landlord-Tenant Courts
stakeholders: Tenants facing eviction, landlords, and local community members
innovative_summary: The bill introduces new technology-based notification procedures and emphasizes protecting tenants' personal property rights, which are relatively innovative approaches to eviction protocols.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill potentially reduces the hardship of eviction and property loss, which could have a secondary benefit in alleviating child poverty by preventing homelessness and unstable housing.

Title: Higher Education - Hunger-Free Campus Grant Program - Alterations
Synopsis: Requiring the Maryland Higher Education Commission to designate certain private institutions of higher education as hunger-free campuses; and prohibiting certain private institutions of higher education from being eligible to receive grant funding under the Hunger-Free Campus Grant Program.
bill_summary: The bill establishes the Hunger–Free Campus Grant Program to designate certain Maryland colleges and universities as hunger–free campuses and provide funding to support student food security initiatives, including food pantries and meal-sharing programs.
responsible_party: Maryland Higher Education Commission
stakeholders: Students at Maryland higher education institutions, particularly those facing food insecurity
innovative_summary: The program promotes strategic partnerships, student surveys, and innovative food assistance programs within higher education institutions to combat student hunger.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has a moderate potential to reduce child poverty by addressing food insecurity among college students and supporting their basic needs.

Title: Correctional Services - Death of Incarcerated Individual - Notification
Synopsis: Requiring the Commissioner of Correction to notify certain elected representatives whenever an incarcerated individual dies in a Division of Correction facility; and requiring the Department of Public Safety and Correctional Services to adopt certain regulations compliant with the federal Health Insurance Portability and Accountability Act.
bill_summary: This bill requires the Maryland Department of Correction to notify certain individuals, including legislators and local officials, when an incarcerated person dies and specifies what information must be included. It also mandates the department to adopt regulations for implementing this notification process.
responsible_party: Department of Public Safety and Correctional Services
stakeholders: Incarcerated individuals, their families, correctional staff, legislative officials, local government officials, and the public
innovative_summary: The bill implements a transparency and notification process for deaths in correctional facilities, which improves oversight but does not employ new technologies or approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill is not directly aimed at reducing child poverty but could indirectly impact families of incarcerated individuals.

Title: Maryland Medical Practice Act and Maryland Physician Assistants Act - Revisions
Synopsis: Repealing obsolete and redundant language in, clarifying language in, and making language consistent across certain provisions of law governing the State Board of Physicians and the regulation of physicians, physician assistants, and allied health professionals; altering certain licensure requirements; altering the grounds for discipline for physicians, physician assistants, and allied health professionals; authorizing the Board to impose a civil penalty for a certain report made in bad faith; etc.
bill_summary: The bill updates and clarifies regulations and procedures governing physicians, physician assistants, and allied health professionals in Maryland, including licensing, disciplinary processes, reporting requirements, and programs for impairment and license reinstatement.
responsible_party: Maryland State Board of Physicians
stakeholders: Physicians, physician assistants, allied health professionals, and the public in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill mainly modifies existing regulations and procedures; it does not establish new distinct services or initiatives, and thus employs standard regulatory approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill's focus on licensing and regulation has indirect effects, and it does not specifically target child poverty.

Title: Study on Detecting Deadly Weapons in Public Middle and High Schools
Synopsis: Requiring the Maryland Center for School Safety to study how best to detect deadly weapons in public middle and high schools and how best to rapidly report the detection of weapons to a law enforcement agency; requiring the Center to request any available assessment technologies evaluated under the Act; and requiring the Center to issue an interim report by December 1, 2025, and a final report on the findings of the study, in a manner that does not jeopardize school safety, by December 1, 2026, to
bill_summary: This bill requires the Maryland Center for School Safety to study methods for detecting deadly weapons in public middle and high schools and to evaluate security infrastructure and new technologies such as AI, cameras, and metal detectors. The study aims to improve detection and reporting of weapons to law enforcement.
responsible_party: Maryland Center for School Safety
stakeholders: Public middle and high school students, school staff, law enforcement agencies, and the wider community
innovative_summary: The bill promotes the evaluation and potential integration of advanced security technologies such as AI and strategic deployment of metal detectors and cameras, representing innovative approaches to school security.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program may have some indirect impact on child safety and well-being but is primarily focused on security technology evaluation.

Title: Health Occupations - Implicit Bias and Structural Racism Training
Synopsis: Requiring applicants for renewal of certain licenses and certain certificates issued by certain health occupation boards to attest that the applicant completed an implicit bias and structural racism training program, rather than an implicit bias training program, approved by the Cultural and Linguistic Health Care Professional Competency Program; authorizing certain health occupations boards to adopt regulations allowing applicants renewing licenses to receive continuing education credits for completing certain training; etc.
bill_summary: The bill requires health occupation license renewal applicants in Maryland to complete implicit bias and structural racism training programs, which must be approved by the state's Cultural and Linguistic Health Care Professional Competency Program. It establishes the program, updates training program approval, and sets a timeline for implementation.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Health or relevant health occupations boards
stakeholders: Health care professionals and patients, especially those from diverse cultural backgrounds and marginalized racial groups
innovative_summary: The bill emphasizes the integration of structural racism training into health care professional licensing, adopting a comprehensive approach that combines implicit bias and structural racism education, potentially employing new methods and collaboration.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has high potential to impact child poverty by addressing structural inequalities in healthcare that affect health outcomes for children from marginalized communities.

Title: Baltimore City - Alcoholic Beverages Licenses - Alterations
Synopsis: Authorizing the Board of License Commissioners for Baltimore City to provide a certain waiver from certain requirements for a restaurant within a certain bounded area in the 46th alcoholic beverages district; expanding the class of license to which a certain requirement for a memorandum of understanding applies to include any alcoholic beverages license in Baltimore City; providing an exception to a certain prohibition against the Board allowing a certain license transfer under certain circumstances; etc.
bill_summary: The bill modifies alcoholic beverage licensing regulations in Baltimore City, including granting waivers, expanding license categories, setting requirements for community understandings, extending expiration dates for certain licenses, and establishing temporary provisions for transfers and conversions, with detailed provisions on license unexpiration dates and transfer limitations.
responsible_party: Baltimore City Board of License Commissioners
stakeholders: Alcoholic beverage licensees, Baltimore City residents, community associations, and prospective licensees within Baltimore City
innovative_summary: The bill employs temporary extensions and flexible licensing provisions, along with community agreements, to adapt to changing circumstances in Baltimore City's alcohol licensing process; its approach is fairly traditional with some adaptive features.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill's impact on child poverty is likely minimal, as it primarily focuses on licensing regulations for alcoholic beverages in Baltimore City.

Title: Common Ownership Communities and Zoning Authorities - Operation of Family Child Care Homes - Limitations
Synopsis: Prohibiting a provision in certain documents of certain cooperative housing corporations from prohibiting or restricting the establishment or operation of certain family child care homes; prohibiting a provision in certain documents of certain cooperative housing corporations from limiting the number of children for which certain family child care homes provide family child care below the number authorized by the State Department of Education; etc.
bill_summary: This bill prohibits certain restrictions or prohibitions on the establishment, operation, and capacity of family child care homes in common ownership communities, condominiums, homeowners associations, and cooperative housing in Maryland. It ensures that local and community documents cannot limit the number of children or restrict family child care homes below limits set by the state.
responsible_party: Maryland State Department of Education and local jurisdiction agencies
stakeholders: Families, children, and family child care providers in Maryland communities
innovative_summary: The bill introduces legal safeguards for family child care providers against restrictions in housing community governing documents, promoting access to child care services.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has potential to reduce child poverty by increasing access to affordable family child care in communities.

Title: Appellate Court of Maryland - Sessions at Educational Institutions
Synopsis: Authorizing the Appellate Court of Maryland, in conjunction with the administrations of secondary and postsecondary educational institutions in the State, to hold sessions at certain secondary and postsecondary educational institutions in the State.
bill_summary: This bill authorizes the Appellate Court of Maryland to hold sessions at educational institutions in the state, including secondary and postsecondary schools, under certain circumstances.
responsible_party: Appellate Court of Maryland
stakeholders: Students, educators, legal professionals, and the general public in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a new approach by allowing the appellate court to hold sessions at educational institutions, potentially increasing accessibility and educational engagement.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill does not directly impact child poverty but may indirectly benefit educational engagement for youth.

Title: Courts - State Reporter - Publication of Cases
Synopsis: Repealing a requirement that the State Reporter secure copyright for the State of published reports of opinions of the Supreme Court of Maryland and the Appellate Court of Maryland.
bill_summary: The bill repeals the requirement that the Maryland State Reporter secure copyright for published reports of opinions from the Supreme Court and Appellate Court of Maryland, and makes related amendments to the publication process.
responsible_party: Supreme Court of Maryland
stakeholders: Legal professionals, courts, and the public interested in Maryland case law
innovative_summary: The bill simplifies the publication process for Maryland court opinions by removing copyright requirements, potentially streamlining access and distribution.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill does not directly address child poverty or have a measurable impact on it.

Title: Judiciary Department - Commission on Judicial Disabilities - Temporary Appointment
Synopsis: Allowing the chair of the Commission on Judicial Disabilities to appoint a former member to temporarily fill a certain vacancy on the Commission; allowing the Governor, upon certain request of the chair, to appoint a temporary substitute member or extend the term of an existing member of the Commission; and requiring that any temporary substitute is subject to the same qualifications applicable to the member the substitute is replacing and if the member is a judge or an attorney, must be a member in good standing of the Maryland bar.
bill_summary: This bill amends the Maryland Constitution to allow the chair of the Commission on Judicial Disabilities to appoint a former member or a temporary substitute to fill vacancies, and permits the Governor to appoint or extend the terms of temporary members of the Commission. It updates procedures related to the composition, appointments, and disciplinary authority of the Commission on Judicial Disabilities.
responsible_party: Maryland Judiciary, Commission on Judicial Disabilities
stakeholders: Judges, judicial candidates, and the public in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill introduces provisions for temporary appointments and substitutes to the Commission on Judicial Disabilities, and updates procedures which constitute a new approach to judicial disciplinary processes.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill does not have a direct or immediate impact on child poverty, as it primarily focuses on judicial administrative procedures.

Title: Property Tax - Payment Plans - Notice to Taxpayers
Synopsis: Requiring the State Tax Sale Ombudsman to include certain information concerning a certain State installment payment program for property taxes on the Ombudsman's website; requiring the Ombudsman to contract with a vendor to operate an installment payment program for payment of taxes in which any homeowner may enroll; requiring a collector of taxes to include certain information concerning a certain State or local installment payment program for property taxes in a separate insert included with each property tax bill; etc.
bill_summary: This bill requires the Maryland State Tax Sale Ombudsman and tax collectors to provide specific information about installment payment programs for property taxes on their websites, in property tax bills, and notices sent to property owners in tax sale. It also establishes an installment payment program for overdue property taxes that homeowners can enroll in to pay taxes in installments, and sets rules for notices and public information to help homeowners retain their homes.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Assessments and Taxation (or equivalent agency responsible for property tax collection and the Ombudsman)
stakeholders: Property owners, especially homeowners with overdue taxes or limited income
innovative_summary: The bill employs a comprehensive approach combining informational outreach with an installment payment program for overdue property taxes, which includes public notices, website development, and legal processes to assist homeowners.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has potential to improve financial stability for low-income homeowners and thus could reduce child poverty indirectly.

Title: Somerset County - Property Tax - Emergency Services Tax
Synopsis: Authorizing the County Commissioners of Somerset County to impose an emergency services tax on all property subject to the county property tax to pay costs of emergency services; and prohibiting the county commissioners from initially imposing or subsequently increasing an emergency services tax until after a public hearing is held.
bill_summary: The bill authorizes Somerset County to impose an annual emergency services property tax to fund fire, rescue, and emergency medical services, with rules for public hearings and enforcement.
responsible_party: Somerset County Commissioners
stakeholders: Property owners and residents of Somerset County relying on emergency services
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a local emergency services property tax with public hearing requirements, but does not employ new technologies or novel approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program is unlikely to have a direct impact on child poverty as it primarily concerns funding emergency services.

Title: University System of Maryland - Academic Facilities Bonding Authority
Synopsis: Approving certain projects for the acquisition, development, and improvement of certain academic facilities for the University System of Maryland; authorizing the issuance of bonds by the University System of Maryland in a total principal amount of $25,000,000 for financing the projects; and providing that the bonds issued under the authority of the Act are not a debt or obligation of the State or any of its subdivisions.
bill_summary: This bill approves funding for the University System of Maryland to finance projects related to academic facilities, including new construction and renewal of existing facilities, through bond issuance of a total of $30 million.
responsible_party: University System of Maryland
stakeholders: Students, faculty, and university staff of the University System of Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill employs traditional bond financing mechanisms for educational infrastructure development; it does not introduce new technologies or approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has limited direct impact on child poverty, mainly supporting higher education infrastructure.

Title: Federal Public Service Loan Forgiveness Program - Employee Certification and Awareness Materials
Synopsis: Establishing requirements related to the certification of employment by public service employers under the federal Public Service Loan Forgiveness Program, including requirements regarding determinations of whether employees are full-time; and requiring the Student Loan Ombudsman in the Office of the Commissioner of Financial Regulation to develop and disseminate information to increase awareness of and participation in the Program.
bill_summary: This bill establishes procedures for certifying employment for public service employees under the federal Public Service Loan Forgiveness Program, including requirements for determining full-time status, developing awareness materials, and increasing participation.
