responsible_party: Office of the Commissioner of Financial Regulation and the Maryland Department of Labor, Licensing, and Regulation
stakeholders: Public service employees in Maryland, including those working for government and nonprofit organizations
innovative_summary: The bill employs improved collaboration and information dissemination strategies, including mandated awareness materials and standardized certification procedures, to enhance participation in the federal program.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has potential to reduce child poverty by facilitating loan forgiveness for public service workers, benefiting households with dependent children.

Title: Real Property – Filing Fee for Residential Mortgage Foreclosure – Increase
Synopsis: Increasing the filing fee required to accompany an order to docket or a complaint to foreclose a mortgage or deed of trust on residential property from $300 to $450.
bill_summary: This bill increases the filing fee for residential mortgage foreclosure cases from $300 to $450, effective October 1, 2025.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Financial Regulation or relevant state court authority
stakeholders: Homeowners facing mortgage foreclosure, mortgage lenders, and legal entities involved in foreclosure proceedings
innovative_summary: The bill does not employ new technologies or approaches; it primarily modifies existing legal fee structures.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill does not directly impact child poverty, as it primarily concerns legal procedural fees.

Title: Opioid Restitution Fund - Interactive Dashboard
Synopsis: Requiring the Maryland Office of Overdose Response, in collaboration with the Maryland Department of Health, to develop and maintain an interactive dashboard on Opioid Restitution Fund spending to share prescription opioid-related settlement information with the public; requiring the dashboard to include links to the State, county, or municipal websites that provide access to additional information on the use of opioid-related settlement funds; etc.
bill_summary: The bill requires the Maryland Office of Overdose Response, in collaboration with the Maryland Department of Health, to create and maintain an interactive online dashboard that displays information on the use of funds from opioid-related settlements. This includes settlement payments, past and planned spending, and funded initiatives, with links to additional resources from local government websites.
responsible_party: Maryland Office of Overdose Response and Maryland Department of Health
stakeholders: Residents of Maryland, particularly those affected by the opioid crisis, including policymakers, healthcare providers, and community organizations.
innovative_summary: The program employs an interactive online dashboard to transparently share opioid settlement spending information with the public, leveraging digital technology for government transparency and data sharing.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program could potentially reduce child poverty by improving transparency and accountability in opioid settlement spending, which may lead to better allocation of resources towards community health and social services that benefit children.

Title: Economic Development - Maryland Innovation Initiative Institution Partnership Extension Program - Establishment
Synopsis: Establishing the Maryland Innovation Initiative Institution Partnership Extension Program to expand opportunities for technology validation, entrepreneurial development, and industry engagement at eligible institutions; establishing eligibility criteria for project proposals to receive funding under the Program; authorizing the Governor to include an appropriation of $250,000 in the annual budget bill for fiscal years 2027 and 2028 for the Program; and altering the purpose and contents of the Maryland Innovation Initiative Fund.
bill_summary: The bill establishes the Maryland Innovation Initiative Partnership Extension Program, which involves public and private nonprofit higher education institutions to support technology development, entrepreneurship, and industry collaboration with funding and contributions. It aims to promote economic impact through innovation and partnership.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Economic Development (implied, as the initiative is under the Department of Economic Development)
stakeholders: Higher education institutions, industry partners, and regional economic communities in Maryland
innovative_summary: The program employs active collaboration between universities and industry, with funding and project proposals that support commercialization, entrepreneurship, and economic impact, demonstrating a strategic approach to innovation policy.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has potential to create jobs and economic growth, which may benefit child poverty indirectly, but its primary focus is on technology and industry collaboration.

Title: Columbia Association - Lease Requirements and Governing Documents Ho. Co. 14-25
Synopsis: Requiring a written lease for certain residential or commercial real property in Howard County to include information on the annual charge assessed by the Columbia Association and a description of certain rights and privileges under certain circumstances; requiring a landlord to provide a tenant with a copy of certain covenants and governing documents under certain circumstances; etc.
bill_summary: The bill requires that leases for certain residential or commercial properties in Howard County that are subject to Columbia Association covenants must include details about the annual charge assessed by the Columbia Association, and requires landlords to provide tenants with copies of covenants and governing documents.
responsible_party: Howard County Department of Housing and Community Development or equivalent local agency
stakeholders: Tenants and landlords of residential and commercial properties in Howard County subject to Columbia Association covenants
innovative_summary: The bill enhances transparency by requiring landlords to clearly include specific financial and rights information in leases and to provide copies of covenants and governing documents, employing a regulatory approach to improve tenant knowledge.
child_poverty_direct_summary: This bill has limited direct impact on child poverty, focusing mainly on lease transparency and tenant rights.

Title: Out-of-Home Placement Providers - Individuals Enrolled in Higher Education and Vocational Training Programs
Synopsis: Authorizing an individual enrolled in an accredited institution of higher education or a residential vocational training program to return to an out-of-home placement provider with whom the individual was previously placed under certain circumstances; requiring an individual to make a request to a local department of social services at least 30 days before the scheduled break; requiring the local department to make a recommendation to the Department of Human Services not later than 21 days before the scheduled break; etc.
bill_summary: The bill allows individuals enrolled in higher education or vocational training programs to return to previously assigned out-of-home placement providers under certain conditions, and establishes regulations for the maximum number of children assigned to such providers, with exemptions for students in higher education.
responsible_party: Department of Human Services
stakeholders: Children in foster care and students in higher education or vocational training programs
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a targeted policy to facilitate stability for youth in foster care pursuing higher education by allowing return to prior placements, incorporating coordination between education schedules and child welfare services.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program could directly impact child poverty by improving stability and access to education for youth in foster care, which can lead to better educational and economic outcomes.

Title: Maryland Insurance Administration and Maryland Department of Health - Workgroup to Study Pharmacy Benefits Managers
Synopsis: Requiring the Maryland Insurance Administration and the Maryland Department of Health, in consultation with the Prescription Drug Affordability Board, to convene a workgroup to study and review reimbursement for pharmacists; and requiring the workgroup to submit an interim report by December 31, 2025, and a final report on their findings and recommendations to certain committees of the General Assembly by December 31, 2026.
bill_summary: This bill mandates the Maryland Insurance Administration and the Maryland Department of Health to form a workgroup to study pharmacy benefits managers, review reimbursement rates, coverage of specialty drugs, legal exemptions, and related issues, and report findings and recommendations to legislators. It aims to improve transparency, fairness, and efficiency in pharmacy benefits management and reimbursement.
responsible_party: Maryland Insurance Administration and Maryland Department of Health
stakeholders: Pharmacies, pharmacists, managed care organizations, drug manufacturers, insurance carriers, and Medicaid recipients in Maryland.
innovative_summary: The program employs a comprehensive, multi-stakeholder review process and aims to develop new strategies for pharmacy reimbursement and drug pricing transparency, including analyzing legal and interstate comparisons.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has the potential to improve access to affordable medications, which could help reduce child poverty impacts related to health and financial burdens.

Title: Department of Juvenile Services - Report on Youth Service Bureaus
Synopsis: Requiring the Department of Juvenile Services to submit an annual report to certain committees of the General Assembly by October 1 detailing efforts by the Department to promote predelinquent programs, including youth service bureaus, efforts by the Department to collaborate with and provide technical assistance to local governments regarding the establishment of youth service bureaus, and an assessment of the programs and activities of the bureaus and any other efforts to prevent youth offenses.
bill_summary: The bill requires the Department of Juvenile Services in Maryland to submit an annual report on youth service bureaus and related efforts to prevent youth offenses, starting from October 1, 2025.
responsible_party: Department of Juvenile Services
stakeholders: Youth, local governments, and the Department of Juvenile Services in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill mainly focuses on reporting and oversight of existing youth services and prevention programs rather than establishing a new service or using new technologies.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill's focus on youth prevention programs and youth service bureaus has the potential to contribute to reducing child poverty by addressing youth offenses and providing support systems.

Title: Procurement - Employee Stock Ownership Plan Preference - Pilot
Synopsis: Authorizing the Maryland Stadium Authority, Morgan State University, St. Mary's College of Maryland, and Baltimore City Community College to establish a certain preference program for certain procurements; authorizing the establishment of a certain evaluation factor for certain proposals by an entity that utilizes certain employee stock ownership plans; requiring contractors to provide certain information to a unit regarding the use of an employee stock ownership plan; etc.
bill_summary: The bill establishes a pilot program in Maryland that provides procurement preferences for entities that utilize Employee Stock Ownership Plans (ESOPs). It authorizes certain Maryland state institutions to establish evaluation factors that favor ESOP-utilizing bidders and requires contractors to provide documentation of their ESOP status.
responsible_party: Maryland State government agencies including the Maryland Stadium Authority, University System of Maryland, Morgan State University, St. Mary’s College of Maryland, and Baltimore City Community College.
stakeholders: Employees and organizations involved in or utilizing Employee Stock Ownership Plans within Maryland state procurement processes.
innovative_summary: This program introduces a new approach by explicitly incorporating employee ownership plans into state procurement evaluation criteria, leveraging financial and organizational strategies to promote employee ownership.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has potential to reduce child poverty indirectly by promoting employee ownership and economic participation, though its direct impact on child poverty is moderate.

Title: Health Insurance - Utilization Review - Use of Artificial Intelligence
Synopsis: Requiring that certain carriers, pharmacy benefits managers, and private review agents ensure that artificial intelligence, algorithm, or other software tools are used in a certain manner when used for conducting utilization review.
bill_summary: This bill requires health insurance carriers, pharmacy benefits managers, and private review agents in Maryland to ensure that when they use artificial intelligence or similar software tools for conducting utilization review, they do so in a manner that is fair, transparent, and based on accurate clinical information. It also mandates reporting on the use of AI in decision-making processes and sets standards for the use of AI in healthcare benefit determinations.
responsible_party: Maryland Insurance Commissioner and health insurance entities including carriers, pharmacy benefits managers, and private review agents
stakeholders: Health insurance providers, enrollees, healthcare providers, and the general public in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill introduces regulations on the use of artificial intelligence in health insurance utilization review, emphasizing transparency, fairness, and ethical use of AI, which is a relatively new approach in health policy.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill's focus is primarily on fair and ethical use of AI in insurance decisions and does not directly target child poverty, but ensuring fair access to healthcare benefits could have an indirect positive impact.

Title: Maryland Small Business Retirement Savings Board - Membership - Alteration
Synopsis: Adding the Comptroller, or the Comptroller's designee, as a member to the Maryland Small Business Retirement Savings Board.
bill_summary: This bill adds the Comptroller or their designee as a member of the Maryland Small Business Retirement Savings Board, updating the board's membership composition.
responsible_party: Maryland Small Business Retirement Savings Board
stakeholders: Small business owners and employees in Maryland who are affected by the retirement savings policies and board actions.
innovative_summary: The bill primarily involves a modification to the membership structure of an existing government board, which is a standard governance update with no new technology or innovative approach.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill does not directly target child poverty but may indirectly support economic stability for families through improved retirement policy oversight.

Title: Office of Small, Minority, and Women Business Affairs - Repeal of Interdepartmental Advisory Committee and Establishment of the Governor's Subcabinet on Socioeconomic Procurement Participation
Synopsis: Repealing the Interdepartmental Advisory Committee on Small, Minority, and Women Business Affairs within the Office of Small, Minority, and Women Business Affairs; establishing the Governor's Subcabinet on Socioeconomic Procurement Participation to study and make recommendations on socioeconomic procurement in the State; requiring the Subcabinet to conduct certain meetings and report annually to the Governor on the Subcabinet's activities, progress, and recommendations.
bill_summary: The bill repeals the Interdepartmental Advisory Committee on Small, Minority, and Women Business Affairs and establishes the Governor’s Subcabinet on Socioeconomic Procurement Participation to study and improve socioeconomic procurement policies in Maryland.
responsible_party: Governor’s Office of Small, Minority, and Women Business Affairs and related state agencies
stakeholders: Small, minority, women, veteran, and other socioeconomic disadvantaged business communities in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill creates a cross-agency subcabinet to analyze and recommend improvements in socioeconomic procurement, including studying practices in other states and proposing reforms.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has potential to directly impact child poverty by promoting equitable economic opportunities for disadvantaged groups.

Title: Carroll County - Prospective Employees and Volunteers - Criminal History Records Check
Synopsis: Repealing certain limitations on the prospective employees or volunteers of Carroll County for whom the Department of Human Resources of Carroll County may request a criminal history records check.
bill_summary: The bill repeals certain restrictions on the types of positions for which Carroll County's Department of Human Resources can request criminal history records checks for prospective employees or volunteers.
responsible_party: Carroll County Department of Human Resources
stakeholders: Prospective employees and volunteers of Carroll County
innovative_summary: The bill expands existing measures by removing limitations on criminal history checks, making the screening process more comprehensive.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill does not have a direct impact on child poverty.

Title: Carroll County - Public Facilities Bond
Synopsis: Authorizing and empowering the County Commissioners of Carroll County to borrow not more than $36,900,000 in order to finance the construction, improvement, or development of certain public facilities in Carroll County and to effect such borrowing by the issuance and sale at public or private sale of its general obligation bonds; etc.
bill_summary: The bill authorizes Carroll County to issue up to $36.9 million in bonds to finance public facilities projects, including water and sewer infrastructure, fire department equipment and buildings, and land easements for land preservation. It also allows the county to make loans to volunteer fire departments and to issue refunding bonds.
responsible_party: Carroll County Commissioners
stakeholders: Public facilities in Carroll County, volunteer fire departments, residents benefiting from improved infrastructure and services
innovative_summary: The bill employs traditional bond issuance and financing mechanisms for public projects and land easements, which are common approaches used by counties.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program can have an indirect impact on child poverty through improved public facilities and services, but it is not directly targeted at child poverty.

Title: Charles County - Alcoholic Beverages - Baseball Stadium License - Alterations
Synopsis: Altering the areas in which beer, wine, and liquor may be sold and consumed under a Class B-Stadium (baseball stadium) beer, wine, and liquor license in Charles County to exclude any parking areas; and altering the types of containers in which beer, wine, and liquor may be served.
bill_summary: The bill amends the laws in Charles County regarding the sale and consumption of alcoholic beverages at a baseball stadium, including changes to where and how beverages can be served, and in what containers.
responsible_party: Charles County Board of License Commissioners
stakeholders: Baseball stadium attendees and operators in Charles County
innovative_summary: The bill mainly makes administrative and regulatory changes to existing liquor licensing rules in a specific location, without introducing new technologies or approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill does not directly impact child poverty, as it pertains solely to alcohol licensing and sale regulations at a specific baseball stadium.

Title: Health Occupations - Licensed Direct-Entry Midwives - Revisions
Synopsis: Altering the scope of practice of licensed direct-entry midwives; providing that the practice of direct-entry midwifery is independent and not does not require oversight by another health care practitioner; repealing the requirement that licensed direct-entry midwives report certain information to the Direct-Entry Midwifery Advisory Committee; altering the disciplinary actions that may be taken against a licensed direct-entry midwife or an applicant for a license; etc.
bill_summary: The bill revises the scope of practice for licensed direct–entry midwives in Maryland, makes their practice independent without needing oversight by other healthcare practitioners, and updates reporting, disciplinary, and transfer procedures related to midwifery care.
responsible_party: Maryland State Board of Nursing
stakeholders: Pregnant individuals, newborns, and healthcare providers involved in midwifery care in Maryland.
innovative_summary: The bill modernizes and expands the scope and independence of direct-entry midwifery, including developing specific emergency transfer and care plans, and streamlines reporting and disciplinary processes, representing an innovative approach to integrating midwifery into healthcare systems.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has high potential to reduce child poverty by improving prenatal and postpartum care, increasing access to community-based birthing options, and supporting healthy start for families.

Title: Election Law - Provisional Ballots - Nonpartisan Board of Education Contests
Synopsis: Providing that a voter is qualified to vote a provisional ballot if the provisional ballot was cast because the voter claimed a different political party affiliation from the political party affiliation on record for the voter and the voter made a selection in a nonpartisan board of education contest; and requiring a local board of canvassers to count only the votes cast in a nonpartisan board of education contest for those provisional ballots.
bill_summary: This bill allows voters who claim a different political party affiliation from their record and vote in a nonpartisan Board of Education contest to have their provisional ballot counted for that nonpartisan race.
responsible_party: Maryland State Board of Elections
stakeholders: Voters participating in elections with nonpartisan Board of Education contests and those claiming party affiliation discrepancies
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a new approach to counting provisional ballots for nonpartisan races based on specific voter claims, employing targeted rules to ensure ballot validity.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill does not directly focus on child poverty but improves voting procedures which may indirectly support better community and school representation.

Title: Public Senior Higher Education Institutions - Pregnant and Parenting Students - Plan Requirements (Pregnant and Parenting Student Support Act)
Synopsis: Requiring certain public senior higher education institutions to adopt a plan regarding pregnant and parenting students to include referral to on-campus or off-campus services to assist regarding the availability of or eligibility for certain government assistance programs and any other programs, scholarships, or subsidies that may be available for pregnant and parenting students; and requiring each public senior higher education institution to post the plan on the institution's website on or before August 1, 2026.
bill_summary: The bill requires Maryland's public senior higher education institutions to create and publicly post a plan to support pregnant and parenting students, including providing information on government assistance, accommodations, and health services.
responsible_party: Public senior higher education institutions in Maryland
stakeholders: Pregnant and parenting students at Maryland public higher education institutions
innovative_summary: The bill employs a comprehensive approach by formalizing support plans, including referrals, accommodations, and resource networks, which is an innovative way to support student populations.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has moderate potential to impact child poverty by supporting students with children to complete their higher education.

Title: Gaming - Charles County Gaming Permit Review Board - Repeal
Synopsis: Repealing the Charles County Gaming Permit Review Board; and transferring certain powers and duties concerning gaming activities in Charles County from the board to the County Attorney for Charles County.
bill_summary: The bill repeals the Charles County Gaming Permit Review Board and transfers its powers and duties to the County Attorney for Charles County, primarily relating to the regulation and oversight of gaming permits and activities.
responsible_party: Charles County Office of the County Attorney
stakeholders: Fundraising organizations, gaming permit applicants, residents of Charles County
innovative_summary: This bill primarily restructures existing gaming permit oversight by consolidating authority under the County Attorney, rather than creating new programs or utilizing innovative technology.
child_poverty_direct_summary: Limited potential for direct impact on child poverty as it mainly involves administrative restructuring of gaming regulation.

Title: Somerset County - Salaries of Local Officials - Increase
Synopsis: Increasing the salaries of the Sheriff of Somerset County, the County Commissioners of Somerset County, the President of the County Commissioners of Somerset County, a member of the County Roads Board of Somerset County, and the President of the County Roads Board of Somerset County.
bill_summary: This bill increases the salaries of several local officials in Somerset County, including the Sheriff, County Commissioners, and members of the County Roads Board.
responsible_party: Somerset County government
stakeholders: Residents and officials of Somerset County
innovative_summary: The bill is a straightforward adjustment of salaries with no new technologies or approaches involved.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill's impact on child poverty is likely minimal as it focuses on salary increases for local officials.

Title: Health Insurance - Adverse Decisions - Notices, Reporting, and Examinations
Synopsis: Requiring that certain adverse decision and grievance decision notices include certain information in a certain manner; requiring that the information regarding criteria and standards for utilization review that a private review agent is required to post on its website or the carrier's website be posted on the member's and provider's pages of the websites; requiring that certain information submitted to the Maryland Insurance Commissioner be aggregated by zip code; etc.
bill_summary: The bill enhances transparency and accountability in health insurance adverse decision and grievance notices by specifying the details that must be included in the notices, such as factual bases, criteria references, contact information, and rights to file complaints. It also requires carriers to post utilization review criteria on their websites, aggregate adverse decision data by zip code, and report significant increases in adverse decisions to the Maryland Insurance Commissioner. Additionally, it mandates the establishment of dedicated telephone and email contacts for adverse decision and grievance communications and provides the timeframe and process for submitting reports and information to the Commissioner.
responsible_party: Maryland Insurance Commissioner
stakeholders: Health insurance members, providers, and carriers in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill employs a comprehensive approach to improve transparency and data reporting in health insurance decisions, including website posting, detailed notices, and aggregation of decision data, which enhances accountability and enables data-driven oversight.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill potentially reduces financial and administrative barriers to accessing necessary health care, which can contribute to alleviating child poverty.

Title: Workgroup on the Creation of a Data Dashboard for Public Work Contracts and Apprentices - Establishment
Synopsis: Establishing the Workgroup on the Creation of a Data Dashboard for Public Work Contracts and Apprentices to study the most efficient and cost-effective method to create a publicly available data dashboard that disaggregates information regarding public work contracts with the State and apprentices working under the public work contracts; and requiring the Workgroup to report its findings and recommendations to the Governor and the General Assembly by January 7, 2027.
bill_summary: This bill establishes a Workgroup to study the creation of a publicly available data dashboard for public work contracts and apprenticeships in Maryland, detailing contractor and employee information, wages, and apprenticeship data.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Labor
stakeholders: Public work contractors, employees, apprentices, and the general public interested in transparency of public contracts
innovative_summary: The program employs a data dashboard to increase transparency and community engagement through the use of a centralized, publicly accessible digital platform.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has a high potential to impact child poverty by promoting fair wages, employment, and access to skilled apprenticeships that can lead to economic stability.

Title: Postconviction Review - Procedure to Reduce Duration of Sentence (Maryland Second Look Act)
Synopsis: Authorizing a certain individual to file a motion to reduce the duration of a certain sentence if the individual was convicted between the ages of at least 18 and under 25, was not sentenced to life, is not a sex offender, has served at least 20 years of the term of confinement, and was not convicted of murder involving a victim who was a first responder who was killed in the line of duty; applying procedures for a proceeding under the Act; etc.
bill_summary: This bill authorizes individuals serving long-term sentences in Maryland to petition courts for a reduction in their sentence under certain conditions, including after serving at least 20 years, and specifies procedures for hearings, consideration of factors, and limitations on the number of times a petition can be filed.
responsible_party: Maryland courts and judicial system
stakeholders: Individuals incarcerated in Maryland, victims, and communities impacted by crime and justice reforms
innovative_summary: The bill employs a legal approach to post-conviction review by enabling long-serving inmates to petition for sentence reductions, with structured hearings considering multiple factors including age, rehabilitation, and victim impact.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program may have an indirect impact on child poverty by potentially reducing prison populations and promoting more equitable justice practices, but it does not directly target child poverty.

Title: Workgroup on Establishing a Science and Technology Best Practices and Innovation Network - Alterations
Synopsis: Altering the membership of the Workgroup on Establishing a Science and Technology Best Practices and Innovation Network; and extending the workgroup to June 30, 2027.
bill_summary: This bill establishes a Workgroup on Establishing a Science and Technology Best Practices and Innovation Network, to analyze options for creating a digital platform or hub for collaboration, expertise sharing, and promoting best practices in science and technology. The workgroup will report its findings by December 1, 2026.
responsible_party: University of Maryland, Baltimore County
stakeholders: Scientists, researchers, citizens, educational institutions, industry experts, and nonprofit organizations involved in science and technology.
innovative_summary: The bill promotes creating an open access, digital network for collaboration and data sharing among scientists, industry experts, and the public, leveraging technology to advance scientific innovation and community engagement.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program could indirectly benefit children by fostering scientific and technological advancements, but its direct focus on child poverty is limited.

Title: Natural Resources - Pursuing Wounded Deer After Legal Hunting Hours and Using a Light - Authorization
Synopsis: Authorizing a person who is authorized by the Department of Natural Resources to hunt deer and who wounds a deer during legal hunting hours to pursue and kill the deer after legal hunting hours using the means authorized for the applicable hunting season or permit which may include use of a light or throw or cast the rays of a spotlight, a headlight, an artificial light, a battery, or any other device while pursuing the wounded deer.
bill_summary: The bill authorizes individuals in Maryland who are permitted to hunt deer to pursue and kill a wounded deer after legal hunting hours, provided certain restrictions are met, including the use of lights or other devices to locate the deer.
responsible_party: Department of Natural Resources
stakeholders: Deer hunters and wildlife management authorities in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill allows the use of lighting devices such as spotlights and headlights during deer pursuit after legal hunting hours, which is an innovative approach to hunting regulation.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has minimal direct impact on child poverty as it relates primarily to hunting regulations.

Title: Access to Health Insurance for Child Care Professionals - Outreach
Synopsis: Requiring the Maryland Health Benefit Exchange to promote access to health insurance for child care professionals; and requiring the Exchange to conduct a survey, in consultation with the State Department of Education and relevant nonprofit organizations, to assess current levels of health care access across the child care community.
bill_summary: The bill promotes access to health insurance for child care professionals in Maryland by requiring the Department of Education, in collaboration with the Maryland Health Benefit Exchange, to conduct outreach, provide assistance, and assess healthcare access within the child care community. It also establishes a program allowing certain nonprofit organizations and satellite entities to participate in the State Employee and Retiree Health and Welfare Benefits Program.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Education in collaboration with the Maryland Health Benefit Exchange
stakeholders: Child care professionals and their employers in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill employs a comprehensive approach that combines outreach, partnership, and assessment strategies to increase health insurance access, including the use of surveys and collaboration with nonprofit groups and provider hubs.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has high potential to reduce child poverty by improving health coverage for child care providers, thus supporting their stability and ability to care for children.

Title: Public Nuisance - Common Carriers - Damage to Public Infrastructure
Synopsis: Prohibiting certain common carriers from damaging certain public infrastructure necessitating the closure of the infrastructure; establishing that a violation of the Act is a public nuisance; authorizing the State or a local government to bring a civil action against a common carrier for a violation under the Act; and providing that a common carrier that commits a violation may be liable to the State or local government for civil penalties of $1,000 per day for each day the public nuisance continues.
bill_summary: The bill prohibits certain common carriers from damaging public infrastructure such as bridges and highways, making such damage a public nuisance and allowing government actions to seek penalties, injunctions, and damages.
responsible_party: State or local government (for enforcement and legal actions)
stakeholders: Public infrastructure and the communities that use or rely on public roads and bridges
innovative_summary: The bill introduces penalties and legal actions specifically targeting damages to public infrastructure caused by common carriers, emphasizing civil remedies and civil penalties.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program's direct impact on child poverty is limited, primarily affecting infrastructure and public safety.

Title: Transportation Network Companies - Weekly Fare and Earnings Summary and Operator Data Reporting
Synopsis: Requiring a transportation network company to provide each operator with a weekly fare and earnings summary; requiring a transportation network company to report, on or before February 1 each year, certain information to the Public Service Commission; and providing that the report submitted to the Commission may be made available to the General Assembly on request, provided that the report remain confidential and exempt from public disclosure.
bill_summary: The bill mandates transportation network companies to provide weekly fare and earnings summaries to operators, gives operators and passengers access to itemized digital receipts through the company's digital platform, and requires annual reports to the Public Service Commission on various metrics related to transportation network services in Maryland.
responsible_party: Public Service Commission of Maryland
stakeholders: Operators, passengers, transportation network companies in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill introduces requirements for digital receipts and detailed reporting on transportation network services, leveraging technology and data transparency efforts.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill's focus on transparency and data collection could indirectly help improve service and employment conditions, but it does not directly target child poverty.

Title: Catastrophic Event Account - Transfer of Funds - State Disaster Recovery Fund
Synopsis: Authorizing the transfer of funds from the Catastrophic Event Account to the State Disaster Recovery Fund if the balance of the Fund has been depleted due to use or transfer or the estimated costs for providing adequate disaster relief for a natural disaster or catastrophic situation are in excess of the Fund's balance; and providing the Legislative Policy Committee has 10 days to review and make comments before the Governor may transfer certain funds from the Account through budget amendment.
bill_summary: The bill authorizes the transfer of funds from the Catastrophic Event Account to the State Disaster Recovery Fund and makes changes to review periods before such transfers can occur.
responsible_party: Maryland State Government, specifically the Departments responsible for Public Safety, State Finance, and Procurement
stakeholders: State and local government agencies involved in disaster response and recovery
innovative_summary: The bill mainly updates existing procedures for transferring funds, with slight adjustments to review periods, and does not introduce new innovative approaches or technologies.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has limited direct impact on child poverty as it mainly concerns fund transfer procedures for disaster response.

Title: Frederick County - Alcoholic Beverages - Class C (Theater) Beer, Wine, and Liquor License
Synopsis: Establishing a Class C (theater) beer, wine, and liquor license in Frederick County; authorizing the manager of the theater or any other official designated by the theater to sign the application for the license; authorizing the Board of License Commissioners for Frederick County to issue the license for use by certain theaters; authorizing the license holder to sell beer, wine, and liquor for on-premises consumption, subject to certain limitations; establishing an annual license fee of $150; etc.
bill_summary: The bill establishes a new Class C (theater) beer, wine, and liquor license in Frederick County, allowing theaters to sell alcohol for on-premises consumption during certain events.
responsible_party: Frederick County Board of License Commissioners
stakeholders: Theaters in Frederick County and event attendees
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a specialized alcohol license for theaters, enabling them to serve alcohol during performances and events, which is a targeted approach to licensing.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has limited direct impact on child poverty but may improve economic activity in the theater sector.

Title: Preserve Telehealth Access Act of 2025
Synopsis: Repealing the limitation on the period during which the Maryland Medical Assistance Program and certain insurers, nonprofit health service plans, and health maintenance organizations are required to provide reimbursement for certain health care services provided through telehealth on a certain basis and at a certain rate; altering the circumstances under which health care practitioners are authorized to prescribe certain controlled dangerous substances for the treatment of pain through telehealth; etc.
bill_summary: The bill broadens the use and reimbursement of telehealth services in Maryland by removing previous time limitations on audio-only telehealth interactions, requiring regular reporting on telehealth developments, and clarifying rules around prescribing controlled substances via telehealth.
responsible_party: Maryland Health Care Commission and relevant health care and insurance agencies
stakeholders: Patients, health care providers, insurance companies in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill enhances telehealth regulations, maintains reimbursement parity, and mandates periodic reporting on technological and cost developments, employing existing telehealth technologies with policy updates rather than introducing new technologies.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has limited direct impact on child poverty but improves access to health care through telehealth, which could indirectly benefit children from underserved populations.

Title: Health Services Cost Review Commission - Community Benefits - Community Health Worker Workforce Program
Synopsis: Altering the definition of "community benefit" to include a community health worker workforce program which is intended to provide services to patients of a nonprofit hospital and to improve health outcomes; authorizing a nonprofit hospital and a community-based organization to establish a community health worker workforce program; providing that a partnership that establishes a community health worker workforce program may be executed through a memorandum of understanding; establishing requirements for the memorandum of understanding; etc.
bill_summary: The bill authorizes nonprofit hospitals and community organizations to establish community health worker workforce programs as a type of community benefit, aimed at improving health outcomes and addressing social determinants of health through partnerships and employment of community health workers.
responsible_party: Health Services Cost Review Commission and participating nonprofit hospitals and community organizations.
stakeholders: Community health workers, nonprofit hospitals, community-based organizations, and residents benefiting from improved health outcomes.
innovative_summary: The program employs a partnership approach involving memoranda of understanding to establish community health worker programs, including provisions for employment, training, and insurance coverage, which may be considered innovative in how it formalizes collaborations and addresses social determinants of health.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has the potential to reduce child poverty by improving health access and outcomes through community health workers who address social determinants of health.

Title: Residential Real Property - Tenants' Right of First Refusal
Synopsis: Clarifying the circumstances under which liability for the failure to comply with certain requirements relating to a tenant's right of first refusal to purchase residential property is restricted to the owner of the property and does not attach to the property.
bill_summary: This bill clarifies that liability for failing to comply with tenants' right of first refusal to purchase residential property applies only to the owner and not to the property itself. It details the process for tenants to exercise their right and specifies that after a sale to a third party, liability is restricted to the owner.
responsible_party: Office of Tenant and Landlord Affairs, Maryland State Department
stakeholders: Tenants of residential rental properties in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a clear legal framework for tenants' rights of first refusal, including notification procedures, which enhances transparency and tenant protections.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has limited direct impact on child poverty, as it mainly clarifies legal rights related to property transactions.

Title: Prison Education Delivery Reform Commission - Reporting and Sunset Extension
Synopsis: Extending the time for submission of the interim report and final report of the Prison Education Delivery Reform Commission by 3 years; and extending the termination date for the Commission by 3 years.
bill_summary: The bill extends the reporting deadlines and sunset date for the Prison Education Delivery Reform Commission in Maryland, delaying the submission of interim and final reports to 2028 and 2029 respectively, and prolonging the commission's existence until mid-2029.
responsible_party: Maryland Prison Education Delivery Reform Commission or relevant Maryland state agency
stakeholders: Prison inmates, Maryland criminal justice system, policymakers interested in prison education reform
innovative_summary: The bill mainly extends existing reporting and sunset timelines without creating new services or programs, so it does not employ new technologies or approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill does not directly target child poverty but could have indirect effects through prison education reform.

Title: Task Force to Improve Attendance and Reduce Chronic Absenteeism in Schools
Synopsis: Establishing the Task Force to Improve Attendance and Reduce Chronic Absenteeism in Schools for the purpose of studying and making recommendations on practices to identify, prevent, and eliminate chronic absenteeism by students from schools in the State; and requiring the Task Force to report its findings and recommendations to the Governor and the General Assembly by December 31, 2025.
bill_summary: This bill establishes a Task Force to Study and Make Recommendations to Reduce Chronic Absenteeism in Maryland Schools, including analyzing data, identifying strategies, setting statewide goals, and providing guidance and toolkits to local school systems. It also directs the Department of Education to update regulations and distribute resources based on the Task Force's findings.
responsible_party: Maryland State Department of Education
stakeholders: Students, parents, teachers, school administrators, local school systems, and communities in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill employs a comprehensive and culturally responsive approach to addressing absenteeism, including data analysis, community involvement, and toolkit distribution, with a focus on nonpunitive strategies.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has high potential to directly impact child poverty by reducing barriers to education associated with absenteeism.

Title: Family Investment Program - Child Support
Synopsis: Phasing in a requirement that all child support received in a month pass through to a family seeking assistance under the Family Investment Program and prohibiting the consideration of child support in computing the amount of assistance received.
bill_summary: The bill phases in an increase in the pass-through of child support payments to families under the Family Investment Program (FIP) and prevents the consideration of child support when determining benefits under the Supplemental Nutrition Assistance Program (SNAP). It specifies the amounts of child support that pass through to families from fiscal year 2028 onwards and mandates that local departments cannot consider child support when calculating SNAP benefits.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Human Services
stakeholders: Families receiving assistance through FIP and SNAP, children in those families, and social service agencies
innovative_summary: The program employs a phased approach to increasing child support pass-through and enhances benefit calculations by explicitly excluding child support considerations under SNAP, representing a policy shift.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has a significant potential to reduce child poverty by increasing direct support to families and removing child support from benefit calculation.

Title: State Retirement and Pension System – Deferred Vested Former Members – Return to Service
Synopsis: Establishing that an individual who, after earning service credit sufficient for a vested allowance in the State Police Retirement System, the Correctional Officers' Retirement System, or the Law Enforcement Officers' Pension System, separates from service, and subsequently returns to service in a position in the same system under certain circumstances, is subject to the same requirements to which certain members of the same system are subject.
bill_summary: The bill allows certain retired members of Maryland's public retirement systems who left service after earning sufficient credits and later return to work within specific systems to be subject to the same rules as current members, under specified conditions, including military service and re-employment timelines.
responsible_party: Maryland State Retirement Agency
stakeholders: Retirees and current employees of Maryland's public retirement systems, including the Employees' Pension System, State Police Retirement System, Correctional Officers' Retirement System, and Law Enforcement Officers' Pension System.
innovative_summary: The bill updates reemployment rules for retired members across multiple systems, applying a standardized approach to the process, but does not employ new technologies or radically new government approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has limited direct impact on child poverty as it primarily involves retirement and re-employment rules for adults.

Title: Accountants - Licensed Out-of-State Practice Privileges - Qualifications
Synopsis: Altering the qualifications for an individual licensed as a certified public accountant in another state to practice certified public accountancy in the State by requiring that the individual must have passed the Uniform CPA Examination when qualifying for the license in the other state.
bill_summary: The bill modifies the qualifications for out-of-state licensed CPAs to practice in Maryland under practice privileges, primarily allowing individuals licensed in other states to exercise public accountancy without needing Maryland licensure, subject to certain conditions.
responsible_party: Maryland Board of Public Accountancy
stakeholders: Out-of-state licensed CPAs practicing in Maryland and Maryland residents receiving accounting services
innovative_summary: The bill streamlines out-of-state CPA practice privileges, reducing regulatory barriers by removing licensing requirements for certain out-of-state CPAs practicing remotely or through modern communication means.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has little to no direct impact on child poverty as it mainly changes licensing rules for accountants.

Title: Education - Initial Teacher Certification - Qualifications
Synopsis: Altering the qualifications for an initial teacher certificate to include passing a portfolio-based assessment of a nationally accredited teacher preparation program.
bill_summary: This bill amends the qualifications for initial teacher certification in Maryland, allowing candidates to pass a portfolio–based assessment of a nationally accredited teacher preparation program instead of other traditional requirements.
responsible_party: Maryland State Department of Education
stakeholders: Prospective teachers and students in Maryland's education system
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a portfolio-based assessment of a nationally accredited teacher preparation program as an alternative certification pathway, employing innovative assessment methods.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has the potential to help address teacher shortages, which can contribute to disparities affecting children in poverty.

Title: Tidal Fish Licenses - Oyster Authorizations - Administrative Penalties
Synopsis: Requiring the Department of Natural Resources to suspend for up to 5 years for a first violation, rather than revoke, a person's oyster authorization for knowingly committing certain violations; providing for the reinstatement for certain persons of an oyster authorization and an entitlement to engage or work in the oyster fishery; altering a certain offense related to the use of prohibited gear; and repealing the 90-day time period within which a certain administrative hearing must be held.
bill_summary: This bill modifies regulations for oyster fishing in Maryland, reducing suspension periods for first violations from revocation, allowing reinstatement of oyster authorizations under certain conditions, and clarifying procedures and penalties related to oyster harvesting violations.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Natural Resources
stakeholders: Oyster fishers, seafood industry, local communities reliant on oyster fisheries
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a more nuanced approach to penalties, including suspension rather than revocation, and mechanisms for reinstating oyster authorizations, which modernizes and humanizes enforcement policies.
child_poverty_direct_summary: Moderate potential for impact on child poverty as it could support sustainable oyster fisheries and local livelihoods.

Title: Endangered and Threatened Species - Incidental Taking - Bats
Synopsis: Authorizing the Secretary of Natural Resources to issue an incidental taking permit for the Indiana bat, the northern long-eared bat, the tricolor bat, or the eastern small-footed bat if an applicant submits a certain conservation plan and the Secretary makes certain findings.
bill_summary: This bill authorizes the Maryland Department of Natural Resources to issue incidental taking permits for certain bat species, including the Indiana Bat, Northern Long-Eared Bat, Tri-colored Bat, and Eastern Small-Footed Bat, provided applicants submit conservation plans and meet specific criteria. It also establishes procedures for reviewing species status and regulations for protecting endangered and threatened species.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Natural Resources
stakeholders: Bat species, conservation agencies, developers, and the public interested in wildlife protection
innovative_summary: The bill employs a structured permitting process for incidental harm to certain bat species, integrating conservation plans and scientific review, leveraging a tailored regulatory approach for species management.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill does not explicitly target or directly impact child poverty.

Title: Employment and Insurance Equality for Service Members Act
Synopsis: Establishing rules of interpretation related to the uniformed services; altering the rule of interpretation for "veteran"; and altering the application of certain provisions of law governing the regulation of business, economic development, insurance, and labor and employment to apply to all uniformed services, rather than only the armed forces.
bill_summary: The bill establishes new rules of interpretation for the military and veterans, expands existing laws to cover all uniformed services, and creates several programs and protections for service members, veterans, and their families, including expedited licensing, loan programs, and employment protections.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Veterans and Military Families
stakeholders: Service members, veterans, military families, veterans-owned small businesses, and related organizations in Maryland.
innovative_summary: The bill introduces new legal interpretations and creates several targeted programs to support military service members and veterans, including expediting licensing, special loan programs, and employment protections, employing a comprehensive government approach.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has high potential to directly impact child poverty through supporting military families financially and improving their access to services and employment.

Title: Property Tax - Exemption for Blind Individuals - Alteration
Synopsis: Increasing the amount of a certain property tax exemption for dwelling houses owned by blind individuals or their surviving spouses from $15,000 to $40,000.
bill_summary: The bill increases the property tax exemption for dwelling houses owned by blind individuals or their surviving spouses from $15,000 to $40,000 and clarifies provisions related to this exemption including refund policies for counties.
responsible_party: Maryland local governments/County governments
stakeholders: Blind individuals and their surviving spouses
innovative_summary: This bill does not employ new technologies or approaches; it mainly updates existing tax exemption rules.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill's focus on property tax exemptions for blind individuals may indirectly support economic stability for affected families but does not have a direct impact on child poverty.

Title: Baltimore City - Speed Monitoring Systems - Interstate 83
Synopsis: Increasing from two to four the number of speed monitoring systems that may be placed on Interstate 83 in Baltimore City; limiting to not more than one speed monitoring system in each direction that may be in operation at the same time on Interstate 83 in Baltimore City; and making permanent the authorization to place speed monitoring systems on Interstate 83 in Baltimore City.
bill_summary: The bill increases the number of speed monitoring systems that can be placed on Interstate 83 in Baltimore City from two to four, limits their simultaneous operation to one in each direction, and makes the placement of these systems permanent.
responsible_party: Baltimore City Department of Transportation or relevant local government agency
stakeholders: Drivers and residents in Baltimore City using Interstate 83
innovative_summary: The bill expands the use of automated speed enforcement systems and makes their placement permanent, which is a standard approach for traffic management.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has minimal direct impact on child poverty as it primarily deals with traffic enforcement infrastructure.

Title: Family Law - Permanent Protective Orders - Consent
Synopsis: Specifying that an individual may consent to the issuance of a permanent protective order against the individual.
bill_summary: The bill specifies that an individual may consent to the issuance of a permanent protective order against themselves if certain criteria are met, including prior protective orders and convictions for abuse. It clarifies conditions under which permanent protective orders can be issued and that such orders shall be permanent unless terminated at the victim's request.
responsible_party: Maryland Judiciary
stakeholders: Individuals involved in protective order proceedings, victims of abuse, and the legal system in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a new legal provision allowing individuals to consent to permanent protective orders against themselves, possibly streamlining protective order processes and ensuring victims' wishes are considered.
child_poverty_direct_summary: Low potential for direct impact on child poverty, as the bill mainly addresses legal procedures for protective orders.

Title: Public Health Abortion Grant Program - Establishment
Synopsis: Establishing the Public Health Abortion Grant Program to provide grants to improve access to abortion care clinical services for individuals in the State; establishing the Public Health Abortion Grant Program Fund as a special, nonlapsing fund to provide grants under the Program; and requiring that certain premium funds collected by health insurance carriers be used to provide certain coverage and to support improving access to abortion care clinical services under certain circumstances.
bill_summary: The bill establishes the Public Health Abortion Grant Program and Fund in Maryland to provide grants supporting access to abortion care services for individuals with limited resources. It also mandates that certain insurance premium funds collected for abortion coverage be allocated to this program.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Health
stakeholders: Individuals in Maryland who require access to abortion services, especially those uninsured or underinsured
innovative_summary: The program employs a combination of grant funding and regulation of insurance premium allocations to improve access to abortion, integrating health services with insurance regulation and targeted state funding.
child_poverty_direct_summary: High potential to reduce child poverty by improving access to essential reproductive health services for low-income individuals.

Title: Public Ethics - Conflicts of Interest and Blind Trust - Governor
Synopsis: Requiring the Governor to place certain interests into a certain certified blind trust or divest of certain interests within 6 months after taking the oath of office; requiring the Governor to enter into a nonparticipation agreement with the State Ethics Commission for any interests not included in a blind trust; authorizing the Ethics Commission to impose a fine of up to $5,000 for each violation of the Act; requiring the Commission to adopt regulations to carry out the Act including standards for types of interests that be exempted; etc.
bill_summary: The bill establishes new rules for conflicts of interest involving the Governor of Maryland, including the requirement to place personal interests into a blind trust or divest within a specific period, and mandates reporting and transparency measures.
responsible_party: Maryland State Ethics Commission
stakeholders: Governor, Maryland State government, public oversight bodies, general public
innovative_summary: The bill employs a comprehensive approach to conflicts of interest, combining blind trusts, mandatory disclosures, and regulations, which introduces structured transparency but doesn't employ new technologies.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has minimal direct impact on child poverty, focusing primarily on conflict-of-interest rules for officials.

Title: Nursing Homes - Cost Reports
Synopsis: Requiring the Maryland Department of Health to review the cost reports and other data submitted by each nursing home that participates in the Maryland Medical Assistance Program; and requiring the Department to report the findings resulting from the review conducted under the Act to the Governor and certain committees of the General Assembly by October 1, 2025, and each October 1 thereafter through 2029.
bill_summary: The bill requires nursing homes in Maryland to spend at least 75% of their total revenue from nursing and residential care on direct care wages and benefits. It mandates annual submission of detailed cost reports to the Maryland Department of Health, which will review the data and publish annual reports. The bill also establishes enforcement actions for non-compliance.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Health
stakeholders: Nursing homes, residents, and healthcare workers in Maryland
innovative_summary: The program introduces mandatory annual reporting and detailed analysis of nursing home expenditures, with regular public reporting, supported by data review and enforcement mechanisms.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill's potential to directly reduce child poverty is limited as it primarily targets nursing home expenditure regulations.

Title: Health Insurance - Cancellation and Nonrenewal of Coverage - Required Notice
Synopsis: Requiring that a carrier provide notice by certain electronic means, in addition to written notice, of cancellation or nonrenewal of a small group market health benefit plan and include information regarding additional health benefit coverage options in the notice; and applying the Act to all policies, contracts, and health benefit plans issued, delivered, or renewed in the State on or after January 1, 2026.
bill_summary: The bill requires health insurance carriers in Maryland to provide both written and electronic notice of cancellation or nonrenewal of small group health plans, including information on alternative coverage options such as COBRA and Maryland Health Benefit Exchange plans.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Insurance
stakeholders: Small group health insurance policyholders, small employers, health insurance carriers in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill employs dual notification methods (written and electronic) and provides detailed information on alternative coverage options, increasing transparency and accessibility.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill's focus on insurance notification does not directly impact child poverty.

Title: Continuing Care Providers - Governing Bodies - Membership
Synopsis: Requiring the appointment of an alternate subscriber member to the governing body of a continuing care provider; and authorizing the alternate subscriber member to attend all meetings of the governing body and vote only if the regular subscriber is unable to fulfill the subscriber's duties as a regular member of the governing body.
bill_summary: The bill requires continuing care providers in Maryland to have at least one subscriber as a full and regular member of their governing body. If there is only one subscriber, an alternate subscriber must be appointed to serve if the regular subscriber is unable. The bill also specifies how these members are selected, their rights, and involvement in governance, and establishes procedures for providers without a governing body.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Human Services
stakeholders: Residents and subscribers of continuing care providers in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill introduces formal inclusion of subscribers in the governance of continuing care providers, including the appointment of an alternate subscriber, enhancing transparency and resident involvement.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill's primary focus on governance and resident participation is unlikely to directly impact child poverty.

Title: Maryland Commission for Women - Maryland Collaborative to Advance Implementation of Coverage of Over-the-Counter Birth Control
Synopsis: Requiring the Maryland Commission for Women to establish the Maryland Collaborative to Advance Implementation of Coverage of Over-the-Counter Birth Control to study access to over-the-counter birth control; and requiring the Collaborative to submit an interim report by January 1, 2026, and a final report of its findings and recommendations to the Governor and General Assembly by December 1, 2027.
bill_summary: This bill requires the Maryland Commission for Women to establish a Collaborative to study and make recommendations to improve access to over-the-counter birth control, including implementation, coverage, education, and public health strategies.
responsible_party: Maryland Commission for Women within the Maryland Department of Human Services
stakeholders: Individuals seeking over-the-counter birth control, healthcare providers, retailers, insurers, and community organizations in Maryland.
innovative_summary: The program employs a collaborative, multi-stakeholder approach to research and recommend enhancements to over-the-counter birth control access, integrating policy, community engagement, and education efforts.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has a substantial potential to reduce child poverty by increasing access to reproductive health services and lowering barriers for low-income populations.

Title: Criminal Law - Crimes of Malicious or Fraudulent Burning - Prohibitions and Penalties
Synopsis: Prohibiting a person from committing a certain crime of malicious or fraudulent burning that causes the death of or serious physical injury to a firefighter; and establishing that a person who violates the Act is guilty of a felony and on conviction is subject to imprisonment not to exceed 10 years.
bill_summary: The bill prohibits committing malicious or fraudulent burning that results in death or serious injury to a firefighter, classifying it as a felony with up to 10 years imprisonment.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Public Safety and Correctional Services or local law enforcement agencies
stakeholders: Firefighters, law enforcement, and communities affected by arson or fire-related crimes
innovative_summary: The bill introduces specific legal sanctions and enhances protections for firefighters by explicitly criminalizing attacks that cause injuries or death during malicious or fraudulent fires.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has no direct impact on child poverty but contributes to public safety and community well-being.

Title: Election Law - Gubernatorial Primary Election - Date
Synopsis: Altering, from the last Tuesday in June to the fourth Tuesday in June, the date for the primary election in the year of the gubernatorial election.
bill_summary: This bill changes the date of the statewide primary election in Maryland in gubernatorial election years from the last Tuesday in June to the fourth Tuesday in June.
responsible_party: Maryland State Board of Elections
stakeholders: Mary voters participating in gubernatorial primaries and electoral process
innovative_summary: The bill adjusts the electoral schedule, but does not introduce new technologies or approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill primarily deals with election scheduling and is unlikely to directly impact child poverty.

Title: Tax Sales - Homeowner Protection Program - Funding and Alterations
Synopsis: Requiring each collector of taxes that maintains a website to include on the collector's website certain information and a certain link relating to the Homeowner Protection Program; altering the information the State Department of Assessments and Taxation is required to obtain and include in a certain annual report regarding tax sales; requiring the State Tax Sale Ombudsman to take certain actions to maximize enrollment in the Homeowner Protection Program; etc.
bill_summary: The bill establishes the Homeowner Protection Program in Maryland, aimed at assisting vulnerable homeowners to avoid tax sales and remain in their homes. It allocates funding, enhances transparency, and increases outreach efforts.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Assessments and Taxation and Department of Housing and Community Development
stakeholders: Homeowners in Maryland, especially low-income, elderly, or disabled homeowners
innovative_summary: The program employs new approaches such as voluntary donations through a website, targeted outreach, and centralized reporting to improve homeowner protection and engagement.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has a high potential to reduce child poverty by preventing families from losing their homes due to tax issues, thereby stabilizing household income and housing security.

Title: Consumer Protection - Workgroup on Artificial Intelligence Implementation
Synopsis: Establishing the Workgroup on Artificial Intelligence Implementation; requiring the Workgroup to monitor and make recommendations related to the regulation of artificial intelligence, consumer protection, current private sector use of artificial intelligence, enforcement authority for the Office of the Attorney General's Office of Consumer Protection, and impact in the determination of government benefits; and requiring the Workgroup to make its recommendations to certain committees of the General Assembly by July 1, 2026.
bill_summary: The bill establishes a Workgroup on Artificial Intelligence Implementation to monitor and recommend policies related to AI in Maryland, covering issues like consumer protection, privacy, and AI's impact on government and employment.
responsible_party: Department of Maryland Center for Health and Homeland Security, with funding support from the Maryland state government budget.
stakeholders: Consumers, government agencies, industry professionals in AI, biotech, e-commerce, real estate, healthcare, education, and civil rights organizations in Maryland.
innovative_summary: The program is innovative in its interdisciplinary and multi-sector approach to monitor and regulate AI, involving industry, academia, civil rights, and government perspectives.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has limited direct impact on child poverty as it focuses primarily on AI governance and regulation.

Title: Public Health - Pediatric Hospital Overstay Patients and Workgroup on Children in Unlicensed Settings and Pediatric Overstays
Synopsis: Specifying that the scope of the Maryland Mental Health and Substance Use Disorder Registry and Referral System includes private and State inpatient and outpatient mental health and substance use services; requiring the Maryland Department of Health and the Department of Human Services, under certain circumstances, to ensure pediatric hospital overstay patients are placed in the least restrictive setting when clinically indicated and when possible; etc.
bill_summary: The bill establishes new protocols and coordinators to improve the treatment and placement of pediatric patients who overstay in hospitals, and investigates unlicensed child care settings, with a focus on reducing pediatric overstays and improving mental health and support services.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Health and Department of Human Services
stakeholders: Pediatric patients, mental health service providers, child welfare agencies, children in unlicensed settings, families, and healthcare providers
innovative_summary: The program employs new Coordinators and data sharing agreements to improve coordination, oversight, and placement of pediatric mental health and overstayed patients, utilizing state agencies and data systems.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has a high potential to impact child poverty by improving access to appropriate, less restrictive mental health and support services for children in need.

Title: Montgomery County - Task Force on the Displacement of Residents of Emory Grove MC 5-25
Synopsis: Establishing the Task Force on the Displacement of Residents of Emory Grove to study how urban renewal caused the displacement of residents from the Emory Grove community and make recommendations on potential remedies to those who were displaced by urban renewal; requiring the Task Force to submit an interim report by December 15, 2025, and a final report of its findings and recommendations to the Montgomery County Council, the Montgomery County Executive, the Montgomery County Delegation, and the General Assembly by December 15, 2026.
bill_summary: This bill establishes the Task Force on the Displacement of Residents of Emory Grove to study how urban renewal from 1960 to 1985 caused displacement of residents and to recommend remedies.
responsible_party: Montgomery County Office of Human Rights
stakeholders: Residents displaced from Emory Grove community, local government, landowners, and former residents
innovative_summary: The program involves creating a specialized task force to investigate historical urban renewal impacts and recommend remedies, employing data analysis and community engagement.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has potential to directly address issues stemming from displacement, which can impact child poverty, but its primary focus is on historical analysis and remedies.

Title: Somerset County Code of Public Local Laws - 2025 Edition - Legalization
Synopsis: Legalizing the 2025 Edition of the Somerset County Code of Public Local Laws and any supplement to the extent to which that code or supplement contains laws enacted by the General Assembly.
bill_summary: This bill legalizes the 2025 Edition of the Somerset County Code of Public Local Laws and any supplements, recognizing them as valid and lawful references within the state of Maryland.
responsible_party: Somerset County government
stakeholders: Residents and officials of Somerset County, Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill primarily legalizes and recognizes a local legal code and supplements, without introducing new technologies or innovative approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill does not directly impact child poverty as it pertains to local legal code legalization.

Title: Business Regulation – Licensing – Definition of Storage Warehouse
Synopsis: Altering, with respect to business licensing requirements in the State, the definition of "storage warehouse" to exclude a self-service storage facility.
bill_summary: The bill amends the Maryland business licensing law to define 'storage warehouse' and to specify that self-service storage facilities are excluded from this definition. It requires persons operating storage warehouses for a fee in Maryland to obtain a license.
responsible_party: Maryland State Business Regulation Authority (implied, possibly the Department of Business and Economic Development)
stakeholders: Owners and operators of storage warehouses, self-service storage facility businesses, and consumers/indirect users of storage services in Maryland.
innovative_summary: The bill primarily clarifies definitions and licensing requirements; it does not employ new technologies or approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill's focus on storage warehouse licensing likely has minimal or no direct impact on child poverty.

Title: Property Tax - Payment in Lieu of Taxes Agreements - Broadband Service Providers
Synopsis: Authorizing the governing body of a county to enter into a payment in lieu of taxes agreement with a provider of broadband service located in the county for property located in the county and owned by the provider; and applying the Act to all taxable years beginning after June 30, 2025.
bill_summary: The bill allows Maryland counties to enter into property tax payment agreements with broadband service providers, effectively establishing payment in lieu of taxes (PILOT) arrangements for broadband infrastructure, and adjusts valuation methods for rural broadband providers.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Assessments and Taxation
stakeholders: Broadband service providers, counties, and residents benefiting from improved broadband connectivity
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a flexible PILOT arrangement specific for broadband providers, which is a new approach to supporting broadband infrastructure through local government agreements.
child_poverty_direct_summary: By potentially enhancing broadband access, the program can improve opportunities for low-income and rural children, reducing digital disparities.

Title: Health Insurance - Insulin - Prohibition on Step Therapy or Fail-First Protocols
