Synopsis: Prohibiting certain insurers, nonprofit health service plans, and health maintenance organizations from imposing a step therapy or fail-first protocol for insulin or an insulin analog used to treat an insured's or enrollee's Type 1, Type 2, or gestational diabetes; and applying the Act to all policies, contracts, and health benefit plans issued, delivered, or renewed in the State on or after January 1, 2026.
bill_summary: This bill prohibits certain health insurance providers from imposing step therapy or fail-first protocols on insulin and similar drugs used to treat diabetes, unless specific exemptions apply.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Health or Insurance Department (not explicitly specified)
stakeholders: Individuals with diabetes in Maryland receiving health insurance coverage
innovative_summary: The bill introduces protections for diabetes medication coverage, ensuring easier access without step therapy constraints, which is a notable policy improvement but not involving new technology.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill's impact on child poverty is indirect; by improving access to essential diabetes medication, it may positively affect health outcomes for children with diabetes.

Title: Anne Arundel County Crownsville Hospital Memorial Park Advisory Committee
Synopsis: Establishing the Anne Arundel County Crownsville Hospital Memorial Park Advisory Committee to provide advice on the planning of the Park; requiring the Advisory Committee to make recommendations to ensure that the Park focuses on mental and physical health and well-being, is equitable in providing access to the property, is truthful about the history of Crownsville Hospital, and preserves the natural beauty of the site; and requiring the Committee to report its achievements and recommendations to certain entities by February 1 each year.
bill_summary: This bill establishes the Anne Arundel County Crownsville Hospital Memorial Park Advisory Committee, which will advise on the planning and development of the memorial park, considering cultural history, health, recreation, infrastructure, and community input, and make recommendations aimed at preserving the site's natural and historical significance.
responsible_party: Anne Arundel County Department or designated county agency
stakeholders: Residents of Anne Arundel County, especially those interested in cultural history, recreation, health, and community development
innovative_summary: The program employs a community-based advisory approach to plan and develop a memorial park that integrates cultural, historical, health, and recreational considerations, emphasizing community engagement and historical preservation.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has moderate potential for direct impact on child poverty through community health and recreation initiatives, but its primary focus is on memorial park planning.

Title: Real Estate Commission - Continuing Education Requirements - Alterations
Synopsis: Altering certain requirements for continuing education required for the renewal of a license for real estate brokers, associate real estate brokers, and real estate salespersons, including the number of clock hours, course topics, course instructors, and course application fees.
bill_summary: The bill updates and modifies the continuing education requirements for real estate license renewal in Maryland, specifying the number of hours, course topics, instructors, and fees involved.
responsible_party: Maryland State Real Estate Commission
stakeholders: Real estate licensees, prospective and current real estate agents, brokers, and the general public receiving real estate services.
innovative_summary: The bill standardizes and specifies detailed curriculum topics, including remote instruction and verification processes, but does not implement new technological or novel approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has little direct impact on child poverty as it primarily relates to professional licensing requirements.

Title: Health Insurance - Preventive Services - High Deductible Health Plans and Enforcement Authority
Synopsis: Clarifying the application of certain health insurance preventive services coverage requirements to certain high deductible health plans; and requiring the Insurance Commissioner to enforce certain provisions of law related to preventive services consistent with the recommendations and guidelines set by certain federal agencies in effect on December 31, 2024.
bill_summary: The bill clarifies that health insurance plans in Maryland must cover certain preventive services without cost-sharing, even if they are provided through high deductible health plans, and mandates enforcement of these provisions to align with federal guidelines starting from December 31, 2024.
responsible_party: Maryland Insurance Commissioner
stakeholders: Insurance providers, insured individuals, and potential beneficiaries of covered preventive services in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill updates state policy to align with evolving federal guidelines for preventive health services, ensuring comprehensive coverage without cost-sharing in high deductible plans, which is an adaptive regulatory approach but not employing new technologies or novel delivery methods.
child_poverty_direct_summary: Potential for some impact on child health outcomes through improved access to preventive services, but the direct impact on child poverty is limited.

Title: Maryland Self-Service Storage Act - Sale of Personal Property in Satisfaction of Lien - Notice Requirements
Synopsis: Requiring a certain operator of a certain self-service storage facility to notify at least 10 days prior to conducting a sale of an occupant's personal property stored in certain leased space at the self-service storage facility of the time, place, and terms of the sale by hand delivery, verified mail, or electronic mail at the occupant's last known address.
bill_summary:
This bill amends Maryland law to require self-storage facility operators to provide specific notices to occupants before selling their stored property due to unpaid bills, including notice by electronic mail if specified in the agreement, and mandates advertising of sales in multiple ways.

It updates notice and sale procedures for enforcement of liens on personal property stored in self-storage facilities.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Commerce or relevant regulatory agency overseeing self-storage facilities
stakeholders: Self-storage facility operators and occupants
innovative_summary: The bill introduces more detailed and flexible notice requirements, including electronic communication and online advertising, leveraging digital technology to improve transparency and communication in lien sales.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill is unlikely to have a direct impact on child poverty as it pertains to regulations on self-storage lien sales.

Title: Election Law - Local Boards of Elections - Language Assistance Program
Synopsis: Establishing the Language Assistance Program; requiring a local board of elections to participate in the Program if the State Board determines that there is a significant need for language assistance to voters in the county in a language other than English; requiring the State Board to designate, not later than February 1 of the year of the election, certain languages other than English in which a local board that is required to participate in the Program must provide assistance to voters; etc.
bill_summary: The bill establishes a Language Assistance Program within Maryland's election law system to provide language-related assistance to voters in multiple languages, based on demographic needs. It defines criteria for when assistance is necessary, designates specific languages, and outlines provisions for materials, signage, translation services, and enforcement.
responsible_party: Maryland State Board of Elections
stakeholders: Voters with limited English proficiency, non-English speaking communities, local election boards, election judges, and organizations representing affected voters.
innovative_summary: The program employs technology such as licensed translation software, multilingual signage, and video conferencing for translation services, and establishes a structured process for designating languages, making it relatively innovative in election assistance efforts.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has the potential to improve access to voting for non-English speakers, possibly reducing barriers that can contribute to disparities including child poverty affected households.

Title: Public Utilities - Electric Cooperatives - Rate Proceedings
Synopsis: Applying to electric cooperatives certain provisions of law related to rate proceedings held by the Public Service Commission to determine whether additional revenues are required to allow certain public service companies to earn the existing fair rate of return authorized in a previous base rate proceeding; and requiring the Commission to order an electric cooperative to conduct a certain public hearing.
bill_summary: This bill applies certain rate setting procedures and requirements to electric cooperatives in Maryland, including public hearings and order timelines, similar to those for other public service companies.
responsible_party: Public Service Commission of Maryland
stakeholders: Electric cooperatives and their customers in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill enhances transparency and public participation in rate proceedings for electric cooperatives but does not introduce new technologies or approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill does not directly target child poverty but may indirectly affect affordability of electricity for customers.

Title: Baltimore County - Alcoholic Beverages - Class B-OB-CRD (Office Building - Commercial Revitalization District) Beer, Wine, and Liquor License
Synopsis: Establishing a Class B-OB-CRD (office building - commercial revitalization district) beer, wine, and liquor license in Baltimore County; authorizing the Board of License Commissioners for Baltimore County to issue the license to an establishment that previously had or has a certain zoning classification and is at least a certain distance from a place of worship under certain circumstances and subject to certain limitations; etc.
bill_summary: This bill establishes a new license type (Class B–OB–CRD) for restaurants in Baltimore County, allowing them to sell alcoholic beverages, including wine for off-premises consumption, under specific conditions. It also relaxes restrictions on issuing alcohol licenses near places of worship in certain circumstances.
responsible_party: Baltimore County Board of License Commissioners
stakeholders: Restaurants, alcohol license applicants, residents of Baltimore County, religious institutions near licensed establishments
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a specialized alcohol license for a specific district that also incorporates conditions related to proximity to places of worship, and allows the issuance of licenses within 300 feet of places of worship under certain conditions, which is relatively innovative in alcohol licensing policy.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has limited direct impact on child poverty as it mainly focuses on licensing regulations for alcohol sales in specific districts.

Title: Montgomery County - Speed Monitoring Systems - Maryland Route 200 (Intercounty Connector) MC 10-25
Synopsis: Authorizing the placement and use by the Maryland Transportation Authority of speed monitoring systems on Maryland Route 200 (Intercounty Connector) in Montgomery County; requiring the District Court to remit to the Authority any civil penalties collected by the District Court resulting from a citation issued using a speed monitoring system operated by the Authority; and requiring the State Highway Administration to provide the Authority with access to certain systems and contacts.
bill_summary: This bill authorizes the Maryland Transportation Authority to place and use speed monitoring systems on Maryland Route 200 (Intercounty Connector) in Montgomery County. It establishes procedures for collecting and remitting civil penalties from citations issued using these systems and requires annual reporting on the program.
responsible_party: Maryland Transportation Authority
stakeholders: Drivers on Maryland Route 200 in Montgomery County
innovative_summary: The bill employs technology for automated speed enforcement and creates a comprehensive monitoring and reporting system, which is an innovative approach to traffic law enforcement.
child_poverty_direct_summary: While indirectly related, the program could impact child poverty by improving road safety and reducing accidents, but its primary focus is on traffic enforcement.

Title: State Procurement - Minority Business Enterprise Program - Extension and Reports
Synopsis: Altering the termination date for certain provisions of law governing the Minority Business Enterprise Program and its application to public-private partnerships, offshore wind projects, video lottery terminals, and sports wagering licenses; and altering the date by which certain reports, studies, and guidelines must be submitted.
bill_summary: The bill extends and modifies laws related to the Minority Business Enterprise Program, including its application to public-private partnerships, offshore wind projects, and certain gaming licenses. It shifts enforcement deadlines from 2025 to 2026 and mandates evaluations and reports on program compliance and effectiveness.
responsible_party: Maryland Office of Small, Minority, and Women Business Affairs and the Board of Public Works
stakeholders: Minority business owners, especially those involved in offshore wind projects, public-private partnerships, and gaming licensees.
innovative_summary: The bill employs data analysis, disparity studies, and development of race- and gender-neutral approaches to enhance minority business programs and address compliance with federal and constitutional standards—an integrated and data-driven approach.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has the potential to impact child poverty by supporting minority entrepreneurs and economic development, but the direct impact is moderate due to its broad strategic focus.

Title: Workgroup to Study the Rise in Adverse Decisions in the State Health Care System - Establishment
Synopsis: §Establishing the Workgroup to Study the Rise in Adverse Decisions in the State Health Care System to make recommendations to improve State reporting on adverse decisions, reduce the number of adverse decisions, and develop recommendations for legislation to address the rise in adverse decisions; and requiring the Workgroup to report its findings and recommendations to certain committees of the General Assembly by December 1, 2025.
bill_summary: This bill establishes a Workgroup to Study the Rise in Adverse Decisions in the Maryland health care system, aiming to analyze current adverse decision reporting and propose improvements and legislation to reduce adverse decisions and standardize reporting.
responsible_party: Health Services Cost Review Commission and Maryland Insurance Administration
stakeholders: Health payers, healthcare providers, patients, implementation agencies
innovative_summary: The bill creates a comprehensive workgroup to standardize adverse decision reporting and develop strategies for reduction, employing collaborative review and recommendations.
child_poverty_direct_summary: Moderate potential for direct impact on child poverty through improved healthcare decision processes.

Title: Public Health - Phenibut Consumer Protection Act (JT Alvey Phenibut Consumer Protection Act)
Synopsis: Requiring a retailer that prepares, distributes, sells, or exposes for sale a phenibut product to disclose the factual basis on which any representations regarding the phenibut product are made; establishing prohibitions related to the preparation, distribution, and sale of phenibut products, including prohibitions related to the sale of phenibut to individuals under the age of 21 years and the marketing of phenibut to minors; establishing certain penalties for violations of the Act; etc.
bill_summary: This bill is called the Phenibut Consumer Protection Act. It restricts the sale of phenibut, requiring retailers to disclose factual basis for representations about the product, prohibits sale to minors, and bans certain advertising practices. It also mandates reporting on adverse health events related to phenibut use.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Health
stakeholders: Consumers of phenibut, retailers, minors, health authorities
innovative_summary: The program mainly involves regulation, disclosure, and reporting rather than new technological approaches, focusing on restrictions and data collection.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill does not directly target or impact child poverty.

Title: Public Health - Alzheimer's Disease and Related Dementias - Information on Prevalence and Treatment
Synopsis: Requiring the Maryland Department of Health, in partnership with certain entities, to incorporate information regarding treatments approved by the Food and Drug Administration for Alzheimer's disease and related dementias and to increase understanding and awareness of treatment of Alzheimer's disease and related dementias into relevant public health outreach programs; requiring the Department to establish and maintain a website with information on the prevalence and hospitalization rate for Alzheimer's and related dementias;  etc.
bill_summary: The bill requires the Maryland Department of Health to include information about FDA-approved treatments for Alzheimer's disease and related dementias in public health outreach programs, and to establish a website with data on the prevalence and hospitalization rates of these conditions in Maryland.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Health
stakeholders: Individuals affected by Alzheimer's disease and related dementias, healthcare providers, and the general public in Maryland.
innovative_summary: The program's innovation lies in combining public health outreach with the creation of a dedicated website that provides detailed, disaggregated data on Alzheimer’s and related dementias, including treatment information and outcomes.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program could have a moderate impact on child poverty by enhancing awareness and early diagnosis, potentially leading to better management and reduced burden; however, it is not primarily focused on children.

Title: Disability and Life Insurance - Medical Information (Genetic Testing Protection Act)
Synopsis: Prohibiting insurance carriers that offer life insurance or disability insurance policies or contracts from unfairly discriminating against an individual by taking certain actions relating to coverage based on medical information; prohibiting certain carriers from accessing sensitive medical information without first obtaining written consent or mandating certain genetic testing or full genome sequencing as a prerequisite for life insurance or disability insurance eligibility or coverage;  etc.
bill_summary: This bill prohibits life, long-term care, and disability insurance carriers in Maryland from discriminating against applicants based on genetic testing results or requesting genetic testing as a precondition for coverage.
responsible_party: Maryland Insurance Commissioner or relevant state insurance authority
stakeholders: Applicants for life, long-term care, and disability insurance in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill employs a discrimination protection approach similar to existing laws but explicitly prevents the use of genetic testing results in insurance decisions, which is a significant step in genetic privacy and anti-discrimination.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has limited direct impact on child poverty as it mainly focuses on insurance discrimination protections.

Title: African American Heritage Preservation Program and Grant Fund - Noncapital Grants and Donations
Synopsis: Altering the purpose of the African American Heritage Preservation Program and Grant Fund to provide funding for African American Heritage Preservation Noncapital Grants for the purpose of preserving or sharing African American history or culture in the State; requiring certain noncapital grants to be made using certain money received by the African American Heritage Preservation (AAHP) Grant Fund; and authorizing the AAHP Grant Fund to receive grants and donations.
bill_summary: The bill redefines the purpose of the African American Heritage Preservation Program and Grant Fund to include funding for noncapital grants aimed at preserving African American history and culture in Maryland. It establishes a dedicated grant fund with an annual appropriation of 5 million dollars to support these projects, and creates a process for applications, reviews, and grant awards.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Planning and the Trust in partnership with the Commission on African American History and Culture
stakeholders: African American communities, cultural preservation organizations, local governments, and Maryland residents interested in African American history
innovative_summary: The program employs a structured grant system focused on noncapital projects to preserve African American history, funded by state allocations and donations, with oversight and regulation aimed at achieving geographic diversity and addressing emergencies.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program could have a positive impact on child poverty by preserving cultural sites and opportunities connected to African American history, fostering community engagement, and supporting local development.

Title: Baltimore Convention and Tourism Redevelopment and Operating Authority Task Force - Revisions
Synopsis: Requiring the Baltimore Convention and Tourism Redevelopment and Operating Authority Task Force to identify certain funding sources and mechanisms, and to submit a report to the Governor, the Mayor of Baltimore City, and the General Assembly on its findings and recommendations by December 1, 2025; and extending the termination date for the Task Force from June 30, 2025, to June 30, 2026.
bill_summary: This bill establishes the Baltimore Convention and Tourism Redevelopment and Operating Authority to oversee the renovation, revitalization, and operation of the Baltimore Convention site and the area's marketing as a tourist destination. It extends the existing Task Force's responsibilities, funding mechanisms, and mandates the formation of a new authority with specific members and powers.
responsible_party: Baltimore Convention and Tourism Redevelopment and Operating Authority
stakeholders: Tourists, Baltimore City residents, local businesses, and the state of Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill creates a new city-state authority to manage and operate critical tourism and convention infrastructure, potentially employing modern governance and financing strategies.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program could have a moderate impact on child poverty through economic growth and tourism jobs generated by the authority.

Title: Financial Institutions - Conventional Home Mortgage Loans - Assumption and Required Disclosures
Synopsis: Requiring banking institutions, credit unions, mortgage lenders, mortgage lending businesses, and mortgage loan originators to include a certain provision in certain conventional home mortgage loans authorizing a certain borrower to purchase the property interest of a certain borrower in connection with a decree of absolute divorce if the lending entity determines that the assuming borrower qualifies for the loan; applying certain provisions of the Act retroactively; etc.
bill_summary: The bill requires certain banking and credit union institutions to include provisions in conventional home mortgage loans that allow an existing borrower to assume the mortgage and purchase another borrower's interest in the property in connection with a divorce decree. It also mandates disclosure of this assumption provision to loan applicants and applies these rules retroactively.
responsible_party: Maryland financial institutions regulatory authorities and the Maryland Department of Housing and Community Development
stakeholders: Homeowners, borrowers going through divorce, financial institutions, mortgage lenders, credit unions in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill employs a targeted approach to facilitate property transfer in divorce cases through mandated mortgage assumption provisions and disclosures, integrating legal processes with mortgage practices.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has potential to positively impact families going through divorce, which may indirectly affect child poverty by stabilizing housing arrangements.

Title: Consumer Protection - Credit Reporting - Medical Debt (Fair Medical Debt Reporting Act)
Synopsis: Prohibiting a consumer reporting agency from furnishing any consumer report containing certain adverse information relating to a consumer's medical debt, or any collection action against a consumer for medical debt, or maintain a file on a consumer related to medical debt or collections; prohibiting a person from using medical debt information from a consumer report for certain purposes; prohibiting a health care facility, a health care practitioner, or an ambulance service from disclosing medical debt to a consumer reporting agency; etc.
bill_summary: The bill aims to reduce the impact of medical debt on consumers by prohibiting the inclusion of medical debt information in credit reports and restricting the disclosure and use of medical debt data in creditworthiness assessments. It also establishes reporting and procedural standards for hospitals related to medical debt collection and reporting.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Health and the Maryland Statewide Commission on Credit and Debt Collection Practices
stakeholders: Consumers, hospitals, healthcare providers, and debt collection agencies in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill introduces new protections for consumers' medical debt information by blocking its reporting and use in credit decisions, and establishes new hospital debt collection procedures and transparency measures, including mandatory reporting and patient rights.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has the potential to significantly reduce barriers to credit access for low-income individuals, thereby possibly decreasing child poverty.

Title: Real Estate Appraisers - Licensure and Certification - Qualifications
Synopsis: Prohibiting the State Commission of Real Estate Appraisers, Appraisal Management Companies, and Home Inspectors from requiring an applicant to hold a bachelor's degree or higher to qualify for a certain certification or licensure as a real estate appraiser.
bill_summary: The bill prohibits the Maryland State Commission of Real Estate Appraisers from requiring applicants for real estate appraiser licenses or certificates to hold a bachelor’s degree or higher, aligning state requirements with federal standards and reducing educational barriers.
responsible_party: Maryland State Commission of Real Estate Appraisers
stakeholders: Aspiring real estate appraisers in Maryland, particularly those without college degrees
innovative_summary: The bill simplifies licensing requirements by removing the college degree requirement, potentially broadening access to the profession without introducing new technologies or approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill may indirectly benefit low-income individuals by increasing access to real estate appraisal careers, which can lead to higher incomes and economic mobility.

Title: Frederick County - Alcoholic Beverages - Tasting Permits
Synopsis: Altering in Frederick County the beer and wine consumption permit to be the beer and wine tasting permit and the beer, wine, and liquor consumption permit to be the beer, wine, and liquor tasting permit; and requiring the Board to regulate the quantity of beer and wine served to an individual and the number of bottles or other containers from which the quantity is served.
bill_summary: The bill modifies alcohol tasting permits in Frederick County, changing permit titles, adjusting permitted tasting quantities for beer, wine, and liquor, and updating some administrative rules.
responsible_party: Frederick County Alcoholic Beverages Board
stakeholders: Alcohol license holders, consumers of alcohol, and the local economy in Frederick County
innovative_summary: The bill introduces specific regulations for alcohol tasting permits, focusing on quantities and issuing processes, but does not employ new technologies or innovative approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has limited direct impact on child poverty, primarily affecting alcohol permit regulations.

Title: Workgroup to Study Implementation of an Expanded 3-1-1 Nonemergency System
Synopsis: Establishing the Workgroup to Study Implementation of an Expanded 3-1-1 Nonemergency System; requiring the Workgroup to review a certain study completed by the Department of Information Technology in order to establish a plan to implement the recommendations of the study; and requiring the Workgroup to report its findings and recommendations to the Governor and the General Assembly by November 1, 2025.
bill_summary: The bill establishes a Workgroup to study the implementation of an expanded 3-1-1 nonemergency telephone system in Maryland, including reviewing current services, best practices, and developing a plan for expansion.
responsible_party: Department of Information Technology (Maryland)
stakeholders: Maryland residents and public safety agencies accessing 3-1-1 services
innovative_summary: The study and expansion of a statewide 3-1-1 system involves integrating existing services, improving accessibility, and potentially developing a virtual portal, employing technology for better nonemergency communication.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has a moderate potential to impact child poverty by improving access to nonemergency services and public safety resources.

Title: Board of Trustees for the State Retirement and Pension System - Investment Division - Compensation and Staffing
Synopsis: Clarifying that the Board of Trustees for the State Retirement and Pension System shall pay certain incentive compensation to the Chief Investment Officer for the State Retirement and Pension System if the Chief Investment Officer retires from the Investment Division of the State Retirement Agency in a certain manner; clarifying that the Board of Trustees shall pay certain incentive compensation to certain employees of the Investment Division if the employees retire from the Investment Division in a certain manner; etc.
bill_summary: The bill clarifies and modifies the rules around compensation, incentives, and staffing for the Board of Trustees of the Maryland State Retirement and Pension System, including establishing a new Compensation and Staffing Committee and setting criteria for incentive payments and salary adjustments.
responsible_party: Board of Trustees for the State Retirement and Pension System, Maryland State Retirement Agency
stakeholders: Employees within the Investment Division, Chief Investment Officer, Maryland State Retirement and Pension System
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a structured and criteria-based approach to incentive compensation and staffing, including objective benchmarks and a new committee structure, which represents a more formalized and transparent approach to staff incentives in the public pension context.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has limited direct impact on child poverty, as it mainly focuses on the administration and staffing of a pension system.

Title: Correctional Officers' Retirement System - Membership - Clarifications
Synopsis: Clarifying the membership in the Correctional Officers' Retirement System for certain employees of certain Maryland Department of Health facilities; and clarifying that certain participating employees who are appointed, promoted, or transferred are members of the Correctional Officers' Retirement System as a condition of employment.
bill_summary: This bill clarifies membership rules for the Correctional Officers' Retirement System in Maryland, including eligibility, transfer of service credits, and retirement benefits for certain employees of the Department of Health and other agencies, and specifies start and end dates for certain provisions.
responsible_party: Maryland State Retirement and Pension System
stakeholders: Correctional officers and employees of the Maryland Department of Health and other related agencies
innovative_summary: The bill primarily updates and clarifies existing rules for retirement system membership and service credit transfer, rather than employing new technologies or innovative approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill does not directly target child poverty, its impact on child poverty is minimal or indirect.

Title: State Retirement and Pension System - Reemployment Earnings Limitations - Maximum Average Final Compensation
Synopsis: Clarifying that the maximum average final compensation that certain retirees of the State Retirement and Pension System is to be based on the minimum annual salary on the standard State pay scale as of January 1 of the preceding calendar year in order to be exempt from a certain reemployment earnings limitation; and adding an average final compensation reemployment exemption for the temporary suspension of a retirement allowance for disability retirees.
bill_summary: The bill clarifies that the maximum average final compensation used to determine retirement benefits for certain retirees is based on the minimum annual salary on the standard state pay scale as of January 1 of the previous year. It also introduces an exemption for reemployment earnings during the temporary suspension of a disability retirement allowance, under specific salary conditions.
responsible_party: Maryland State Retirement and Pension System, managed by the Board of Trustees
stakeholders: Retirees of the Maryland State Retirement and Pension System, especially those returning to work after retirement, and the Maryland State Government
innovative_summary: The bill primarily clarifies existing rules and introduces a specific exemption for reemployment earnings during suspension periods, with no significant employments of new technology or approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill does not directly target child poverty, but it could indirectly impact public workers and retirees by clarifying retirement benefit rules.

Title: State Retirement and Pension System – Alterations and Clarifications
Synopsis: Altering certain due dates of certain reports from the State Retirement and Pension System; and clarifying the eligibility requirements of State Police Retirement System members to participate in the Deferred Retirement Option Program.
bill_summary: The bill makes changes to the reporting deadlines for the Maryland State Retirement and Pension System, clarifies eligibility requirements for the Deferred Retirement Option Program (DROP) for Maryland State Police Retirement System members, and adjusts rules regarding participation and the duration of the DROP.
responsible_party: Maryland State Retirement and Pension System
stakeholders: Members of the Maryland State Police Retirement System and the State Retirement and Pension System administrators
innovative_summary: The bill primarily clarifies eligibility and reporting requirements, with some adjustments to the DROP program, employing standard regulatory updates without introducing new technologies or approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill does not directly address child poverty or include targeted interventions for children.

Title: Electricity and Gas - Emissions Reductions, Rate Regulation, Cost Recovery, Infrastructure, Planning, Renewable Energy Portfolio Standard, and Energy Assistance Programs (Next Generation Energy Act)
Synopsis: Authorizing the Department of Housing and Community Development to issue loans, in addition to grants, for certain purposes relating to reducing direct greenhouse gas emissions from certain multifamily residential buildings; requiring the Maryland Energy Administration, in coordination with the Public Service Commission and the Department of Natural Resources, to pursue certain agreements with neighboring states and federal agencies related to the development of new nuclear energy generation stations; etc.
bill_summary: The bill authorizes loans and grants to reduce greenhouse gas emissions from multifamily buildings, expands state efforts in nuclear energy development, updates regulations for utilities, promotes clean energy projects including nuclear and renewable projects, establishes procurement processes for energy storage and generation, and implements related programs and funding mechanisms to advance Maryland's energy and climate goals.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Housing and Community Development and Maryland Energy Administration
stakeholders: Low- to moderate-income residents, energy companies, contractors, small, minority, women–owned, veteran–owned businesses, and general Maryland residents
innovative_summary: The bill employs a comprehensive and technologically diverse approach, including nuclear innovation, long-term energy storage, and streamlined procurement processes, driving Maryland's transition to clean and reliable energy.
child_poverty_direct_summary: High, due to targeted support for low-income communities and workforce development programs in the energy sector.

Title: Public Utilities - Generating Stations - Generation and Siting (Renewable Energy Certainty Act)
Synopsis: Altering the factors the Public Service Commission must consider before taking final action on a certificate of public convenience and necessity; establishing a distributed generation certificate of public convenience and necessity to authorize the construction and operation of a certain distributed solar energy generating system; requiring the Power Plant Research Program, by July 1, 2026, to develop and submit to the Commission proposed siting and design requirements and licensing conditions; etc.
bill_summary: This bill updates regulations for solar energy generating stations in Maryland, establishing new siting, design, and permit requirements, creating a distributed generation certificate process, and promoting community solar projects and innovations in solar contractor licensing.
responsible_party: Maryland Public Service Commission and Maryland Department of Natural Resources
stakeholders: Residents, local governments, solar industry, environmental groups, low- and moderate-income communities
innovative_summary: The bill introduces innovative programs such as automated community solar enrollment, standardized siting and licensing requirements, and a new process for partnership-based power purchase agreements, leveraging technology and streamlined procedures.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has high potential to reduce child poverty by promoting affordable solar energy and energy equity programs targeted at low- and moderate-income communities.

Title: Energy Resource Adequacy and Planning Act
Synopsis: Establishing the Strategic Energy Planning Office; requiring the Office to develop a Comprehensive Wholesale Energy Markets and Bulk Power System Risk Report and examine certain scenarios to support the development of the Risk Report; requiring the Risk Report to assess wholesale energy market financial resource adequacy and reliability risks and to identify any necessary cost-effective solutions that ensure electric system reliability while meeting the State's energy policy goals; etc.
bill_summary: The bill establishes the Strategic Energy Planning Office within the Maryland Public Service Commission, requiring it to develop comprehensive energy forecasts, conduct risk assessments of wholesale energy markets, and examine scenarios to support energy planning with a focus on reliability and affordability. It also mandates studies, stakeholder engagement, and the development of integrated resource plans for electric companies, as well as related reports and regulatory requirements.
responsible_party: Maryland Public Service Commission and the Strategic Energy Planning Office
stakeholders: Electricity consumers, ratepayers, energy and utility companies, state agencies, and the general public in Maryland impacted by energy planning and market risks.
innovative_summary: The bill employs advanced energy modeling, comprehensive risk assessments, stakeholder engagement processes, and long-term scenario planning, utilizing new analytical tools and integrating diverse data sources, representing a significant modernization effort in state energy planning.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has the potential to reduce child poverty indirectly by promoting affordable, reliable, and clean energy that can decrease household energy costs and support economic development.

Title: Health Insurance, Family Planning Services, and Confidentiality of Medical Records - Consumer Protections - Updates
Synopsis: Updating references to federal law related to family planning services, grandfathered plans, explanation of benefits, summaries of benefits and coverage, medical loss ratios, catastrophic plans, annual limits for cost sharing, prescription drugs, and rescissions; altering the definitions of "legally protected health care" and "sensitive health services" to include gender-affirming care for purposes of law governing the disclosure of information regarding sensitive health services; etc.
bill_summary: This bill updates Maryland laws related to health insurance, family planning services, and confidentiality of medical records, including references to federal laws, funding conditions, and definitions such as 'sensitive health services' and 'family planning providers.' It also establishes a state program to support family planning services.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Health and Maryland Insurance Administration
stakeholders: Individuals seeking family planning and reproductive health services in Maryland, including gender–affirming care recipients
innovative_summary: The bill employs a comprehensive approach by updating legal references, ensuring continuity of services for providers lost federal funding, and establishing state-funded programs to support family planning, reflecting innovative coordination between federal and state health policies.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program's focus on accessible family planning services has the potential to reduce child poverty by improving reproductive health and economic stability for families.

Title: Mechanical Repair Contracts - Technical Service Bulletins
Synopsis: Prohibiting a mechanical repair contract from containing a provision precluding coverage for service to a motor vehicle solely for issues identified in a technical services bulletin and prohibiting the denial of a service claim solely for such an issue by a guarantor or provider.
bill_summary: The bill establishes regulations for mechanical repair contracts for motor vehicles, including prohibiting deceptive statements, ensuring truthful testimonials, and preventing coverage denial based solely on issues identified in technical service bulletins.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Insurance
stakeholders: Motor vehicle consumers, vehicle repair industry, insurance providers
innovative_summary: The bill introduces new rules to prevent denial of coverage based on technical service bulletins, enhancing consumer protection and transparency for mechanical repair contracts.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill's focus on improving transparency and preventing unfair contract practices may have an indirect impact on reducing child poverty by protecting consumer rights.

Title: Judicial and Public Safety for Service Members Act
Synopsis: Establishing rules of interpretation related to the uniformed services; altering the rule of interpretation for "veteran"; and altering the application of certain provisions of judicial proceedings, corrections, criminal, family, public safety, and real property laws to apply to all uniformed services, rather than only the armed forces.
bill_summary: This bill updates Maryland laws to expand protections, rights, and definitions for members of the uniformed services, veterans, and military families. It clarifies legal protections in various contexts, including correctional services, judicial proceedings, family law, public safety, real property, and general provisions, aligning these with federal definitions and standards.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Veterans and Military Families
stakeholders: Members of the military, veterans, and their families in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill primarily updates legal definitions and protections to align state laws with federal standards, without employing new technologies or approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has limited direct impact on child poverty as it mainly focuses on legal protections and definitions for military-related populations.

Title: Montgomery County Planning Board and Washington Suburban Sanitary Commission - Open Meetings - Live Streaming Requirement MC/PG 101-25
Synopsis: Establishing that certain project site visits and educational field tours do not constitute open meetings subject to the requirement that the Montgomery County Planning Board and the Washington Suburban Sanitary Commission, respectively, stream live video or audio of their open meetings.
bill_summary: The bill establishes requirements for live streaming and archiving open meetings of the Montgomery County Planning Board and the Washington Suburban Sanitary Commission, including conditions for when meetings must be streamed and exceptions for site visits and educational tours.
responsible_party: Montgomery County Planning Board and Washington Suburban Sanitary Commission
stakeholders: Residents and stakeholders of Montgomery County and the Washington Suburban Sanitary Service Area
innovative_summary: The bill employs technology to enhance transparency by requiring live streaming and archiving of open meetings, with specific conditions and exceptions.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill's focus on transparency and accessibility of government meetings may indirectly support initiatives that benefit vulnerable populations, but it does not explicitly target child poverty.

Title: Prince George's County - Board of Appeals - Membership MC/PG 106-25
Synopsis: Altering the membership of the board of appeals in Prince George's County to be at least three members; and altering the number of members of the board required to concur in any resolution to a simple majority.
bill_summary: This bill alters the membership requirements of the Board of Appeals in Prince George's County, including the number of members and the voting requirement for resolutions.
responsible_party: Prince George's County Council
stakeholders: Residents and officials in Prince George's County involved with land use and appeals processes
innovative_summary: The bill makes administrative changes to the existing Board of Appeals, without introducing new technologies or approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill does not directly impact child poverty levels.

Title: Commission on Behavioral Health Care Treatment and Access - Workgroups
Synopsis: Requiring the Commission on Behavioral Health Care Treatment and Access to establish a workgroup on the improvement of health, social, and economic outcomes related to substance use; requiring the workgroup to make recommendations on changes to State laws, policies and practices needed to mitigate the harm related to criminalization of substance use and related to the discharge of patients from substance use treatment programs; and requiring the workgroup to submit a certain report annually.
bill_summary: This bill modifies the membership and responsibilities of the Maryland Commission on Behavioral Health Care Treatment and Access, establishes new workgroups, including one focused on improving health, social, and economic outcomes related to substance use, and outlines their review and recommendation tasks.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Health
stakeholders: Individuals affected by behavioral health issues, including those with substance use disorders, their families, healthcare providers, criminal justice system, and policymakers.
innovative_summary: The bill employs a collaborative approach by establishing specialized workgroups to comprehensively evaluate and improve behavioral health and substance use outcomes, integrating data review, policy recommendations, and targeted focus groups.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has the potential to reduce child poverty by improving access to behavioral health services, housing, and employment support for affected populations.

Title: Life and Health Insurance Policies and Annuity and Health Maintenance Organization Contracts - Discretionary Clauses - Prohibition
Synopsis: Prohibiting the use of discretionary clauses in life insurance policies, health insurance policies, annuity contracts, and health maintenance organization contracts.
bill_summary: The bill prohibits the use of discretionary clauses in health insurance policies, life insurance policies, annuity contracts, and health maintenance organization contracts in Maryland, starting from January 1, 2026.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Health and the Maryland Insurance Administration
stakeholders: Consumers purchasing health and life insurance policies, HMO members, insurance companies, and health maintenance organizations
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a legal restriction on discretionary clauses in insurance policies, which is a regulatory enforcement approach rather than an innovative use of technology.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill's prohibition on discretionary clauses can lead to more transparent and fair insurance practices, potentially benefiting vulnerable populations including children by providing clearer coverage terms.

Title: State Retirement and Pension System - Administrative Fees - Repeal
Synopsis: Requiring the Board of Trustees for the State Retirement and Pension System to certify certain employer contribution rates each fiscal year; requiring the employer contribution rates to include recognition of certain administrative and operational expenses; repealing a requirement that certain administrative and operational expenses of the State Retirement and Pension System and the State Retirement Agency be funded by charging each participating employer an administrative fee for each system participant; etc.
bill_summary: The bill eliminates the administrative fee charged to employers for the administration of the Maryland State Retirement and Pension System, requiring the system to fund administrative and operational expenses from the accumulation fund instead. It mandates annual certification of contribution rates, includes expenses in employer contribution rates, and sets provisions for funding and reporting.
responsible_party: Board of Trustees for the State Retirement and Pension System
stakeholders: Employers, state employees, retirees, and local government employers participating in the Maryland State Retirement System
innovative_summary: The program employs a new approach by repealing administrative fees and funding system expenses from the accumulation fund, integrating expenses into employer contribution rates, which streamlines funding and transparency.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill's direct impact on child poverty is low, as it primarily addresses pension fund management and funding structures.

Title: Residential Real Property - Landlord and Tenant - Notice of Landlord Entry
Synopsis: Requiring a landlord to provide a tenant with certain written notice in a certain manner at least 24 hours in advance of when the landlord intends to enter a leased premises, except in the event of a certain emergency; and authorizing the court to issue a certain injunction or assess certain damages under certain circumstances.
bill_summary: This bill requires landlords of residential property in Maryland to give tenants written notice before entering the leased premises for various purposes, except in emergencies, and specifies the manner and timing of such notices.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Housing and Community Development (implied)
stakeholders: Residential tenants and landlords in Maryland
innovative_summary: The program introduces a structured notice requirement for landlord entries, including electronic delivery options, which modernizes and clarifies the notification process.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill directly addresses tenant rights and housing conditions, which can indirectly influence child poverty through improved housing stability.

Title: Prince George's County - Federal Bureau of Investigation Headquarters - Mandated Appropriation
Synopsis: Requiring the Governor to include $200,000,000 in the annual operating or capital budget bill for site redevelopment and transportation infrastructure improvements if the U.S. General Services Administration applies to Prince George's County or the State for a permit associated with the relocation of the Federal Bureau of Investigation Headquarters to Prince George's County.
bill_summary: The bill mandates the Maryland governor to include at least $200 million in the state budget for site redevelopment and transportation infrastructure improvements related to the potential relocation of the Federal Bureau of Investigation Headquarters to Prince George's County, contingent upon the federal government applying to the state or county for a permit for this relocation.
responsible_party: Governor of Maryland
stakeholders: Residents and government agencies in Prince George's County and the State of Maryland, federal agencies
innovative_summary: The bill employs a straightforward legislative approach to secure funding for a future federal project, without employing new technologies or innovative approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The direct impact on child poverty is likely minimal, as the bill primarily aims to secure funding for infrastructural development related to federal relocation.

Title: Local Government - Local Personnel - Leave With Pay
Synopsis: Establishing that governmental units may provide disaster service leave with pay to certain employees; establishing that an employee of a governmental unit of a county or a municipality in the State may be entitled to disaster service leave with pay under certain circumstances; authorizing certain governmental units to waive certain requirements for disaster service leave; and authorizing a governmental unit of a county or a municipality to provide leave with pay under certain circumstances.
bill_summary: This bill allows government units in Maryland to provide disaster service leave with pay to employees who volunteer or serve in various emergency and disaster response roles, and to extend certain paid leave options for employees involved in jury service, military training, and other circumstances.
responsible_party: Local government agencies of Maryland, including counties and municipalities
stakeholders: Employees of Maryland counties and municipalities, emergency service volunteers, and residents affected by disasters or emergencies
innovative_summary: The bill employs a flexible approach to paid disaster service leave, allowing governmental units to waive approval requirements and extend leave duration during prolonged disasters, which represents an adaptive management approach.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program could potentially reduce child poverty by supporting workers involved in emergency services, although its direct impact is limited.

Title: Health Insurance - Individual Market Stabilization - Establishment of the State-Based Health Insurance Subsidies Program
Synopsis: Establishing the State-Based Health Insurance Subsidies Program to provide subsidies to individuals in the State to mitigate the impact of a reduction in certain federal advance premium tax credits for calendar years 2026 through 2028; and requiring the Maryland Health Benefit Exchange to implement the Program under certain circumstances.
bill_summary: The bill establishes the State–Based Health Insurance Subsidies Program in Maryland to provide financial assistance to individuals in response to potential federal reductions in premium tax credits, aiming to stabilize the individual health insurance market.
responsible_party: Maryland Health Benefit Exchange
stakeholders: Individuals purchasing health insurance in Maryland, especially those affected by federal subsidy changes
innovative_summary: The program employs a targeted subsidy approach in response to federal policy changes, coordinating state funding and regulations to stabilize and maintain affordability in the health insurance market.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has a moderate potential to reduce child poverty by making health insurance more affordable for families, thus increasing access to health care.

Title: Behavioral Health Advisory Council and the Commission on Behavioral Health Care Treatment and Access - Plan to Implement Early and Periodic Screening, Diagnostic, and Treatment Requirements
Synopsis: Requiring the Behavioral Health Advisory Council and the Commission on Behavioral Health Care Treatment and Access, through its workgroup, to implement Early and Periodic Screening, Diagnostic, and Treatment requirements; requiring the workgroup to provide recommendations to implement recommendations in a certain Centers for Medicare and Medicaid Services State Health Official letter; and requiring the Maryland Department of Health to report its findings and recommendations to the General Assembly by January 1, 2026.
bill_summary: The bill requires the Maryland Department of Health to convene a workgroup to develop a plan for implementing Early and Periodic Screening, Diagnostic, and Treatment (EPSDT) requirements for children's behavioral health, focusing on screening, assessment, community services, and addressing urgent needs. The workgroup will include professionals, specialists, advocates, and parents, and will submit a report with recommendations to the General Assembly by January 1, 2026.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Health
stakeholders: Children with behavioral health issues, their families, and caregivers, as well as behavioral health professionals and advocates.
innovative_summary: The program employs a collaborative, multi-stakeholder approach to improve early behavioral health screening and services for children, incorporating best practices and diagnostic tools.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has potential to directly reduce child poverty by improving access to mental health services and early interventions for children from underserved communities.

Title: Housing Authorities - Tax-Exempt Status - Modifications
Synopsis: Exempting certain real property owned by certain nonprofit entities created by public housing authorities from State and local property taxation; directing certain nonprofit entities created by public housing authorities to make payment in lieu of taxes that may be set by mutual agreement with a political subdivision; and applying the Act to all taxable years beginning after June 30, 2025.
bill_summary: This bill modifies the tax exemption policies for property owned by public housing authorities and their subsidiaries in Maryland, allowing certain nonprofit entities created by these authorities to be exempt from state and local taxes if they meet specific control and ownership criteria, and to make payments in lieu of taxes through agreements.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Housing and Community Development
stakeholders: Public housing authorities, nonprofit entities created by housing authorities, and residents of affordable housing in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a tailored tax exemption structure for nonprofit entities controlled by housing authorities, enabling them to operate with tax privileges that facilitate affordable housing development and management.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has a moderate potential to directly impact child poverty by supporting the development and maintenance of affordable housing for low-income families.

Title: Maryland Medical Assistance Program and Health Insurance - Coverage for Anesthesia - Prohibiting Time Limitations
Synopsis: Requiring, beginning January 1, 2026, the Maryland Medical Assistance Program, managed care organizations, and certain insurers, nonprofit health service plans, and health maintenance organizations, if providing coverage for the delivery of anesthesia for a procedure for which a licensed medical professional issues an order, to provide the coverage for the duration of the procedure; prohibiting the establishment, implementation, or enforcement of policies or practices  that place time limitations on the delivery of anesthesia; etc.
bill_summary: This bill requires the Maryland Medical Assistance Program, managed care organizations, and certain health insurers to cover the full delivery of anesthesia for procedures without imposing time limits, starting January 1, 2026.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Health and the Maryland Insurance Administration
stakeholders: Patients requiring anesthesia, healthcare providers, Medicaid beneficiaries, and insured individuals in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a legal mandate ensuring no arbitrary time limits are placed on anesthesia delivery, promoting comprehensive patient care without restrictions.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill's focus on healthcare coverage can improve health outcomes but does not specifically target child poverty.

Title: Health Insurance - Step Therapy or Fail-First Protocols - Drugs to Treat Associated Conditions of Advanced Metastatic Cancer
Synopsis: Prohibiting certain insurers, nonprofit health service plans, and health maintenance organizations from imposing a step therapy or fail-first protocol for certain prescription drugs prescribed by a treating physician to treat a symptom of or side effect from the treatment of stage four metastatic cancer and use of the prescription drug is consistent with best practices for treatment of the condition.
bill_summary: This bill prohibits certain health insurance providers from imposing step therapy or fail-first protocols on prescriptions used to treat symptoms or side effects of advanced metastatic cancer, under specific conditions, starting January 1, 2026.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Health and Insurance
stakeholders: Patients with advanced metastatic cancer and their healthcare providers
innovative_summary: The bill introduces specific exemptions to existing step therapy protocols for a vulnerable patient population, supporting more personalized and timely treatment.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has limited direct impact on child poverty as it primarily concerns adult cancer treatment protocols.

Title: Montgomery County - Alcoholic Beverages - Beauty Salon and Barbershop License MC 3-25
Synopsis: Expanding eligibility for a certain beauty salon license in Montgomery County to include a holder of a certain barbershop permit; authorizing a holder of the license to provide up to 1.7 ounces of liquor for on-premises consumption in addition to beer and wine; and authorizing the holder to provide not more than 12 ounces of beer, 5 ounces of wine, or 1.7 ounces of liquor for on-premises consumption by a beauty salon or barbershop customer; and requiring an annual license fee of $100.
bill_summary: The bill expands eligibility for the beauty salon license in Montgomery County to include barbershops, allowing license holders to provide up to 12 ounces of beer, 5 ounces of wine, and 1.7 ounces of liquor for on-premises consumption in connection with cosmetology or barbering services, or at fundraising events.
responsible_party: Montgomery County Department of Permitting Services
stakeholders: Beauty salons, barbershops, and their customers in Montgomery County
innovative_summary: The program introduces a new licensing category for barbershops and expands alcohol service rights in these establishments, leveraging existing licenses and permits to create a new public service environment.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill potentially increases economic activity in beauty salons and barbershops, which could benefit workers and owners, indirectly affecting child poverty.

Title: Insurance - Automobile Insurance - Maryland Automobile Insurance Fund and Affordability Study
Synopsis: Requiring the Maryland Automobile Insurance Fund to calculate and report its risk based capital level in accordance with certain provisions of insurance law and maintain total adjusted capital in a certain amount; establishing that certain provisions of insurance law regarding prior approval rate making apply to the Fund during a certain time period and under certain circumstances; requiring the Maryland Insurance Administration to establish a workgroup to study automobile insurance affordability; etc.
bill_summary: The bill establishes requirements for the Maryland Automobile Insurance Fund regarding its capital levels, rate determination, and premium calculation processes. It also mandates the Maryland Insurance Administration to study automobile insurance affordability and submit a report, and permits the Fund to certify an additional assessment up to $20 million for 2025 operating results.
responsible_party: Maryland Insurance Administration and Maryland Automobile Insurance Fund
stakeholders: Automobile insurance consumers, policymakers, and automobile insurers in Maryland.
innovative_summary: The bill employs a combination of capital requirement oversight, rate study, and consumer affordability analysis, including a targeted workgroup with stakeholder input, which represents an integrated approach to automobile insurance regulation. There is limited use of new technologies.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill's focus on insurance affordability and financial thresholds may indirectly influence economic stability, but it does not directly target child poverty.

Title: Public Health - Health Equity Dashboard
Synopsis: Requiring the Maryland Department of Health, in collaboration with the Commission on Health Equity, to develop a clear and easy-to-understand graphic data dashboard that includes age-adjusted health disparity data disaggregated by race, ethnicity, and gender; and requiring the Department to update the data dashboard on a quarterly basis, as determined by data availability.
bill_summary: This bill requires the Maryland Department of Health, in collaboration with the Commission on Health Equity, to develop and maintain a health equity data dashboard that displays various health disparities data disaggregated by race, ethnicity, and gender. The dashboard must be updated at least every 30 days and be accessible on the department's website.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Health in collaboration with the Commission on Health Equity
stakeholders: Public health officials, minority and underserved communities, policymakers, researchers
innovative_summary: The bill employs a publicly accessible, dynamic data dashboard utilizing disaggregated health data, promoting transparency and data-driven decision-making to address health disparities.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has a moderate potential to impact child poverty by highlighting disparities that can inform targeted interventions.

Title: Maryland Department of Health - AHEAD Model Implementation - Electronic Health Care Transactions and Population Health Improvement Fund
Synopsis: Clarifying that electronic health care transactions information may be used to support the participation of the State in the States Advancing All-Payer Health Equity Approaches and Development (AHEAD) Model and any successor models; establishing the Population Health Improvement Fund to support the statewide population health targets under the AHEAD Model and any successor models; authorizing the Health Services Cost Review Commission to assess a uniform, broad-based, and reasonable amount in hospital rates to be credited to the Fund; etc.
bill_summary: The bill establishes a Population Health Improvement Fund to support population health initiatives and the state's participation in the AHEAD Model, a health equity approach supported by the Centers for Medicare and Medicaid Innovation. It clarifies the use of electronic health data for health improvement programs and allocates funding through hospital rate assessments and other sources.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Health and the Health Services Cost Review Commission
stakeholders: Healthcare providers, public health agencies, patients, vulnerable populations, and policymakers involved in health equity and population health in Maryland.
innovative_summary: The bill employs a new approach to fund population health improvements through a dedicated fund supported by hospital rate assessments, with a focus on health equity and data sharing for public health.
child_poverty_direct_summary: High potential to impact child poverty through improved population health, health equity, and social determinants.

Title: Allegany County - Alcoholic Beverages - Minimum Age for Employment of Underage Individuals
Synopsis: Altering the minimum age for employment in Allegany County for alcoholic beverages license holders that do not derive more than half of their revenues from the sale of food from 16 years of age to 18 years of age.
bill_summary: This bill amends the rules in Allegany County regarding the minimum age for employment in establishments serving alcoholic beverages, raising the minimum age from 16 to 18 for certain license holders, especially those that do not derive most of their revenue from food sales.
responsible_party: Allegany County government or licensing authority
stakeholders: Employers, underage individuals seeking employment, and alcoholic beverage license holders in Allegany County
innovative_summary: The bill employs a straightforward legal change without introducing new technologies or novel approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has little to no direct impact on child poverty as it pertains primarily to employment age restrictions for alcohol license holders.

Title: Public Utilities - Solar Energy Generating Systems - Systems Located on or Over Water Retention Ponds, Quarries, or Brownfields
Synopsis: Providing that solar energy generating systems located on or over certain water retention ponds or quarries are eligible for the Small Solar Energy Generating System Incentive Program; and authorizing the Mayor and City Council of Baltimore City or the governing body of a county or municipal corporation to grant by law, a certain property tax credit against the county or municipal corporation property tax imposed on certain nonresidential solar energy generating systems.
bill_summary: The bill expands eligibility for the Small Solar Energy Generating System Incentive Program to include floating solar systems on or over water retention ponds, quarries, or brownfields. It also authorizes property tax credits for certain nonresidential solar systems on brownfields or water retention ponds.
responsible_party: Maryland Public Utilities Commission and local governing bodies in Baltimore City and other counties or municipalities
stakeholders: Nonresidential solar energy system developers, local governments, environmental redevelopment projects, and communities near brownfields and industrial water sites
innovative_summary: The bill introduces the inclusion of floating solar systems on water retention ponds and brownfields into existing solar programs, and grants local governments authority to provide property tax credits, fostering innovative use of industrial sites for renewable energy.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill could potentially impact disadvantaged communities by promoting renewable energy deployment in industrial and brownfield sites, indirectly supporting economic development and environmental health.

Title: Public Safety - State Clearinghouse for Missing Persons
Synopsis: Renaming and transferring the State Clearinghouse for Missing Children to be the State Clearinghouse for Missing Persons; requiring the Department of State Police to study the Department's capacity to report about persons who have disappeared from, or thought to be located in Maryland, to the National Missing and Unidentified Persons System; and requiring the Department to submit its findings to the Governor and the General Assembly by December 1, 2025.
bill_summary: The bill renames the State Clearinghouse for Missing Children to the State Clearinghouse for Missing Persons, transferring responsibilities and updating reporting requirements. It also requires the Department of State Police to assess and report on the capacity to share missing persons information with the national system.
responsible_party: Department of State Police
stakeholders: Missing persons and law enforcement agencies in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill primarily updates existing structures and reporting protocols; it does not introduce new technologies or fundamentally new approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill's impact on child poverty appears minimal as it mainly concerns updating a reporting system for missing persons.

Title: Child Care Scholarship Program - Youth Transitioning From Foster Placement to Successful Adulthood Program - Establishment
Synopsis: Establishing the Youth Transitioning From Foster Placement to Successful Adulthood Program in the Child Care Scholarship Program to remove certain application barriers for parenting foster youth and increase eligibility access to the Child Care Scholarship Program;
bill_summary: This bill establishes the Youth Transitioning From Foster Placement to Successful Adulthood Pilot Program within the Child Care Scholarship Program. It aims to assist foster youths in accessing child care subsidies and remove application barriers for foster youth until December 31, 2028.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Education
stakeholders: Foster youths aged 16 to 21 and their children
innovative_summary: The program employs new approaches by removing application barriers and integrating a pilot program specifically for foster youth to improve access to child care subsidies.
child_poverty_direct_summary: High potential to directly impact child poverty by providing better access to child care for foster youth and their children.

Title: Office of Child Care Advisory Council - Membership - Alterations
Synopsis: Increasing the maximum number of members of the Office of Child Care Advisory Council from 30 to 31; and adding a representative of the Maryland Association of Public Library Administrators to the membership of the Council.
bill_summary: The bill increases the maximum number of members on the Maryland Office of Child Care Advisory Council from 30 to 31, adds a representative from the Maryland Association of Public Library Administrators to the council, and makes related alterations to its membership rules.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Education
stakeholders: Child care providers, public libraries, early childhood education community, and possibly families and children in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill mainly modifies the composition of an advisory council without establishing new programs or using new technologies.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has limited direct impact on child poverty as it mainly involves adjustments to a council's membership.

Title: Correctional Services - Geriatric and Medical Parole
Synopsis: Requiring the Maryland Parole Commission to consider the age of an incarcerated individual when determining whether to grant parole; altering how the Commission evaluates a request for medical parole; requiring the Commission to develop procedures for assessing parole requests by certain incarcerated individuals; repealing the authorization for the Governor to disapprove of a decision by the Commission to grant medical parole; requiring the Commission to conduct a certain risk assessment at a certain time; etc.
bill_summary: This bill modifies the Maryland correctional parole system by establishing procedures for medical and geriatric parole, including considering age and medical conditions, developing risk assessments, and defining eligibility criteria for special paroled populations such as elderly inmates. It repeals certain existing provisions and creates new guidelines for parole applications, hearings, and assessments, and allocates savings for reinvestment initiatives.
responsible_party: Maryland Parole Commission
stakeholders: Incarcerated individuals, especially elderly and medically debilitated inmates, victims, correctional staff, and the broader community.
innovative_summary: The bill employs a comprehensive, health and age-based assessment approach for parole decisions, incorporating risk assessments, victim input, and savings reinvestment, representing a significant modernization of the traditional parole process.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has a moderate potential to impact child poverty by potentially reducing incarceration costs and improving reinvestment funds aimed at community and social programs.

Title: Dorchester County - Well and On-Site Sewage Disposal Activities - Privatization Program
Synopsis: Authorizing the Department of the Environment, at the request of the Dorchester County government and the local health department or county agency in Dorchester County that has received a well or on-site sewage disposal system delegation of authority by the Department, to establish a privatization program for the performance of activities associated with the well or on-site sewage disposal system delegation of authority in Dorchester County.
bill_summary: This bill authorizes the Maryland Department of the Environment to establish a privatization program in Dorchester County for activities related to well and on-site sewage disposal systems, at the request of local authorities, with the aim of streamlining or privatizing certain environmental health activities.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of the Environment
stakeholders: Residents and businesses in Dorchester County requiring well and sewage disposal services
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a privatization approach to environmental health services, allowing private entities to perform certain activities traditionally managed by government, which is a relatively innovative approach in environmental regulation.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program could potentially improve access to environmental health services, which might indirectly reduce child poverty by improving living conditions.

Title: Workgroup on Home Detention Monitoring - Report Alterations and Data Collection
