Synopsis: Requiring the Workgroup on Home Detention Monitoring to study and make recommendations to the General Assembly regarding certain policies, practices, and responses when a person violates a condition of home detention monitoring; and requiring the Department of Public Safety and Correctional Services to collect and report to the Workgroup certain data on or before September 1 each year.
bill_summary: The bill establishes a Workgroup on Home Detention Monitoring to study policies, practices, and responses related to violations of home detention conditions and mandates data collection and reporting by the Department of Public Safety and Correctional Services.
responsible_party: Department of Public Safety and Correctional Services
stakeholders: Individuals on home detention, law enforcement, and judicial agencies
innovative_summary: The program introduces a dedicated workgroup to evaluate and improve home detention policies using data collection and analysis.
child_poverty_direct_summary: Potential for moderate impact through improved monitoring and responses that could reduce recidivism and support prisoners' reintegration.

Title: Unemployment Insurance - Child Support Arrearage to Work Pilot Program - Established
Synopsis: Establishing a Child Support Arrearage to Work Pilot Program within the Department of Labor to connect individuals who are unemployed and in arrears under a child support order with employment opportunities in the State; and requiring the Department to report on or before July 1, 2026, on the Department's findings and any recommendations related to the continuation of the Program.
bill_summary: The bill establishes the Child Support Arrearage to Work Pilot Program within the Maryland Department of Labor to connect unemployed individuals with child support arrearages to employment opportunities in the state, including state government jobs. The program aims to help individuals reduce arrearages through employment.
responsible_party: Department of Labor, in consultation with the Department of Human Services and the Department of Budget and Management
stakeholders: Unemployed individuals in Maryland who are in arrears on child support
innovative_summary: The program is a new initiative linking child support arrearage resolution with employment opportunities, using coordinated efforts across state agencies.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has the potential to reduce child poverty by helping parents in arrears secure employment and stabilize income.

Title: Public Health - Buprenorphine - Training Grant Program and Workgroup
Synopsis: Establishing the Buprenorphine Training Grant Program to assist counties with offsetting the cost of training paramedics to administer buprenorphine; including the Program as an authorized use of funding from the Opioid Restitution Fund; requiring the Governor to include in the annual budget bill an appropriation of at least $50,000 from the Opioid Restitution Fund for the Program; and requiring the Maryland Office of Overdose Response to convene a workgroup to study access to buprenorphine in the State.
bill_summary: This bill establishes the Buprenorphine Training Grant Program to assist Maryland counties in funding training for paramedics to administer buprenorphine, and creates a workgroup to study access to buprenorphine in the state.
responsible_party: Maryland Office of Overdose Response
stakeholders: Paramedics, healthcare providers, substance use disorder patients, Maryland counties
innovative_summary: The bill employs a dedicated grant program for paramedic training and a state-wide workgroup to analyze and improve access to buprenorphine, incorporating data collection and strategic planning.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has potential to reduce child poverty by expanding access to substance use disorder treatment and recovery services, which can stabilize families.

Title: Baltimore County - Alcoholic Beverages - Change of Location
Synopsis: Establishing an additional circumstance under which the Board of License Commissioners for Baltimore County may approve a change of location for a certain alcoholic beverages license; and providing that the Board may approve a certain change if the license was originally issued within the same election district and has been at the same location for a least 10 years.
bill_summary: This bill amends the rules in Baltimore County for changing the location of alcoholic beverages licenses, establishing additional conditions under which licenses can be transferred or relocated, including a new provision granting a license the ability to relocate within the same election district if it has been at the same location for at least 10 years.
responsible_party: Baltimore County Board of License Commissioners
stakeholders: Alcoholic beverages license holders, business owners, and residents in Baltimore County
innovative_summary: The bill introduces flexibility in the location of alcohol licenses within Baltimore County by allowing longer-standing licenses to relocate within the same election district, which is a nuanced policy adjustment rather than a technology-based innovation.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has minimal direct impact on child poverty, as it mainly changes licensing rules for alcohol vendors.

Title: Public Health - Maryland Interested Parties Advisory Group - Establishment
Synopsis: Establishing the Maryland Interested Parties Advisory Group to ensure adequate access to applicable home- and community-based services in the State; requiring the Maryland Department of Health to provide certain support to the Advisory Group; and requiring by September 1 each year beginning in 2026, the Advisory Group to report its activities and recommendations to the Governor and the General Assembly.
bill_summary: The bill establishes the Maryland Interested Parties Advisory Group to ensure adequate access to home and community-based Medicaid services and to maintain an adequate direct care workforce in Maryland.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Health
stakeholders: Medicaid home and community-based service consumers, direct care workers, providers, and advocacy groups in Maryland.
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a structured advisory group that combines data analysis, public input, and inter-agency collaboration to improve Medicaid services and workforce conditions, employing data transparency and stakeholder engagement approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has high potential to directly impact child poverty by improving access to essential health and community services that support families and children.

Title: Maryland Collaborative to Improve Children's Oral Health Through School-Based Programs - Establishment
Synopsis: Establishing the Maryland Collaborative to Improve Children's Oral Health Through School-Based Programs to study and make recommendations on ways to improve school-based dental programs; and requiring the Collaborative to submit an interim report by December 1, 2025, and a final report on its findings and recommendations by October 1, 2026.
bill_summary: This bill authorizes dental hygienists to practice under general supervision in schools and school-based health centers and establishes the Maryland Collaborative to improve children's oral health through school-based programs by studying and recommending improvements to current dental services for children.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Health
stakeholders: Children in Maryland, school personnel, dental providers, and families
innovative_summary: The bill promotes innovative approaches by expanding dental hygienists' roles in schools, supporting policy initiatives, and establishing a collaborative to explore new models of pediatric dental care.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has significant potential to reduce child poverty by improving access to dental care, which is closely linked to overall health and well-being.

Title: State Public Transit Service and Stations - Exclusion for Assault and Bodily Injury
Synopsis: Providing that a person alleged by a public transit operator to have committed an assault or other intentional act causing bodily injury may be prohibited from using a State public transit service or entering a State public transit service station; requiring the Maryland Transit Administration to create a rider code of conduct and implement a comprehensive internal safety program to strengthen protection for operators and passengers; etc.
bill_summary: The bill amends Maryland law to prevent individuals accused of assault or causing bodily injury on public transit from being barred from using transit services or stations, prescribes a process for establishing a rider code of conduct and safety program, and creates procedures for addressing assault incidents involving transit users.
responsible_party: Maryland Transit Administration (MTA)
stakeholders: Public transit riders, transit operators, and passengers in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a comprehensive internal safety and conduct program, including a workgroup to develop a rider code of conduct and safety protocols, emphasizing process improvements and behavioral standards.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill’s focus on transit safety could improve access and safety for vulnerable populations, indirectly helping to reduce child poverty by supporting transit accessibility.

Title: Baltimore County - Alcoholic Beverages - Waiting Period After License Denial
Synopsis: Establishing in Baltimore County certain waiting periods for the application for or issuance of an alcoholic beverages license at a specific location if an application for a license at that location has been previously denied.
bill_summary: This bill establishes waiting periods in Baltimore County for applying for or receiving an alcoholic beverage license if a previous application for the same location was denied. It specifies a 6-month waiting period after the first denial and a 2-year waiting period after a second denial.
responsible_party: Baltimore County Alcoholic Beverages Licensing Board
stakeholders: Alcoholic beverage license applicants and residents of Baltimore County
innovative_summary: The bill implements a structured waiting period approach for license applications following denials, which is a targeted policy intervention rather than employing new technologies or innovative methods.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill's focus on licensing rules for alcohol sales is unlikely to directly impact child poverty levels.

Title: Maryland Behavioral Health Crisis Response System – Integration of 9–8–8 Suicide and Crisis Lifeline Network and Outcome Evaluations
Synopsis: Requiring the Maryland Behavioral Health Crisis Response System to have a State 9-8-8 Suicide and Crisis Lifeline, rather than a crisis communication center, in each jurisdiction; requiring each State 9-8-8 Suicide and Crisis Lifeline in the System to coordinate with the national 9-8-8 Suicide and Crisis Lifeline Network to provide supportive counseling, suicide prevention, crisis intervention, referrals to additional resources, and direct dispatch to other services as needed; etc.
bill_summary: The bill requires the Maryland Behavioral Health Crisis Response System to incorporate a State 9–8–8 Suicide and Crisis Lifeline in each jurisdiction, coordinate with the national 9–8–8 network, and include various crisis intervention services. It also mandates outcome evaluations for these services and details data collection and reporting requirements. The system aims to improve crisis response, reduce unnecessary hospitalization, and enhance community-based behavioral health services.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Health
stakeholders: Individuals experiencing behavioral health crises, families, behavioral health providers, emergency services, law enforcement, and the general public in Maryland.
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a comprehensive, unified 9-8-8 crisis response system integrated with a national network, employing modern data evaluation and community-based interventions, which is a relatively innovative approach to mental health crisis management.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program could have a significant impact on child poverty by providing timely mental health crisis support, reducing unnecessary hospitalization, and diverting children and families from criminal justice involvement.

Title: Residential Condominium Unit Insurance - Lapses in Coverage - Prohibition on Denial
Synopsis: Prohibiting an insurer, with respect to residential condominium unit insurance, from refusing to issue a policy based solely on a prior lapse in coverage of the applicant if the lapse was due to an insurer's withdrawal from the market, the lapse in coverage was for no longer than 90 days, the applicant provides an affidavit that the applicant has not incurred any losses during the lapse in coverage, and the applicant provides any other documentation required by the insurer.
bill_summary: This bill prohibits property and casualty insurers from denying coverage for homeowners or renters' residential condominium units solely based on a prior lapse in coverage, under certain conditions. It also authorizes requiring an affidavit from the applicant regarding losses during the lapse.
responsible_party: Maryland Insurance Administration
stakeholders: Homeowners and renters of residential condominium units in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill introduces protections for consumers by preventing denial of coverage solely based on prior coverage lapses, with a requirement for affidavits in specific circumstances.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has minimal direct impact on child poverty, as it mainly affects insurance policy rules.

Title: Real Property - Residential Rental Property - Pet Policy Disclosure (Pet Policy Transparency Act)
Synopsis: Requiring the landlord of a residential rental property to provide the property's pet policy on the property's website and as part of an application form for a rental unit on the property.
bill_summary: The bill requires landlords of residential rental properties in Maryland to disclose their pet policies on their websites, in digital advertisements, rental search platforms, and within rental applications. It aims to increase transparency about pet restrictions, fees, and requirements for prospective tenants.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Housing and Community Development
stakeholders: Residential tenants and landlords in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill employs a digital transparency approach by requiring pet policy disclosures across websites, advertisements, and applications to improve access to pet restriction information for prospective tenants.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill is unlikely to have a direct impact on child poverty because it primarily addresses pet policy disclosures and transparency between landlords and tenants.

Title: Department of the Environment - Definition of Ecological Restoration
Synopsis: Defining the term "ecological restoration" as an activity undertaken with the goal of recovering, re-establishing, or enhancing a degraded, damaged, or destroyed ecosystem through improvements to physical, chemical, or biological characteristics or processes, returning natural or historical functions or services, or protecting or improving resiliency.
bill_summary: This bill defines the term 'ecological restoration' and requires the Maryland Department of the Environment to update relevant regulations to incorporate this definition and ensure consistency.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of the Environment
stakeholders: Ecosystems, environmental agencies, conservation efforts
innovative_summary: The bill emphasizes a formalized definition of ecological restoration and regulatory updates, which is a standard approach rather than a new technological innovation.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill does not directly relate to child poverty or include programs targeting children.

Title: Heating, Ventilation, Air-Conditioning, or Refrigeration Contractors - Equipment Sales
Synopsis: Prohibiting a person from knowingly offering to sell or selling heating, ventilation, air-conditioning, or refrigeration equipment to an individual that does not hold a certain license issued by the Board of Heating, Ventilation, Air-Conditioning, or Refrigeration Contractors except under certain circumstances; requiring certain persons to provide a certain notice to purchasers of heating, ventilation, air-conditioning, or refrigeration equipment at the time of sale; etc.
bill_summary: This bill prohibits unlicensed sales of heating, ventilation, air-conditioning, and refrigeration equipment unless under certain circumstances, and requires sellers to collect and report information on purchasers' licenses.
responsible_party: Maryland State Board of Heating, Ventilation, Air–Conditioning, and Refrigeration Contractors
stakeholders: Heating, ventilation, air-conditioning, and refrigeration equipment sellers and buyers, including licensed professionals
innovative_summary: The bill employs a regulatory approach requiring detailed reporting and license verification for equipment sales, but does not introduce new technologies.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill's direct impact on child poverty is likely minimal as it mainly regulates commercial transactions and licensing.

Title: Montgomery County - Municipal Authority to Regulate Structures - Alterations MC/PG 116-25
Synopsis: Altering the authority of a municipal corporation or governed special taxing district in Montgomery County to adopt an additional or stricter building requirement than is required by a State, regional, or county unit to regulate the construction, repair, or remodeling of certain structures on land zoned for single-family residential use to apply to buildings with four or fewer dwelling units and their accessory structures without regard to the zoning for the land where the building is located.
bill_summary: The bill alters the authority of municipal corporations and special taxing districts in Montgomery County to regulate construction, repair, or remodeling of certain structures, limiting regulations to buildings with four or fewer units and their accessory structures, regardless of zoning.
responsible_party: Montgomery County municipal government or special taxing districts
stakeholders: Residents and property owners within Montgomery County, especially those involved with small residential buildings and their accessory structures
innovative_summary: The bill standardizes the scope of local building regulations across Montgomery County for small residential structures, making the rules more uniform regardless of zoning distinctions.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill's impact on child poverty is indirect; by simplifying and limiting regulation scope, it may impact housing conditions but does not directly target child poverty reduction.

Title: Corporations and Associations – Revisions
Synopsis: Establishing a process for and certain exceptions to the transfer of assets that are collateral for securing a mortgage, pledge, or security interest without the approval of the stockholders; and repealing provisions of law specifying what shall be included in the articles of merger if a limited partnership or limited liability company is a party to the articles.
bill_summary: This bill revises laws regarding corporate asset transfers and mergers in Maryland, including procedures for asset transfers secured as collateral, and amendments to articles of mergers.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Assessments and Taxation
stakeholders: Corporations, Limited Partnerships, LLCs, and other associations in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill mainly updates legal procedures and rules for corporate asset transfers and mergers, with no new technological approaches or innovative methods.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill does not appear to have a direct impact on child poverty, as it mainly involves corporate legal procedures.

Title: Baltimore City – Alcoholic Beverages – Authorizations and Revisions
Synopsis: Requiring the Board of License Commissioners for Baltimore City to impose a fee of not more than $250 for expedited processing of certain Class C per diem licenses; requiring the Board to adopt regulations related to the application process for Class C per diem licenses, including for the denial or revocation of the licenses, and limiting the number of licenses that may be issued to a person for the same location within a certain period of time; etc.
bill_summary: This bill revises alcohol licensing rules in Baltimore City, including fees for expedited processing, application regulation, license issuance restrictions, and specific licensing conditions for certain areas and establishments.
responsible_party: Baltimore City Board of License Commissioners
stakeholders: Businesses and residents in Baltimore City, particularly those involved in alcohol sales and event hosting
innovative_summary: The bill employs tailored licensing conditions and specific geographic restrictions to regulate alcohol sales, which is a nuanced approach but not employing new technologies.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill's provisions do not directly address child poverty.

Title: Montgomery County - Speed Monitoring Systems - High-Risk Highways MC 17-25
Synopsis: Authorizing the placement and use of speed monitoring systems on highways in Montgomery County that are at high risk for certain motor vehicle crashes; prohibiting the placement and use of speed monitoring systems on certain highways in Montgomery County; requiring the fines collected by Montgomery County or by a municipal government in Montgomery County as a result of violations enforced by a speed monitoring system to be used to fund the study, design, and construction of certain safety-related projects; etc.
bill_summary: The bill authorizes the use of speed monitoring systems on certain high-risk highways in Montgomery County, prohibits their placement on controlled access highways, and allocates fines collected from violations to fund safety projects. It also mandates regular evaluations of the systems' effectiveness.
responsible_party: Montgomery County Department of Transportation or relevant local authority
stakeholders: Drivers, residents, and government agencies in Montgomery County
innovative_summary: The bill employs targeted use of speed monitoring technology coupled with a structured evaluation process and revenue allocation to fund safety improvements, reflecting an integrated tech-enabled approach.
child_poverty_direct_summary: Moderate potential impact on child poverty through improved safety and traffic management, though indirectly related.

Title: Montgomery County - Alcoholic Beverages - Class BD-BWL Licenses - Multiple Licenses MC 18-25
Synopsis: Increasing to two the number of Class BD-BWL alcoholic beverages licenses in Montgomery County that the same person may hold; and specifying that the establishment for which a second class BD-BWL license is issued shall have average daily receipts from the sale of food that exceed the average daily receipts from the sale of alcoholic beverages.
bill_summary: This bill increases the number of Class BD–BWL alcoholic beverages licenses in Montgomery County that a single person can hold, clarifies the conditions under which a second license may be held, and specifies the types of beverages that can be sold with the second license, including restrictions on off-premises private-label products.
responsible_party: Montgomery County Department of Liquor Control or relevant county licensing authority
stakeholders: Alcoholic beverage license holders, Montgomery County residents, restaurant and bar owners
innovative_summary: The program clarifies licensing limits and requirements, including restrictions on the types of products sold with additional licenses, and does not employ new technologies or innovative approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill does not directly impact child poverty but may indirectly affect local economy and employment.

Title: Family Law - Child Custody - Determinations
Synopsis: Authorizing the court, in determining legal and physical custody in certain child custody proceedings, to consider certain factors; and authorizing the court to modify a child custody or visitation order if the court determines that there has been a material change in circumstances since the issuance of the order that related to the needs of the child or the ability of the parents to meet those needs and that modifying the order is in the best interests of the child.
bill_summary: This bill updates Maryland laws concerning child custody and visitation, allowing courts to consider certain factors when determining legal and physical custody and establishing criteria to modify custody or visitation orders, especially in cases involving abuse or significant changes in circumstances.
responsible_party: Maryland Judiciary
stakeholders: Children and their parents involved in custody and visitation disputes
innovative_summary: The bill incorporates detailed, comprehensive criteria for custody decisions and modifications, emphasizing safety, stability, and the child's best interests, but does not employ new technologies or approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has limited direct impact on child poverty, primarily affecting custody arrangements and legal procedures.

Title: Housing Development Permits - Local Reporting Requirements (Maryland Housing Data Transparency Act)
Synopsis: Requiring certain counties to report information quarterly about certain housing development permits to the Department of Planning beginning January 1, 2027; authorizing municipalities to make certain quarterly reports to the Department regarding housing development permits issued by the municipality, beginning January 1, 2027; and requiring the Department of Planning to make certain permit information available on a public, interactive, and searchable website; etc.
bill_summary: The bill requires Maryland counties with at least 150,000 residents to report quarterly on housing development permits, including detailed data on permits issued, rejected, and approved, along with project specifics. Municipalities may report similar data starting January 1, 2027. The Department of Planning will publish this information for public access.
responsible_party: Department of Planning and Department of Housing and Community Development
stakeholders: Residents, housing developers, local governments, and policymakers in Maryland, especially in large counties and municipalities involved in housing development.
innovative_summary: The program employs a comprehensive data transparency approach, making detailed housing permit data publicly available through an interactive online platform, facilitating data-driven decisions.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program could significantly impact child poverty by increasing transparency and potentially accelerating housing development, which can improve access to affordable housing.

Title: Washington Suburban Sanitary Commission - Membership, Reporting, Billing, and Planning (WSSC Planning and Reporting Act of 2025) MC/PG 105-25
Synopsis: Requiring one of the three commissioners from Montgomery County on the Washington Suburban Sanitary Commission to be the Director of the Montgomery County Department of Environmental Protection or a designee; requiring the Commission to submit a long range comprehensive financial plan in a certain manner; requiring the budget authorization for the Office of the Inspector General of the Commission to be approved independently and without involvement of Commission staff; etc.
bill_summary: The bill makes various reforms and oversight enhancements to the Washington Suburban Sanitary Commission, including requiring long-range financial planning, public reporting, improving customer engagement, and assessing taxes and efficiency.
responsible_party: Washington Suburban Sanitary Commission and Maryland State Department of Legislative Services
stakeholders: Customers of the Washington Suburban Sanitary Commission, Montgomery County, Prince George's County, and Maryland residents
innovative_summary: The bill employs technological improvements such as a public searchable website for financial and payment data and requires independent evaluations and stress testing, representing a modern approach to utility transparency and accountability.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program's focus on transparency, financial stability, and customer engagement has the potential to indirectly benefit child poverty by improving utility services and affordability.

Title: Property Tax - Credit for Law Enforcement Officer or Rescue Worker - Expansion to Judicial Officer
Synopsis: Authorizing the governing body of a county or municipal corporation or the Mayor and City Council of Baltimore City to provide a certain property tax credit to certain judicial officers, surviving spouses, or cohabitants; requiring the county or municipal corporation to define, by law, who is a correctional officer and judicial officer; and applying the Act retroactively to all taxable years beginning after June 30, 2022.
bill_summary: The bill authorizes Maryland counties and Baltimore City to provide property tax credits to certain judicial officers, public safety officers, their surviving spouses, and cohabitants, especially in cases of disability or death related to their service, with provisions for defining eligible individuals and applying this retroactively to years after June 30, 2022.
responsible_party: Maryland counties and Baltimore City government
stakeholders: Judicial officers, public safety officers, their families, and property owners within the state
innovative_summary: The program is standard in its approach, primarily providing property tax relief; it does not employ new technologies or innovative approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill's focus on property tax credits likely has limited direct impact on child poverty.

Title: Public and Nonpublic Schools - Student Elopement - Notice and Reporting Requirements (Ace's Law)
Synopsis: Requiring certain public and nonpublic schools to notify a parent or guardian if a student attempts or accomplishes an elopement, the act of leaving the school campus without permission; requiring certain schools and individualized education program teams to review and address with relevant stakeholders certain behavior in updating a student's individualized education program or behavior intervention plan; etc.
bill_summary: This bill, known as Ace's Law, requires public and nonpublic schools in Maryland to notify parents within 24 hours if a student attempts or accomplishes an elopement from the campus. The law establishes reporting requirements, annual data collection, and accountability measures to address student wandering and elopement, especially for students with disabilities.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Education and local school systems
stakeholders: Students, parents, schools, and school districts in Maryland, especially students with behavioral or disability challenges
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a systematic statewide approach to track, report, and address student elopement behaviors, including accountability systems, data analysis, and policy updates, employing data collection and analysis tools.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program's impact on child poverty is indirect, focusing on behavioral safety and educational stability for vulnerable students, which may contribute to improved outcomes.

Title: Montgomery County - Board of Education - Student Member Compensation MC 7-25
Synopsis: Altering the compensation of the student member of the Montgomery County Board of Education.
bill_summary: The bill increases the compensation for the student member of the Montgomery County Board of Education, sets a schedule of increasing salaries for the elected members, and specifies benefits and a scholarship for the student member.
responsible_party: Montgomery County Board of Education
stakeholders: Students and residents of Montgomery County involved in or affected by the Board of Education
innovative_summary: The program employs a structured compensation and scholarship system for student board members, combining elected official salary schedules with educational support, which is somewhat innovative in integrating student participation with compensation and educational incentives.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill's direct impact on child poverty is minimal, as it primarily focuses on the compensation and benefits for school board members, including a student member.

Title: Child Abuse and Neglect - Reports and Records - Disclosure
Synopsis: Requiring a local director of a local department of social services or the Secretary of Human Services to disclose certain reports and records of child abuse and neglect within 30 days after receiving a request if certain conditions are met; requiring the Secretary to notify the State's Attorney's office of a request to disclose certain reports and records of child abuse and neglect; requiring the State's Attorney's office to be given 30 days during which the office is authorized to redact certain portions of the reports and records; etc.
bill_summary: The bill updates procedures for the disclosure of child abuse and neglect reports and records in Maryland, including timing, conditions, and required notifications, with the aim to improve transparency and coordination among authorities.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Human Services
stakeholders: Children who are victims or at risk of abuse, families involved in abuse cases, law enforcement, and child welfare agencies
innovative_summary: The bill employs a structured, transparent approach with specific timelines for disclosure, including notifications to law enforcement and redaction allowances, ensuring coordination while protecting sensitive information.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The impact on child poverty is indirect; the bill improves child protection procedures, which can contribute to reducing adverse childhood experiences linked to poverty.

Title: Public Safety - Immigration Enforcement (Maryland Values Act)
Synopsis: Requiring federal law enforcement officers to notify certain individuals of federal immigration action at certain sensitive locations; prohibiting certain schools, libraries, and units of State or local government that operate at certain sensitive locations from allowing certain federal personnel access to areas not accessible to the general public, subject to certain exceptions; requiring the Attorney General to develop and publish certain guidance regarding immigration enforcement actions at certain sensitive locations; etc.
bill_summary: This bill enhances the state's policies on immigration enforcement, including prohibiting certain immigration agreements, requiring notifications to immigration authorities before release of certain individuals, developing guidance for immigration enforcement at sensitive locations, and restricting federal immigration enforcement access to certain public facilities.
responsible_party: Attorney General of Maryland in collaboration with relevant state agencies
stakeholders: Immigrants, public service providers, educational institutions, and law enforcement agencies
innovative_summary: The bill employs a comprehensive approach to regulate immigration enforcement activities at sensitive locations through new guidance, restrictions, and policies, with a focus on protecting civil rights and privacy.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill indirectly impacts child poverty by protecting access to essential services at sensitive locations and limiting enforcement actions that could destabilize families.

Title: State Board of Cosmetologists - Licensing - Eyelash Extensions
Synopsis: Authorizing the State Board of Cosmetology to issue a limited license to provide eyelash extension services; altering the definition of "provide esthetic services" to include providing eyelash extension services; and requiring an applicant for a limited license to provide eyelash extension services to be at least 17 years old, have successfully completed a 9th grade education or equivalent, received certain training, and passed a practical and written examination.
bill_summary: The bill authorizes the Maryland State Board of Cosmetologists to issue a limited license specifically for providing eyelash extension services, updates licensing definitions, and establishes regulations for training and practicing eyelash extension services.
responsible_party: Maryland State Board of Cosmetologists
stakeholders: Individuals seeking eyelash extension services, licensed cosmetologists and estheticians, beauty salons, and the general public receiving beauty services.
innovative_summary: This program introduces a specialized licensing and regulation process for eyelash extension services, which is a new approach to cosmetology licensing in Maryland.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has limited direct impact on child poverty, focusing mainly on professional licensing and regulation.

Title: Montgomery County - School Bus Stops on Highways - Alterations MC 8-25
Synopsis: Applying certain provisions of law regarding school bus stops located on certain highways in Montgomery County to a school bus stop at a location for which at least 400 citations were issued in the preceding fiscal year to drivers traveling in the opposite direction of the bus stop; and prohibiting, beginning on December 31, 2028, locating a school bus stop on any highway with five or more undivided traffic lanes, except under certain circumstances.
bill_summary: The bill allocates fines from traffic violations in Montgomery County to fund median dividers on highways, establishes rules for traffic citation payments, and sets conditions for school bus stops on highways in Montgomery County, including requirements for a school crossing guard or traffic control device.
responsible_party: Montgomery County Department of Transportation
stakeholders: Drivers, pedestrians, students, and residents of Montgomery County
innovative_summary: The bill employs technology for traffic monitoring and allocates fines directly to fund highway safety infrastructure, integrating legal and technological approaches to improve traffic safety.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has minimal direct impact on child poverty but improves safety for school children, which can indirectly benefit low-income families.

Title: Department of Commerce - Montgomery County Agricultural Reserve Study MC 15-25
Synopsis: Requiring the Department of Commerce, in coordination with certain county agencies and organizations, to study economic development in and the tourist and visitor economy of the Montgomery County Agricultural Reserve and, on or before June 30, 2026, report its findings to the members of the Montgomery County Delegation to the General Assembly; and requiring the Department to make recommendations regarding policies and programs that can help promote and preserve the Montgomery County Agricultural Reserve.
bill_summary: The bill commissions a study by the Maryland Department of Commerce and other agencies to analyze the economic and tourism impact on the Montgomery County Agricultural Reserve, aiming to develop policies to support its economic vitality and preservation.
responsible_party: Department of Commerce in coordination with Montgomery County agencies and organizations
stakeholders: Small businesses, recreation sites, historic sites, tourists, visitors, and local community in Montgomery County
innovative_summary: The program employs geolocation technology and visitor surveys to analyze tourism impact, which are modern approaches for understanding visitor behavior and regional economic effects.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program is unlikely to have a direct impact on child poverty since it mainly focuses on economic development and tourism.

Title: Washington Suburban Sanitary Commission - System Development Charge - Exemptions MC/PG 107-25
Synopsis: Requiring, rather than authorizing, the Montgomery County Council and the Prince George's County Council to grant exemptions from the system development charge imposed by the Washington Suburban Sanitary Commission for certain properties and projects located in Montgomery County; limiting the exemption to $80,000; altering the method by which the county councils establish eligibility for the exemptions; prohibiting the county councils from requiring that an applicant for an exemption own the property for which the exemption is sought; etc.
bill_summary: This bill mandates that Montgomery County and Prince George's County automatically grant exemptions from the Washington Suburban Sanitary Commission's system development charges for certain properties and projects, establishes first-come, first-served approval for Montgomery County until a maximum annual limit is reached, and modifies reporting and exemption criteria.
responsible_party: Montgomery County and Prince George's County Governments
stakeholders: Property owners and developers in Montgomery County and Prince George's County, particularly those involved in revitalization, affordable housing, child care, and programs for developmentally disabled individuals.
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a streamlined exemption process with first-come, first-served approvals and annual reporting requirements, standardizing and simplifying exemptions for select projects, which is a moderately innovative approach to managing development charges.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill could indirectly impact child poverty by reducing development costs for affordable housing and community programs, but its direct effect is limited.

Title: Queen Anne's County - Municipalities - Speed Limits
Synopsis: Authorizing municipalities in Queen Anne's County to decrease the maximum speed limit to not less than 15 miles per hour on highways without performing an engineering and traffic investigation.
bill_summary: The bill authorizes municipalities in Queen Anne's County to lower speed limits on highways to not less than 15 miles per hour without the need for an engineering and traffic investigation.
responsible_party: Queen Anne's County municipalities and Maryland Department of Transportation
stakeholders: Residents, drivers, and local authorities in Queen Anne's County
innovative_summary: Allows local municipalities to reduce speed limits without conducting engineering investigations, streamlining local traffic safety measures.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill is unlikely to have a direct impact on child poverty.

Title: Somerset County - Alcoholic Beverages - Liquor Tasting License
Synopsis: Establishing a liquor tasting license in Somerset County; authorizing the Board of License Commissioners for Somerset County to issue the license to the holder of a Class A beer, wine, and liquor license; and establishing liquor tasting license fees.
bill_summary: The bill establishes a liquor tasting license in Somerset County, allowing the holder of a Class A beer, wine, and liquor license to permit tasting of liquor without charging consumers. It sets the terms for consumption quantity and licensing fees based on duration.
responsible_party: Board of License Commissioners for Somerset County
stakeholders: Liquor license holders, consumers, Somerset County residents
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a specific license for liquor tastings, which is a specialized approach within alcohol regulation.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has limited direct impact on child poverty as it mainly pertains to alcohol licensing and tasting events.

Title: Health Insurance - Coverage for Specialty Drugs
Synopsis: Prohibiting certain insurers, nonprofit health service plans, and health maintenance organizations from excluding coverage for certain specialty drugs that are administered or dispensed by a provider that is an in-network provider of covered medical oncology services and complies with State regulations for the administering and dispensing of specialty drugs, if the specialty drugs meet certain qualifications; and requiring the reimbursement rate for certain specialty drugs to meet certain criteria.
bill_summary: This bill establishes rules to guarantee coverage for certain specialty drugs under health insurance plans, prohibits excluding coverage for drugs administered by qualified providers, and sets reimbursement standards for specialty drugs.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Health and Maryland Insurance Administration
stakeholders: Individuals requiring specialty drugs, healthcare providers, insurers, and pharmacy benefit managers in Maryland.
innovative_summary: The bill employs a comprehensive approach to regulate specialty drug coverage, provider networks, and reimbursement rates, employing new restrictions and requirements for insurers and pharmacy benefit managers.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill could potentially reduce financial barriers to critical medications, thereby improving health outcomes and reducing child poverty indirectly.

Title: Maryland Developmental Disabilities Administration Waiver Advisory Council - Establishment
Synopsis: Establishing the Maryland Developmental Disabilities Administration Waiver Advisory Council to advise and provide recommendations to the Developmental Disabilities Administration on system design, service delivery, and quality enhancement strategies for the Medicaid waiver programs operated by the Administration.
bill_summary: The bill establishes the Maryland Developmental Disabilities Administration Waiver Advisory Council to advise on the design, delivery, and quality of Medicaid waiver programs for individuals with developmental disabilities.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Health or Maryland Developmental Disabilities Administration
stakeholders: Individuals with developmental disabilities and their families, advocacy groups, service providers, and policymakers in Maryland.
innovative_summary: The program employs a collaborative, stakeholder-driven advisory council that emphasizes diversity, inclusion, and evidence-based decision-making, with a structured process for recommendations and public engagement.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill's focus is on improving Medicaid waiver services for individuals with developmental disabilities, which may indirectly reduce child poverty by increasing access to services and support.

Title: Hospitals and Medical Professional Liability Insurers - Obstetric Services Policies (Doula and Birth Policy Transparency Act)
Synopsis: Requiring certain hospitals to adopt certain policies relating to obstetric services and to provide evidence to the Maryland Department of Health that the hospital has the policies; requiring the Maryland Department of Health to provide certain policies to the public on request; and requiring insurers that issue or deliver medical professional liability insurance policies in the State to provide the Maryland Department of Health, on request, with information regarding the insurer's policy regarding coverage of obstetric services.
bill_summary: The bill requires hospitals to adopt and provide policies on obstetric services, including support from doulas, informed consent for medical interventions, and transfer procedures. It also mandates insurers to share information on coverage for obstetric services with the Maryland Department of Health.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Health
stakeholders: Hospitals, pregnant individuals, doulas, health care providers, insurers in Maryland
innovative_summary: This bill introduces transparent policies on obstetric care, supports doula presence, and enhances transfer and consent protocols, employing a comprehensive approach to obstetric care transparency and support.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill could potentially reduce child and maternal health disparities, which may indirectly impact child poverty, but its primary focus is on care policies.

Title: Department of Social and Economic Mobility - Established
Synopsis: Establishing the Department of Social and Economic Mobility; providing for the Secretary of Social and Economic Mobility; providing the purpose of the Department is to provide support for units of State government, individuals, and businesses for the maintenance of social equity policies in the State; establishing the Department of Social and Economic Mobility Special Fund; requiring the Governor to include in the annual budget bill a certain appropriation from the Transportation Trust Fund to the Fund; etc.
bill_summary: This bill establishes the Maryland Department of Social Equity and Economic Mobility, consolidating several state offices related to social equity, minority and women business enterprises, and social justice programs. It creates a dedicated fund to support these initiatives, outlines the department's duties, and coordinates efforts across various state agencies to promote social equity, participation in the cannabis industry, and economic opportunity.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Social Equity and Economic Mobility
stakeholders: Individuals and businesses targeted by social equity programs, minority and women-owned businesses, communities impacted by social justice initiatives, and participants in the regulated cannabis industry.
innovative_summary: The bill employs organizational restructuring and funding coordination to create a comprehensive Department focused on social equity, integrating multiple existing offices and programs under a new agency to enhance efficiency and impact.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has a high potential to impact child poverty by promoting economic opportunities and social inclusion for disadvantaged communities.

Title: Anne Arundel County - Alcoholic Beverages - License and Permit Distance Requirements
Synopsis: Authorizing the Board of Liquor Commissioners for Anne Arundel County to issue a certain dancing permit to the holder of a Class H beer and wine or beer, wine, and liquor license for a licensed premises located within 1,000 feet of a school located at the Annapolis Mall, rather than prohibiting the Board from doing so; and authorizing the Board to issue a new Class B beer and wine or beer, wine, and liquor license to an establishment located within 1,000 feet of a school located at the Annapolis Mall.
bill_summary: The bill relaxes restrictions on issuing certain alcohol licenses and permits in Anne Arundel County, especially concerning locations near schools and places of worship, allowing more flexibility for license issuance and permit granting.
responsible_party: Anne Arundel County Board of Liquor Commissioners
stakeholders: Alcohol license holders, local residents near licensed premises, schools, and places of worship in Anne Arundel County
innovative_summary: The bill employs a regulatory relaxation approach, easing restrictions on alcohol licensing near sensitive locations, which is a common policy adjustment, not employing new technologies or innovative governance models.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill primarily affects alcohol licensing regulations and is unlikely to have a direct impact on child poverty.

Title: Anne Arundel County - Alcoholic Beverages - Limited Special Event Permit
Synopsis: Authorizing the Board of License Commissioners for Anne Arundel County to issue a limited special event permit to holders of certain alcoholic beverages licenses; and authorizing a permit holder to provide music, dancing, and other legal forms of entertainment.
bill_summary: This bill authorizes the issuance of a new limited cultural special event permit by the Anne Arundel County Board of License Commissioners, allowing license holders to provide cultural music, dancing, and entertainment at events for one specific day and location, with certain restrictions and fees.
responsible_party: Anne Arundel County Board of License Commissioners
stakeholders: Licensed alcohol beverage establishments, cultural event organizers, local residents, and attendees of cultural events in Anne Arundel County
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a new type of permit specifically for cultural events, which is a relatively new approach to regulating entertainment and alcohol service at specific community events.
child_poverty_direct_summary: Moderate potential for impact on child poverty through supporting community and cultural engagement, though not directly targeted at child poverty issues.

Title: Charles County - Off-Highway Recreational Vehicles - Regulation and Enforcement
Synopsis: Authorizing Charles County to regulate the operation of off-highway recreational vehicles in the county and to impound an off-highway recreational vehicle that is the subject of certain alleged motor vehicle violations.
bill_summary: The bill authorizes Charles County to regulate and enforce rules for the operation of off–highway recreational vehicles, including registering, imposing age restrictions, and impounding vehicles for certain violations.
responsible_party: Charles County government or local law enforcement agencies
stakeholders: Off–highway recreational vehicle users in Charles County, including minors and vehicle owners
innovative_summary: The bill introduces local regulation and enforcement of off–highway recreational vehicles, including impoundment and age restrictions, which is a targeted local initiative rather than a broad technological innovation.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program's impact on child poverty is minimal and indirect, focusing mainly on vehicle regulation and enforcement.

Title: Health Insurance - Provider Directory - Required Updates
Synopsis: Renaming "network directory" to be "provider directory" to conform to a certain federal law; altering the time period from 15 to 2 working days within which certain carriers are required to update the information that must be made available in the carrier's provider directory on the Internet; altering the information required to be included in a provider directory; requiring that a provider directory in printed form include a statement regarding the accuracy of the provider information; etc.
bill_summary: This bill updates Maryland laws related to health insurance provider directories, including renaming 'network directory' to 'provider directory', specifying update timelines, and requiring directories to include specific information about providers and facilities.
responsible_party: Maryland Insurance Commissioner
stakeholders: Health insurance carriers, healthcare providers, and enrollees in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill enhances transparency and accuracy of provider directories through updated regulations and online systems, but it does not employ new technologies or approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has limited direct impact on child poverty, primarily improving information accuracy and access for beneficiaries.

Title: Baltimore City - Office of the Sheriff - Neighborhood Services Unit
Synopsis: Establishing the Neighborhood Services Unit within the Office of the Sheriff of Baltimore City; requiring the Neighborhood Services Unit and the Board of License Commissioners of Baltimore City to work in partnership to enforce the alcoholic beverages laws of Baltimore City and to enter into a memorandum of understanding that specifies the respective roles and responsibilities of the parties and funding in connection with the partnership; expanding the authorized uses of certain revenue to include the Neighborhood Services Unit; etc.
bill_summary: This bill establishes a Neighborhood Services Unit within the Office of the Sheriff of Baltimore City, which will work in partnership with the Board of License Commissioners to enforce alcohol laws and other duties related to community safety. It also provides for funding mechanisms and integration with court surcharge revenues to support the unit.
responsible_party: Office of the Sheriff of Baltimore City and the Board of License Commissioners of Baltimore City
stakeholders: Residents of Baltimore City, law enforcement, court system, and local government agencies involved in alcohol law enforcement and community safety
innovative_summary: The program employs a collaborative partnership model between law enforcement and licensing authorities, supported by court-generated revenue to fund enforcement and community safety initiatives.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has the potential to improve community safety and stability, which can contribute to reducing child poverty indirectly.

Title: Commercial Law - Credit Regulation - Earned Wage Access and Credit Modernization
Synopsis: Subjecting certain earned wage access products to the Maryland Consumer Loan Law and other provisions that regulate entities that provide consumer credit; restricting the acceptance of tips by certain lenders under certain circumstances; providing for the licensing or registration of certain entities offering earned wage access products with certain exemptions; regulating earned wage access service agreements; limiting the costs and fees associated with obtaining an earned wage access product; etc.
bill_summary: This bill regulates earned wage access products in Maryland, subjecting them to existing consumer loan laws, restricting tips acceptance, setting licensing requirements for providers, regulating service agreements, and limiting associated costs and fees.
responsible_party: Maryland Office of Financial Regulation
stakeholders: Consumers, earned wage access providers, employers in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill incorporates modern wage access practices into existing consumer credit regulations and introduces specific licensing and operational standards, but does not employ new technologies or approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has a moderate potential to impact child poverty by regulating wage access, potentially reducing financial instability for families.

Title: Environment - Managed Aquifer Recharge Pilot Program - Establishment
Synopsis: Prohibiting a person from performing groundwater augmentation except under certain circumstances; establishing the Managed Aquifer Recharge Pilot Program to regulate and evaluate the use of treated reclaimed water as a source for groundwater augmentation through managed aquifer recharge permits; requiring the demonstration facility to address a groundwater supply or quality problem that is anticipated to occur in the next 25 years; etc.
bill_summary: The bill establishes a Managed Aquifer Recharge Pilot Program in Maryland to test the use of treated reclaimed water for groundwater augmentation, with regulations and permits managed by the Department of the Environment.
responsible_party: Department of the Environment
stakeholders: Water utilities, environmental agencies, industrial users, communities relying on groundwater, and public health authorities
innovative_summary: The program is innovative in employing a regulated pilot to evaluate using treated reclaimed water for groundwater augmentation and includes comprehensive testing and monitoring protocols.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program could have an indirect impact on child poverty through improved water resource sustainability, but the direct impact is limited.

Title: Maryland Medical Assistance Program, Maryland Children’s Health Program, and Health Insurance – Transfers to Special Pediatric Hospitals – Prior Authorizations
Synopsis: Prohibiting the Maryland Medical Assistance Program, the Maryland Children's Health Program, managed care organizations, and certain health insurers, nonprofit health service plans, and health maintenance organizations from requiring prior authorization for a transfer to a special pediatric hospital.
bill_summary: This bill prohibits the Maryland Medical Assistance Program, the Maryland Children’s Health Program, managed care organizations, and certain insurers from requiring prior authorization for transfers to special pediatric hospitals, starting January 1, 2026.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Health
stakeholders: Children and adolescents requiring transfer to special pediatric hospitals in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill removes prior authorization requirements for transfers to specialized pediatric hospitals, streamlining access and care.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill’s impact on child poverty is indirect and limited to improving healthcare access for pediatric vulnerable populations.

Title: Prescription Drug Repository Program - Revisions
Synopsis: Altering the Prescription Drug Repository Program, including by allowing certain entities located in another state to participate in the Program as drop-off sites and repositories, including over-the-counter drugs under the Program, and altering the individuals who are eligible to receive drugs or medical supplies under the Program; and altering the persons for whom and the activities with respect to which certain immunity is provided under the Program.
bill_summary: This bill revises and expands the Maryland Prescription Drug Repository Program to include entities in other states as drop-off sites and repositories, allowing donation, dispensation, and proper disposal of prescription drugs, over-the-counter drugs, and medical supplies to eligible individuals.
responsible_party: Maryland State Board of Pharmacy
stakeholders: Needy individuals, eligible patients, pharmacies, drop-off sites, medical supplies providers, and drug donors in Maryland and other participating states.
innovative_summary: The bill employs a collaborative, cross-state approach for drug donation and distribution, leveraging expanded participation of out-of-state entities and ensuring proper handling and safety standards.
child_poverty_direct_summary: High potential for impact, as it improves access to essential medications for underserved populations through expanded donation and distribution networks.

Title: Vaccinations by Pharmacists and Health Insurance Coverage for Immunizations
Synopsis: Altering the vaccinations that a pharmacist may administer, subject to certain requirements, to an individual of at least a certain age; altering the vaccinations included in the minimum package of child wellness services for which certain health insurers and nonprofit health service plans are required to provide coverage to include those recommended by the Advisory Committee on Immunization Practices of the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention as of December 31, 2024.
bill_summary: The bill expands the scope of vaccinations that pharmacists can administer to include individuals at least age 3, with specific requirements for training and reporting. It also mandates that health insurance plans cover a minimum package of child wellness services, including immunizations and developmental screenings, and makes certain adjustments to the timing and regulations around these provisions.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Health and the Maryland Insurance Administration
stakeholders: Children, parents, health insurers, healthcare providers, pharmacists
innovative_summary: The bill employs a collaborative approach involving pharmacists and state agencies, utilizing digital reporting systems like ImmuNet, and updates vaccination protocols in line with CDC recommendations, representing a proactive modernization of public health strategies.
child_poverty_direct_summary: By increasing access to vaccinations and preventive health services for children, the bill has the potential to reduce child health disparities and poverty-related health issues.

Title: Primary and Secondary Education - Youth-Centric Technology and Social Media Resource Guide
Synopsis: Requiring the National Center for School Mental Health at the University of Maryland School of Medicine, in consultation with the State Department of Education, to develop and publish a youth-centric technology and social media resource guide by the 2027-2028 school year; requiring the guide to be distributed, beginning with the 2027-2028 school year, to each public school and the parent teacher organization for each public school and posted on the websites of the Department and each county board; etc.
bill_summary: The bill requires the Maryland Department of Education, in consultation with the National Center for School Mental Health at the University of Maryland, to develop, publish, and update a youth-centric social media and technology resource guide for public school students. The guide aims to provide age-appropriate information and best practices for safe and informed use of technology and social media, starting in the 2027-2028 school year.
responsible_party: National Center for School Mental Health at the University of Maryland, in consultation with the Maryland State Department of Education
stakeholders: Public school students, parents, guardians, and educators in Maryland
innovative_summary: The program employs a structured, multimedia approach to guide development, involving periodic updates and a comprehensive landscape review of youth-centric technology and social media. It also integrates the use of multimedia products and tailored resources for schools and families.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has the potential to significantly impact child poverty by equipping students and families with knowledge and best practices for safe and productive use of technology, possibly reducing related harms and disparities.

Title: Natural Resources - Vessels - Carbon Monoxide Warning Labels (Matthew's Law)
Synopsis: Prohibiting a person from operating a gasoline-powered vessel manufactured after July 31, 2007, that has accommodation spaces, swim platforms, or aft lounging areas on the waters of the State unless the vessel has carbon monoxide warning labels affixed in conspicuous locations in the vicinity of both the transom and the helm of the vessel; and prohibiting the Department of Natural Resources from imposing a penalty on a person that violates the Act.
bill_summary: This bill requires operators of certain gasoline-powered vessels in Maryland to have carbon monoxide warning labels affixed in specific locations on the vessel and prohibits the Department of Natural Resources from imposing penalties for violating this requirement.
responsible_party: Department of Natural Resources
stakeholders: Vessel operators and manufacturers in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a health and safety regulation focusing on warning labels to prevent carbon monoxide poisoning.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill does not have a direct impact on child poverty.

Title: Garrett County - Bids and Contracts - Advertisement Exceptions
Synopsis: Providing that, in Garrett County, a certain requirement to advertise for bids does not apply to a certain contract for goods or services procured on an as-needed basis over time or for certain vehicles.
bill_summary: This bill amends Garrett County's procurement laws to relax bidding requirements for certain contracts, specifically allowing purchases on an as-needed basis and the purchase of vehicles up to $100,000 without advertising for bids.
responsible_party: Garrett County Government
stakeholders: Residents and businesses in Garrett County benefiting from quicker procurement processes
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a more flexible and expedited procurement process for Garrett County by reducing requirements for bidding under specific circumstances.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has limited direct impact on child poverty as it primarily modifies procurement procedures for local government.

Title: Caroline County - Alcoholic Beverages - Special Event Venue License and Multiple Event Licenses
Synopsis: Establishing the special event venue beer, wine, and liquor license in Caroline County; authorizing the Board of License Commissioners of Caroline County to issue the license to the owner of a venue with a certain zoning classification; authorizing holders of certain multiple event licenses in Caroline County to store alcoholic beverages on the licensed premises between individual events in a certain manner; requiring the license holder to keep complete records of all alcoholic beverages purchased and sold on the premises; etc.
bill_summary: The bill establishes a new special event venue license for alcohol sales in Caroline County, allowing owners of certain zoned venues to sell beer, wine, and liquor during designated events, and creates a multiple event license option that allows storing alcohol between events under specific conditions.
responsible_party: Maryland Alcoholic Beverages and Cannabis Board
stakeholders: Owners of special event venues, event attendees in Caroline County
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a multiple event license that enables stored alcohol sales across multiple events with record-keeping and storage conditions, applying innovative licensing flexibility and alcohol management procedures.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has limited direct impact on child poverty but could indirectly improve community vibrancy and economic activity.

Title: Anne Arundel County - Property Tax - Day Care Centers and Child Care Centers
Synopsis: Exempting personal property used in connection with certain large family child care homes from valuation and taxation in Anne Arundel County; authorizing the governing body of Anne Arundel County or the governing body of a municipal corporation in Anne Arundel County to grant, by law, a property tax credit against the real property tax owed on the portion of real property used for certain child care centers and day care centers; etc.
bill_summary: The bill provides property tax exemptions and credits for certain child care centers and large family child care homes in Anne Arundel County, Maryland. It aims to reduce the tax burden on properties used for child care to promote early childhood development.
responsible_party: Anne Arundel County Government or municipal corporations within Anne Arundel County
stakeholders: Child care centers, large family child care homes, and the general public benefiting from improved child care access in Anne Arundel County
innovative_summary: The bill employs targeted property tax incentives for child care providers, encouraging investment and growth in early childhood care services via fiscal measures.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has potential to directly reduce child poverty by lowering operational costs for child care providers, making child care more accessible and affordable.

Title: Department of General Services - Assessment of State-Owned Facilities - Child Care Centers
Synopsis: Requiring the Department of General Services to conduct an assessment of facilities owned by the State and operated by the 16 State agencies the Department supports to evaluate whether the facility or a portion of the facility would be suitable to lease to a child care center;  requiring the Department to report to the General Assembly the results of the assessment and a description of whether each facility is suitable to lease to a child care center by December 1, 2026; and requiring the report to be published on the Department's website.
bill_summary: The bill requires the Maryland Department of General Services to assess its state-owned facilities to determine if any can be leased to child care centers. The department must report its findings by December 1, 2026, and the act expires on June 30, 2027.
responsible_party: Department of General Services
stakeholders: State agencies, child care providers, children, families
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a state assessment process to potentially transform state-owned facilities into child care centers, utilizing state property to address child care needs.
child_poverty_direct_summary: By increasing access to child care facilities, the bill has the potential to reduce child poverty by supporting working families.

Title: Security Guards and Security Guard Employers - Registration, Certification, and Regulation
Synopsis: Providing that a cannabis agent who is employed to provide security services for a cannabis licensee or cannabis registrant as a security guard or by a security guard agency is not required to obtain a State or national criminal history records check if the cannabis agent is authorized to provide security guard services; altering the definition of "security guard employer" for purposes of certain provisions of law to exclude video lottery facilities, sports wagering facility licensees, and health care facilities; etc.
bill_summary: The bill amends Maryland laws to relax security guard registration requirements for cannabis agents working with licensed cannabis businesses, and clarifies the definitions of security guard-related roles and exemptions for certain facilities.
responsible_party: Maryland Alcohol and Cannabis Commission
stakeholders: Cannabis licensees, security guard agencies, security personnel in Maryland, and facilities exempted under the law
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a targeted regulatory adjustment specific to cannabis-related security services, simplifying compliance for licensed cannabis agents working as security guards.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has limited potential to directly impact child poverty, as it primarily deals with security guard registration rules for cannabis businesses.

Title: Health Insurance - Provider Panels - Credentialing for Behavioral Health Care Professionals
Synopsis: Altering the providers of certain community-based health services that a carrier is prohibited from rejecting for participation on the carrier's provider panel; altering the period of time in which certain carriers are required to accept or deny certain social workers, counselors, and psychology associates for participation on the carrier's provider panel to within 60 days after the date a carrier receives a completed application.
bill_summary: This bill amends Maryland insurance law regarding credentialing procedures for behavioral health care professionals seeking to be included on health insurance provider panels. It specifies timelines for acceptance or rejection of applications, the types of providers protected from rejection, and procedures for application processing.
responsible_party: Maryland Insurance Administration or designated health insurance regulators
stakeholders: Behavioral health care professionals, health insurance carriers, and patients seeking mental health services
innovative_summary: The bill introduces standardized credentialing timelines and protections for behavioral health providers, potentially streamlining access to mental health care services.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill could indirectly impact child poverty by improving access to behavioral health services for children and families.

Title: Health Insurance - Required Coverage - Hearing Aids
Synopsis: Altering the circumstances under which certain insurers, nonprofit health service plans, and health maintenance organizations are required to provide coverage for medically appropriate and necessary hearing aids for adults to require coverage if the hearing aid is ordered, fitted, and dispensed by a licensed hearing aid dispenser.
bill_summary: This bill requires health insurers, nonprofit health service plans, and health maintenance organizations in Maryland to cover medically necessary hearing aids for adults, with specific conditions on ordering, fitting, and dispensing from licensed professionals. It also sets a benefit limit of $1,400 per hearing aid every 36 months, allowing individuals to pay the difference if they choose more expensive hearing aids.
responsible_party: Maryland health insurance regulatory agencies
stakeholders: Adults with hearing impairments, hearing aid providers, insurance companies
innovative_summary: The bill standardizes hearing aid coverage requirements for adults, including licensing and dispensing rules, but does not employ new technologies or innovative approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The policy primarily benefits adults with hearing impairments and does not directly target child poverty.

Title: Lead Testing and Inspections - Falsifying Information - Penalty
Synopsis: Establishing a civil penalty not exceeding $50,000 for a person who falsifies information that is submitted in a report of the results of lead-contaminated dust testing or visual inspection of an affected property.
bill_summary: This bill establishes penalties for falsifying information in lead testing and inspection reports, including civil penalties up to $50,000 and potential civil penalties for owners with actual knowledge of false verification.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of the Environment
stakeholders: Property owners, tenants, lead testing professionals, and the general public living in affected properties
innovative_summary: The bill primarily introduces penalties for falsifying lead testing data, which is a legal enforcement measure rather than a new technological or innovative approach.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill's focus is on compliance and penalties for lead testing, which may indirectly impact child health by ensuring safer environments, but does not directly target child poverty.

Title: Vehicle Laws - Driver's Licenses - Electronic Credentials (Maryland Mobile ID Enhancement Act)
Synopsis: Authorizing the Motor Vehicle Administration to enter into an agreement to facilitate the issuance, use, and verification of electronic credentials through a national association of motor vehicle agencies; and authorizing an individual who will operate a rented vehicle to use a certain electronic credential showing a representation of a valid driver's license, instead of a driver's license, to rent the vehicle.
bill_summary: The bill authorizes the Maryland Motor Vehicle Administration to issue and use electronic driver credentials that can be used as a substitute for physical driver's licenses, especially for renting vehicles. It also establishes guidelines for verifying these electronic credentials during transactions.
responsible_party: Maryland Motor Vehicle Administration
stakeholders: Drivers who rent vehicles, residents and nonresidents of Maryland, motor vehicle rental companies
innovative_summary: The bill introduces electronic credentials that can serve as a digital version of a driver’s license, utilizing new technology to improve verification and convenience.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has limited direct impact on child poverty as it mainly updates driver identification processes, but it could indirectly benefit low-income populations by simplifying access to vehicle rental services.

Title: Vehicle Equipment - Portable Variable Messaging Signs - Authorization
Synopsis: Authorizing a tow truck to display a portable variable messaging sign mounted on the tow truck while at the scene of a crash or a disabled vehicle; and requiring the portable variable messaging sign to conform to the standards established in the manual on uniform traffic control devices adopted by the State Highway Administration and display only messages approved by the Administration.
