bill_summary: The bill authorizes tow trucks to display portable variable messaging signs at the scene of accidents or disabled vehicles, provided they meet certain standards and message approval.
responsible_party: Maryland State Highway Administration
stakeholders: Tow truck drivers, emergency responders, drivers on Maryland highways
innovative_summary: The bill introduces the use of portable variable messaging signs mounted on tow trucks, aligning with traffic management and safety enhancements.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill does not have a direct impact on child poverty.

Title: Civil Actions - Child Sexual Abuse
Synopsis: Altering certain provisions relating to the award of noneconomic damages to a claimant in an action for child sexual abuse; altering certain provisions relating to the liability of the State under the Maryland Tort Claims Act and of a local government under the Local Government Tort Claims Act for certain claims of child sexual abuse; and requiring the Maryland Judiciary to report to the General Assembly by January 31, 2027, and each year thereafter, on the amount of each award and a summary of the sexual abuse claims related to the award.
bill_summary: This bill eliminates statutes of limitations for child sexual abuse claims where the victim was a minor, adjusts damages limits, expands sovereign immunity defenses for certain government entities, and sets new insurance and liability standards for schools and government agencies related to child sexual abuse claims, effective June 1, 2025.
responsible_party: Maryland Judiciary and Maryland State Agencies (including the State Insurance Commissioner)
stakeholders: Victims of child sexual abuse, government entities, schools, legal and insurance professionals
innovative_summary: The bill employs a broad approach to removing time limits and increasing damages, and introduces structured reporting, but mainly modifies existing legal frameworks rather than employing new technologies.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill's primary focus is on legal and liability reforms related to child sexual abuse; its potential direct impact on child poverty is indirect and likely minimal.

Title: Health Care Facilities - Hospitals and Freestanding Birthing Centers - Perinatal Care Standards
Synopsis: Requiring the Maryland Department of Health, in coordination with the Maryland Institute for Emergency Medical Services Systems, to adopt regulations establishing minimum perinatal care standards for hospitals that meet or exceed the Maryland Perinatal System Standards for each hospital that provides obstetrical services; and requiring each hospital that provides obstetrical services and freestanding birthing centers, as a condition of licensure, to comply with certain minimum perinatal care standards.
bill_summary: The bill requires the Maryland Department of Health, in coordination with the Maryland Institute for Emergency Medical Services Systems, to establish minimum perinatal care standards for hospitals providing obstetrical services and for freestanding birthing centers. Hospitals and birthing centers must meet these standards as a condition of licensure.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Health in coordination with the Maryland Institute for Emergency Medical Services Systems
stakeholders: Hospitals providing obstetrical services, freestanding birthing centers, pregnant women, and infants in Maryland.
innovative_summary: The program involves establishing standards that meet or exceed existing perinatal system standards, and requiring compliance as a condition of licensure, encouraging quality improvement and safety in maternal and infant care.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program potentially improves maternal and infant health outcomes, which can contribute to reductions in child poverty impacts.

Title: Howard County - Alcoholic Beverages - Class D Licenses - Delivery
Synopsis: Applying certain provisions of law relating to the delivery of alcoholic beverages in Howard County to a holder or an employee of a holder of a Class D license.
bill_summary: This bill allows license holders or their employees with a Class D license in Howard County to deliver alcoholic beverages within the county, with specific age and verification requirements, and establishes procedures for delivery endorsements.
responsible_party: Howard County Alcohol Beverage Licensing Authority or equivalent local agency
stakeholders: Alcohol retailers, delivery employees, consumers of legal drinking age in Howard County
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a regulated alcohol delivery process in Howard County, incorporating age verification and documentation procedures to ensure compliance with existing alcohol laws.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The direct impact on child poverty is minimal as the bill mainly concerns alcohol delivery regulations.

Title: Support and Protections for Individuals Affected by Federal Actions (Protect Our Federal Workers Act)
Synopsis: Renaming the Federal Government Shutdown Employee Assistance Loan Fund to be the Federal Government Employee Assistance Loan Fund; authorizing funds appropriated to the Catastrophic Event Account to be expended to assist in funding costs connected to a relocation, closure, or mass layoff of a unit of the federal government; establishing the Expedited Hiring Program in the Department of Budget and Management; authorizing an appointing authority to recruit for certain vacant positions in State government; etc.
bill_summary: The bill renames the Federal Government Shutdown Employee Assistance Loan Fund to the Federal Government Employee Assistance Loan Fund, authorizes use of funds from the Catastrophic Event Account to assist in federal shutdowns or similar circumstances, expands powers of the Attorney General to take action against federal actions threatening Maryland residents, establishes a program for expedited hiring of federal workers into state government, and creates a loan fund for federal employees facing hardship due to federal shutdowns or layoffs, along with funding and research provisions.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Labor and Office of the Attorney General
stakeholders: Federal employees in Maryland, federal contractors, residents affected by federal shutdowns or layoffs
innovative_summary: The bill employs a proactive legal and financial approach, including a new loan fund, expedited hiring programs, and enhanced powers for the Attorney General, to support residents affected by federal government actions.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has a high potential to reduce financial hardship and child poverty among federal employees and contractors by providing immediate financial support and job placement assistance.

Title: Courts - Parental Accommodations
Synopsis: Requiring circuit courthouses in the State, constructed or renovated on or after October 1, 2025, to maintain on its premises a private lactation room to be used by certain individuals; providing that breast-feeding mothers and certain individuals caring for children under 3 years old may be excused from jury service; and requiring the Maryland Judiciary to collect certain information on jury service excusals and report annually to the Maryland General Assembly beginning by December 31, 2025.
bill_summary: The bill requires Maryland circuit courthouses to maintain lactation rooms and allows breastfeeding mothers and certain caretakers of young children to be excused from jury service. It also mandates the collection and reporting of data on jury service excusals related to caregiving.
responsible_party: Maryland Judiciary
stakeholders: Breastfeeding mothers, caregivers of young children, and individuals summoned for jury duty in Maryland.
innovative_summary: The bill introduces accommodations for breastfeeding and caregiving needs within the judicial system, including private lactation rooms and specific jury excusal provisions, employing policies that recognize and support personal health and caregiving responsibilities.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program could have a moderate impact on child poverty by supporting caregiving responsibilities, thereby enabling participation in civic duties and possibly improving economic stability for families.

Title: Juveniles - Truancy Reduction Pilot Programs - Report
Synopsis: Requiring the Chief Justice of the Supreme Court of Maryland to report annually by November 1 to the General Assembly on the Truancy Reduction Pilot Program; and requiring the report to include the number of Truancy Reduction Pilot Programs established in State, the number of participants in each pilot program; information on the outcomes of the participants in each program, and recommendations to improve the function of the current program.
bill_summary: This bill requires the Maryland Judiciary to report on the impact and effectiveness of Truancy Reduction Pilot Programs, including data on student GPA, graduation rate, and truancy rate, and to provide recommendations for their effectiveness in Baltimore City. The report is due by December 1, 2026.
responsible_party: Maryland Judiciary
stakeholders: Students, families, and schools affected by truancy reduction efforts in Maryland, especially Baltimore City.
innovative_summary: The bill mainly involves reporting and evaluation of existing or pilot programs; it does not establish new services or interventions. It emphasizes data collection and recommendations for program improvement.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill could potentially impact child poverty by improving school attendance and graduation rates, which are linked to economic stability.

Title: Local Government - Hiring and Promotion Preferences for Veterans and Spouses of Service Members and Veterans (Families Serve Act)
Synopsis: Authorizing counties and municipalities to grant a preference in hiring and promotion to eligible veterans, spouses of an eligible service member, spouses of certain eligible veterans and eligible service members, and surviving spouses of deceased eligible veterans; and authorizing counties and municipalities to adopt a local law that allows for the application of a certain credit on a selection test for eligible spouses, eligible veterans, and certain spouses and surviving spouses.
bill_summary: This bill authorizes Maryland counties and municipalities to enact local laws that provide hiring and promotion preferences for veterans, their spouses, and surviving spouses. It also allows the application of a point credit on selection tests for these groups, including specific provisions for those with service-connected disabilities and former prisoners of war.
responsible_party: Counties and municipalities in Maryland
stakeholders: Veterans, spouses of service members and veterans, surviving spouses, local government employment agencies
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a formal mechanism for local governments to incorporate preference points on employment tests for veterans and their families, which is a targeted approach to veteran employment support.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program may indirectly benefit child poverty by improving employment opportunities for veterans and their families, though it is not directly targeted at child poverty.

Title: Maryland Small Business Innovation Research and Technology Transfer Incentive Program - Alterations
Synopsis: Repealing certain provisions of law specifying certain limitations on awards or investments provided to certain small businesses under the Maryland Small Business Innovation Research and Technology Transfer Incentive Program.
bill_summary: This bill revises the Maryland Small Business Innovation Research and Technology Transfer Incentive Program, removing certain limitations on awards or investments that small businesses can receive, particularly for research related to public health crises.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Commerce (The Corporation)
stakeholders: Small businesses engaged in research and development, especially those involved in health crisis preparedness and response in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill primarily makes administrative changes and removes limits on awards, with some emphasis on supporting research related to public health crises, but does not introduce new technologies or approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The impact on child poverty is indirect and not explicitly addressed by the program; the program's focus is on small business support and public health research.

Title: Economic Development - Western Maryland Economic Future Investment Board and Senator George C. Edwards Fund - Alterations
Synopsis: Altering the composition of the Western Maryland Economic Future Investment Board; providing that the Executive Director serves as a nonvoting member of the Board, but may vote to break a tie; providing criteria for the awarding of grant and loan funding to include the creation or retention of at least 25 jobs, creation or retention of at least 10 jobs each with wages that exceed 120% of the State minimum wage, or creates significant population growth in the area in which the project is located; etc.
bill_summary: This bill alters the structure and purpose of the Western Maryland Economic Future Investment Board and the Senator George C. Edwards Fund to promote economic development and job creation in the region through grants and loans, with specified funding levels and criteria for projects.
responsible_party: The Council (presumably a regional economic development council)
stakeholders: Businesses, local governments, and residents in Western Maryland seeking economic development and job creation
innovative_summary: The program employs targeted grants and loans based on specific economic development criteria, with a focus on creating jobs and population growth, integrating investment monitoring and potential fund reclamation.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has a moderate potential to impact child poverty by fostering economic growth and job creation in the region.

Title: Motor Vehicles – Rental Fleet Vehicles – Registration
Synopsis: Establishing an alternative registration process for rental fleet vehicles; requiring the Motor Vehicle Administration to issue distinctive registration plates for rental vehicles registered under the alternative process; and requiring, in addition to an annual registration fee, the owner of a registered rental vehicle to pay a one-time initial registration fee not to exceed $8.50 when the new registration plates are issued.
bill_summary: The bill establishes an alternative registration process for rental fleet vehicles in Maryland, including issuing distinctive registration plates and setting fees.
responsible_party: Maryland Motor Vehicle Administration
stakeholders: Rental vehicle fleet owners and rental car companies in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a specialized registration process with distinctive plates for rental fleet vehicles, simplifying identification and regulation.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has little to no direct impact on child poverty as it mainly involves vehicle registration policies.

Title: Transportation-Related Tolls - Installment Payment Plans
Synopsis: Requiring the Maryland Transportation Authority to establish programs to offer installment payment plans for the payment of certain tolls, in excess of $300.
bill_summary: The bill requires the Maryland Transportation Authority and the Department of Transportation to establish income-based installment payment plans for tolls, civil penalties, and fines related to transportation violations, with specific eligibility criteria and regulations.
responsible_party: Maryland Transportation Authority and Department of Transportation
stakeholders: Individuals with unpaid tolls and transportation-related fines in Maryland
innovative_summary: The program employs a targeted, income-based approach to payment plans, leveraging regulations and eligibility verification to assist individuals in managing transportation-related penalties.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has the potential to directly benefit individuals struggling with transportation fines by offering manageable payment options, which could indirectly impact child poverty by reducing financial burdens.

Title: Land Use and Real Property - Accessory Dwelling Units - Requirements and Prohibitions
Synopsis: Establishing the policy of the State to promote and encourage the creation of accessory dwelling units on land with a single-family detached dwelling unit as the primary dwelling unit in order to meet the housing needs of the citizens of the State; requiring, on or before October 1, 2026, the legislative body of certain counties or municipal corporations to adopt a local law authorizing the development of accessory dwelling units on land with certain single-family detached dwelling units subject to certain requirements; etc.
bill_summary: This bill requires Maryland counties and municipalities to adopt laws allowing the development of accessory dwelling units (ADUs) on land zoned for single-family residential use. It sets standards for ADUs, including size limits, safety, and parking requirements, and specifies that some fees cannot be charged for smaller ADUs. It also allows homeowner associations to treat ADUs as separate lots for voting and assessments.
responsible_party: Local government legislative bodies and planning agencies in Maryland
stakeholders: Homeowners, residents in single-family zones, potential ADU developers, homeowner associations
innovative_summary: The program employs a comprehensive approach to facilitate and standardize the development of accessory dwelling units using new policies, standards, and authority for homeowner associations, including treating ADUs as separate lots for voting and assessments.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has potential to impact child poverty by increasing affordable housing options for families.

Title: Local Finance - Special Taxing Districts - Anne Arundel County Erosion Prevention Projects and Erosion Control Projects
Synopsis: Requiring interest earnings on money deposited for a certain taxing and assessment district to be credited to that district; specifying that a certain provision of law governing the petition process for the construction of an erosion prevention project or erosion control project in a certain district in Anne Arundel County does not apply to certain planning, permitting, or cost estimate activities; authorizing certain entities to use tax funds for upkeep or reconstruction of an existing shore erosion control project; etc.
bill_summary: The bill amends laws related to shore erosion control projects and special taxing districts in Maryland, specifically allowing interest earned on funds deposited for such projects to be credited to the district, and clarifies rules for the use of tax funds for maintenance, repair, or reconstruction of erosion control projects.
responsible_party: Maryland local government agencies managing shore erosion control districts
stakeholders: Property owners, local governments, and residents in districts affected by shoreline erosion issues in Maryland
innovative_summary: This bill introduces clarifications in the legal framework for erosion control districts, but does not employ new technologies or innovative approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill does not directly address child poverty.

Title: Prince George's County - Chesapeake and Atlantic Coastal Bays Critical Area Protection Program - Cutting or Clearing Trees MC/PG 113-25
Synopsis: Providing that, in Prince George's County, to enforce a certain violation involving the clearing or cutting of trees in the Chesapeake and Atlantic Coastal Bays Critical Area, the Prince George's County Department of Permitting, Inspections, and Enforcement must record a lien on property that is the subject of the violation in a certain manner; establishing certain limits, prohibitions, requirements, and authorizations on actions certain local jurisdictions may take if a lien is not recorded as required by the Act; etc.
bill_summary: The bill regulates tree cutting and clearing in the Chesapeake and Atlantic Coastal Bays Critical Area in Prince George's County, including provisions for liability, enforcement, liens, and reimbursement, and applies retroactively.
responsible_party: Prince George’s County government and Maryland–National Capital Park and Planning Commission
stakeholders: Property owners, local government agencies, environmental agencies, and residents of Prince George's County
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a legal framework for enforcing tree preservation in critical areas, including retroactive application and reimbursement provisions, which is relatively innovative in environmental legal enforcement.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program's focus is environmental protection, and it is unlikely to have a direct impact on child poverty.

Title: State Government - Equal Access to Public Services for Individuals With Limited English Proficiency and Individuals With Disabilities
Synopsis: Requiring the Governor's Office of Immigrant Affairs and the Department of Disabilities to convene the Maryland Language Advisory Group, by January 1, 2026, to make findings and recommendations on oversight, monitoring, investigation, and enforcement of certain provisions of law relating to equal access to public services for certain individuals; altering provisions of law relating to equal access to public services for individuals with limited English proficiency to include individuals with disabilities; etc.
bill_summary: The bill requires the Maryland government to improve access to public services for individuals with limited English proficiency and disabilities through the creation of language access plans, oversight, and enforcement. It establishes advisory groups, mandates reporting, and allocates funds for these efforts.
responsible_party: Governor’s Office of Immigrant Affairs and the Department of Disabilities
stakeholders: Individuals with limited English proficiency and individuals with disabilities in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill employs a structured approach to improve language access across state agencies through planning, oversight, and stakeholder engagement, including the development of templates and standards.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has moderate potential to impact child poverty by improving access to essential services for vulnerable populations.

Title: State Board of Professional Counselors and Therapists - Temporary Telehealth Licenses - Establishment
Synopsis: Establishing a temporary telehealth license to be issued by the State Board of Professional Counselors and Therapists authorizing the holder to provide clinical professional counseling services only to a student attending an institution of higher education in the State if the student and out-of-state licensed professional counselor have a previously established relationship that has existed for at least 6 months; limiting the term of the temporary license to 6 months; and prohibiting the renewal of a temporary licensed issued under the Act.
bill_summary: The bill authorizes the Maryland State Board of Professional Counselors and Therapists to issue a temporary telehealth license to out-of-state licensed professional counselors, allowing them to provide services via telehealth to students enrolled in Maryland institutions of higher education, under specific conditions. It also establishes regulations for out-of-state counselors and the use of telehealth in counseling.
responsible_party: Maryland State Board of Professional Counselors and Therapists
stakeholders: Students enrolled in Maryland institutions of higher education, out-of-state licensed counselors, and the Maryland public health community.
innovative_summary: The bill employs a temporary licensing approach to facilitate telehealth counseling services across state lines, enhancing access through new regulatory pathways.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program could have a moderate impact on child poverty by increasing access to mental health services for students, potentially improving educational and social outcomes.

Title: Maryland State Department of Education - Publicly Funded Prekindergarten - Analysis and Report (Mixed Delivery Model Viability Act)
Synopsis: Requiring the State Department of Education to convene a workgroup to conduct an analysis of the mixed delivery, publicly funded prekindergarten system established under the Blueprint for Maryland's Future; and requiring the workgroup to submit a final report, by December 31, 2027, to the Accountability and Implementation Board and the General Assembly on any changes made by the Department in response to the recommendations in its interim report, and any additional recommendations for changes to the prekindergarten system; etc.
bill_summary: This bill requires the Maryland State Department of Education to create a workgroup to analyze the mixed delivery, publicly funded prekindergarten system, including its policies, implementation, and effectiveness, and to provide recommendations for improvements.
responsible_party: Maryland State Department of Education
stakeholders: Prekindergarten children, families, private and public prekindergarten providers, child care providers, and policymakers in Maryland.
innovative_summary: The program employs a collaborative, comprehensive analysis involving multiple stakeholders and expert input to improve and possibly reform the publicly funded prekindergarten system, focusing on equity, efficiency, and quality enhancements.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has the potential to directly impact child poverty by improving early childhood education quality and access for underserved populations.

Title: Public Health - Report on Establishing a Directory of Home Health Care Providers
Synopsis: Requiring the Maryland Department of Health, in consultation with certain stakeholders, to submit a report on the feasibility of establishing and maintaining an online directory of home health care providers to certain committees of the General Assembly by December 31, 2025.
bill_summary: This bill requires the Maryland Department of Health to create an online directory of home health care providers and to report on the feasibility of maintaining such a directory for use in selecting providers and supporting workforce development.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Health
stakeholders: home health care providers, individuals seeking home health care services, and related healthcare agencies in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill proposes an integrated, searchable online directory of home health care providers that can facilitate client choice, support workforce development, and improve communication during emergencies.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has the potential to improve access to home health care, especially for vulnerable populations, which could help reduce child poverty indirectly.

Title: Disability Services - Adapted Vehicle Access Pilot Program - Established
Synopsis: Establishing the Adapted Vehicle Access Pilot Program to provide adapted vehicles to individuals who require a mobility aid; and requiring the Department of Disabilities to implement and administer the Program, request, apply for, and facilitate certain donations to the Program, study the impacts of the Program, and report to the Governor and the General Assembly on the Program on or before December 1, 2028.
bill_summary: This bill establishes the Adapted Vehicle Access Pilot Program to provide adapted vehicles to individuals who require a wheelchair or mobility aid, aiming to improve their independence and mobility.
responsible_party: Department of Disabilities
stakeholders: Individuals needing adapted vehicles for mobility who may lack access through existing programs
innovative_summary: The program employs a new approach by providing customized adapted vehicles to underserved individuals, supported by donations and grants.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has moderate potential to impact child poverty by increasing mobility and access for individuals in need, possibly affecting family stability and employment.

Title: Howard County - Alcoholic Beverages - Class MT (Movie Theater) License
Synopsis: Establishing a Class MT (movie theater) beer, wine, and liquor license in Howard County; authorizing the Board of License Commissioners for Howard County to issue the license to the owner of a movie theater who holds a crowd control training certification; authorizing a license holder to sell beer, wine, and liquor to certain patrons at retail for on-premises consumption; and authorizing the Board to set certain limitations on and requirements for the license.
bill_summary: This bill establishes a new Class MT (movie theater) alcohol license in Howard County, allowing theaters with certain certifications to sell beer, wine, and liquor to patrons who have purchased a ticket for a movie. The license's hours, fees, and requirements are set by the Board of License Commissioners, and the program begins on July 1, 2025.
responsible_party: Howard County Board of License Commissioners
stakeholders: Movie theater patrons and owners in Howard County
innovative_summary: This program introduces a specialized alcohol license for movie theaters, integrating alcohol sales directly within entertainment venues, which is a novel approach to licensing in Maryland.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has limited direct impact on child poverty, as it focuses on alcohol licensing in theaters rather than services or supports for children or low-income families.

Title: Baltimore City - AIDS Prevention Sterile Needle and Syringe Exchange Pilot Program - Revisions
Synopsis: Renaming the AIDS Prevention Sterile Needle and Syringe Exchange Pilot Program to be the HIV Prevention Syringe Services Program; altering the duties of the Program to provide for the safe distribution of syringes and  hypodermic needles and account for the number of hypodermic needles and syringes exchanged and distributed by the Baltimore City Health Department; altering the membership and duties of the Program's oversight committee; altering the immunity provided to Program staff and participants; etc.
bill_summary: The bill renames the existing AIDS Prevention Sterile Needle and Syringe Exchange Pilot Program in Baltimore City to the HIV Prevention Syringe Services Program. It revises the duties, oversight, staffing, and data collection processes related to the program, emphasizing HIV prevention, safe distribution of needles and syringes, referrals to treatment, and program evaluation to reduce the spread of HIV among injecting drug users.
responsible_party: Baltimore City Health Department
stakeholders: Injecting drug users, public health officials, community members in Baltimore City
innovative_summary: The program employs comprehensive data collection, community outreach, and harm reduction strategies, incorporating mobile syringe sites and detailed evaluation plans, which are relatively innovative approaches for a needle exchange program.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program may have an indirect impact on child poverty by reducing HIV transmission and associated health costs, but it is not primarily focused on child poverty alleviation.

Title: State Personnel - Paid Family and Medical Leave
Synopsis: Requiring the Secretary of Budget and Management and the governing body of a public institution of higher education adopt regulations governing paid family and medical leave benefits for Executive Branch employees; establishing certain parameters for the paid family and medical leave; authorizing, beginning July 1, 2026, Executive Branch employees to submit a request for paid family and medical leave in accordance with established procedures; etc.
bill_summary: The bill mandates paid family and medical leave benefits for Maryland Executive Branch employees, establishing regulations, program parameters, and procedures for requesting leave related to childbirth, adoption, serious health conditions, and deployment. It also repeals previous parental leave provisions.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Budget and Management and governing bodies of public higher education institutions
stakeholders: Maryland Executive Branch employees and their families
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a comprehensive paid family and medical leave program for Maryland state employees, aligning with federal standards and expanding existing leave policies.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has potential to reduce child poverty by supporting parents in caring for children and family health, but its direct impact depends on implementation.

Title: Medical Records - Notice of Destruction - Method
Synopsis: Requiring that notice of the destruction of medical records be provided by first-class mail or by e-mail, rather than by both methods; and providing that if notice is provided by e-mail and no response or delivery receipt is obtained from the e-mail address to which notice was provided, the health care provider shall provide notice via first-class mail at least 10 days before the date on which the record is to be destroyed.
bill_summary: The bill revises the notification process for the destruction of medical records, requiring that notice be provided either by first-class mail or by e-mail, rather than both, except in certain circumstances.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Health or relevant health care providers
stakeholders: Patients, parents or guardians of minors, healthcare providers
innovative_summary: This bill introduces a simplified and potentially more efficient method of notifying patients about the destruction of their medical records via electronic communication, replacing the previous requirement of dual notification methods.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill does not have a direct or significant impact on child poverty.

Title: Financial Institutions - Consumer Credit - Application of Licensing Requirements (Maryland Secondary Market Stability Act of 2025)
Synopsis: Providing that certain provisions of law governing the licensing of providers of certain financial services in the State do not apply to a certain trust that acquires or is assigned a certain mortgage loan under certain circumstances; establishing the Maryland Licensing Workgroup to study and make recommendations on licensing requirements for persons that provide financial services in the State; and requiring the Workgroup to report to the Governor and the General Assembly by December 31, 2025.
bill_summary: This bill clarifies certain licensing exemptions for mortgage-related financial services and establishes a Maryland Licensing Workgroup to study and recommend improvements to licensing requirements for financial service providers.
responsible_party: Maryland Office of Financial Regulation
stakeholders: Mortgage lenders, financial service providers, consumers in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill employs a collaborative workgroup to study and recommend licensing reforms, integrating stakeholder feedback and potentially modernizing licensing processes.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill's direct impact on child poverty is limited, as it primarily concerns licensing and regulation of financial services.

Title: Prior Authorizations of State Debt - Alterations
Synopsis: Amending certain prior authorizations of State Debt to change the names of certain grantees, alter the authorized uses of certain grants, and extend the termination date of certain grants.
bill_summary: This bill amends prior authorizations of State Debt for various projects including infrastructure, community facilities, health and educational facilities, arts and cultural projects, and redevelopment initiatives across Maryland, extending deadlines, changing project details, and adjusting funding amounts.
responsible_party: Maryland State Department of Budget and Management, or other relevant Maryland state agencies responsible for project implementation
stakeholders: Maryland residents, local governments, community organizations, students, patients, arts organizations, and redevelopment authorities in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill employs a conventional approach by adjusting funding allocations, project deadlines, and project details without adopting new technologies or methods.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill's impact on child poverty is indirect, primarily through funding community and educational projects; the potential for a direct impact on child poverty is low.

Title: Wicomico County Board of Education - Election of Members, Student Member, and Compensation
Synopsis: Altering, beginning with the general election in 2026, the districts from which certain members of the Wicomico County Board of Education are elected; adding at least one student member from the 11th or 12th grade in good standing and regularly enrolled in the public school system to the county board for purposes of advising the county board on the thoughts and feelings of students in the County public schools; and providing that the members of the county board are entitled to certain compensation and reimbursement.
bill_summary: The bill modifies the Wicomico County Board of Education to expand the number of elected members from 5 to 7, establish district-based elections, add at least one student member who serves without voting rights, and sets compensation and reimbursement rules for board members, including the student member.
responsible_party: Wicomico County Board of Education
stakeholders: Students, parents, and residents of Wicomico County
innovative_summary: The bill introduces the inclusion of a nonvoting student member to the county's education board and formalizes procedures for student engagement and compensation, which is a relatively innovative approach in local education governance.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill's direct impact on child poverty is limited, focusing mainly on school board structure and student participation.

Title: Gaming - Sports Wagering Facilities - Request for Relocation
Synopsis: Authorizing certain sports wagering facility licensees to submit a written request to the State Lottery and Gaming Control Commission to relocate the sports wagering facility if the facility was originally issued a Class B sports wagering facility license on or before September 30, 2023, and the new location is in the same county, complies with certain location requirements, and is approved by the Sports Wagering Application Review Commission.
bill_summary: The bill authorizes certain licensed sports wagering facilities in Maryland to request a relocation of their facility within the same county, subject to specific conditions and approvals.
responsible_party: Maryland State Lottery and Gaming Control Commission
stakeholders: Sports wagering facility operators and patrons within Maryland
innovative_summary: This bill introduces a streamlined process for licensed sports wagering facilities to relocate within their county, simplifying operational adjustments for licensees.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has limited direct impact on child poverty but may indirectly influence local economic conditions.

Title: Barbers and Cosmetologists - License Qualifications - Domestic Violence Awareness Training
Synopsis: Requiring the State Board of Barbers and the State Board of Cosmetologists, beginning October 1, 2025, to require as a condition for licensure and initial renewal of a license an applicant or a licensee to complete certain training in domestic violence awareness; requiring the Maryland Department of Labor to approve certain domestic violence awareness training that is offered in person and virtually, includes guidance on certain topics, and has a duration of at least 1 hour; etc.
bill_summary: This bill requires the Maryland State Board of Barbers and the State Board of Cosmetologists to mandate domestic violence awareness training for licensure and license renewal of barbers, cosmetologists, and related practitioners. It establishes a 1-hour domestic violence awareness training program developed and approved by the Department of Labor, which must include guidance on recognizing signs of domestic violence, communicating with victims, and connecting them with resources.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Labor and State Boards of Barbers and Cosmetologists
stakeholders: Barbers, cosmetologists, barber-stylist, nail technicians, estheticians, and their clients in Maryland, especially victims of domestic violence.
innovative_summary: The program incorporates a standardized, minimal-hour training on domestic violence awareness directly into licensing requirements, using both in-person and virtual formats, which is a practical approach but not highly innovative in technology use.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program could indirectly impact child poverty by potentially supporting victims of domestic violence, including children, through increased awareness and resource connection.

Title: Maryland Higher Education Commission - Academic Program Approval - Revisions
Synopsis: Requiring certain nonpublic institutions of higher education to submit a certain letter of intent regarding intended new graduate level programs to the Maryland Higher Education Commission in a certain manner and every 6 months; repealing a provision of law that required the Commission to circulate certain letters of intent; repealing a certain provision of law that limited which institutions of higher education could propose or implement certain academic programs for certain graduate level programs under certain circumstances; etc.
bill_summary: The bill updates Maryland's higher education policy by requiring nonpublic institutions to submit letters of intent for new graduate programs, promoting collaboration, and updating the State Plan for Higher Education to include workforce needs and emerging programs. It also revises procedures for proposing academic programs and limits certain approvals to specific universities for emerging workforce programs.
responsible_party: Maryland Higher Education Commission
stakeholders: Higher education institutions, students, and regional industries in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill employs new regulation procedures and emphasizes collaboration and strategic planning for emerging workforce programs, utilizing structured submission, review, and coordination mechanisms.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has moderate potential to impact child poverty by aligning higher education and workforce development with regional economic needs.

Title: Real Property - Holding Over - Expedited Hearing and Service of Summons for Active Duty Service Members
Synopsis: Requiring the District Court to hold a hearing on a tenant holding over within 45 days after a landlord makes a complaint if the landlord or the landlord's spouse is on active duty with the United States military; and authorizing a private process server to serve a certain summons if the constable or sheriff of the county fails to serve the summons within 10 days after the summons is issued by the court.
bill_summary: This bill mandates that the District Court hold a hearing within a specific number of days when a tenant is holding over a property and the landlord or landlord's spouse is on active military duty. It also authorizes private process servers to serve certain legal documents under specified circumstances, particularly when the landlord or their spouse is on active duty with the U.S. military and has relocated to Maryland.
responsible_party: District Court of Maryland
stakeholders: Tenants, landlords, active duty military members, military families
innovative_summary: The bill introduces provisions for expedited court hearings and service of legal documents specifically for active duty military landlords or spouses, utilizing private process servers if necessary. This approach employs technology and specialized process serving to expedite legal proceedings for military families.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has a moderate potential to impact child poverty by stabilizing housing situations for military families, thus reducing risk factors associated with housing instability and displacement.

Title: Real Property - Wrongful Detainer - Time of Hearing and Service of Process
Synopsis: Altering provisions relating to wrongful detainer actions, including requirements for summonses, hearing, and judgments.
bill_summary: The bill criminalizes the act of possessing or claiming rights to possess residential real property without lawful possession with intent to defraud, establishes penalties for violations, and modifies procedures for wrongful detainer actions including summons, hearings, and appeals.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Public Safety and Correctional Services
stakeholders: Property owners, tenants, and residents of Maryland
innovative_summary: This bill introduces a new criminal offense related to wrongful possession of residential property and updates legal procedures, employing a combination of criminal and civil law approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The potential to directly impact child poverty appears limited, as the bill mainly focuses on property possession and legal procedures.

Title: Department of General Services - Identification Cards - Veteran Status Notation
Synopsis: Authorizing the Department of General Services to include a notation on a certain identification card indicating that the holder is a veteran under certain circumstances; requiring the Department to obtain the consent of a certain holder of an identification card before transmitting certain information to a certain executive agency; and prohibiting the Department from transmitting certain information obtained on an application for an identification card except under certain circumstances.
bill_summary: This bill authorizes the Maryland Department of General Services to include a veteran status notation on certain identification cards for state employees and contractors, and regulates the sharing of veteran status information with executive agencies.
responsible_party: Department of General Services
stakeholders: Veterans and state employees or contractors who hold identification cards in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a process for highlighting veteran status on official identification and sets rules for sharing that information, enhancing veteran recognition and data privacy.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has little direct impact on child poverty, as it mainly deals with veteran identification and information sharing protocols.

Title: Funeral Establishments, Crematories, and Reduction Facilities - Disposition of Unclaimed Remains - Veterans
Synopsis: Requiring a licensed funeral establishment, crematory operator, or reduction facility to take certain actions if a certain veterans service organization does not take possession of certain unclaimed cremains, hydrolyzed remains, or soil remains that qualify for a plot in a veterans cemetery within a certain period of time.
bill_summary: The bill mandates that funeral establishments and crematories must provide information about unclaimed remains of veterans to veterans service organizations. If unclaimed remains are identified as veterans' remains, they must be transferred to veterans organizations for appropriate disposition, or to the Department of Veterans and Military Families if not claimed within specified timeframes.
responsible_party: Department of Veterans and Military Families
stakeholders: Veterans and their families, funeral service providers, veterans service organizations
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a structured process for identification and disposition of unclaimed veteran remains, involving mandatory data sharing and coordination with veterans organizations, which is a new approach.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill does not have a direct impact on child poverty.

Title: Health Occupations Boards - Notation of Veteran Status and Eligibility for Benefits
Synopsis: Authorizing health occupations boards to include a notation indicating veteran status on a license, certificate, registration, or public profile.
bill_summary: This bill authorizes health occupations boards in Maryland to create a process for indicating veteran status on licenses, certificates, or registrations, and to assist in determining eligibility for veterans benefits.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Health or relevant health occupations boards
stakeholders: Veterans applying for health professional licenses, boards, and veterans seeking benefits in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a systematic approach to indicate veteran status on professional licenses and facilitates communication for veterans benefits, leveraging existing licensing processes.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has limited direct impact on child poverty but benefits veteran families potentially including some with children.

Title: Chesapeake Conservation Corps Program - Renaming
Synopsis: Renaming the Chesapeake Conservation Corps Program to be the Thomas V. Mike Miller, Jr. Chesapeake Conservation and Climate Corps Program.
bill_summary: This bill renames the Chesapeake Conservation Corps Program to the Thomas V. Mike Miller, Jr., Chesapeake Conservation and Climate Corps Program, in honor of Thomas V. Mike Miller, Jr., and updates references and funding details related to the program.
responsible_party: Chesapeake Bay Trust in coordination with the Maryland State government
stakeholders: Environmental conservation volunteers of all ages in Maryland and the Chesapeake Bay region
innovative_summary: The program is a community-based environmental and energy conservation volunteer initiative that employs citizen engagement and education.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has the potential to impact child poverty indirectly through youth engagement and educational opportunities, but its primary focus is environmental conservation.

Title: Criminal Law - Animal Abuse or Neglect - Penalties
Synopsis: Prohibiting a person from committing a violation of the prohibition against abusing or neglecting an animal that results in the death of a domestic animal or livestock or the need to euthanize the domestic animal or livestock; providing that a person who violates the Act is guilty of a misdemeanor and on conviction is subject to imprisonment for up to 1 year or a fine of up to $5,000 or both; and authorizing a court to impost certain conditions of sentencing and probation.
bill_summary: This bill enhances penalties for animal abuse or neglect, especially when it results in the death or euthanasia of an animal. It also authorizes courts to prohibit convicted individuals from owning or residing with animals and to impose psychological counseling. The bill aims to strengthen animal cruelty laws and ensure proper punishment.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Agriculture or Judiciary (not explicitly specified)
stakeholders: Animals, animal owners, and the general public concerned with animal welfare
innovative_summary: The bill primarily strengthens existing laws with increased penalties and court-ordered prohibitions, using traditional legal approaches rather than new technologies or innovative methods.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill does not directly impact child poverty as it mainly addresses animal cruelty laws.

Title: Department of the Environment - Notation of Veteran Status
Synopsis: Authorizing the Department of the Environment to establish a certain process in collaboration with one or more boards under the Department's direction and control that requires a board to include a notation indicating veteran status on a professional license or certificate.
bill_summary: The bill authorizes the Maryland Department of the Environment to create a process that allows, with their collaboration, to include a veteran status notation on professional licenses or certificates issued by relevant boards. It also enables the process to assist in determining eligibility for veterans benefits.
responsible_party: Department of the Environment
stakeholders: Veterans applying for professional licenses and certificates in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill employs a new approach of integrating veteran status recognition directly into professional licensing and certification processes to facilitate benefits eligibility.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has the potential to improve employment opportunities for veterans, which may reduce child poverty indirectly.

Title: Election Law - Absentee Ballots - Notice to Request Application
Synopsis: Requiring the local board of elections to send a written notice regarding a request for a State-approved absentee ballot application with a specimen ballot and any other mailings to voters and eligible voters to further awareness of the option of mail-in voting, except under certain circumstances.
bill_summary: The bill requires Maryland local election boards to include a written notice on how to request an absentee ballot with mailed materials to voters at least 60 days before each statewide primary election, unless the voter has permanent absentee ballot status or other exceptions.
responsible_party: Maryland State Board of Elections
stakeholders: Eligible voters in Maryland, especially those interested in absentee voting
innovative_summary: This bill employs existing mailing infrastructure to improve voter awareness about absentee ballot requests, which is a strategic informational outreach approach rather than a new technology-based innovation.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has limited direct impact potential on child poverty as it mainly improves information dissemination about absentee voting.

Title: Boating Accidents - Reporting Requirement - Property Damage
Synopsis: Specifying that property damage that results from an accident that involves any vessel subject to the State Boat Act while on the waters of the State includes damage to navigational aid markers, lights, or identifiers for purposes of a certain reporting requirement.
bill_summary: The bill amends Maryland law to specify that property damage from boating accidents includes damage to navigational aid markers, lights, or identifiers, and updates reporting requirements accordingly.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Natural Resources
stakeholders: Boaters, maritime authorities, state natural resources agency
innovative_summary: The bill mainly clarifies existing legal requirements and does not introduce new techniques or approaches; it updates definitions and reporting rules.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has no direct impact on child poverty.

Title: Maryland Public Ethics Law - School Boards - Compliance Certification
Synopsis: Requiring each school board to certify to the State Ethics Commission, on or before October 1 each year, that the school board is in compliance with certain requirements of the Maryland Public Ethics Law.
bill_summary: This bill requires each school board in Maryland to annually certify to the State Ethics Commission that it is in compliance with the Maryland Public Ethics Law by October 1.
responsible_party: Maryland State Ethics Commission
stakeholders: School boards, school officials, employees of local school systems in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a formal annual certification process for school boards to affirm compliance with ethics laws.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has no direct impact on child poverty.

Title: Maryland Department of Labor - Licenses - Notation of Veteran Status and Eligibility for Benefits
Synopsis: Authorizing units in the Maryland Department of Labor to establish a certain process to include a notation of veteran status on an occupational license.
bill_summary: This bill authorizes the Maryland Department of Labor to establish a process for including a notation of veteran status on occupational licenses and to assist in determining eligibility for veterans' benefits.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Labor
stakeholders: Veterans applying for occupational licenses in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a process to formally recognize veteran status on occupational licenses, facilitating easier access to benefits.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has limited direct impact on child poverty as it mainly pertains to veteran recognition on licenses.

Title: Boating Accidents - Duty to Stop at the Scene, Render Assistance, and Provide Information - Penalties
Synopsis: Requiring the operator of a vessel involved in a collision, accident, or other casualty stop the vessel as close as possible to the scene of the collision, accident, or casualty until the operator has rendered certain assistance and provided certain information; establishing certain criminal penalties for the operator of a vessel involved in a collision, accident, or other casualty who does not take certain actions in violation of the Act of imprisonment of up to 2 months or a fine not to exceed $500 or both; etc.
bill_summary: This bill updates Maryland law regarding vessel operators involved in accidents, requiring them to stop near the scene, assist injured persons, and provide their information, with specific penalties for violations.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Natural Resources
stakeholders: Vessel operators, accident victims, property owners, the general public using watercraft
innovative_summary: The bill enhances accountability and safety procedures for boating accidents, but does not incorporate new technologies or approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill does not have a direct impact on child poverty.

Title: State Board of Stationary Engineers - Member Appointments - Advice and Consent of the Senate
Synopsis: Providing that the Governor appoint members of the State Board of Stationary Engineers with the advice and consent of the Senate.
bill_summary: The bill changes the appointment process for the members of the State Board of Stationary Engineers, requiring that the Governor appoint members with the advice and consent of the Senate.
responsible_party: Governor of Maryland
stakeholders: Members of the State Board of Stationary Engineers and related industries in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill mainly modifies the appointment process for existing board members; it does not implement a new service or initiative.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill does not have a direct impact on child poverty.

Title: Access to Counsel in Evictions - Task Force and Special Fund
Synopsis: Extending through fiscal year 2028 distributions by the Comptroller from funds gained from abandoned property in the State to the Access to Counsel in Evictions Special Fund; altering the staff and duties of the Access to Counsel in Evictions Task Force; and extending through fiscal year 2028 an annual $14,000,000 appropriation by the Governor from the Access to Counsel in Evictions Special Fund to the Maryland Legal Services Corporation.
bill_summary: The bill extends and allocates funding for the Access to Counsel in Evictions program, including establishing a special fund, setting program funding amounts, and creating a task force to evaluate and improve access to legal representation in eviction proceedings.
responsible_party: Maryland Legal Services Corporation (MLSC)
stakeholders: Tenants facing eviction, legal service providers, community organizations, landlords, and local governments.
innovative_summary: The program employs a comprehensive approach involving dedicated funding, a task force for evaluation, and coordination among multiple agencies and organizations to improve legal access for tenants facing eviction.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has high potential to reduce child poverty by preventing homelessness and supporting low-income families.

Title: Agriculture - Departmental Authority Over Identification, Inspection, and Sale of Cantaloupes - Repeal
Synopsis: Repealing the Department of Agriculture's authority over the identification, inspection, and sale of cantaloupes.
bill_summary: This bill repeals the Maryland Department of Agriculture's authority over the identification, inspection, and sale of cantaloupes, effectively removing regulations related to cantaloupe production and sale.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Agriculture
stakeholders: Cantaloupe growers, sellers, and consumers in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill removes a specific regulatory framework rather than introducing new technology or approaches, making it non-innovative.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill does not directly impact child poverty as it mainly changes agricultural regulatory authority.

Title: Health – General Article – References to Mental Health
Synopsis: Replacing references to mental hygiene with references to mental health in certain provisions of law governing public health; establishing that, by July 1, 2027, the Department of Health shall conduct a thorough review of Department regulations and adopt regulations to ensure consistency with the Act; and requiring the Department to update all public-facing electronic materials to be consistent with the Act as soon as practicable.
bill_summary: This bill updates references from 'mental hygiene' to 'mental health' in various Maryland laws and regulations. It establishes a Community–Based Services Fund funded by proceeds from sales, leases, or closures of behavioral health facilities to support community services, housing, and employment for individuals with mental health needs.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Health
stakeholders: Individuals with mental health needs, community mental health service providers, and families
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a dedicated community-based funding mechanism for mental health services, supported by proceeds from facility sales and closures, emphasizing community integration and recovery.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program could have a high impact on child poverty by improving mental health services and support for affected families, potentially reducing barriers to stable housing and employment.

Title: Confined Aquatic Disposal Cells - Construction - Moratorium
Synopsis: Prohibiting the Department of the Environment from processing or making any recommendation on a certain application submitted for the purpose of constructing a confined aquatic disposal cell from June 1, 2025, through May 31, 2029; and prohibiting the Board of Public Works from approving a certain application submitted for the purpose of constructing a confined aquatic disposal cell from June 1, 2025, through May 31, 2029.
bill_summary: This bill imposes a moratorium on the construction and approval of confined aquatic disposal cells within 5 miles of residential overburdened communities in Maryland from June 1, 2025, through May 31, 2029. It also clarifies regulations on dredged material discharges and redeposits in the Chesapeake Bay and its tributaries.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of the Environment and the Board of Public Works
stakeholders: Residents living near proposed aquatic disposal sites, environmental groups, and the dredging industry in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill employs a temporary moratorium approach combined with specific regulatory clarifications, rather than introducing entirely new technologies or innovative practices.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill primarily focuses on environmental regulation and does not directly target child poverty.

Title: Maryland Veterans Trust - Board of Trustees - Membership
Synopsis: Altering the membership of the Board of Trustees of the Maryland Veterans Trust to include the Secretary of Disabilities or the Secretary's designee.
bill_summary: This bill amends the membership of the Board of Trustees of the Maryland Veterans Trust to include the Secretary of Disabilities among its ex officio members.
responsible_party: Maryland State Government (Board of Trustees of the Maryland Veterans Trust)
stakeholders: Veterans in Maryland and related organizations
innovative_summary: The bill primarily updates a governing body's membership and does not introduce new technologies or innovative approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has minimal direct impact on child poverty, as it focuses on the composition of a veterans' trust board.

Title: Correctional Services - Geriatric and Medical Parole
Synopsis: Requiring the Maryland Parole Commission to consider the age of  incarcerated individuals when determining whether to grant parole; altering how the Commission evaluates a request for medical parole, including providing for a meeting between the incarcerated individual and the Commission; requiring the Commission to develop procedures for assessing parole requests by older incarcerated individuals; requiring the Commission to report yearly to the Justice Reinvestment Oversight Board on the outcomes of certain parole considerations; etc.
bill_summary: This bill modifies Maryland laws related to geriatric and medical parole, including considering an inmate's age during parole decisions, establishing procedures for medical parole evaluations, and expanding eligibility for certain elderly inmates to be considered for parole.
responsible_party: Maryland Parole Commission and Department of Public Safety and Correctional Services
stakeholders: Incarcerated elderly individuals and the Maryland criminal justice system
innovative_summary: The bill employs a specialized health and risk assessment process for elderly and medically infirm inmates to inform parole decisions, including medical evaluations and risk assessments, and integrates technology for case management and reporting.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill's focus is on elderly parole, which has limited direct impact on child poverty.

Title: Maryland Veterans Service Animal Program - Eligibility - Family Members of Veterans
Synopsis: Expanding eligibility for the Maryland Veterans Service Animal Program to include a spouse or dependent of an eligible veteran.
bill_summary: The bill expands the Maryland Veterans Service Animal Program to include that spouses or dependents of eligible veterans can now participate in the program that trains service dogs, support dogs, and therapy horses for veterans and their family members.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Veterans Affairs
stakeholders: Veterans and their families in Maryland, particularly spouses and dependents of eligible veterans
innovative_summary: The program incorporates a comprehensive approach to training and pairing service animals with veterans and family members, utilizing nonprofit entities and creating a dedicated fund.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has the potential to improve mental health and well-being among veterans and their families, which could contribute to reducing child poverty indirectly.

Title: Board of Trustees of the Maryland Teachers and State Employees Supplemental Retirement Plans - Renaming
Synopsis: Renaming the Board of Trustees of the Maryland Teachers and State Employees Supplemental Retirement Plans to be the Board of Trustees of the Maryland State Employees Supplemental Retirement Plans; and providing that the Board of Trustees of the Maryland State Employees Supplemental Retirement Plans is the successor of the Board of Trustees of the Maryland Teachers and State Employees Supplemental Retirement Plans.
bill_summary: This bill renames the Board of Trustees of the Maryland Teachers and State Employees Supplemental Retirement Plans to the Board of Trustees of the Maryland State Employees Supplemental Retirement Plans and establishes that the new board is the successor of the old one.
responsible_party: Department of Legislative Services and State Personnel and Pensions Department
stakeholders: State employees, teachers, and other beneficiaries of the Maryland State Employees Supplemental Retirement Plans
innovative_summary: The bill primarily involves administrative renaming and legal succession, with no introduction of new technologies or untested approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has no direct impact on child poverty as it pertains solely to the administrative structure of the retirement plans.

Title: Property Tax - Deadline to Set County and Municipal Corporation Tax Rates - Alteration
Synopsis: Altering, from July 1 to June 20, the deadline by which the governing body of a county or municipal corporation is required to set its property tax rate for the next taxable year.
bill_summary: This bill modifies the deadline by which counties and municipal corporations in Maryland must set their property tax rates for the upcoming taxable year, changing it from July 1 to June 1.
responsible_party: Maryland county and municipal governments
stakeholders: Residents, property owners, local governments in Maryland
innovative_summary: This bill primarily changes a legal deadline for setting property tax rates; it does not introduce new technologies or innovative approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill’s impact on child poverty is likely minimal as it mainly addresses administrative deadlines for tax setting.

Title: Drunk and Drug-Impaired Driving and Failure to Remain at the Scene - Revocation of Driver's License
Synopsis: Requiring the Motor Vehicle Administration to revoke the driver's license of a person who has been convicted of impaired driving that contributes to an accident, or fails to remain at the scene of an accident, that results in the death or life-threatening injury to another person; and authorizing a person whose driver's license is revoked under the Act or for homicide by motor vehicle while impaired to apply for license reinstatement after a certain period of time.
bill_summary: This bill mandates the revocation of a driver's license for individuals convicted of impaired driving that causes injury or death or for failing to remain at the scene of an accident resulting in death or serious injury. It also specifies conditions for license reinstatement after revocation, including time periods and circumstances that may restrict reinstatement.
responsible_party: Maryland Motor Vehicle Administration
stakeholders: Drivers convicted of impaired driving or involved in fatal or injury-causing accidents
innovative_summary: The bill mainly updates legal procedures and revocation statutes; it does not introduce new technologies or approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill's focus on driver license revocations for serious violations has limited direct impact on child poverty.

Title: Cannabis Reform - Revisions
Synopsis: Extending the time period from July 1, 2025, to July 1, 2026, during which a holder of a certain cannabis dispensary license may continue to deliver medical cannabis; limiting application submissions for on-site consumption licenses to social equity applicants under certain circumstances; authorizing a political subdivision to establish hours of operation for on-site consumption establishments; providing that a certain food sales exemption from the sales and use tax does not apply to the sale of certain cannabinoid beverages; etc.
bill_summary: The bill reforms Maryland's cannabis laws by extending the medical cannabis delivery period, modifying licensing processes, establishing rules for on-site consumption and cannabis events, and setting out regulations for vendors and taxes associated with cannabis products.
responsible_party: Maryland Cannabis Administration
stakeholders: Cannabis consumers, medical patients, cannabis licensees, social equity applicants, local governments, and the general public in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill introduces new approaches, such as regulated cannabis events, vendor permits, and a focus on social equity licenses, employing technology for registration and oversight.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has potential to reduce child poverty by promoting social equity and economic opportunities related to cannabis licensing and business development.

Title: Workers' Compensation - Payment From Uninsured Employers' Fund - Revisions
Synopsis: Authorizing the Worker's Compensation Commission to offset or credit against an award certain benefits paid by the Uninsured Employer's Fund; requiring the Workers' Compensation Commission to make the Fund a party to a claim filed against an uninsured employer; authorizing a covered employee or the dependents of a covered employee to apply to the Director of the Fund for payment from the Fund;  requiring the Fund to pay certain additional awards under certain circumstances; etc.
bill_summary: This bill revises procedures related to the Uninsured Employers' Fund in Maryland, including how benefits are paid out and how the Fund interacts with claims against uninsured employers.
responsible_party: Workers’ Compensation Commission of Maryland
stakeholders: Employees and dependents filing claims against uninsured employers in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a more integrated and direct process for paying and managing claims through the Uninsured Employers' Fund, including making the Fund a party in claims and clarifying payment procedures.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has some potential to impact child poverty by ensuring injured workers receive timely benefits, which may support families.

Title: Limited Line Credit Insurance - Qualification of Applicants
Synopsis: Altering certain requirements relating to programs of instruction for applicants for certain limited lines credit insurance licenses; and requiring the insurer that provides the program of instruction to retain records relating to the program of instruction while in use and for a period of at least 5 years after its last use.
bill_summary: The bill alters requirements for programs of instruction for applicants for limited line credit insurance licenses, including record-keeping obligations for insurers providing these programs.
responsible_party: Maryland Insurance Administration
stakeholders: Applicants for limited line credit insurance licenses, insurers offering instruction programs, and the Maryland state government.
innovative_summary: The bill introduces record-keeping requirements for insurers providing instruction programs for license applicants, but does not employ new technologies or novel approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has limited direct potential to impact child poverty.

Title: State Government - Public Employee Relations Act - Alterations
Synopsis: Repealing the condition that must be met for a certain exclusive representative to meet with a new employee by video or similar technology; altering certain requirements for the deputy directors appointed by the Public Employee Relations Board; and altering certain procedures regarding the timing of exclusive representation elections.
bill_summary: The bill modifies the Maryland Public Employee Relations Act by allowing exclusive representatives to meet with new employees via video or similar technology, removing the requirement for in-person meetings if public health concerns are a factor. It also clarifies the conditions under which employee membership dues can be deducted, adjusts requirements for deputy directors of the Public Employee Relations Board, and updates procedures for union representation elections.
responsible_party: Public Employee Relations Board, Maryland Department of Budget and Management
stakeholders: Public-sector employees, employee organizations, public employers in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill employs virtual meeting technology for union activities and online voting procedures, reflecting an innovative approach to labor relations and election processes.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill's direct impact on child poverty appears limited, as it mainly focuses on public sector labor relations procedures and governance.

Title: Department of the Environment - Fees, Penalties, Funding, and Regulation
Synopsis: Altering the authorized uses of the Maryland Clean Air Fund to include certain activities relating to mitigating and reducing air pollution in the State; authorizing the Department of the Environment to charge a fee for processing and issuing on-site sewage disposal permits and individual well construction permits under certain circumstances; requiring a holder of a license to transfer oil into the State to pay a certain fee when oil owned by the licensee is first transferred into the State; establishing the Private Dam Repair Fund; etc.
bill_summary: The bill makes various amendments to Maryland's environmental laws, including changing fund uses, permit fees, registration and inspection requirements, and establishing a Private Dam Repair Fund and related loan programs to improve dam safety and manage environmental protection.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of the Environment
stakeholders: Dam owners, environmental agencies, local governments, property owners, and communities impacted by dam safety and environmental regulations.
innovative_summary: The bill employs new regulatory approaches including the creation of a dedicated Private Dam Repair Fund with loan provisions, and adjusting fees to incentivize safety and environmental compliance, using modern financial and regulatory tools.
child_poverty_direct_summary: It has limited direct impact on child poverty, focusing mainly on environmental safety and infrastructure.

Title: Controlled Hazardous Substance Facility Permit - Research Facilities - Chemical Warfare Material Requirements
Synopsis: Providing that certain provisions of law regarding chemical warfare material requirements under a controlled hazardous substance facility permit do not apply to the incineration of chemical warfare materials at a certain research facility if the incineration is done for research, development, or demonstration purposes; and establishing additional requirements applicable to research, development, and demonstration permits issued for the incineration of chemical warfare materials at a research facility.
bill_summary: The bill regulates the incineration of chemical warfare materials at research facilities in Maryland, establishing conditions for permits, safety, monitoring, and emergency response, and creating specific permits for research, development, and demonstration purposes.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of the Environment
stakeholders: Research facilities handling chemical warfare materials, local communities near such facilities, and environmental and public health agencies.
innovative_summary: The bill introduces strict monitoring, emergency preparedness, and real-time emission tracking for the incineration of dangerous chemical materials, representing a novel approach to environmental safety in hazardous waste management.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has limited direct impact on child poverty as it mainly focuses on hazardous waste regulation and environmental safety.

Title: Election Law - Local Boards of Elections - Election Plan Requirements
