Synopsis: Requiring a local board of elections to submit an election plan to the State Board of Elections for approval at least 7 months before each statewide primary election; establishing requirements related to an election plan; and altering the requirements related to polling place plans, ballot drop box plans, and early voting center plans.
bill_summary: The bill updates election planning requirements for local boards of elections in Maryland, including submitting election plans for approval, and details related to polling places, ballot drop boxes, and early voting centers.
responsible_party: Maryland State Board of Elections
stakeholders: Voters, particularly those affected by polling place and early voting center planning, including historically disenfranchised communities
innovative_summary: The bill includes comprehensive planning and analysis requirements for election infrastructure, considering voter participation and accessibility, but does not employ new technologies directly.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill's focus on equitable access and planning may help improve voting access for disadvantaged communities, potentially reducing barriers that contribute to child poverty.

Title: Maryland Tort Claims Act - Employees of an Office of a Sheriff
Synopsis: Providing that an employee of the office of a sheriff of a county or Baltimore City is immune from liability under the Maryland Tort Claims Act in the same manner as a sheriff or deputy sheriff.
bill_summary: This bill extends immunity from certain liability to employees of sheriff's offices in Maryland, similar to the immunity already granted to sheriffs and deputy sheriffs.
responsible_party: Maryland State Government, specifically the Department of Judicial Proceedings and the Office of the Sheriff
stakeholders: Employees of sheriff's offices, sheriffs, deputy sheriffs, and the general public in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill updates legal immunity provisions to include employees of sheriff's offices, aligning their legal protections with those of sheriffs and deputies, but does not employ new technologies or approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill is unlikely to have a direct impact on child poverty.

Title: Baltimore City - Alcoholic Beverages - Hours of Operation Violations - Civil Penalties
Synopsis: Establishing for a first offense by a holder of an alcoholic beverages license in Baltimore City of operating the licensed premises outside specified hours of operation without obtaining a certain exemption a fine of not less than $1,000 or suspension of the license or both, and for a second or subsequent offense a fine of not less than $2,000 and not more than $20,000 or suspension of the license or both.
bill_summary: The bill establishes civil penalties for alcoholic beverage license holders in Baltimore City who operate outside the permitted hours without an exemption, including fines and license suspensions for violations.
responsible_party: Baltimore City Alcoholic Beverages Board
stakeholders: Alcoholic beverage license holders and patrons in Baltimore City
innovative_summary: The program mainly enforces existing laws with new penalties rather than employing new technologies or approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill is unlikely to have a direct impact on child poverty as it focuses on licensing penalties for alcohol establishments.

Title: Maryland Protecting Opportunities and Regional Trade (PORT) Act - Reports of Attorney General - Frequency
Synopsis: Altering from each month to every 6 months the frequency with which the Attorney General is required to report to the General Assembly regarding the status of the recovery of economic damages arising from the closure of the Helen Delich Bentley Port of Baltimore and the collapse of the Francis Scott Key Bridge; and requiring the Attorney General to pursue all available options, including filing actions against the applicable parties, to recover all possible economic damages arising from the Port closure and the Bridge collapse.
bill_summary: The bill requires the Maryland Attorney General to report to the General Assembly every six months on the status of efforts to recover economic damages resulting from the collapse of the Francis Scott Key Bridge and the closure of the Port of Baltimore. These reports are to start from July 1, 2024, until all options for recovery are exhausted.
responsible_party: Attorney General of Maryland
stakeholders: State of Maryland, residents, businesses affected by the port closure and bridge collapse
innovative_summary: This bill employs regular, mandated reporting intervals to monitor and update recovery efforts, which encourages transparency and accountability but does not involve new technologies or innovative approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill's focus on economic damages recovery is indirect; it does not specifically target child poverty but could have a positive economic impact.

Title: Financial Institutions and Activities - Virtual Currency Kiosks - Registration and Regulation
Synopsis: Establishing registration and operating requirements for a virtual currency kiosk operator to operate a virtual currency kiosk in the State; authorizing the Commissioner of Financial Regulation to investigate and enforce the Act in a certain manner; and authorizing the Commissioner to assess against a virtual currency kiosk operator a civil penalty not to exceed $1,000 for each knowing and willful violation  of the Act.
bill_summary: The bill establishes registration, security, disclosure, and operational requirements for virtual currency kiosks and their operators in Maryland, starting from January 1, 2026, including regulations for conduct, disclosures, and enforcement.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Labor, Commissioner of Financial Regulation
stakeholders: Virtual currency kiosk operators and users in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill employs regulatory oversight and disclosure requirements for virtual currency kiosks, integrating modern financial technology regulation approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program is not directly targeted at child poverty, but it could indirectly influence financial inclusion and security for consumers.

Title: Election Law – Chief Election Judges – Party Affiliation
Synopsis: Requiring the election director of a local board of elections to designate chief election judges from certain political parties to each polling place except under certain circumstances; and requiring an election director who is unable to designate chief judges for a polling place at least 45 days before the start of early voting to make a certain designation in a certain manner.
bill_summary: This bill requires local election boards to designate chief election judges from certain political parties at each polling place, with specific rules for when this cannot happen. It also sets procedures for appointing judges and designating chief judges.
responsible_party: Local election boards and election directors of Maryland
stakeholders: Voters, election judges, political parties in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill employs a structured approach to ensure political party representation among election judges and introduces specific requirements for chief judge designation, but does not rely heavily on new technologies.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill does not directly address child poverty or include measures targeting disadvantaged children.

Title: Department of Veterans and Military Families - Communications, Outreach, and Advocacy Program - Alterations
Synopsis: Requiring the Communications, Outreach, and Advocacy Program in the Department of Veterans and Military Families to expand certain services to include service members and their families; and requiring the Secretary of Veterans and Military Families to submit an annual report by December 1 each year to the Governor and the General Assembly that includes a general assessment of communication methods utilized in support of the Communications, Outreach, and Advocacy Program.
bill_summary: The bill establishes a Communications, Outreach, and Advocacy Program within the Maryland Department of Veterans and Military Families. It requires the department to create an online registry by December 31, 2025, for veterans, service members, military families, and interested individuals to register and access relevant information about services, benefits, and news. The program aims to improve communication and access to benefits for the military community and to report annually on the registry's status and federal veterans programs.
responsible_party: Department of Veterans and Military Families
stakeholders: Veterans, service members, military families, interested individuals in Maryland
innovative_summary: The program employs a new online registry system to centralize information and improve communication channels for veterans and military families, leveraging technology for government outreach.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has the potential to directly improve access to benefits and services for veterans and military families, which may indirectly reduce child poverty in affected families.

Title: Education - Youth Suicide Prevention School Program - Revisions
Synopsis: Altering the requirements of the Youth Suicide Prevention School Program to increase pupil awareness of the relationship between gambling and youth suicide.
bill_summary: The bill revises the Maryland Youth Suicide Prevention School Program to include increasing awareness about the connection between gambling and youth suicide, and emphasizes recognizing student behavioral health issues, trauma, or violence as part of suicide prevention.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Education
stakeholders: Maryland students, educators, and community health providers
innovative_summary: The program is updated to incorporate awareness of gambling and its link to youth suicide, and emphasizes a comprehensive approach including behavioral health and trauma recognition.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has potential to impact child poverty by improving mental health and behavioral support for youth, which can contribute to better outcomes for disadvantaged children.

Title: Natural Resources - Canada Geese - Bag Limits
Synopsis: Requiring, during the migratory Canada goose (Atlantic population) hunting season, the bag limit for all Canada geese in certain areas of  the State, including geese found in the Atlantic Flyway Resident Population Hunt Zone and the Atlantic Population Hunt Zone, to conform to the bag limit for Atlantic population Canada geese adopted annually by the Department of the Interior's U.S. Fish and Wildlife Service.
bill_summary: The bill updates Maryland's regulations on bag limits for Canada geese during the migratory season to conform with the limits set annually by the U.S. Fish and Wildlife Service, with some county exclusions, and specifies a 5-year duration starting July 1, 2025.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Natural Resources
stakeholders: Wildlife hunters, conservationists, residents of Maryland, and the geese populations
innovative_summary: This bill primarily aligns state hunting regulations with federal guidelines, with no introduction of new technologies or innovative approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has minimal direct impact on child poverty.

Title: Baltimore County - Speed Monitoring Systems - Interstate 695 and Interstate 83
Synopsis: Authorizing the State Highway Administration to place and use not more than four speed monitoring systems on Interstate 695 and Interstate 83 in Baltimore County subject to notice requirements; requiring that fines collected in Baltimore County as a result of violations enforced by speed monitoring systems on Interstate 695 and Interstate 83 be used to recover costs and assist in covering the cost of roadway and safety improvements on Interstate 695 and Interstate 83 in Baltimore County; etc.
bill_summary: The bill authorizes the placement and use of speed monitoring systems on certain highways in Baltimore County, Maryland, and establishes how fines collected from violations will be used to fund roadway and safety improvements. It also delineates procedures for issuing citations, handling violations, and reporting on the speed monitoring program.
responsible_party: Maryland State Highway Administration
stakeholders: Drivers and residents of Baltimore County, Maryland, especially those near the monitored highways, and local government transportation agencies.
innovative_summary: The program employs modern automated speed monitoring systems, digital imaging, and data management techniques to enforce speed regulations and fund safety improvements.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has limited direct impact on child poverty, focusing mainly on roadway safety and traffic enforcement.

Title: Baltimore City - Raffles - Organizations Affiliated With a Professional Major League Baseball Team
Synopsis: Authorizing certain organizations that are affiliated with a professional major league baseball team that plays its home games in Baltimore City to conduct certain raffles; requiring the organization to obtain a permit to conduct raffles from an agency designated by the Baltimore City government; providing that a permit to hold certain raffles expires at the end of the calendar year in which the permit was issued; requiring that raffle tickets are sold using age-verification measures to ensure the buyer is at least 18; etc.
bill_summary: This bill authorizes organizations affiliated with a Major League Baseball team in Baltimore City to conduct raffles, including specific rules about permits, sales, and geographic boundaries.
responsible_party: Designated City Agency in Baltimore City
stakeholders: Organizations affiliated with Baltimore's Major League Baseball team and residents attending the raffles.
innovative_summary: The bill employs technology such as geofencing and electronic devices for ticket sales to modernize and secure the raffle process.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill primarily focuses on raffle regulations and does not directly address child poverty.

Title: Revenge Porn - Definition of Visual Representation and Civil Action
Synopsis: Authorizing a person to bring and maintain a civil action for defamation against another who distributes a computer-generated visual representation that is indistinguishable from an actual visual representation of the person and is of a sexual or intimate nature; and prohibiting a person from knowingly distributing a certain computer-generated visual representation of another under certain circumstances.
bill_summary: This bill criminalizes the distribution of computer-generated visual representations that depict a person with intimate parts exposed or engaged in sexual activity without consent, often referred to as revenge porn. It also establishes civil causes of action for individuals whose images are distributed in violation of the law.
responsible_party: Maryland State Judiciary and Criminal Law Enforcement Agencies
stakeholders: Individuals depicted in or targeted by revenge porn, victims of privacy violations, and the general public concerned with online safety and privacy.
innovative_summary: The bill introduces specific legal definitions and civil remedies for revenge porn involving computer-generated images, emphasizing privacy and consent, with protections around court record confidentiality.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill is unlikely to have a direct impact on child poverty.

Title: Maryland Department of Health and Office of Health Care Quality - Nursing Home Inspections - Reporting
Synopsis: Requiring the Secretary of Health, on request of a county, to delegate to the county the authority to conduct surveys and complaint investigations of nursing homes; requiring the Maryland Department of Health to execute a certain memorandum of understanding with a requesting county within 90 days; and requiring that the Maryland Department of Health and counties equally share the costs of conducting surveys delegated by the Secretary of Health.
bill_summary: The bill requires the Maryland Department of Health to delegate authority to counties to conduct site visits, surveys, and complaint investigations of nursing homes upon request. It also establishes a reporting process for the frequency and types of inspections conducted in each county and requires the Department to execute memoranda of understanding with counties for delegation of inspection authority. The bill sets geographically specific reporting requirements and specifies that delegation begins once requested, with shared costs between the state and counties.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Health
stakeholders: Nursing homes, residents of nursing homes, county health departments, the general public
innovative_summary: The bill employs a collaborative approach to oversight, delegating inspection authority to counties and implementing a structured reporting system to monitor inspection activities. It uses existing agreements and expands local oversight, which is a somewhat innovative approach in public health administration.
child_poverty_direct_summary: Moderate potential to impact child poverty, as improved oversight of nursing homes can lead to better care for vulnerable populations, including children of residents.

Title: Maryland Police Training and Standards Commission - Review of Report and Recommendations
Synopsis: Requiring the Maryland Police Training and Standards Commission to annually review a certain report published by the Independent Investigations Division of the Office of the Attorney General; and requiring the Commission to make any recommendations that the Commission determines are appropriate based on its review of the report.
bill_summary: The bill requires the Maryland Police Training and Standards Commission to annually review a report published by the Independent Investigations Division of the Office of the Attorney General and to make recommendations based on that review.
responsible_party: Maryland Police Training and Standards Commission
stakeholders: Law enforcement agencies, the Maryland community, and oversight organizations
innovative_summary: The bill establishes a regular review and recommendation process for police standards based on independent investigation reports, promoting transparency and continuous improvement.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has minimal direct impact on child poverty as it focuses on police oversight and standards.

Title: Public Safety Officer - Performance of Duties - Death Benefits
Synopsis: Altering circumstances under which certain individuals are presumed to have died as a direct and proximate result of an injury sustained in the performance of duties for purposes of eligibility for death benefits.
bill_summary: The bill modifies the circumstances under which public safety officers are presumed to have died as a result of their duties for death benefits eligibility, adjusts death and funeral benefits, authorizes 911 specialists to join the law enforcement pension system, and makes related provisions for disability and retirement benefits for various public safety personnel.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Public Safety and Correctional Services
stakeholders: Public safety officers, firefighters, emergency medical technicians, 911 specialists, and their families in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill employs new legal presumptions and extends pension benefits to 911 specialists, potentially involving new data tracking and administrative processes.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has limited direct impact on child poverty, mainly affecting benefits of public safety personnel and their families.

Title: Natural Resources - Wildland Areas - Overhead Transmission Lines
Synopsis: Exempting certain areas in the Big Savage Mountain Wildland, Bear Pen Wildland, and Dan's Mountain Wildland from being designated as a wildland area, subject to a certificate of public convenience and necessity being obtained for a certain transmission line; and requiring the Public Service Commission to require an applicant for a certificate of public convenience and necessity for the construction of a certain overhead transmission line to provide wildland impact mitigation guarantees.
bill_summary: The bill establishes the designation of certain large Wildland areas in Maryland as protected wildlands and sets rules for transmission line construction, including impact mitigation and land management requirements, especially around designated wildland areas.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Natural Resources and the Public Service Commission
stakeholders: Wildlands, local communities, wildlife, and residents near transmission lines
innovative_summary: The bill employs new impact mitigation and land conservation strategies in the context of transmission line development, integrating environmental protection with infrastructure planning.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has low direct impact on child poverty but promotes environmental preservation which can indirectly benefit children by maintaining their natural environment.

Title: Environment - Coal Combustion By-Products - Fees, Coordinating Committee, and Regulations
Synopsis: Altering the factors that the Department of the Environment is required to consider in establishing a certain fee; requiring the Department to use certain excess fees collected from certain generators of coal combustion by-products for certain purposes; establishing the Statewide Coal Combustion By-Products Coordinating Committee to share information, monitoring results, and certain remedial actions with respect to certain coal combustion by-product sites; etc.
bill_summary: The bill establishes a minimum fee for coal combustion by-product generators, creates a statewide committee to oversee coal by-products, and sets regulations aligning with federal guidelines to manage these waste materials.
responsible_party: Department of the Environment and the Department of Natural Resources
stakeholders: coal combustion by-product generators, environmental agencies, public health officials, and local communities affected by coal waste sites
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a coordinated oversight committee and aligns state regulations with federal guidelines, incorporating new chemical testing and monitoring practices.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has potential for high impact on child poverty by improving environmental health and safety near coal waste sites.

Title: Registered Apprenticeship Investments for a Stronger Economy (RAISE) Act
Synopsis: Altering the duties of the Maryland Apprenticeship and Training Council; repealing the Youth Apprenticeship Advisory Committee; establishing the Maryland Office of Registered Apprenticeship Development to scale registered apprenticeships across industries and occupations to meet the needs of the State's economy; establishing the Maryland Pay Per Apprentice Program within the Maryland Department of Labor; establishing the Maryland Pay Per Apprentice Program Fund as a special, nonlapsing fund; etc.
bill_summary: The bill establishes various initiatives to promote registered apprenticeships in Maryland, including waivers for licensing exams for qualified apprentices, creation of new programs and boards to oversee and promote apprenticeships, and financial incentives and funds to support apprenticeship development.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Labor and Division of Workforce Development and Adult Learning
stakeholders: Individuals seeking apprenticeships, employers, industry sectors, and communities in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a comprehensive approach with new programs, funding mechanisms, and advisory boards to expand and improve registered apprenticeship opportunities, leveraging various strategies and oversight.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has a high potential to reduce child poverty by providing youth apprenticeship programs, workforce development, and incentives that can lead to better employment opportunities for young people.

Title: Criminal Records – Expungement and Maryland Judiciary Case Search (Expungement Reform Act of 2025)
Synopsis: Altering certain provisions of law relating to waiting periods for the filing of certain petitions for expungement to authorize the filing of a petition a certain amount of time after the completion of the sentence; adding to the list of misdemeanor convictions that a person may expunge under certain circumstances; prohibiting the Maryland Judiciary Case Search from in any way referring to the existence of a charge of possession of cannabis if the conviction was later pardoned by the Governor; etc.
bill_summary: The bill reforms Maryland's expungement laws by reducing waiting periods for filing expungement petitions after completing sentences, expanding the list of misdemeanors eligible for expungement, and changing rules on record removal and the Maryland Judiciary Case Search to better protect individuals' records.
responsible_party: Maryland Judiciary and Maryland State's Attorneys' Offices
stakeholders: Individuals with criminal records seeking expungement, legal professionals, and the general public
innovative_summary: The bill employs a comprehensive legal reform approach, introducing new rules for record sealing and improving privacy of records through modifications to judicial search systems, employing legal technology and policy changes.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has a moderate potential to reduce barriers to employment and housing for individuals with criminal records, which could help alleviate child poverty indirectly.

Title: Trafficking Regulated Firearms - Felony Classification
Synopsis: Requiring that the prosecution for an offense of trafficking a regulated firearm be instituted within 3 years after the offense was committed; reclassifying the prohibition against transporting a regulated firearm into the State for the purpose of unlawfully selling or trafficking the firearm to be a felony; and establishing a penalty on conviction of imprisonment of up to 10 years or a fine of up to $25,000 or both.
bill_summary: The bill updates Maryland laws related to trafficking firearms by changing the classification of unlawful transportation of firearms to a felony, extends the statute of limitations for certain firearm trafficking offenses to 3 years, and makes the illegal transportation of regulated firearms into Maryland a felony punishable by up to 10 years in prison and a fine.
responsible_party: Maryland State Police or the Maryland Department of Public Safety and Correctional Services
stakeholders: Law enforcement agencies, firearm traffickers, the general public, and victims of firearm trafficking
innovative_summary: The bill mainly updates legal classifications and time limits; it does not employ new technologies or innovative approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill largely focuses on criminal law reforms and is unlikely to have a direct impact on child poverty.

Title: Security Guard Agencies - Special Police Officers - Application for Appointment
Synopsis: Authorizing a certain security guard agency to apply for the appointment of special police officers in order to protect property owned or leased by the security guard agency's clients.
bill_summary: The bill authorizes security guard agencies in Maryland to apply for the appointment of special police officers to protect property owned or leased by their clients, provided they hold a valid security guard agency license.
responsible_party: Maryland Police Training and Standards Commission, Department of Public Safety, or related Maryland law enforcement agencies
stakeholders: Security guard agencies, property owners, security personnel, clients of security services, and the general public.
innovative_summary: The bill enhances the capabilities of private security agencies by allowing them to appoint special police officers, potentially improving security measures through legal authority.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has minimal direct impact on child poverty as it primarily pertains to private property security.

Title: Real Property - Unlawfully Restrictive Covenant Modifications - County or Municipality Notice Requirements
Synopsis: Altering notice requirements relating to the recordation of a restrictive covenant modification to an unlawfully restrictive covenant by authorizing a county or municipality to provide notice by publication in one or more newspapers of general circulation in the county or municipality where the property is located once per week for 4 successive weeks and on the official website of a county or municipality where the property is located.
bill_summary: This bill alters notice requirements for counties and municipalities in Maryland when they modify or record changes to unlawfully restrictive covenants, particularly those based on race, religion, or national origin.
responsible_party: Maryland counties and municipalities for implementing notice procedures and records
stakeholders: Property owners within Maryland counties and municipalities, especially those affected by restrictive covenants
innovative_summary: The bill introduces specific notice and publication requirements for government actions to modify unlawfully restrictive covenants, enhancing transparency and community awareness.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has limited direct impact on child poverty, primarily focusing on property law reform and community notice procedures.

Title: Home Builders - New Home Sales - Notice of Appliance Warranty Registration
Synopsis: Requiring a person registered to build a new home to provide at the time of closing for the initial sale of a new home information about the warranties for appliances registered by the person, including the date of the warranty registration and the time remaining under the warranty.
bill_summary: The bill requires home builders to include warranty information for appliances registered by the builder at the time of the initial sale of a new home, including the registration date and remaining warranty period.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Business Regulation
stakeholders: Homebuyers of new homes in Maryland
innovative_summary: This program employs a straightforward informational requirement without introducing new technologies or novel approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill's provisions are unlikely to have a significant or direct impact on child poverty.

Title: Prince George's County - Illegal Dumping and Litter Control Law - Video Evidence and Reward Programs
Synopsis: Authorizing Prince George's County to establish a pilot program allowing a member of the public to submit video evidence of an alleged violation of the Illegal Dumping and Litter Control Law to a certain enforcement unit; requiring the program to allow a member of the public to receive a portion of fines collected in relation to the violation; and authorizing the governing body of Prince George's County to refer unpaid fines to the Central Collection Unit of the Department of Budget and Management for collection.
bill_summary: This bill establishes a pilot program in Prince George's County allowing residents to submit video evidence of illegal dumping and litter violations and to receive a portion of fines as rewards. It also sets rules for fine collection and enforcement related to litter violations.
responsible_party: Prince George's County governing body or enforcement agency
stakeholders: Residents of Prince George's County, local government, enforcement agencies, people involved in illegal dumping and littering
innovative_summary: The program employs community-sourced video evidence collection as a new approach to environmental law enforcement, incentivizing public participation with rewards.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program could potentially reduce child poverty by improving community environments and increasing civic engagement, though direct impact is indirect.

Title: Business Occupations and Professions - Professional Engineers - Examination
Synopsis: Requiring an applicant for a license to practice engineering to pass an examination in the fundamentals of engineering given by the State Board for Professional Engineers before passing the required examination in the principles and practice of engineering.
bill_summary: The bill requires applicants for a professional engineering license in Maryland to pass an examination in the fundamentals of engineering before taking the exam in the principles and practice of engineering.
responsible_party: Maryland State Board for Professional Engineers
stakeholders: Applicants seeking engineering licensure, engineering students, engineering regulatory bodies
innovative_summary: The bill enhances the licensure process by explicitly requiring passing an exam in the fundamentals of engineering prior to the principles and practice exam, streamlining certification standards.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has no direct impact on child poverty.

Title: Public Safety - Police Accountability - Time Limit for Filing Administrative Charges
Synopsis: Altering the deadline for the completion of the process of review by a certain investigating unit through disposition by an administrative charging committee under certain circumstances; requiring a law enforcement agency to file any administrative charges arising out of an investigation of alleged police officer misconduct that is not required to be reviewed by an administrative charging committee within 1 year and 1 day after the date that the appropriate official employed by the law enforcement agency became aware of the incident; etc.
bill_summary: The bill modifies deadlines for law enforcement agencies to complete reviews and investigations of police misconduct, and for filing administrative charges, particularly when criminal activity is involved.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Public Safety and Correctional Services
stakeholders: Law enforcement agencies, police officers, and the public involved in misconduct investigations
innovative_summary: The bill updates and clarifies the timelines for police misconduct investigations and charges, ensuring timely action and accountability but does not employ new technologies.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill's focus is on police accountability protocols and does not directly impact child poverty.

Title: Commission to Study Health Insurance Pooling - Establishment
Synopsis: Establishing the Commission to Study Health Insurance Pooling to study the pooling of public employee health insurance purchasing between the State, counties, municipal corporations, and county boards of education in the State to maximize value and efficiency while maintaining a broad package of benefits and reasonable premiums for public employees; and requiring the Commission to report its findings and recommendations to the Governor and the General Assembly by December 1, 2026.
bill_summary: This bill establishes a Commission to Study Health Insurance Pooling to evaluate the potential benefits of pooling health insurance purchasing among the State, counties, municipal corporations, and school boards for public employees, with the aim of improving value and efficiency while maintaining benefits and reasonable premiums.
responsible_party: Department of Budget and Management
stakeholders: Public employees, State and local government entities in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill promotes innovative approach by creating a commission to analyze and potentially implement large-scale health insurance pooling for government entities, utilizing data analysis and strategic recommendations.
child_poverty_direct_summary: By potentially reducing health insurance costs for public employees, the program could improve economic stability for low-income families, thus having a positive impact on child poverty.

Title: Baltimore City - Property Tax - Authority to Impose on Vacant and Abandoned Property Owned by Nonprofit Organizations
Synopsis: Authorizing the Mayor and City Council of Baltimore City to establish, by law, a subclass of real property consisting of certain property that is owned by a nonprofit organization that has been vacant and has not been significantly improved for at least 5 consecutive years and to set a special property tax rate for that property.
bill_summary: The bill authorizes Baltimore City to implement a special property tax rate for vacant and abandoned property owned by nonprofit organizations that has not been used or improved for a specified period. It also clarifies the conditions under which certain properties owned by nonprofits and religious organizations are exempt from property tax.
responsible_party: Baltimore City Mayor and City Council
stakeholders: Nonprofit organizations, property owners in Baltimore City, residents of Baltimore
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a tailored property tax policy for vacant and abandoned properties owned by nonprofits, including the ability to set a special tax rate, which is a novel approach to property tax management aimed at addressing blight.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill does not directly address child poverty but could have an indirect impact through urban renewal and property management.

Title: State Government - Maryland Reparations Commission
Synopsis: Establishing the Maryland Reparations Commission to study and make recommendations relating to appropriate benefits to be made to individuals whose ancestors were enslaved in the State or were impacted by certain inequitable government policies; and requiring the Commission to submit a preliminary report by January 1, 2027, and a final report of its findings and recommendations to the Governor and the General Assembly by November 1, 2027.
bill_summary: The bill establishes the Maryland Reparations Commission to study and recommend benefits for individuals impacted by slavery or historical inequitable government policies in Maryland, including potential reparations and other forms of redress.
responsible_party: Maryland Reparations Commission, State Archives, and public colleges or universities
stakeholders: Individuals impacted by historical inequality, including descendants of enslaved people and communities affected by inequitable policies in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill employs a comprehensive, multi-stakeholder approach to studying reparations, including recommendations for various types of benefits and a framework for implementation and funding.
child_poverty_direct_summary: High potential for impact on child poverty through reparations and targeted social and economic remedies.

Title: Behavioral Health Crisis Response Grant Program - Funding
Synopsis: Requiring the Governor to include in the annual budget bill for each of fiscal years 2027 through 2029 an appropriation of $5,000,000 to the Behavioral Health Crisis Response Grant Program.
bill_summary: The bill allocates funding for the Behavioral Health Crisis Response Grant Program in Maryland, specifying annual appropriations from fiscal year 2020 through 2029, and mandates that starting in 2023, at least one-third of the funds be used for grants to mobile crisis teams.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Health
stakeholders: Individuals experiencing behavioral health crises and community mental health providers
innovative_summary: The bill emphasizes funding for mobile crisis teams as part of community behavioral health crisis response, promoting a modern, community-based approach to mental health emergencies.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has potential to reduce child poverty by providing crisis mental health services that can support vulnerable children and families.

Title: Baltimore City and Takoma Park - Stop Sign Monitoring Systems - Authorization of Pilot Program
Synopsis: Authorizing the use of stop sign monitoring systems in school zones in Baltimore City, if authorized by local law; providing that the owner or driver of a motor vehicle recorded failing to obey a stop sign is subject to a citation and a certain civil penalty under certain circumstances; establishing certain defenses to a charge of an alleged violation recorded by a stop sign monitoring system; requiring that 50% of the fines collected under the Act be distributed to the local management board and be used only for certain youth programming; etc.
bill_summary: The bill authorizes the use of stop sign monitoring systems in specific school zones in Baltimore City and Takoma Park as part of a pilot program, with revenue from fines directed to youth programs and city agencies.
responsible_party: Baltimore City Department of Transportation and City of Takoma Park
stakeholders: Residents, drivers, and youth in Baltimore City and Takoma Park, especially in school zones
innovative_summary: The bill employs automated stop sign monitoring technology for traffic enforcement and revenue earmarking for youth programs, representing an innovative use of traffic tech for community benefits.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill’s focus on youth programming and services indicates a potential for a meaningful, direct impact on child poverty.

Title: Criminal Procedure - U Nonimmigrant Status Petitions
Synopsis: Altering the requirements for certification of a U Nonimmigrant Status Petition; altering the individuals eligible to request a certain official to certify victim helpfulness relating to certification of a U Nonimmigrant Status Petition; altering the time periods within which a certain certifying entity shall certify or decline a certain form under certain circumstances; requiring a certifying entity to develop protocols to assist certain petitioners to take certain actions.
bill_summary: The bill updates Maryland laws and procedures related to certifications for U Nonimmigrant Status for crime victims, including rules for certifying entities, timelines, and disclosures.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Labor and law enforcement agencies
stakeholders: Crime victims, law enforcement, immigration officials, advocacy groups
innovative_summary: The bill employs new protocols for certification processes, including assistance for petitioners with limited English proficiency, and clarifies disclosure rules, making the process more accessible and transparent.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has a moderate potential to impact child poverty through improved victim support and safety, but it mainly focuses on legal processes.

Title: Courtroom Security - Minimum Adequate Security
Synopsis: Requiring each law enforcement agency, department, or entity providing security at a courthouse facility to submit a report by September 30, 2025, to the Chief Justice of the Supreme Court of Maryland; requiring the report include the current number of court security officers available, the minimum number needed to meet adequate security standards, the current number of vacancies and a viable plan to meet minimum adequate security standards as identified in the Act; etc.
bill_summary: This bill establishes minimum security staffing standards for courtrooms in Maryland. It requires each courthouse security agency to report on staffing levels and develop plans to meet security standards. Starting July 1, 2026, the bill mandates specific numbers of security officers present during court proceedings.
responsible_party: Maryland Judiciary and courthouse security agencies
stakeholders: Court personnel, defendants, plaintiffs, the general public attending court proceedings, law enforcement agencies
innovative_summary: The bill employs a structured staffing requirement approach to enhance courtroom security, but does not employ new technologies or innovative methods beyond set staffing standards.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill does not directly impact child poverty but may improve safety in court proceedings.

Title: St. Mary's County - Public Facilities Bond
Synopsis: Authorizing and empowering the County Commissioners of St. Mary's County to borrow not more than $71,000,000 in order to finance the construction, improvement, or development of certain public facilities in St. Mary's County, and to effect such borrowing by the issuance and sale at public or private sale of its general obligation bonds; etc.
bill_summary: This bill authorizes St. Mary's County to issue bonds totaling up to $71 million to finance the construction, improvement, or development of various public facilities in the county, including roads, schools, parks, and public safety buildings.
responsible_party: St. Mary's County Commissioners
stakeholders: Residents and taxpayers of St. Mary's County, public facility users in the county
innovative_summary: The bill primarily involves standard procedures for issuing bonds to fund public facilities and does not employ new technologies or innovative approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The direct impact on child poverty is limited, as the bill funds broad public infrastructure improvements rather than targeted social programs.

Title: Campaign Finance - Political Organizations - Disclosures on Solicitations (Stop Scam PACs Act)
Synopsis: Requiring certain political organizations to include certain disclaimers and disclosures on certain solicitations; authorizing the State Administrator of Elections to investigate a potential violation of the Act; and authorizing the State Board after the issuance of a public report of its finding to prohibit a person who violated the Act from making further solicitations for a certain period or impose a civil penalty not to exceed $10,000.
bill_summary: This bill, known as the Stop Scam PACs Act, increases transparency for political organizations by requiring them to include specific disclaimers and disclosures on solicitations, especially when soliciting for candidates or political parties, or when the solicitations appear to have a charitable or political purpose. It authorizes the State Administrator of Elections to investigate violations, impose civil penalties, and regulate these disclosures.
responsible_party: State Administrator of Elections
stakeholders: Political organizations, candidates, political parties, donors, and the general public
innovative_summary: The program employs new regulations requiring detailed disclaimers and disclosures on solicitations and grants investigative authority to the State Administrator of Elections, enhancing transparency and accountability in political fundraising.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has limited direct impact on child poverty as it primarily focuses on election transparency and regulation.

Title: Courts - Artificial Intelligence Evidence Clinic Pilot Program - Establishment
Synopsis: Establishing an Artificial Intelligence Evidence Clinic Pilot Program within the Administrative Office of the Courts to provide expertise in artificial intelligence to the circuit courts and the District Court in the form of expert testimony on the authenticity of electronic evidence the court determines may have been created or altered using artificial intelligence; authorizing the Governor for fiscal years 2027 and 2028 to include an appropriation of $250,000 in the annual budget bill for the Program; etc.
bill_summary: The bill establishes an Artificial Intelligence Evidence Clinic Pilot Program within the Maryland courts, aimed at providing expertise on AI-related electronic evidence for court cases, particularly civil cases with limited legal representation.
responsible_party: Administrative Office of the Courts
stakeholders: Courts, legal professionals, college students, recent graduates, faculty, AI and technology researchers, civil litigants
innovative_summary: The program employs innovative use of AI research, development, and expert testimony to assist courts, integrating AI expertise into legal proceedings.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program's primary focus is on AI expertise in courts, with limited direct impact on child poverty.

Title: Maryland Community Action Agencies - Funding
Synopsis: Requiring the Governor to include an appropriation of $250,000 in the annual budget bill to the Department of Housing and Community Development in fiscal years 2027 through 2030 as a grant to community action agencies statewide for measures to combat poverty.
bill_summary: The bill requires the Maryland state government to allocate specific funding amounts annually from 2027 to 2032 to community action agencies as operating grants. The purpose of these grants is to support community programs aimed at combating poverty and supporting low-income populations.
responsible_party: Department of Housing and Community Development
stakeholders: Community action agencies and low-income residents of Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill establishes a structured, phased funding program over several years explicitly designated for operational support of community agencies working to alleviate poverty, which could be seen as a strategic and sustained government intervention.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has a high potential to directly impact child poverty by strengthening community agencies focused on supporting low-income families and children.

Title: Labor and Employment - Uninsured Employers' Fund Board - Membership and Reserves
Synopsis: Altering the membership of the Uninsured Employers' Fund Board; and requiring, rather than authorizing, the Board to establish reserves to meet potential losses of the Uninsured Employers' Fund.
bill_summary: This bill alters the membership of the Uninsured Employers' Fund Board, requires the Board to establish reserves to cover potential losses, and specifies appointment and removal procedures for members.
responsible_party: Uninsured Employers' Fund Board
stakeholders: Employers, employees, insurance companies, and the general public in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill enhances governance and financial stability of the Uninsured Employers' Fund by specifying reserve establishment and broadening board membership.
child_poverty_direct_summary: Moderate potential to impact child poverty through improved worker protections and insurance stability.

Title: Health Care Facilities - Service Member Community Members (SFC Matthew Fast Act )
Synopsis: Authorizing each health care facility to screen each patient for information on whether the patient is a service member community member, include on the patient's medical record whether the patient is a service member community member, and  meet certain standards established by The Joint Commission for the purpose of improving health care equity for warrior community members; and defining "service member community member" to mean a service member, a veteran, a certain spouse, a certain child, or a certain stepchild.
bill_summary: The bill requires health care facilities in Maryland to screen patients for service member and veteran status, include this information in medical records, and meet standards for health care equity for service members and veterans. It also mandates annual reporting on progress toward health care equity for these populations starting in 2026.
responsible_party: Department of Veterans and Military Families and The Joint Commission standards
stakeholders: Service members, veterans, their families, and healthcare providers in Maryland
innovative_summary: The program employs data collection and standardized screening to improve healthcare equity for military communities, which is a new and targeted approach.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill does not directly address child poverty, but improving healthcare access for military families could have secondary benefits.

Title: Condominiums and Homeowners Associations - Elections, Financial Statements, and Enforcement
Synopsis: Establishing certain requirements for elections of the governing body of a condominium or homeowners association; requiring that the governing body of a condominium accommodate unit owner organizing activities relating to the governance of the condominium; prohibiting unit owners and lot owners from being charged for examining certain records of the condominium or homeowners association in a certain manner; etc.
bill_summary: The bill establishes new requirements for elections, records, and enforcement for condominiums and homeowners associations in Maryland. It mandates independent parties conduct elections, preserves residents' rights to access association records, and clarifies enforcement authority for the Attorney General's office.
responsible_party: Division of Consumer Protection of the Office of the Attorney General
stakeholders: Condominium and homeowners association residents and owners in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill employs third-party vendors and technology platforms to conduct elections and emphasizes transparency and accountability in governance.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill’s focus on governance transparency and consumer protection can contribute indirectly to stable housing environments but does not directly target child poverty.

Title: Calvert County Sheriff - Deputy Sheriffs and Correctional Deputies - Collective Bargaining
Synopsis: Providing that full-time deputy sheriffs and correctional deputies at the rank of major and below in the Calvert County Sheriff's Office have the right to organize and negotiate with the County Administrator of Calvert County and the Calvert County Sheriff with regard to certain wages and employee benefits in a certain manner.
bill_summary: The bill grants deputy sheriffs and correctional deputies in Calvert County the right to organize and bargain collectively with the County concerning wages and health care premium shares.
responsible_party: Calvert County Sheriff's Office and the Calvert County government
stakeholders: Deputy sheriffs, correctional deputies, Calvert County residents
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a formal collective bargaining process for law enforcement deputies in Maryland, including certification, negotiations, and agreements, which is a structured approach to employee representation and negotiation.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program could impact child poverty indirectly by potentially improving wages and benefits for deputies, which may lead to economic stability for their families.

Title: Health Benefit Plans - Calculation of Cost-Sharing Contribution - Requirements
Synopsis: Requiring administrators, carriers, and pharmacy benefits managers to include certain cost sharing amounts paid by or on behalf of an enrollee or a beneficiary when calculating the enrollee's or beneficiary's contribution to a cost sharing requirement for certain health care services; providing that the calculation requirement does not apply to enrollees in certain high-deductible health plans; requiring third parties that pay certain financial assistance to provide certain notification to an enrollee; etc.
bill_summary: This bill requires health insurers, nonprofit health plans, and health maintenance organizations to include certain discounts, financial assistance, and out-of-pocket expenses when calculating prescription drug cost-sharing contributions. It also mandates notification about financial assistance and restricts the ability to set coverage terms based on assistance availability. The bill aims to improve transparency and protect consumers regarding cost-sharing calculations for prescription drugs.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Insurance
stakeholders: Individuals with health insurance, especially those receiving prescription drug assistance
innovative_summary: The program implements enhanced transparency and consumer protection measures by standardizing notifications and restricting coverage restrictions related to financial assistance, employing regulatory oversight and clear communication protocols.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has the potential to reduce child poverty indirectly by making prescription drug cost-sharing more transparent and manageable for insured families, which could improve medication adherence and health outcomes.

Title: Annual Corrective Bill
Synopsis: Correcting certain errors or omissions in certain articles of the Annotated Code; clarifying language; correcting certain obsolete references; reorganizing certain sections of the Annotated Code; providing that the Act is not intended to affect any law other than to correct technical errors; and providing for the correction of certain errors and obsolete provisions by the publishers of the Annotated Code.
bill_summary: This bill is an annual technical correction bill that amends and clarifies multiple sections of Maryland law across various articles, primarily addressing errors, updating obsolete references, fixing grammatical and typographical issues, and ensuring consistency in terminology.
responsible_party: Publisher of the Maryland Annotated Code under the Department of Legislative Services
stakeholders: State agencies, legal practitioners, government officials, and Maryland residents affected by legal and administrative clarity
innovative_summary: The bill employs a comprehensive approach to technical legal corrections, which is a standard legal housekeeping activity rather than an innovation employing new technologies or methodologies.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill does not directly impact child poverty; its focus is on technical legal corrections across a wide scope of Maryland law.

Title: Labor and Employment - Unpaid Parental Leave - Definition of Employer
Synopsis: Altering the definition of "employer" to exclude employers who are covered by the federal Family and Medical Leave Act for the current year from being required to provide to employees a certain unpaid parental leave benefit in the State.
bill_summary: The bill amends Maryland labor law to change the definition of 'employer,' excluding those covered by the federal Family and Medical Leave Act from being required to provide unpaid parental leave benefits in the state.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Labor
stakeholders: Employees in small to mid-sized companies and employers not covered by federal FMLA
innovative_summary: The bill primarily changes legal definitions to modify employer requirements and does not introduce new technology or innovative approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has limited direct impact on child poverty, as it primarily changes employer obligations under state law.

Title: Higher Education - Hunger-Free Campus Grant Program - Alterations
Synopsis: Requiring the Maryland Higher Education Commission to designate certain private institutions of higher education as hunger-free campuses; prohibiting a 4-year or 2-year private institution of higher education or a regional higher education center operated by a private nonprofit institution of higher education from being eligible to receive grant funding under the Hunger-Free Campus Grant Program; and authorizing the Governor in certain fiscal years to include $150,000 in the annual budget bill for the Program.
bill_summary: The bill establishes the Hunger–Free Campus Grant Program in Maryland, designating certain higher education campuses as hunger–free if they meet specific criteria. It provides funding, sets requirements for campus programs to address student hunger, and aims to reduce food insecurity among students.
responsible_party: Maryland Higher Education Commission
stakeholders: Students at higher education institutions, especially those experiencing food insecurity
innovative_summary: The program adopts a comprehensive, multi-faceted approach by involving campus-based tasks forces, awareness campaigns, food pantries, meal-sharing initiatives, and data collection via student surveys, leveraging community engagement and data-driven strategies.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has high potential to directly impact child poverty by reducing food insecurity among student populations, which can be linked to reduced child poverty in some family contexts.

Title: Howard Community College - Board of Trustees, Meetings, and Contracts - Alterations Ho. Co. 1-25
Synopsis: Adding two members to the Board of Community College Trustees for Howard County; requiring each meeting of the Board to allow for public comment; requiring the Board to make a video or audio recording of its meetings which are to be made available on the Board's website; requiring Board members to undergo certain training specific to Board governance; and requiring the Board to submit a report to the General Assembly by January 1, 2026, and every 6 months thereafter until a contract is finalized, on the status of the faculty union contract.
bill_summary: The bill makes several changes to the governance and transparency of the Howard Community College Board of Trustees, including adding members, updating meeting and training requirements, mandating annual employee satisfaction surveys, and setting procedures for contract renewal and public engagement.
responsible_party: Howard Community College Board of Trustees
stakeholders: Howard Community College employees, trustees, and the Howard County community
innovative_summary: The bill introduces structured public engagement, transparency through recordings, and regular employee surveys, employing technology and modern governance practices.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill's impact on child poverty is minimal as it focuses on governance of a community college.

Title: Municipalities - Enforcement of Ordinances and Resolutions
Synopsis: Increasing from $1,000 to $5,000 the maximum amount of a criminal fine or municipal infraction that may be imposed by a municipality to enforce certain ordinances and resolutions enacted by the municipality.
bill_summary: The bill increases the maximum fine for municipal infractions and violations of ordinances or resolutions to $5,000, up from $1,000, and clarifies enforcement methods.
responsible_party: Municipal governments of Maryland
stakeholders: Residents and businesses within municipalities enforcing ordinances and resolutions
innovative_summary: The bill mainly updates legal thresholds for fines and enforcement, with no new technology or novel approach indicated.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has no direct impact on child poverty; it primarily modifies penalties and enforcement authority.

Title: Workers' Compensation - Claims Application Form - Authorization for Release of Information
Synopsis: Altering the entities to which a claimant is required to authorize the release in a claim application filed with the Workers' Compensation Commission to include the Uninsured Employers' Fund and the Subsequent Injury Fund; altering the information which a claimant is required to authorize the release in a claim application to include additional claims filed by the claimant and information in the custody of the Commission; etc.
bill_summary: This bill modifies the legal requirements for authorization forms related to workers' compensation claims in Maryland, clarifying what information can be released and the entities involved.
responsible_party: Maryland Workers’ Compensation Commission
stakeholders: Workers filing for workers' compensation benefits, attorneys, insurance companies, and employers involved in workers' compensation claims
innovative_summary: The bill mainly updates existing legal procedures without introducing new technologies or approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill does not directly address or impact child poverty.

Title: Department of Human Services - Study on Private Treatment Foster Care Homes
Synopsis: Requiring the Department of Human Services to conduct a study to determine the types of State support that would be appropriate and beneficial to assist private providers of treatment foster care homes in the provision of services; and requiring the Department to report its findings and recommendations on or before December 1, 2025.
bill_summary: The bill requires the Maryland Department of Human Services to increase funding and provide stipends for private treatment foster care homes to cover child care expenses, and to conduct a study on supporting private providers of treatment foster care.
responsible_party: Department of Human Services
stakeholders: Children in treatment foster care, private treatment foster care providers, families of children in care
innovative_summary: The bill employs a new approach by providing child care stipends to private treatment foster care homes and requiring a study on further support mechanisms.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has high potential to reduce child poverty by supporting private foster care providers and possibly improving care availability.

Title: Electronic Smoking Devices - Seizure and Wholesaler Record-Keeping Requirements
Synopsis: Authorizing the Executive Director of the Alcohol, Tobacco, and Cannabis Commission to seize electronic smoking devices that are sold or offered for sale in violation of certain provisions of law without a warrant; establishing procedures for the return of certain property seized by the Executive Director; establishing certain record-keeping requirements for electronic smoking devices wholesaler distributors and wholesaler importers; etc.
bill_summary: This bill authorizes the Maryland Alcohol, Tobacco, and Cannabis Commission to seize illegal electronic smoking devices and tobacco products without a warrant, establishes procedures for the return and destruction of seized items, creates licensing requirements for manufacturers and wholesalers of electronic smoking devices, and mandates record-keeping and reporting.
responsible_party: Alcohol, Tobacco, and Cannabis Commission of Maryland
stakeholders: Electronic smoking device manufacturers, wholesalers, retailers, and consumers in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill employs a comprehensive regulatory framework combining enforcement, licensing, record-keeping, and online publication, which is a modern approach to tobacco and electronic smoking device regulation.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has limited direct impact on child poverty but could have indirect effects through regulation of tobacco and vaping products.

Title: Maryland Self-Service Storage Act - Sale of Personal Property in Satisfaction of Lien - Notice Requirements
Synopsis: Requiring an operator of a certain self-service storage facility to notify an occupant in default at least 10 days before conducting a sale of the occupant's property stored in the self-storage facility of the time, place, and terms of the sale by hand delivery, verified mail, or electronic mail at the occupant's last known address; and requiring the operator of a self-storage facility to send a second notice if no response has been received 5 days prior to the sale.
bill_summary: The bill updates the Maryland Self–Service Storage Act to specify the notification procedures required before a sale of personal property in storage to enforce a lien, including requirements for notice via hand delivery, verified mail, or electronic mail, and changes concerning the advertising of the sale.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Commerce or equivalent agency responsible for self-storage regulations
stakeholders: Operators and occupants of self–service storage facilities in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill introduces electronic mail notifications and online advertisement options for storage sale notices, modernizing the notification process.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill's impact on child poverty is likely minimal as it mainly concerns property storage sales procedures.

Title: Business Regulation - Cellular Phone Carriers - Authorized Users
Synopsis: Requiring a cellular phone carrier to allow a customer of record who is responsible for payment of an account to have the option to designate other individuals as authorized users on the customer's account and to allow an authorized user to take certain actions in connection with the account.
bill_summary: The bill requires cellular phone carriers to offer customers the option to designate additional individuals as authorized users on their accounts, allowing these authorized users to make changes or purchase services, subject to the customer's written agreement. The bill also mandates that carriers enable accounts to be altered or canceled by more than one record customer if all agree in writing.
responsible_party: Maryland State Department of Commerce (or relevant regulatory agency for telecommunications)
stakeholders: Cellular phone customers and account holders in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a policy of allowing multiple authorized users on cellular accounts, enhancing user flexibility and control.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has no direct impact on child poverty but improves consumer rights and flexibility in mobile service management.

Title: Mold - Landlord Requirements and Regulations (Maryland Tenant Mold Protection Act)
Synopsis: Requiring the Department of the Environment, the Maryland Department of Health, the Department of Housing and Community Development, the Maryland Department of Labor, and the Department of General Services to develop a certain pamphlet and website; requiring a landlord to provide a tenant with certain information at certain times and in a certain manner; requiring a landlord to perform a mold assessment and mold remediation within 15 days after receipt of a written notice regarding the detection of mold; etc.
bill_summary: The bill, known as the Maryland Tenant Mold Protection Act, mandates the development of public resources on mold and mandates landlords to inform tenants about mold and perform mold assessments and remediation within specified timeframes. It establishes standards for mold assessment and remediation, and requires certain regulations.
responsible_party: Department of the Environment in coordination with the Maryland Department of Health, the Department of Housing and Community Development, the Department of Labor, and the Department of General Services
stakeholders: Tenants, landlords, residents of Maryland, housing authorities, and public health agencies
innovative_summary: The bill employs a coordinated governmental approach, developing standardized assessment and remediation standards, and creating centralized educational resources, which introduces a structured and unified strategy for addressing mold issues in residential properties.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill could potentially reduce health-related costs and improve living conditions, which can positively impact children living in affected housing.

Title: Cyber Maryland Program - Revisions
Synopsis: Transferring the Cyber Maryland Program from the Maryland Technology Development Corporation to the Maryland Department of Labor; altering the duties of the Program; requiring the Program to issue competitive grants and contracts beginning in fiscal year 2026, to enhance cybersecurity workforce development, including cybersecurity for operational technology; authorizing the Governor for fiscal year 2027 and each fiscal year thereafter to include in the annual budget bill an appropriation sufficient to run the program; etc.
bill_summary: The bill revises the Maryland Cyber Maryland Program, transferring it to the Department of Labor, expanding its activities including awarding grants and contracts for cybersecurity workforce development, establishing a fund, and creating a board to oversee these efforts. It aims to develop a skilled cybersecurity workforce, support related initiatives, and improve cybersecurity infrastructure across the state.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Labor
stakeholders: cybersecurity workforce, students, veterans, employers, educational institutions, and vulnerable community groups across Maryland
innovative_summary: The program employs a strategic, data-driven approach to cybersecurity workforce development, including innovative talent pipeline management and pilot programs with targeted community groups, and integrates multiple state efforts into a comprehensive approach.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has potential to reduce child poverty by increasing access to cybersecurity careers and improving educational and economic opportunities for diverse populations.

Title: Department of the Environment - Community Water and Sewerage Systems - Cybersecurity Planning and Assessments
Synopsis: Requiring the Department of the Environment to coordinate, in coordination with the Department of Information Technology and the Maryland Department of Emergency Management, cybersecurity efforts within community water systems and community sewerage systems; establishing the roles and responsibilities of various State agencies with respect to regulating, assessing, and promoting cybersecurity efforts within the water and wastewater sector; etc.
bill_summary: The bill mandates cybersecurity efforts, including planning, assessment, and incident reporting, for community water and sewerage systems in Maryland, in coordination with state agencies.
responsible_party: Department of the Environment in coordination with the Maryland Department of Information Technology and the Maryland Department of Emergency Management
stakeholders: Community water and sewerage systems, local governments, water sector personnel, and residents served by these systems.
innovative_summary: The program introduces a comprehensive cybersecurity framework incorporating standards, assessments, training, incident reporting, and inter-agency coordination, emphasizing a zero-trust cybersecurity approach.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program potentially reduces child poverty by protecting critical water infrastructure, ensuring continued access to safe water, and preventing disruptions caused by cyberattacks.

Title: Governor's Office for Children - Boys and Girls Clubs of Maryland - Grant Funding
Synopsis: Requiring the Governor to include $250,000 in the annual budget bill for fiscal years 2027 through 2030 to the Governor's Office for Children to provide grants to fund operating expenses for the Boys and Girls Clubs of Maryland.
bill_summary: The bill mandates that starting in fiscal year 2027, the Maryland government will allocate $250,000 annually through the state budget to fund grants for the Boys and Girls Clubs of Maryland, supporting their operational expenses.
responsible_party: Governor’s Office for Children
stakeholders: Children, Families, Boys and Girls Clubs of Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill allocates funding to enhance existing programs through targeted grants, which is a standard approach rather than an innovative new technology or method.
child_poverty_direct_summary: By providing grants to support the Boys and Girls Clubs, the bill has a positive potential to reduce child poverty by improving access to programs for children in need.

Title: Office of Social Equity - Community Reinvestment and Repair Fund - Modifications
Synopsis: Repealing provisions of law requiring the Office of Social Equity to report on the Community Reinvestment and Repair Fund and to solicit public input on the uses of the Fund and publish a review of the input; requiring the Office to oversee the appropriation of funds from the Fund and to train Fund recipients; altering certain limitations on the use of the Fund; limiting certain administrative costs to administer the Fund to a certain amount; requiring counties to administer funds from the Fund in a certain manner; etc.
bill_summary: The bill establishes the Office of Social Equity and the Community Reinvestment and Repair Fund to support communities adversely impacted by cannabis enforcement, allocating funds for community programs and requiring local governments to develop plans for distribution.
responsible_party: Office of Social Equity within the Maryland Cannabis Administration
stakeholders: Communities disproportionately impacted by cannabis law enforcement, local governments, community organizations, and residents of impacted areas.
innovative_summary: The bill employs a new approach by creating a dedicated office and fund to repair social and economic disparities caused by cannabis enforcement, including community-based planning and regular public engagement.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has high potential to impact child poverty by funding programs that support families and address community disparities.

Title: Environment - Packaging and Paper Products - Producer Responsibility Plans
Synopsis: Requiring certain producers of covered materials, individually or as part of a producer responsibility organization, to submit a certain covered materials producer responsibility plan to the Department of the Environment for review and approval on or before July 1, 2028, and every 5 years thereafter, in accordance with certain requirements, or to develop an alternative collection program; requiring a producer responsibility organization to pay certain costs to the Department; etc.
bill_summary: The bill establishes a producer responsibility program in Maryland requiring producers of packaging and paper products to submit plans for recycling, reuse, and waste reduction. It creates a Department-led framework for approving these plans, setting recycling goals, and utilizing fees and funds to support recycling infrastructure, education, and compliance.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of the Environment
stakeholders: Producers of packaging and paper products, local governments, recycling service providers, and residents
innovative_summary: The program employs a comprehensive, technology-enabled, and collaborative approach to producer responsibility, recycling, and waste reduction with ongoing assessments and stakeholder engagement.
child_poverty_direct_summary: High potential for impact on child poverty by promoting environmental sustainability, health, and community infrastructure.

Title: Public Schools - High School Sports Officials - Payment and Fees
Synopsis: Establishing requirements for local school systems that issue invitations for bids for high school sports officiating services for boys' and girls' high school sports; authorizing the Department of Education to develop guidelines to assist a local school system in the implementation of the provisions of the Act, including additional criteria for determining which high school sports qualify as similar boys' and girls' high school sports.
bill_summary: The bill mandates that Maryland local school systems conduct joint bidding processes for boys' and girls' high school sports officiating services to ensure pay parity; it also requires the state to develop and update a list of similar boys' and girls' sports for determining officials' pay and bidding procedures.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Education
stakeholders: High school sports officials, students, school athletic departments, and local school systems
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a parity-based, coordinated procurement process for high school sports officiating services and a systematic categorization of similar sports to ensure equitable pay, employing a new structured approach for procurement and classification.
